Posted by                  Paul Jerajian             Director of Strategic Analytics                                     Send InMail                    At Zenefits, our mission is to level the playing field for the other 99.7%— the underserved small and mid-size businesses that fuel our economy. These businesses face challenges disproportionate to their size and resources. That’s why we provide an intuitive, mobile, all-in-one People Operations ("POPs") platform specifically built for small businesses and their employees.The Role:Zenefits’ strategic analytics team is a collaborative group of people who are passionate about the power of automated data analytics to drive positive operating results for the company. Our team’s mission is to provide the organization with robust information, analyses and insight to inform and assess Zenefits’ strategic objectives. Our team’s objectives include:Democratizing data access across the organization and providing tools and training to support data-informed decisionsAcquiring and synthesizing all relevant information about our ecosystem, our competitors, the HR and benefits landscape, and our users, to provide high quality strategic advice to decision makers at all levels of the organizationRaising the quality of data in our system, including improving our data infrastructure and modeling, and utilizing a variety of research methodologies to understand our users and their experiencesTo achieve this we will seek to use the most up to date data, analytical techniques, and appropriate technologies. We collaborate with teams across the organization to provide colleagues with reliable and actionable information through research, reporting, dashboards, and analytics. We value peer feedback, continuous learning, and blameless post-mortems.What you'll do:Explore data from all sides of the business (Sales, Success, Marketing, Finance) and drive insights through dashboards, reports, and modeling (Marketing attribution models, churn prediction, account health)Partner closely with anyone and everyone across the company to build dashboards, extract insights and empower them with dataWork cross-functionally with product leaders to define KPIs and measure metric categories including adoption, engagement, and retention.Evangelize the use of data tools and best practices and ensure stakeholders’ analytic needs are being metEnsure data, business metrics, definitions, and dashboards are up to date and accurateCommunicate results directly with all levels of management at ZenefitsWhat you'll bring:2+ years experience with Looker (LookML, Explores, Dashboards, and administration) and/or similar self-service BI tools (e.g. Tableau or Mode)2+ years working with a data warehouse/BI-tool (Snowflake experience is a plus)Experience synthesizing information and communicating takeaways to diverse audienceKnowledge of traditional relational databases and strong foundation in SQLKnowledge of data modeling concepts and familiarity or willingness to learn DBTEnthusiasm for operating in a version-controlled (GitHub or similar) analytic code environmentExperience with organizational tools and ticketing systems (e.g. JIRA)Practice data visualization and dashboard design best practicesExperience in a startup data environment is positive but not a requirement; exposure to common tools is a plus (Salesforce, Marketo, Segment, etc.)Familiarity with R (particularly the Tidyverse and Shiny) and/or Python (particularly Scikit-learn) is positive but not a requirementWhat we offer:Ability to work remote and collaborate with a team that spans borders and timezonesCompetitive, market-based pay, based on your experience, abilities, impact, and geographic region - just ask us the range for your locationSolid benefits package including 401(k), medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and more for our US employees and a comprehensive ancillary package for our Canadian employeesGenerous time off including holidays, vacation, sick, civic, and volunteering time offThe opportunity to build solutions that help drive small business success storiesLife at Zenefits:As an equal opportunity employer, we’re leveling the playing field for everyone. We are proud to celebrate diversity and champion an inclusive workplace. No matter who you are, where you’re from, who you love, how you think, or what you believe, all are encouraged to apply.

Victoria - British Columbia - CanadaJob SummaryResponsible for ensuring the business makes better decisions through collection and usage of data. Ensures business data and analysis requirements are met by properly applying data concepts, including data structures, collection and cleansing, and structured and unstructured data analysis and reporting. Ability to collect, analyze, manipulate, and report on CBRE data.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Performs ad-hoc, strategic analysis of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources, reflecting global real estate markets and the operations of real estate assets.  Develops data structures and pipelines to organize, collect, cleanse, and standardize data in order to generate insights and addresses reporting needs.  Defines data requirements and gathers and validates information, using judgment and statistical tests.  Utilizes programming and analytical tools, including open source programs including Python, R and SAS, SQL, Oracle, or similar relational database tools to formulate models and/or extract insights. Well versed in knowledge of creating algorithms, identifying patterns and insights from structured and unstructured data sets utilizing graphs, trees and/or other data representation techniques as required.  Identifies and troubleshoots data integration and integrity issues in cooperation with the appropriate CBRE business units; Designs work flows and procedures.  Identifies opportunities to maximize data usage, applying modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve business performance.  Develops ad-hoc analytics and reporting based on analysis of existing data sources, utilizing a variety of tools (i.e. SSRS, Tableau).  Exhibits analytical rigor, judgment, and ability to present a comprehensive 'data story' to multiple levels of the organization.  Other Duties as Assigned Supervisory Responsibilities No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.  May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers.  May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project. QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.EDUCATION And EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree in computer science, math, engineering, or related field with a minimum of 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data modeling, reporting, relational database tools, data warehousing, database architecture, SQL, SAS and/or SPSS  2-3 years technical experience in software development, machine learning or statistical analysis, data engineering and data visualization related work. CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  A technical certification in data management is desired. Communication Skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Strong organizational and analytical skills.  Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable, and courteous service to customers.  Ability to effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE  Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles.  Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions.  Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY  Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents.  Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations.  Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills. OTHER SKILLS And ABILITIES Experience with BI stack (e.g., SSRS) a bonus.  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook.  Strong analytical skills. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY  Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines.  Responsible for setting own project or task deadlines to meet objective or project requirements and timelines. Service line: GWS Segment

job_title: Data Analyst - Brother Emerging Talent Associate
job_desc: people delivering a superior customer experience.This could be your chance to join our winning team! We’re looking for recent or upcoming university graduates to work with us as a Brother Emerging Talent Associate for a year.You would report to the Manager – Analytics and Insights. The program is designed to expose you to different aspects of our business by using your analytics skills to wrangle complex data sets and turn them into meaningful visualizations and insights.Are you known for bringing the notion of analytics and critical thinking to another level?Are you obsessed about details and nuances that are commonly overlooked?Can you pinpoint the not so obvious patterns in data?Are you proficient with data analytics and visualization tools?If you answered yes to these questions, we MUST meet!This is NOT an internship!We are investing in your accelerated development to help build our talent bench strength and make you a successful and long-term member of our team!How The BETA Program WorksThe BETA candidate will be assigned to various departments, responsibilities, projects and initiatives to analyze how things are done at Brother. They will map processes, analyze various situations, present recommendations, and implement improvements company-wide. The BETA candidate is provided with one-on-one coaching and mentoring from the program executive to successfully complete a series of projects and mandates within departments and increase organizational performance.We want your drive and for you to challenge the status quo. You will be given the autonomy to make recommendations to implement impactful changes!Here's What You'd Be DoingDocument and analyze business processesBuild or improve custom reports and visualizations using TableauExtract, analyze, summarize insights from large sets of disparate dataExamples of data sources: Financials, sales, customer profiling, supply chain, logisticsParticipate in projects, acting in various roles – documenting business requirements and user stories, writing project progress reports, leading workshopsRecommend and implement business improvements, using predictive analytics to influence decisionsContribute to instill a culture of Continuous ImprovementWhat We Look ForBachelor’s degree in Commerce, Economics, Mathematics & Statistics, Engineering or relevant fieldMBA or Graduate Degree in Management Analytics, Economics, Statistics and EngineeringProven academic and/or professional experience with data analysisStrong ability to establish analysis methodologiesPython, R, Tableau is a mustAzure and SAP an assetSix sigma and project management certification is an assetSome of the coaching, training and development you will benefit from and be required to put into practice:Navigating the Brother Business modelSales, supply chain, logistics and financial performance interpretationAdopting Brother’s continuous improvement methodologyHow to write and deliver a business case, project updateEffective workshop facilitationBrother’s sales forecast and demand planning methodologyHurry, and apply now!

Change the future with us. We are looking for dedicated and talented people who tackle ever-changing challenges, customer needs, and questions from colleagues with clever concepts and creativity. We embrace change and work with curious minds re-inventing the future of work. Join us and let us focus together on what’s truly important: making lives better with new ideas and the latest technology around the world. Why you’ll love working for Siemens! Freedom and a healthy work- life balance– Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces. Solve the world’s most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects. Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment. Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale. Competitive total rewards package. Profit sharing available. Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle. Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community. Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events. Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them! Employee perks and discounts. Diversity and inclusivity focused. Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2022, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2022 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022. What will you do? Working closely with the hiring manager and the financial team, you will be trained in the Business Intelligence (BI) tool/s and apply knowledge and learnings to support the team. Apply tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs. Work closely with different data teams and other stakeholders including Product Managers, Pricing Team, Partner Management team, Sales Teams and the Material Master team Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems. Develop applications to automate consumption of data files for internal application. Utilize corporate data platforms and support and maintain regional data for Product master data & Product Pricing automation. Support the ecommerce & Digital Business initiatives with regards to Data and data visualization Perform data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing, and analysis using SQL and other query & scripting languages. Offer solutions or services based on existing portfolio of present IT solutions such as SAP and provide consultancy to the business. Apply AI & Machine Learning algorithms and statistical models where applicable. Manage expectations of business/IT stakeholders during the implementation of IT demands/projects (deliverables + timeline). Maintain detailed relevant understanding of key technologies/platforms and processes that support the business. Communicate with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements. Handover IT solution/application on its completion to the support team and train stakeholders. What will you need to succeed? Degree or diploma in Computer science, Data science, Data Analytics, Statistics or related field. Demonstrated leadership or initiative with a growth mindset, and a passion for learning Collaborative with an ability to cultivate relationships and networks Agile, technically savvy, with a knack at creating solutions Creative thinker with a unique ability for resourcefulness Relevant data analysis experience with IT and Programming knowledge ideally gained through Co-Op program / experience Experience working in small/medium sized data migration projects Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SQL, SSIS, SAS, etc.) Strong knowledge and experience with BI Tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik Sense), databases (SQL), programming (Phyton/R) Skills / experience in SQL joins, sub queries, tracing, and performance tuning for better running of queries Strong knowledge in IT technologies (Microsoft Windows/SQL server) and Microsoft cloud tools Skills / experience in application development and knowledge of application development technologies Working knowledge of SAP is a plus Working knowledge of ML & Statistical Models is a plus Ability to train others, facilitation and demonstration skills and abilities About us. We share our ideas and champion the people behind them. For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Active across Canada, the company focuses on intelligent infrastructure for buildings and distributed energy systems and on automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. Siemens brings together the digital and physical worlds to benefit customers and society. Through Mobility, a leading supplier of intelligent mobility solutions for rail and road transport, Siemens is helping to shape Canada’s passenger rail services. Via its majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, Siemens is also a leading supplier of medical technology and digital health services. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power. Making a difference together we raised $$385,000 towards charitable contributions, support over 38 non-profit organizations and planted 660 trees in our local communities. Siemens Canada has 2,500 employees from coast-to-coast and 24 office and production facilities across Canada. Join our team of approximately 293,000 talented professionals in more than 190 countries/regions and help us tackle the most exciting challenges to build a successful future together. So, what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us. To learn more about Siemens Canada, visit our website at www.siemens.ca While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Organization: Digital Industries Company: Siemens Canada Limited Experience Level: Mid-level Professional Job Type: Full-Time temporary Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Siemens Canada will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. By submitting personal information to Siemens Canada Limited or its affiliates, service providers and agents, you consent to our collection, use and disclosure of such information for the purposes described in our Privacy Code available at www.siemens.ca. Siemens s’engage à créer un environnement diversifié et est fière d’être un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour ce poste. En transmettant des renseignements personnels à Siemens Canada limitée ou à ses sociétés affiliées, à ses fournisseurs de services ou à ses agents, vous nous autorisez à recueillir, à utiliser et à divulguer ces renseignements aux fins prévues dans notre Code de protection de la confidentialité, que vous pouvez consulter au www.siemens.ca.

The Development and Release Engineering (DRE) team are EA's continuous integration and build experts. We're a team of over 100, located in EA studios across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. We pride ourselves on providing superior automation services to our internal customers - EA's game, product, and content teams.Our work creates a LOT of data! As a Senior Data Analyst on the DRE team, you will help support the business through data analysis to improve the efficiency and quality of EA's game development workflows. Your insights will influence how DRE helps EA make amazing games. You'll report to a Sr. Engineering Manager and become part of the larger data analytics community at EA.Responsibilities Create statistical analysis models for hypothesis testing, prediction, or inference.  Create performant data models that can be further used for visualization by the team.  Visualize high-readability data insights using tools like Power BI, Kibana, or Grafana.  Work with business and technical stakeholders to translate their needs into data insights.  Perform data analysis on business processes to provide an objective view on how the business operates.  Work with data engineers to manipulate, analyze and tell a story with complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from multiple sources using different tools and data analysis techniques.  Use and promote data exploration techniques to discover new or previously unasked questions.  Evaluate, interpret and present data to find risks and opportunities to improve our service.  Build scripts and queries to import, clean, transform, and enhance data.   Qualifications  5+ years of work experience in a past analytical role, using data to create process improvements.  Bachelor's degree in a technical field (e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or completion of post-secondary level Math and Statistics courses.  Creative thinking and analytical skills.  Proficient in one or more of the following: Python, R, Scala, or SQL.

Posted by                  Kent Blackburn             CEO at Quarry IT Consulting                                     Send InMail                    Data Scientistlocation - OttawaMulti-year contract or permanent (if preferred)MUST HAVE SKILLS;MUST have 10 years residency in Canada (eligible for Top Secret clearance)MUST have minimum of five (5) years of Data Science experience in the last seven (7) years, working with datasets having two (2) million records or more.MUST have a minimum of three (3) years of experience in the last seven (7) years, prototyping and developing data exploitation capabilities using PythonMUST have a minimum of two (2) years of experience in the last seven (7) years, working with text analytics and Natural Language Processing (NLP)/Name Entity Recognition (NER) in relation to artificial intelligence.Senior Data Scientist will support the key technology directorate initiatives, including new and existing projects. As a reminder, all career opportunities can be found here .Search Data Analyst - CanadaDuration: PermanentLocation: Canada (Remote)Start: ASAPDue to the current conditions of COVID-19, this key position will initially work from home, until such a time when we return to our office.Who We AreFor 25 years, Getty Images has embraced disruption and change; riding the digital wave to evolve from a fragmented, analog stock photo business into a multi-billion-dollar, global e-commerce industry leader and trusted brand. The breadth and quality of our content has always allowed our customers and partners to tell their stories with greater creativity and accuracy, eliciting more emotion and enabling more action. Getty Images moves the world, whether the goal is commercial or philanthropic, revenue-generating or society-changing, market-disrupting or headline-driving. Help us move the world with images! Getty Images is the most trusted and esteemed source of visual content in the world, with over 405 million assets available through its industry-leading sites www.gettyimages.com and www.istock.com . The Getty Images website serves creative, business and media customers in almost 200 countries and is the first-place people turn to discover, purchase, and share powerful content from the world's best photographers and videographers. Getty Images works with over 330,000 contributors and image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 160,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography. Getty Images is a world leader in visual content. With over 405 million assets, of which over 285 million are digitized, encompassing the latest global news, sports, celebrity, music, and fashion coverage; exclusive conceptual creative images; and the world’s largest commercial archive. New content is added daily, with 8-10 million new assets added each quarter. We are inclusive of different voices, perspectives, and experience. We believe diversity is critical to our mission to objectively reflect the world we live in and allow our customers to illustrate that world. This means including a diverse range of voices in our content, actively pursuing diversity in our team and sources of content and listening to our customers to make sure we are as open and adaptable as possible. Who You AreGetty is embarking on its next wave of innovation in visual storytelling and how to put the flawless image or video in our customer’s hands, be it for a society-changing headline or a brand’s next big campaign—truly moving the world with images !We are looking for a curious hardworking and innovative Data Analyst to uncover customer insights through data to optimize Getty Images search experiences for our customers. This is a high-impact position where you will guide product strategy through data insights and experimentation. Your vision to extract insights about our customers to support data-informed decisions will affect over 50 million visitors from almost every country in the world, with a direct tie to Getty Images' revenue.In this position, you will be responsible for performing business analyses and providing useful insights and recommendations to optimize impact within the customer search experience and business operations. The role will work closely with internal clients to identify analytical requirements, clearly articulating data-driven results sourced from multiple systems.Your Next ChallengeProvide analysis of data to answer specific questions related to business value and operations, focusing on user impact.Resolve sound statistical methods to find and interpret data related to our internal metadata product and/or search results.Design experiments to generate practical insights and recommendations.Create dashboards to monitor metrics.Develop and propose new metrics.Work across the global Search organization to make practical intelligence available to business partners. Translate analysis into business recommendations.Report and present project progress and final findings in a clear, engaging, and distributable way for monitoring ongoing performance and stand-alone investigations.Work with the other analytics team to implement and document standard methodologies related to data gathering, cleansing, analysis and reporting. Be comfortable, or swiftly become comfortable- working across multiple platforms using Pytho, SQL, Looker using your general familiarity with data wrangling, and sophisticated joins as the data infrastructure and tooling is constantly evolving. (Required)Due to the current conditions and impact of Covid-19, this key position will initially work from home, until such a time we open our offices. At the time of the local office opening, employees and managers will partner to determine the work site location in line with our Flexible working policy.Benefits At Getty ImagesExtended Health InsuranceWe provide comprehensive health and dental benefits through Manulife Financial. Economical is part of Definity, which includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, Definity has grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Develop, monitor, and enhance analytical solutions in collaboration with business stakeholders and IT professionals. Effectively plan and manage analytics projects, leading team members through technical work. Develop a strong understanding of the insurance business through independent learning and working closely with business stakeholders. Experience with cloud computing platforms such as GCP or AWS is highly desired. Experiencing with CI/CD pipelines for deploying data and machine learning models is highly desired. Knowledge of Git for version control and collaboration is an asset.We also take potential into consideration. We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.comJob DescriptionWhat You’ll Be DoingThe Quality Assurance, Fraud and Credit Integrity team independently identifies, manages, and reports on credit and fraud risks to ensure alignment with CIBC's risk appetite. The Senior Portfolio Analyst conducts data-driven analysis on the operational effectiveness of credit policies and procedures as well as fraud processes and strategies to derive insights and recommendations. They lead initiatives from end-to-end and act as subject matter expert in utilizing data proactively to support our business teams with efficiencies, effectiveness, innovation, and decision making.How You’ll SucceedAnalytics – Conduct advanced analysis to support the development and implementation of fraud and credit integrity strategies for all Retail Products with a focus on Business Banking portfolio designed to optimize risk-reward tradeoffs for all retail lending products. Develop risk indicators and identify populations for further review. Understand and interpret business requirements, evaluate complex data relationships, and deliver outputs that meet business expectations. Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data and analytic results using well-developed quantitative methods.Data Management – Work collaboratively with partners to augment/acquire internal and external data and tools. Design solutions to support the automation of processes and reporting. Manage large data sets and maintain databases such as Access, SAS, SQL. Develop strategies that ensure data accuracy, consistency, timely capture and standardization at the various levels across varying product groups.Reporting - Perform data aggregation and develop and deliver dynamic and visually appealing Tableau reports and dashboards to outline issues and influence decisions. Interpret results, provide insights, identify gaps, and recommend improvements to processes and strategies.Engagement and Communication - Frequently liaise with key partners and peers to understand data, determine requirements, provide expertise, and communicate insights and recommendations to various audiences. Prepare presentations that clearly and concisely communicate key findings and objectives. Contributes to the advancement of the team’s processes, efficiencies and best practices.Project Management - Utilize project management skills and methods to plan and prioritize initiatives, manage timelines while being agile in delivery, understand scope, requirements, and constraints, identify risks and develop mitigation strategies, and manage stakeholder expectations as well as ensure high quality workWho You AreYou have a degree in an advanced analytical designation (MBA, CA, CMA, CFA, MA, M.Sc., etc.) and/or equivalent progressive work experience within a large multi-dimensional organization.You demonstrate technical experience using analytic and reporting tools such as SAS, SQL, Python, Excel/VBA, Access Database, and Tableau. It’s an asset if you have knowledge of retail lending data, systems, processes and procedures.You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way. You have data management experience.You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountabilityWhat CIBC OffersAt CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at homeConnect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativityDevelop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product trainingProsper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase planWhat You Need To KnowCIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. Description Are you ahead of the curve, agile, curious and creative? Do you like to analyze big data to extract its value? Are you motivated by teamwork and challenges?As a Data Analyst at National Bank, you will be joining a team of passionate individuals who are striving to change the world of banking. We are client-focused and work on big data, high-impact machine learning and data modelling projects used for risk management related to fraud.This position will report to the Senior Manager, Models, Technology and Transformation, Fraud.Your Main Challenges Use and explore large volumes of data to meet various business needs. Define indicators and create metrics in order to identify trends related to financial crime. Use your creativity and expertise in analytics to extract relevant knowledge and information from a large volume of data. Work on reporting activities for anti-financial crime activities and business needs analyses, including presenting the results. Using effective visualization methods, present fraud performance results and trends. Work with other stakeholders with different mandates and varied expertise (technology, data science, fighting financial crimes). Influence your sector’s risk management orientations and ensure they are consistent with those of the Bank. Recommend approaches to optimize the detection of financial crimes and reduce false alarms. Support and develop financial crime detection models. Ensure the quality and integrity of data used for modelling and visualization. Carry out specific analyses and present the results clearly and concisely. Make concepts easy to understand and communicate complex informationQualificationsTarget profile: Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of relevant experience or a master’s degree and 4 years of relevant experience Expert-level knowledge of SAS Expert-level knowledge of PowerBI Expertise in data visualization techniques Excellent knowledge of SQL Knowledge of R, Python, an asset Knowledge of the Bank’s data warehouses, an asset Experience in fighting financial crime, an asset An attitude focused on the client experience and exploring solutions Proactive, innovative and committed Strong collaboration skills Bilingualism, spoken and written (English and French)Your BenefitsUpon hiring, you will be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family: Health and wellness program, including many benefits Flexible group insurance Defined benefit pension plan Employee Share Ownership Plan Employee and family assistance program Preferred banking services  philippe@aeroportvoyage.com Volunteer program Telemedicine Virtual sleep clinicThese are just a few of the many benefits we offer. We've rolled out a number of additional measures to ensure your health, safety and wellbeing during the pandemic.We're putting people firstWe're a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people. Full Circle is hiring an Advanced Data Analyst in Vancouver, or remote within North America, as part of our Studio Data & Insights (SDI) team. Reporting to the Director of Analytics for Full Circle, you will be part of a growing team that provides impactful analysis with relevant takeaways for our studio partners.What An Advanced Data Analyst Does At Full CircleOur team strives to be the voice of the player by discovering insights that improve the player experience. We do this by exploring a rich landscape of behavioral gameplay data and combining it with qualitative data from partner teams in User Research, Consumer Insights, and more. As an Advanced Data Analyst, you will design, prioritize, and execute analytics projects for multiple feature teams across the studio, and partner with them to turn your findings into action. These projects may include feature analysis, onboarding analysis, player segmentation, text analytics, geospatial analysis, retention modeling, building self-serve data products, A/B experiments, and more.You will share your findings directly with the development team, ranging from 1:1 chats up to studio-wide presentations. Many different disciplines will rely on you as a trusted source of information, including Product Management, Game Design, Engineering, Studio Executives, Brand Management, Marketing, and Finance. As part of working with a diverse group of partners, you will gain exposure to different perspectives inside the gaming industry.As a team of analysts and researchers, we understand how important learning and growth are. In addition to working with our studio partners at Full Circle, you will have many opportunities to collaborate and share with hundreds of other data experts as part of the larger data analytics community at EA.ResponsibilitiesProvide recommendations on solutions to analytics needs using player data from multiple sourcesNavigate ambiguous problems, determine causes and constraints, translate qualitative/quantitative data into applicable insight, and create recommendations / outcomesElevate the studio's data maturity through creation of powerful self-serve tools and training non-data-professionals in their useMentor more junior analysts throughout the analytics process by employing best practices such as coding standards, code reviews and peer reviews to achieve high-quality outcomesRequirements7+ years experience in an analytical role performing quantitative analysis with big data3+ years experience managing your own deliverables and producing high quality results, building analytics plans with clear deliverables, ownership, and communication plansA Masters degree or Ph.D. in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, mathematics, engineering, economics), or equivalent experienceProficient in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources with differing structures Proficiency with a statistical analysis tool (such as R or Python) to perform analysisExperience defining goals, their associated reporting, and communicating their interpretation to the businessExperience leading and coaching presentations to wide audience of diverse skillsets, including senior managementConsidered a PlusExperience with Google Big Query and Google Cloud PlatformFamiliarity with version control and reproducible research best practicesExperience defining telemetry schemas for Mobile or HD gamesExperience developing dashboards and data models within LookerPassion for playing and thinking about games

JOB POSTING # 899308Position: Clinical Research Analyst Site: Princess Margaret Cancer CentreDepartment: Surgical Oncology/UrologyReports to: Principal InvestigatorPay Scale: $55,474 to $69,342 per annum (Commensurate with experience and consistent with UHN Compensation Policy)Hours: 35 hours per weekStatus: Permanent Full-timeUniversity Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Clinical Research Analyst in our Surgical Oncology/Urology Department.Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning.The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's five research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.The Division of Urology Research at Princess Margaret Cancer Centre (PM) is seeking an individual to join the Division of Urology team. Working under the direction of a Principal Investigator Surgeon Scientist, and supported by a research team, the Clinical Research Analyst requires past experience in the coordination and administration of research studies.The Clinical Research Analyst’s primary role is supporting clinical trials pertaining to virtual cancer care, biomarker analysis, surgical techniques and more. Primary responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, recruitment of study participants (e.g. identifying, screening potential participants & obtaining informed consent); coordinating patient visit schedules as per study protocol; executing/coordinating all aspects of study visits (e.g. and as applicable, documentation of adverse events & medications, administration of questionnaires, reviewing & assessing study-related documents; liaising with sponsors, external stakeholders & members of the clinical care team; implementing and coordinating all aspects of data collection and source documentation, as per UHN policy and ICH/GCP guidelines; executing study-related administrative tasks, such as completion of relevant study CRFs, logs, trackers, databases, etc.; and maintaining regulatory files. The Clinical Research Analyst must be able to interpret applicable regulations to ensure compliance during the conduct of the study. In addition to management of research protocols/studies, the Clinical Research Analyst may be required to support grant application preparation (e.g. scientific writing, collection of supporting documents, budget preparation) and manuscript writing.Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited ToAssist in the coordination and overall operations of virtual cancer clinics; manage financial budgets under the guidance of program Principal Investigator; manage communications with patients and clinical care team.Apply fundamental knowledge of research to produce high-quality, scientifically accurate written documents, such as grant applications, publications, stewardship reports, and presentations.Conduct literature reviews and comprehensive reports on relevant topics as directed.Assist with data collection and analysis and support manuscript preparation (e.g., organize and conduct interviews, transcriptions, thematic analysis, drafting manuscript).Collaborate with clinical care providers, subject matter experts, researchers, and educators to understand programmatic needs and execute strategic initiatives.Perform cross-functional duties as assigned or requested.QualificationsAt minimum, a Bachelor’s degree in life sciences, oncology, or other health/science-related disciplines, and/or a Master’s degree in similar fields preferred.Minimum one (1) to two (2) years of relevant experience working in an academic or healthcare setting.Strong knowledge and experience with advanced methods in quantitative and qualitative research.Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate effectively to stakeholders with varying degrees of expertise.Ability to parse complex scientific information and translate to lay language, while adhering to scientific accuracy.Ability to adapt writing style to specific formatting requirements and audiences.Proficient at identifying and extracting key messaging from complex scientific/medical material.Proven ability to work within tight and strict deadlines, as well as manage competing demands of short- and long-term projects, and independently coordinate and prioritize relevant tasks and responsibilities.Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to learn new concepts and techniques quickly. Familiarity with medical terminology is an asset.Critical mindset and attention to detail are crucial.Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment, as well as independently.Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights CodeIf you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and covering letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.Posting Date: May 19, 2022 Closing Date: June 16, 2022For current UHN employees, only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.UHN thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, BIPOC, persons with disabilities and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Why join us?Our people make all the difference in our success.As the Analyst, Pension Insights, you will be joining Pensions Data & Operations within OMERS to enable cross-platform success for Pensions data – maturing leadership on our data program to enable broader data capabilities to drive analytics and insights.In this role, you will be joining Pensions Data & Operations within OMERS to enable cross-platform success for Pensions Experience. You will help support our Voice Of the Customer program and our customer research community to enable broader customer experience (CX) measurement, omnichannel feedback and sentiment collection, in order to drive analytics and insights about the experience of OMERS members, employers and stakeholders. Reporting to the Lead of Pension Insights, and leveraging enterprise capabilities, you will use your skills in data analytics to explore CX insights about our members that may be adopted to help OMERS deliver a better pension experience.This is an exciting opportunity for emerging data analysts with an interest in CX and/or pensions to advance their career within a growing team. With the help of the Lead of Pension Insights, you will gain valuable skills in statistical analysis and modeling, data visualization and storytelling with data.To note We value our talented colleagues, and whenever possible, strive to help them grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you see yourself in this open position, we encourage you to apply!As a member of this team, you will be responsible for Supporting the Pensions Experience Insights program, maturing our capabilities in customer experience measurement, omnichannel feedback and sentiment collection, survey programming and text analyticsAnalyzing large member data setsManaging the extract, transform, load (ETL) process for the purposes of producing data-driven insights about our members, includingworking with other technical teams to define the data pipeline;performing data analyses and building insightful visualizations;documenting system requirementsCollaborating with peers and data analytics leaders toIdentify, draft and communicate findings to senior leadership;Research best practices in CX analytics and reporting;Advise senior leadership on approaches to enhancing our existing ETL processWorking collaboratively across a variety of technical, data science, and business teams to deliver the Pension Experience Insights programAssisting other members of the Pension Insights teams with data validation and checking, where neededTo succeed in this role, you have A university degree. A post-graduate certificate in Data Analytics/ Data Science is preferred;Experience running end-to-end data analytics projects. This includes requirements gathering, data collection, data cleaning, and analysis;1+ years of experience in SQL;1+ years of experience in Python and/or R;1+ years of experience with Excel, Power Point;Experience working with teams in a fast-paced setting;Demonstrable skills in problem-solving and critical thinking;Experience using Salesforce Marketing Cloud preferred;An interest in demography, behavioral psychology or in pension administration would be an asset.The Pensions Team is constantly evolving, and your role may evolve with it. OMERS is committed to helping you learn and grow alongside us.Our storyFounded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.Vaccination PolicyAt OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Are you ready to be a player who drives Scotford to beat-lead-thrive through the energy transition? Ready to lead Scotford’s transformation beyond our existing ways of working into our Energy & Chemicals Park of the future? Are you ready to bring Scotford’s bold 2030 Vision to life?Where you fit in - When you join the Scotford Digital and Business Transformation team, you are joining a diverse group of pioneers committed to exploring our potential and expanding perspectives to shape our collective future. We are an inclusive team which supports and fosters open dialogue and collaboration as we seek to drive our transformation at pace. We welcome an entrepreneurial spirit and the willingness to experiment, to try new methods, techniques, and approaches as we generate solutions to both anticipated and adaptive challenges.What's the role - The Digital + Business Transformation Team is looking for a Data Scientist who is responsible for delivering data science and analytics opportunities for the Scotford asset. The Data Scientist will tackle big data from multiple sources; bringing structure to large quantities of data and applying analytics and machine learning practices to extract information and in turn provide accurate insights and predictions that can be used to power critical business decisions at ScotfordAccountabilitiesTranslate business needs to technical specifications by transforming and selecting features for modelling dataUse exploratory data analysis techniques to identify meaningful relationships, patterns, or trends from complex data setsBuild machine learning/statistical models for high impact business problemsCommunicate data analysis and findings through effective data visualizationsEnd to End Deployment machine learning models to production environments (Azure ML, C3).Mentor site staff in data scienceCollaborate with teams to integrate systemsResponsible for design methodology and project technical documentationWhat’s in it for you Hands on experience working in an Agile work environment Deepen your knowledge in emerging technologies (Advanced Analytics, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning) The ability to make an impact and shape your career experience in digital + business transformation The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives, and ideas to achieve our transformationSkills & Requirements:What we need from you - A legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer.Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related quantitative discipline4+ years relevant development experienceExperience with programming languages, preferably PythonExperience in deployment of machine learning models in cloud platforms like Azure or C3Knowledge of applied statistical analysis, machine learning modeling techniques, and data processing methods, model validation techniques, etcExperience with time series forecasting is an assetAbility to work with unstructured data from various sourcesCompany DescriptionShell is a global group of energy and petrochemical companies with about 84,000 employees across more than 70 countries. We aim to meet the world’s growing need for more and cleaner energy solutions in ways that are economically, environmentally and socially responsible. We have expertise in among other exploration, production, refining and marketing of oil and natural gas, and the manufacturing and marketing of oil products, chemicals, electric power, renewables and energy solutions.As a global energy company operating in a challenging world, we set high standards of performance and ethical behaviors. We are judged by how we act and how we live up to our core values of honesty, integrity and respect for people. Our Business Principles are based on these. They promote trust, openness, teamwork and professionalism, as well as pride in what we do and how we conduct business.Building on our core values, we aspire to sustain a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone feels respected and valued, from our employees to our customers and partners. A diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment are vital to our success, leading to greater innovation and better energy solutions.An innovative place to workThere’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.An inclusive place to workTo power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.A rewarding place to workCombine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

DescriptionTHE ROLEHerschel Supply is searching for a Consumer Data Analyst to drive a data-driven approach to our marketing campaigns and support our brand, digital, and finance teams in analyzing our consumer trends to maximize value.As the Consumer Data Analyst, you will be responsible for working cross-functionally to develop insights to drive both consumer acquisition and retention efforts. By leveraging your experience, you will use existing and new data sources to evaluate our marketing programs, suggest areas for improvement and help support teams with new insights and tracking. You’ll provide actionable insights to develop stronger connections between our consumers and the brand.A DAY IN THE LIFEOur workplace is dynamic, supportive, and entrepreneurial in spirit, and we pride ourselves in being a collaborative, open-minded and imaginative team.On a day-to-day basis, the Consumer Data Analyst will: Create data-driven models to identify patterns of successful customer behaviour. Develop Recency, Frequency, Monetary analysis of customer behaviour and provide recommendations for improvement. Support forecasting and revenue/profitability modelling of the consumer database.  Analyze channels and provide insight and segmentation strategies to drive customer lifetime value. Analyze campaigns for ROI and profitability optimizations. Develop a testing framework to drive a learning agenda to optimize marketing strategies for ROI and growth.  Work with Marketing and Digital teams to develop attribution strategies to optimize marketing and brand investments. Work with Marketing, BI, Finance and Digital teams to leverage the key insights into clear deliverables. Partner with the BI team to manage and access data (existing and new sources) to provide insights to the business.  Build dashboards, reports, and metrics to help teams monitor outcomes. Present data and insights in a clear and concise manner using visuals, slide decks, and reports.Your Qualifications 5+ years analyzing data and developing advanced dashboards in a transactional focused business. Ability to leverage the power of SQL, R or Python in building reproducible and concise analysis. Experience with Power BI an asset. Knowledge of market research, performance marketing, and brand positioning best practices.  Ability to analyze data and create visual dashboards (Experience with Power BI an asset). Ability to prioritize work and focus efforts on the highest impact insights. Ability to find solutions to complex problems and connect recommendations to root causes. Works cross-functionally to deliver results, meaningfully contributing to the team and prioritizing team needs over individual needs.

Posted by                  Caitlyne Hawrelak (she/her)             Talent Acquisition Specialist @Samsung Ads l We're hiring!                                     Send InMail                    Samsung Ads is looking to add a Sr. Big Data Analyst to our Product Data Analytics team.About the teamThe Goal of the Product Data Analytics Team is to guide decisions & conversations by providing accurate & actionable information based on extensive exploratory analytics of data. We work very closely with not only the Product domains, but also many cross-functional team members such as AdOps, Inventory, FinOps among others.This role reports directly to our Sr. Manager, Product Data Analytics.All of our employees are currently working remotely from home. In the future, this role will be fully remote based anywhere in Canada if you are outside of Montreal or surrounding areas or hybrid based and will require a mix of working from our Montreal, QC office and remote work.What you will doSynthesize raw data into actionable insights to drive business results, identify key trends and opportunities and report the findings in a simple, compelling wayDesign and maintain data systems and databases; this includes fixing coding errors and other data-related problemsMine data from various sources, possibly reorganizing it in a format that can be easily read by either human or machinePrepare reports to effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data. JSON, Parquet, avro)Excellent verbal, written and reading English communication skills; French is an assetOpen to collaboration and working as part of a team Strong time management and problem solving skills with the ability to think critically Nice to Haves (assets):Experience with AWS Services (Athena, Lambda, EC2)Experience with BI Tools (ex. Quicksight, Tableau, Looker, etc)Experience with Unix/Linux and shell scripting Experience with Apache AirFlowKnowledge or experience of the AdTech space Basic Statistic backgroundBenefits100% company-paid comprehensive health & dental coverage (including massage and therapeutic care) as of Day 1. Access to an employee assistance program and a virtual care platform (wellness, medical & nutrition).Personal spending account & Healthcare spending account with Sun Life Life that can offer you personalized perks like home office equipment, spa treatments, green living, fitness equipment, music streaming services and more!Up to 2000$ reimbursed for Mental Health CareGenerous RRSP Matching Program up to 5% Competitive compensation package, including performance incentive bonus plan based on company, team and personal objectivesMinimum 21 days of paid time off PerksVirtual social committee-lead activities such as monthly wine club night, games night as well as wellness initiatives like virtual yoga and meditation, art therapy, aromatherapy classesAccess to learning and development opportunities (your own LinkedIn Learning license, Pluralsight, professional development program, continuing education and more)Officevibe - anonymous feedback from our teams to know how you’re really doing and keep you engagedOnboarding framework which ensures you’re set up for success from Day 1 to Year 1. This also includes a buddy program (someone who will be there for you) from Day 1Amazing discounts through Samsung Employee Discounts website and access to Perkopolis website with great rebates, coupons and promotionsSummer FridaysGenerous Employee Referral ProgramGiving Back Program which includes donation matching & volunteering initiatives including one paid volunteer day*certain benefits & perks apply to only full time permanent roles. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on big complex projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.We are proud to have built a world-class organization, grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. job_title: Sr. Data Scientist - North American Integrated Analytics
job_desc: Munich Re is one of the world’s leading reinsurance companies with approximately 40,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe. We expanding our diverse team of Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and Software Engineers as we deploy more complex and larger products. Headquartered in midtown New York City, our Integrated Analytics team operates as a start-up within the larger corporation; we are central to innovation and pioneering new technologies in the Life Insurance space. Our solutions are driven by the bold vision and strong sponsorship of North America CEO Mary Forrest. Our challenging work environment champions high performance, professional development, and innovation. The Integrated Analytics team is looking individuals who thrive in a collaborative working culture and are eager to learn from their peers. As a fast-growing startup within the Life and Health division, you will have broader responsibilities and development opportunities than at a typical tech company. As a Data Scientist you will apply statistical techniques and machine learning to build solutions to core challenges in the life insurance industry. You will immerse in real-time business problems to deliver world-class, innovative solutions for our North American operations and clients. The goal of our department is to make buying insurance policies less invasive and easily accessible to more people.Your jobApply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to build models for underwriting, experience studies, assumption development, pricing, and claims management.Help us drive innovation by enabling new underwriting paradigms, distribution models, and data management.Build and implement solutions that enable operational units to improve quality and speed of core processes in order to generate incremental revenue or reduce expense.Proactively research new ways of modeling data to unlock actionable insights or improve processes.Collaborate across Munich Re functions and with clients to use analytics to influence business decisions.Work with existing data science groups at Munich Re and collaborate with internal partners to leverage capabilities in big data technology.Your profileFirst and foremost, the successful candidate will demonstrate a natural desire to provide exceptional client service through his/her energy, enthusiasm and initiative.In addition, we are looking for the following qualifications:Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or Applied Mathematics, plus 3 years’ experience OR Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or Applied Mathematics, plus 1 years’ experience.Insurance or financial services background is preferred but not required.Actuarial examinations or designation is an asset but not required.Expertise in advanced predictive analytic techniques.Strong experience working with Python, or R; working knowledge of SQL (familiarity with multiple languages considered an asset).Experience working with analytics through the modeling lifecycle including gathering data, design, recommendations, testing, implementation, communication, and retraining.Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (ex. AWS, Microsoft Azure).Familiarity with big data technologies (ex. Apache Spark, Hadoop, etc.), natural language processing and deep learning frameworks (ex. Tensorflow, Pytorch) is an asset but not required.Excellent communication skills, effectively interpreting modeling results, distilling actionable insights and presenting them to partners.The ability to learn quickly.A drive to make a difference.Thrive in a dynamic environment and successfully deliver on multiple assignments under deadlines.We thank all candidates for their interest. Munich Re Canada is committed to providing a work environment that is inclusive and free of employment barriers and discrimination. Accommodations will be made for qualified applicants with a disability throughout the recruitment process. If you receive a request for an interview and you have a disability which will require an accommodation to support your participation, please consult with human resources or contact AODARequestHR@munichre.ca as soon as practical so that suitable accommodations can be arranged.

job_title: Data Scientist - NLP & Search (anywhere in Canada)
job_desc: *COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: Due to our customers' commitment to enforce a healthy and safe workplace, this position requires that potential candidates be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.  Machine Learning and Data Science applications under the Grainger Technology Group (GTG) spans E-commerce Search, Recommender Systems, Information Retrieval Systems and Visual Search. Projects often encompass research, problem solving, model development, testing, scaling, and implementing them in production. As a Data Scientist at Grainger Canada, belonging to the Search and Information Retrieval Team the candidate will be working on some of the organization's most important priorities for the next few years. The candidate will help develop machine learning & deep learning models, build robust, real-time service APIs that go towards building world class ML solutions in the MRO space.Responsibilities Build ML APIs that are robust, interoperable, and scalable.Deploy and maintain ML endpoints that perform/solve business critical functions/problemsPartner closely with Product, Engineering, UX, and Data Science teams to shape rigorous ML solutionsSupport your team in creating analyses that tell a story focused on insights, not just dataEngage with many parts of the organization to expand the adoption of key metrics (like conversion) across multiple dimensions of analytics to help us realize improved business outcomesBe recognized as Data Science SME for Grainger Canada in DS processes and algorithmsPartner with engineering to drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sourcesCommunicate with stakeholders on timelines and deliverable, attend cross functional calls to resolve implementation issuesRequirements Strong SQL skills and Python proficiencySolid understanding of model training methodology, ML foundations and the model improvement lifecycle. (Measuring drift, performing data augmentation and model refreshes)3+ yrs. experience working with and analyzing large datasets to solve problemsExperience building ML APIs that can handle >100 requests per secondMS in a quantitative field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Natural Sciences, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics)Strong working knowledge of REST (Representational State Transfer) APIs, Git, Bash Scripting, Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS (Amazon Web Services)Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable mannerisGrainger strives to be an employer of choice, to attract and retain top diverse talent, and to provide a safe and positive work environment for all of its team members. As part of Grainger hiring process, pre-employment background checks will be required for all external candidates. In accordance with Performance Excellence guidelines, team members are encouraged to apply for positions closely matching their experience/background and that are aligned with their Individual Development Plan. Grainger is committed to the principles and practices of employment equity. We invite all qualified women and men, including persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and Aboriginal Peoples to apply for our career opportunities. Accommodations are available on request for all persons with disabilities taking part in the selection process.
