organized with a research and audibility mindsetTrack record as a proven Data Analyst and solid spreadsheet skills (including formula building)Have a proficient understanding of best practices in data managementExcellent verbal and written communicationAbility to bridge understanding of customer goals and how data can be used to support tracking progress toward goalsExperience with requirements gathering, steward of dataGreat interpersonal skills, with proven success building relationships across all levelsStrong ability to collaborate within a remote working environmentSupply chain/procurement domain experience an assetExperience with Agile methodologies and scrum master experience is an assetExperience with Design thinking is an assetWhere Will You Work?The health and safety of our employees will always be a priority at Tealbook. As such, for the rest of 2021, Tealbook is a remote-first workplace and you get to decide what workspace works for you. You are encouraged to find a space that empowers you and that has your support group around you. We have an incredible office in Toronto (located at Spadina and Richmond, conveniently close to all the delicious eats) and we look forward to welcoming our TealBookers again when we reopen the office in January 2022. While we work remotely right now, we are busy renovating and adding in exciting perks to our office (spoiler alert….there just might be a coffee bar being added!)The Perks of Being a TealBookerYou will be a part of a culture that is people first, teamwork first and a promise to deliver. We are a collective of people and collaboration is key to our process. We are proud to have built a culture that every TealBooker has an impact on, cultivates and embraces. You will never hit a cap on your growth. Your manager will work with you closely to collaborate on your growth plan, set learning milestones, invest in meaningful resources and set you up for success. You will have unlimited access to our internal mentors and world renowned external learning content at your fingertips. You will be confident in being compensated well for your hard work and contribution. We believe in paying fairly and in sharing our success with our employees. This is why we pay competitively, transparently and ensure that every single employee gets a Stock Option Plan. You will be empowered to do the best work of your career at TealBook. We believe in autonomy, flexing those creative muscles, being open minded and trusting our employees with their responsibilities. You will have all the right tools and resources to do your job well. We invest in a new MacBook laptop when you join, provide you with an allowance to set up your work space and will give you access to our ongoing upgraded tech stack. You will be cared for - physically and mentally. We invest in our employees well being through our virtual yoga sessions, best in class mental health and EAP provider, very generous PTO policy and much more. We are not just another tech company, we care about delivering delight to every single customer we interact with. These customers are you, me, our vendors, our clients, our investors and everyone in between. We don’t work for our clients; we work with them. We feel proud to hear customer success stories from S&P, Macy's Freddy Mac, Johnson and Johnson and many more. We look to delight our own employees through every aspect of their TealBook journey. We hear them, we celebrate with them and we grow them. Everyone brings something valuable to the table and we empower each other to be a change-maker. This is the place where you will get to make a big impact and have all the support to do so. We got your back. Curious to know more? Send us a note because we are excited to hear from you! TealBook is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity, and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the requirements for the position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Statistical Analyst, Elevating Devices (5840)Requisition ID: 5840 Number of Vacancies: 1 Department: Plant Maintenance (20000007) - Elevating Devices Supervision (30000437) Salary Information: $59,677.80 - $74,529.00Pay Scale Group:  6SAEmployment Type:  RegularWeekly Hours: 35, Off Days: Sat/Sun Shift: DayPosted On: May 27, 2022Last Day to Apply: June 6, 2022Reports to: Manager, Elevating Devices The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) is North America's third largest transit system and has been recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA. Guided by a forward-thinking strategic plan, the TTC's vision is to be a transit system that makes Toronto proud. The TTC's recruitment efforts are directly aligned to its mission of providing "a reliable, efficient, and integrated bus, streetcar and subway system that draws its high standards of customer care from our rich traditions of safety, service and courtesy."General AccountabilityDevelops reports, identifies trends, forecasts, and provides statistical information and analysis to the section. The role also creates, maintains, and ensures data integrity of all databases related to the work, and coordinates data collection, data entry, and running of database audit reports.Key Job Functions Perform analyses of information relevant to the work assigned to identify and forecast trends, problems, and/or potential risk areas, ensuring the validity and accuracy of data. Maintain integrity of data through regular auditing and monitoring and reviewing, verifying and editing data to ensure accuracy. Review statistical methods and procedures used to obtain data to ensure validity, applicability, efficiency and accuracy of raw data. Receive, code, sort and input data from multiple sources on a timely basis, ensuring validity, applicability, efficiency, and accuracy. Maintain a central file system, update file list, index, assigning file codes to correspondence and ensuring correspondence is filed appropriately. Participates in the TTC Customer Service Ambassador Program. Demonstrates behaviours that support diversity, inclusion, and a respectful work and service environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. Helps to remove barriers and accommodate employees and customers (within their area of responsibility) in accordance with TTC’s commitments and obligations under the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC) and Related Orders, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and TTC’s policies.SkillsPerform relevant mathematical calculations and statistical analysesMaintain documentation and historical recordsUse office technology, software and applicationsCommunicate in a variety of mediumsApply analytical skillsEducation and ExperienceCompletion of a post-secondary college diploma or university degree in a related discipline or combination of education, training and experience deemed to be equivalent.Additional Requirements Comprehensive knowledge of statistical, analytical, and research methodologies Must have working knowledge of personal computers and software applications related to the job (i.e. Crystal Report Writer, Minitab, Micro Strategy, Microsoft Word, Excel and Access etc.) including the ability to manipulate computer databases Must have working familiarity with various forecasting models Ability to identify measures or indicators of database system performance and identify the actions needed to improve or correct performance Detail oriented, produce quality work, meet required deadlines and work with minimal supervision Good organizational skills, effective interpersonal, oral and written communication skills for dealing with staff at various levels; presentation and problem solving skills Knowledge of data entry methods and modern office practices and procedures Experience in entering and managing high quantity of data is mandatoryMust possess excellent mathematical skills; excellent typing, word processing and keyboarding skills Ability to operate various office equipment necessary to perform dutiesThe TTC is committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, anti-racism and inclusion in the delivery of its services and in its workplaces. The TTC is committed to fostering a diverse workforce that is representative of the communities it serves at all levels of the organization, and supports an inclusive environment where diverse employee and community perspectives and experiences bring value to the organization. The TTC encourages applications from all applicants, including members of groups with historical and/or current barriers to equity, including but not limited to, Indigenous, Black and racialized groups, people with disabilities, women and people from the LGBTQ(IA+) community. The TTC values and supports an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Accommodations for applicants are available upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process, including for those who identify as having a disability. Please contact Human Resources – Talent Management at (416) 393-4570. Any information received related to an accommodation will be addressed confidentially.The TTC’s policy prohibits relatives of current TTC employees from being hired, assigned, transferred or promoted into positions, where there is a conflict of interest due to a relationship. Should you be selected for an interview, you will be required to disclose the name, relationship and position of any relative who is a current TTC employee. Note: All TTC Employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a precondition of employment in accordance with TTC's Mandatory Vaccination PolicyWe thank all applicants for their interest but advise only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

The Development and Release Engineering (DRE) team are EA's continuous integration and build experts. We're a team of over 100, located in EA studios across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. We pride ourselves on providing superior automation services to our internal customers - EA's game, product, and content teams.Our work creates a LOT of data! As a Senior Data Analyst on the DRE team, you will help support the business through data analysis to improve the efficiency and quality of EA's game development workflows. Your insights will influence how DRE helps EA make amazing games. You'll report to a Sr. Engineering Manager and become part of the larger data analytics community at EA.Responsibilities Create statistical analysis models for hypothesis testing, prediction, or inference.  Create performant data models that can be further used for visualization by the team.  Visualize high-readability data insights using tools like Power BI, Kibana, or Grafana.  Work with business and technical stakeholders to translate their needs into data insights.  Perform data analysis on business processes to provide an objective view on how the business operates.  Work with data engineers to manipulate, analyze and tell a story with complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from multiple sources using different tools and data analysis techniques.  Use and promote data exploration techniques to discover new or previously unasked questions.  Evaluate, interpret and present data to find risks and opportunities to improve our service.  Build scripts and queries to import, clean, transform, and enhance data.   Qualifications  5+ years of work experience in a past analytical role, using data to create process improvements.  Bachelor's degree in a technical field (e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or completion of post-secondary level Math and Statistics courses.  Creative thinking and analytical skills.  Proficient in one or more of the following: Python, R, Scala, or SQL.

Help Us Shape the Future of HealthcareAt League, we’re big on building connections - both through our product and with each other. Our platform is consumer centric, personalized and always on. We’re reimagining the health benefits experience to give people a more consumer-centric way to manage their health: immediate, seamless, and tailored to their unique needs. It’s a front door to healthcare that empowers people to live healthier, happier lives. Every day.As a Data Analyst, you will help us create an engaging product that improves the health outcomes of our users. In this role, you will use in-depth analysis and governance of business intelligence, to enable and drive our product managers and marketing team to improve the user experience and engagement on our platform.People who have worked within cross-functional and multi-disciplined teams (and enjoyed doing so) will thrive in this role. Furthermore, you have experience in tying numbers to a larger, more strategic, business context. You enjoy communicating with non-technical stakeholders, using the art of converting simple questions into complex analysis and translating them back into meaningful and actionable insights.Our data team also manages an internal Business Intelligence product that primarily leverages a SQL-based ETL to surface key performance indicators company-wide within Looker. You will be working closely with data engineers and data scientists on the team to build and maintain our data pipelines to ingest and transform data from a variety of sources to support these BI tools.In This Role, You Will Develop analytics strategies and frameworks to monitor and analyze product performance and business KPIs related to application usage, and user engagement & conversion.  Provide insights through analysis to help inform decisions in all parts of the business, including Product Management, Marketing, and Healthcare.  Work closely with internal stakeholders to define the work you take on in support of their teams, as well as communicate data considerations and issues they need to consider in their work.  Work closely with data-engineers and data-scientists on data requirements, reporting and forecasting of metrics.  Regularly conduct tagging audits and analysis to ensure the accuracy of reports, in particular of the client events generated by user button clicks and screen loads within the app. Attributes You care deeply about using information and data in decision-making and have experience in communicating that logic to stakeholders.  You are a strong problem solver and can communicate the challenges and solutions effectively  You are a strong communicator and comfortable collaborating with groups and at times, training or educating teams to use data tools or to understand results  You drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.  You like working in a fast-paced environment and are comfortable managing multiple tasks to tight deadlines.  You are eager to learn from others and help others grow with you. Desired Outcome Ownership of stakeholder relationship, where your consistent and impactful analysis and business intelligence work is aligned with company objectives.  Empower your stakeholders to make data driven decisions by guiding and assisting them to use our data products and by providing them with data insights. Required Education/Experience/Certificates Strong SQL skills and experience working with a modern ETL framework  Experience working as a data analyst or data scientist  Undergraduate or Masters degree in business administration, statistics, computer science or similarly quantitative discipline, or equivalent practical experience Nice To Have ExperienceData analysis and data manipulation in Python (Pandas, PySpark, etc)Healthcare industry experienceAt League, everyone is welcome. We believe individuals should not be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status If you are an individual in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at recruitinginfo@league.com.Here are some additional resources to learn more about League:Learn more about us in this short video!League, Cleveland Clinic collaborate to make employees healthier across North AmericaLeague and Loblaw bring next-generation digital health platform to customersLeague Completes Workday Approved IntegrationGiven the current public health guidance on COVID-19 and to help support office health and safety, at this time, it is our company policy to require all Leaguers to be fully vaccinated to attend our offices in person.Recognize and Avoid Employment scams. Practice safe job searching.Scammers are getting craftier and leveraging fake job postings to get personal information. Know the warning signs and protect yourself from scammers. Learn more here .Privacy PolicyReview our Privacy Policy for information on how League is protecting personal data.

At Elastic, we see endless possibility in a world of endless data. And we use the power of search to help people and organizations turn that possibility into results. Elastic is the leading platform for search-powered solutions. With solutions in Enterprise Search, Observability, and Security, we help improve customer and employee search experiences, keep critical applications running smoothly, and protect against cyber threats. Elastic enables organizations worldwide to use the power of Elastic, including Netflix, Uber, BBC, Microsoft, and thousands of others.Elastic was built on a foundation of being free and open, which trickles down to how we work. We’re a distributed organization and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn’t just a way of doing business—it’s a mentality that is at the core of our culture.The Elastic Security Machine Learning team is looking for a Data Scientist to contribute to the maturation of our endpoint malware detection models, and help build models for entity analytics in the Elastic SIEM. You will work closely with ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Managers, and UX teams, to build and deploy new models, identify model blindspots, detect drift patterns, confidently label never-before-seen samples, and address questions like:How to expose model outputs to users?How does the performance of our models change over time?What can we do to improve our models?If you are ready to solve these challenges and more, we look forward to hearing from you!What You Will Be DoingYou will have the opportunity to build models within the Elastic Stack, leveraging Elastic Security telemetry data, while collaborating with other teams at ElasticYou will also have the opportunity to work with machine learning engineers on the team, to prototype and productionize models for the Elastic Endpoint Security malware detection productYou will participate in regular production deployments and model validation tasksWhat You Will Bring Along2+ years of machine learning experienceExperience using or developing ML pipelinesPython programming skillsAbility to synthesize evaluation metrics, customer feedback, and internal analysis to communicate model performanceEnthusiasm for providing novel contributions to the information security research community on machine learning techniquesBonus PointsExperience with javaExperience writing production-quality codeMalware or security backgroundExperience with any part of the Elastic stackAdditional Information - We Take Care Of Our PeopleAs a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave

Job description:Job category: Information technologyJob posting ID: 3071 Employment status: Regular full-time Classification: PTS/MGT/IT BSalary/Rate of pay: $84,000 - $99,000 Application deadline: 2022-05-31  Somewhere in Canada there’s a life you can save.  Be part of a dynamic, collaborative and caring organization committed to saving and improving the lives of Canadians. Thousands of Canadians depend on us every day for reliable access to blood, plasma, stem cells and organs and tissues.  Join Canada’s Lifeline and make a meaningful difference every day.  About the role: Canadian Blood Services is looking for a Regular Full-Time Data Scientist to join our dynamic Integrated Supply Chain Business Systems and Analytics team. In this role you will be responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and predicting outcomes and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining, and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, you will also be proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, designing specialized database and computing environments, and communicating results. Key responsibilities include: Works with Canadian Blood Services stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome. Identifies what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes such as geo-location information or social media. Solves client analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies. Works in iterative processes with the client and validates findings. Forecasts various key metrics to enable operational planning. Identifies and analyzes patterns in the volume of data supporting the initiative, the type of data (e.g., images, text, clickstream or metering data) and the speed or sudden variations in data collection. Presents and depicts the rationale of their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Helps the organization understand the principles and the math behind the process to drive organizational buy-in. Provides business metrics for the overall project to show improvements. Assesses, with the business, the expected qualification and assurance of the information in support of the use case. Works with the data steward to ensure that the information used is in compliance with the regulatory and security policies in place. Education, Training and Experience: Master’s degree in mathematics, statistics or computer science or related field; an equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered. 3-5 years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics. Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques. Strong programming skills and statistical modeling (such as experience with Power BI, Azure Synapse or SQLServer Data Warehouse, Azure Data Lake, Python, R, SAS) Experience using machine learning. Proficiency in the use of statistical packages. Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization. Knowledge or experience with one or more business or functional area of Canadian Blood Services such as health care or supply chain management.  Demonstrated Competencies, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Must possess a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem-solving skills and programming knowledge to be able to quickly cycle hypothesis through the discovery phase of the project. Excellent written and communications skills to report back the findings in a clear, structured manner are required. The ability to come up with solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large areas of focus. Strong communication and interpersonal skills.  Benefits: Competitive base salary range  Annual Performance Award up to 8% 4 weeks vacation to start Comprehensive extended health and benefits Choice of defined contribution or defined benefits pension plan Employee discounts, wellness programs and professional advancement opportunities  Diversity and inclusion play a vital role in ensuring health equity for patients across Canada. We are committed to reflecting Canada’s population in our organization and fostering an environment where all employees can be their authentic selves, with equal opportunities to succeed and contribute.  To protect the health and safety of its employees, all Canadian Blood Services’ employees are required to be fully vaccinated (COVID-19 vaccine doses as approved by Health Canada), subject to any medical or other human rights grounds. If this role resonates with you, we encourage you to apply! This could be your first step towards a meaningful and inspiring career. Come to work each day knowing that you save lives.  We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those considered for an interview or those invited to participate in an assessment (such as testing) will be contacted. Applicants who require accommodation should discuss their needs with us.

job_desc: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Overview:We are looking for analysts to join the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia based in Bangkok, Thailand. Agoda is a strongly data driven organization: as a Data Analyst, your insights will impact strategic and tactical decisions driving business growth.Responsibilities: You will work in the Data Analytics team to deliver significant and action-oriented analyses and recommendations to your stakeholders, to help drive decision-making with insights from customer data analysis.Your work will be project-oriented, since you will get the opportunity to own analytical projects, starting from understanding stakeholder needs and problem definition, to the analysis and interpretation of results as well as communicating the findings to the Operational teams or other groups in Agoda (Marketing, Product, Partners Services). Typical analysis projects can be: Predictive modeling, e. g. of customer wait times or future call demand  Segmentation of customers based on differing usage patterns of our customer service  Design TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewThe Group Risk Management team develops and implements TD's risk management strategies, policies, reporting and operating frameworks, regulatory affairs and operations. We assess operational, enterprise and credit risks, and regulatory affairs throughout TD’s footprint to ensure Bank has an effective operational risk management program within its risk appetite. If you want to be a brand ambassador who can help strive efficiencies for the bank, then join our team and make an impactful contribution to TD and your own success.Job DescriptionAre you a dynamic professional that can confidently provide a broad range of risk analysis, reporting, monitoring and support to business partner requests? Working as Senior Group Risk Analyst, you will report to the Senior Manager of Reporting, Model Management and Analytics, act as a specialist in providing guidance and oversight on risk related matters. In addition, you will:Act as one of the primary analysts in the reporting and analysis of Risk Weight Asset (RWA) for Canadian and US Retail portfolios.Act as one of the primary analysts the primary analyst in the development of new processes to support additional reporting and reconciliation needed for reporting.Analyze the movements in the monthly and quarterly reporting results and contribute to the preparation of the flash summaries to the executives.Interact with peers from other risk management, TBSM, Chief Accountants and Finance areas within the Bank to understand new requirements, gather inputs and validate assumptions for new reporting initiatives and changes including Basel reform.Collaborate with the Model Development and Implementation teams to perform impact estimation for new model implementations.Contribute to complex data requests including the Basel Quantitative impact studies and OSFI data requests.Lead the work to support ad-hoc requests from various business partners.Build and maintain relationship with other business partners including Risk Capital Assessment, Chief Accountant Department, TBSM and various Product groups by providing analysis support related to Regulatory and Economic Capital.Ensure governance and controls related to regulatory reporting processes are adequate as per the internal and external audit standards and if any gaps are identified bring them to senior management's attention. Job RequirementsUndergraduate degree in Finance, Math, Statistics, Computer Science or similar discipline and over 5 years of relevant experienceProgramming experience using SAS, SQL or PythonPRM, FRM, CFA or similar accreditation is also considered an assetSAS Certification is considered as an assetBroad and deep knowledge of business and risk and control environmentStrong communication skills to build and maintain strong working relations with cross functional teamsPossess high degree of judgement and decision-making skills and integrity to process and handle confidential details with discretionExcellent organizational skills with the ability to multi-task while meeting deadlines and adapt to change in a fast-paced dynamic environmentInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Posted by                  Christine Nascimben             Connecting top talent with opportunities at Northbridge; Actuarial and Data Analytics focus                                     Send InMail                    At Northbridge, our Business Data Analytics team acts as a central partner to the business by helping unlock the value of data and supporting our transformation into an analytics data-driven organization. The Senior Data Analyst will provide insights using analytics descriptive and diagnostic techniques to business units of focus.They will provide in-depth expertise, analytical interpretation, key insights, and action items to multi-functional business partners across the organization that will help solve increasingly complex business problems by enabling informed business decisions.They have a passion for fostering a team of analytics and business experts, an analytical mindset, and a keen interest in influencing business performance through insights. In other words, they’re awesome. If you are too, consider joining our Data and Analytics team!You’re great at: Communicating effectively and impactfully with business stakeholders and senior leadersApplying your strong understanding of business strategies to produce relevant and substantial data analysis to support business goals and objectivesProviding seasoned specialized analytics expertise, advice, and mentorship to various business and team membersTranslating business requirements (questions, opportunities, and problems) into analytics needs for a given domainBeing a business expertYou have: B. Sc Computer Science, Mathematics, Stats, Engineering or equivalent work experience3+ years in statistical analytics techniques (i.e., correlation, regression, cohort, experimental design & measurement)Intermediate to advanced knowledge of statistical analytical techniquesAdvanced knowledge of data mining languages SQL and/or PythonExpert at writing standard SQL queries to extract and integrate data from a variety of different data sourcesWe’re great at putting you first by: Prioritizing your well-being (Wellness Program, flexible health benefits, employee assistance)Promoting balance (flexible schedules, generous time off, and work from home options)Supporting your financial health (employee share purchase plan, pension plans, discount on staff insurance)Helping you grow in your career (education assistance, internal mobility)Caring about the community and the causes you believe in (donation matching, team volunteering)

Our priority is the health and wellness of employees and the people of Ontario. As such, this position may involve working from home for part of the duration of this position. The WSIB model mixes working from home, office and field. About The Workplace Safety And Insurance Board (WSIB)We’re here to help. When an injury or illness happens on the job, we move quickly to provide wage-loss benefits, medical coverage and support to help people get back to work. Funded by businesses, we also provide no-fault collective liability insurance and access to industry-specific health and safety information. We are one of the largest insurance organizations in North America covering over five million people in more than 300,000 workplaces across Ontario. For more information, visit wsib.ca .At The WSIB, You’ll Have The Opportunity To explore many career paths and follow your passion continuously learn and grow professionally be recognized for the great work you do participate in programs that support your health and wellbeingYou’ll also receive a competitive salary and may be eligible to participate in our health and dental plan.This is a temporary opportunity for up to 6 months.Salary Grade: 211 From: $74,294.73 Job SummaryAs part of the non-functional group within a Testing Team, provide data analysis, profiling and synchronization services including collection of data requirements, maintaining data delivery frameworks, supporting generation of test files and delivering data results. Assist the team in identifying improvement opportunities for existing data profiling, generation, and synchronization capabilities.Major Responsibilities Intake, categorize, prioritize, analyze, carry out, present and report on all data profiling. Build and maintain GW (Guide Wire) structural data matrices defining core data categories, such as Accounts, Claims, and Contacts. Analyze, design and build new structural data matrices for other core data categories as required. Manage, control, maintain and enhance data analysis, profiling, synchronization and test files generation frameworks as well as adapting them to new requirements and processes. This includes maintaining and controlling all associated codes and ensuring they align with and are relevant to GW data model changes. Maintain GW data dictionary, data models for all GW modules, and GW records subset solution for building test data. Design, implement, and manage automated processes for vendor files collection for testing purposes. Manage data management SQL server and all assets it contains. Manage and maintain GW test data subset solution. Keep all documentation related to data analysis, profiling, synchronization, test files generation and subset solution up to date and in a proper repository. Develop mapping documents between legacy copybooks and relational database systems. Control, maintain, analyze, enhance and automate library and usage of data profiling queries. Provide analysis, feedback, reports to lead and manager relating to the scope of data delivery. Perform other related duties as assigned or required.Education Job Requirements  University completion at undergraduate level with a specialty focus Computer Science, Information Systems or Computer Engineering. Senior Data Analyst As Canada's destination for the coolest tech, Best Buy offers one of the best work environments in the country! Annually recognized as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, our culture is one of inclusion, recognition, innovation, and enjoyment.At Best Buy, we are a diverse team of forward-thinking team-players with the ability to make an impact. Our voices are heard, acknowledged, and we inspire change. Our skills are nurtured, our well-being is supported, and our growth is encouraged. We are powered by passion: passion for our fields, our customers, and technology.At our head office, in beautiful Vancouver, BC, we practice a remote first working model, leveraging in person interactions for strategic, collaborative and social purposes.As an embedded Data Analyst, you will help our business partners in their day-to-day decision-making process, working together to better serve our customers.As a Senior Data Analyst, you will…Lead problem research, insights exploration, metrics design, and data storytelling to provide actional recommendations on business operations and product roadmapsOptimize cost and revenue potential via opportunity analysis, forecasting, or simulationCommunicate key insights, recommendations, and results to business stakeholdersDesign and build experiments to measure impact of technology and operational changes that impact millions of customersCreate self-serve dashboards to track KPIs and support insights explorationPartner with other analysts and engineering teams to support of data products and artifactsEducate and evangelize the value of advanced analytics in the company (decision support, problem solving vs. data pulling) through formal workshops, Open Houses, and presentationsInfluence and partner with key stakeholders to bring in new data sources and analytics toolsWe hope you are passionate about… Lead by intent at any stage in your career. Every analyst carries the freedom and responsibility to bring innovative ideas and recommendations that challenge the status-quo.Develop domain expertise through embedded culture. Your cross-functional team will trust you as the Analytics Expert while you get to develop your knowledge in a specific business function.Grow your analytics toolkit within the Analyst Community. Best Buy has one of the largest analytics team in Vancouver. Embedded analysts come together weekly to share learnings, establish best practices/methodologies/frameworks, innovate through hackathons, and take courses together.What you will need to succeed: 3+ years of experience working in an analytics related/relevant business areaAgile mindset on how to deliver value iteratively and adapt quickly to changeCuriosity and drive to continuously learnFlexibility to work in multiple data-related areas like data modeling & design, writing complex SQL queries, Power BI dashboarding, ETLs, etc.Advanced proficiency with SQL and comfortable with PythonAbility to convey complex technical information in a digestible format to audiences ranging from your peers to senior executivesAbility to work independently and provide mentorship to junior members of the teamWe believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology. Join our amazing team!We are looking for people just like you.

Gandeeva Therapeutics Inc. is a rapidly growing precision biotechnology company located in Vancouver, BC, Canada harnessing the power of cryo-EM technology and machine learning to advance drug discovery and development at scale. Gandeeva seeks to achieve transformative societal impact on public health by revolutionizing drug discovery and by lowering the risk of late-stage clinical failures. Our unique and world-leading AI-enabled cryo-EM drug discovery platform combines deep biochemical and structural knowledge of the most important protein sites for targeting with tools to cast precision spotlights that translate this knowledge into better, faster and cheaper treatments for patients. We are building an interdisciplinary and innovative team with biologists, chemists, microscopists, engineers, and software developers and business professionals who will be working closely together in state-of-the-art facilities that provide a stimulating environment reflecting our inclusive and welcoming culture. Join us on our mission to bring new treatment options to patients by revolutionizing drug discovery! We are seeking a Data Analyst with a deep understanding of the drug development process. The ideal candidate will work cross-functionally within the company to analyze relevant market and business data in drug discovery and commercialization. Responsibilities:Support due diligence activities across a wide range of scientific and business opportunities. Monitor and compile information from multiple public and proprietary data sources to drive forecasting activities.Evaluate regulatory, coverage, reimbursement, and pricing hurdles, as well as other healthcare industry complexities in relation to company’s business.Identify unique drug development and commercial opportunities.Qualifications:Lifesciences MSc with 2+ years of data analytics experience in a biopharma-related field or a data scientist with an equivalent background.Excellent quantitative and analytical skills, with a preference for individuals that have programming and/or statistical training.Experience using statistical and data visualization packages preferred.Relevant experience evaluating and managing scientific and business data relevant to biotech and pharma drug discovery and clinical processes.Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Must demonstrate and work to a high level of personal and professional integrity and ethics.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Excellent attention to detail with strong critical thinking and decision-making abilities.Excellent time management skills with the strong ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.Must be an independent, self starter who is also an excellent team player with the flexibility to work collaboratively in a multi-disciplinary environment.Gandeeva Therapeutics Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. A highly competitive total compensation package will be offered to the successful candidate. Come join us in the beautiful city of Vancouver!

Posted by                  Mario Naric             CEO, Founder, RP at Motif Labs                                     Send InMail                    Reporting to the Director of Product Commercialization, the Forecasting Analyst will be supporting the commercial team in inventory & sales data analysis, tracking market pricing, dashboard management, and other data driven initiatives. CompanyMotif Labs is a licensed cannabis extraction facility located in SW Ontario. Motif operates as a business-to-business enterprise, offering toll processing and contract manufacturing services to Licensed Producers (LP's) and 3rd Party Brands. Motif is experiencing significant growth and we are seeking dynamic and professional individuals to join our team. Motif prides itself on Integrity, Collaboration and Quality, and these core values are at the center of everything we do. Position Overview:Internal Responsibilities · Periodically review market pricing for Motif SKU categories · Update wholesale inventory tracking tools (data pulls & entry)· Derive market insights from provincial sales reports · Market analysis as required including; trending product sales, pricing adjustments, and profitability analysis· Manage Motif listing pricing; landed, wholesale, and MSRP · Develop sales forecasts and update monthly revenue plan · Revenue forecast updates · KPI dashboard management · Other duties as required External (Client) Responsibilities · Provide weekly updates to Motif brand partners for current inventory and weekly sales · Update brand dashboards with current inventory and inventory allocation for provincial offer sheetsQualifications: · Bachelors degree or College diploma in a related discipline (Business/Finance, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Applied Math or Data Analytics)· 5+ years related work experience· Experience working in small to mid size start up companies· Advanced level Excel user (pivot tables, vlookup functions, basic level VBA· Advanced computer skills including proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word) & Google Suite· Comfortable working with data and using data to drive decisions · Power BI or Tableau experience would be an asset· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills· Positive attitude with strong communication skills· Strong time management skills including ability to multitask and prioritizeNOTE: All candidates are required to pass a criminal background check and provide a copy for employment at Motif. We thank all interested candidates. Only those whom we have selected for an interview will be contacted. HOW TO APPLY: YOU MUST submit your resume and cover letter to Motif Labs careers page at: www.motiflabs.ca to be considered.Please note you must be 19 years of age to both enter our website and work for our company. We thank all interested applicants but only those who have been selected for interview will be contacted. COVID PROTOCOL:This is a remote role where you will need to be on site at our production facility occasionally. Motif provides all required PPE and has continued all safety protocols: a well-fitted mask must be worn at all times while indoors in shared spaces and staff are to remain 2M+ apart, COVID screening must be completed every day prior to entering the facility and we are moving to mandatory vaccination status.

Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and businesses around the globe, from a review of a coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.The Data Science & Analytics team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s products and users. Our teams sit in Yelp’s central product management organization and work directly with cross-functional leaders to understand quantitatively how our products are performing and where the largest opportunities are. We are adept at tasks like modeling user preferences, inference from user and marketplace experiments, and generating insights about the health of local economies. With diverse backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada.Where You Come InJoin a team of Data Scientists and Data Science Analysts that develop analytical frameworks and reliable measurement strategies for Yelp productsDesign, execute, and analyze complex business and user experimentsPartner with other Data Scientists and Data Engineers to set the vision for and develop our experimentation platformDevise and evaluate models for diverse business needs, such as identifying growth opportunities, estimating the impact of new features on our platforms, and personalizing the user experienceProactively research and build ETL pipelines for product and marketplace metricsCommunicate key insights from analyses, experiments and data products to stakeholdersWhat It Takes To SucceedMS/PhD in quantitative field and ideally 3+ years of industry experience in a senior quantitative roleAbility to apply statistical, analytical and technical expertise to product and business problemsPrior experience structuring and leading impactful data science projects independentlyOral and written communication skills to mentor colleagues, and work effectively with partners on engineering, product and business teamsExpertise in SQL, and R or Python for data analysis and platform developmentEnthusiasm for building a culture of learning and developmentIt's Nice To HaveProduct analytics experience with small business or consumer technology productsPrior industry experience building online experimentation and machine learning platformsOther RequirementsVaccination against COVID-19 is not required for this role. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. This means:AI Factory - Versatile Teams Operating in Cross Functional Pods: Utilizing digital and data resources to develop AI products, bringing data management, AI and product development skills to products, programs and projects to create an agile, fulfilling and meaningful work environment. World Class Mentorship and Training: Working with renowned leaders and academics in machine learning to further develop your skillsets The Fine Print:Thank you in advance for your interest.Only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.Follow Sanofi on Twitter: @SanofiUS and on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/sanofi.US Vaccine MandateAs a healthcare company and a vaccine manufacturer, Sanofi has an important responsibility to protect individual and public health. job_desc: Talentify helps candidates around the world to discover and stay focused on the jobs they want until they can complete a full application in the hiring company career page/ATS.CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.What does that mean for you? job_title: Senior Analyst, Innovation and Data Insights- EN
job_desc: TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. At Coast Capital, we’re not dreaming about a better future, we’re building one.As a member-owned cooperative, we’re helping our members with their real goals and real challenges so they can live the real life they want. It’s what we’ve been doing for over 80 years, and it’s why today we stand almost 600,000 members strong. Plus, we invest 10% of our budgeted profits back into our community – almost $90 million since 2000 alone – because when our members do well, we believe our communities should do well too.Why join Coast Capital?Purpose is our North Star.  We look at everything through our purpose. It informs the advice we provide our members, the experiences and products we create, and the programs we build to support our employees and communities.Committed to inclusion and engagement. We have an ongoing focus on equity, diversity, and inclusion and routinely track how we’re doing, and what we need to do to keep improving. We foster a culture where everyone can feel safe to be who they really are and thrive.A career that grows with you. We believe in developing our people and promoting from within. Many employees have spent decades, and sometimes their entire careers, with Coast Capital and have progressed from the frontlines to senior leadership.Work where you’re most effective. In 2020 the world changed, and that includes how we work. In response to COVID-19 we launched myWork, which gives employees flexibility in where they work based on the nature of their role.Benefits that flex to the needs of you and your family.  We offer comprehensive, customizable benefits for you and your family, so you can choose what fits best for you and your lifestyle.Retirement options. We also take care of our employees once they retire. That’s why we offer the choice of a defined contribution or defined benefit pension plan or RSP’s.Mortgage and auto financing benefits. Employees save thousands on their mortgages and auto loans with best-in-category benefits.Real recognition. We recognize excellence throughout the year, through an online community that lets employees give kudos and thanks throughout the year. We’re human, which means we like to have fun with events, celebrations, and recognition throughout the year.An award winning culture. We’re a Platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies and are regularly recognized by Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures and the BC Top Employers Awards.We reinvest 10% back into the community. When we do well, our communities do well. That’s why since 2000 we’ve invested over $90 million into our member’s communities.Double your impact. Through our employee volunteer program, Coast Capital donates $10 for every hour you volunteer to a Canadian charity or non-profit of your choice.Equity, Diversity & Inclusion at Coast CapitalAt Coast Capital, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. We’re not all the same and we like it that way. We don’t just accept differences - we celebrate, support, and we thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our members, and our community. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.COVID-19 at Coast CapitalCoast Capital Savings is committed to the health and safety of our employees, member, and communities. With this commitment in mind, Coast Capital complies with all public health mandates (provincially and/or federally, as applicable) and has implemented various safety measures, including requiring all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, and making COVID vaccination a pre-condition to employment with Coast Capital. All successful applicants must provide acceptable evidence of full vaccination against COVID-19, before any contract of employment becomes final and binding, and before your start date can be set.Exceptions may apply where vaccination is not possible for medical or religious reasons that are protected under Canadian human rights laws. Should successful applicants require a medical or religious accommodation related to vaccination please discuss whether an exception may apply with your Talent Acquisition Advisor.Location: British Columbia (CA-BC), SurreyJob Type: Full Time 6 months plus.What’s the job?The Commercial, Retail and Wealth (CRW) Data Analyst is responsible for the timely preparation of regular and ad hoc reporting to support strategy, initiatives and investigations. The Analyst uses data to maintain or develop reports for stakeholders. These reports and analysis may be distributed widely to front-line staff and management, internal stakeholders or external parties. This individual works collaboratively within the Operating Office, the Commercial, Retail and Wealth management and other stakeholders to develop and validate reporting, provide insights and measure risk and/or performance.What You’ll Get To DoPrepares data and analytics requests from internal and external sources. Applies standardized definitions and calculations for data usage Prepares regular (weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually) reporting as assigned. Supports the 1B line of defence function by providing analysis and reporting of data to identify risks related to the Commercial, Retail and Wealth Group, including design, implementation and maintenance of effective internal controls. Analyzes and interprets data, identifies trends and issues and summarizes business impacts. Assists with ongoing validation of reported results. Works closely with internal partners and management to ensure implemented processes and controls are fully understood and appropriately utilized (DASH, SharePoint) and that processes for reporting are simple and fully transparent. Investigate data anomalies and provide updates to key stakeholders when applicable. Assists the Commercial, Retail and Wealth management with data and analytics to be included in presentations to the key stakeholders. Keeps abreast of changes to policies, procedures, processes, or trends in credit and regulatory issues that may have an impact on reporting and data requests. Works cooperatively, develops strong relationships with Commercial, Retail and Wealth management, business partners and stakeholders. Prepares industry research and analysis in support of decision-making on business cases developed as part of assigned project work. Maintains governance and documentation standards for all assigned regular reporting. Who are we looking for?High School and a Diploma Post-secondary education in math, science, statistics, economics or similar is an asset. 4 - 6 years experience within wealth management, commercial, retail banking and/ or financial institution, or an equivalent combination of education and experience Advanced knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint and SharePoint Proficient knowledge of the process to identify and assess risk Proficient of the relationship between risk and controls Proficient knowledge of risk and credit risk terminology and risk products High proficiency in report writing and presentation skills Working knowledge of Temenos T24 High ethical and professional performance standards Ability to manage diverse stakeholder relationships Excellent ability to make sound decisions based on thorough research and analysis Ability to see the big picture and manage the details Ability to deliver and multi-task in a fast pace environment Ability to work independently with good time management and prioritization skills Excellent time management skills with an attention to detail Self-starter and ability to follow through on all tasks

Posted by                  Mark Dizon             Professional Friend Maker/Talent Acquisition Partner - Lead Recruitment Cowboy                                     Send InMail                    DescriptionOmnicom Media Group is seeking a Data Analyst to improve and scale our Marketing Science services. This role will have a significant impact on Hearts & Science through executing hands-on data analysis, generating actionable insights, providing strategic direction, and building reporting solutions for our fast-growing roster of clients.Not sure you meet every single thing listed below? Apply anyway! About YouYou have a background in data analysis, statistics, econometrics, performance marketing, digital analytics, media planning/strategy, or something along those lines. You are generally what people would call a “numbers person”, and you are familiar with media metrics such as cost per click, reach, frequency, return on ad spend, etc.You have at least 1 year of experience in analytics or media roles. You have a track record of uncovering actionable insights from data, and your friends reach out to you when they have a hard time with an Excel spreadsheet.You have experience at, and are comfortable with, working at client-facing roles. You can independently combine distinct datasets, run an analysis/build a cursory ad-hoc model, and present results to clients.You can build and run a linear regression model in Excel or Python and are able to explain things such as R square, P-value, or regression coefficients to an audience that has no background in statistics. You are very comfortable building pivot tables in Excel or reaching similar outcomes in SQL/Python/R.You have experience with visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI/Domo. Major bonus points if you know Datorama.Finally, you take pride in the quality of your work, yet you remain curious and are never done learning. You work hard to earn and keep client trust, and you don’t sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. About the JobMarketing Science encompasses a wide array of functions but, in general lines, we use data to provide our clients’ Marketing teams a significant competitive advantage within their industries.More specifically, in this role you will:· Develop insights through direct analysis of data that can be sourced from:· Media reports from digital channels (cost, impressions, clicks, revenue, etc.)· Syndicated data (such as Environics, ComScore, Nielsen, etc.)· Client proprietary data sets· Your own research· Communicate with clients about media strategy, measurement, competitive analysis, A/B testing, modelling requirements and results, etc.· Design and maintain data visualization solutions for our clients· Help defining what needs to be measured within our clients’ media activity (Measurement Framework)· Contribute to writing documents that explain our clients’ businesses, challenges, and opportunities for internal consumption (Client Business Overview)· Co-author documents that outline test-and-learn opportunities that can work to benefit our clients (Learning Agenda)· Lead or contribute to the development of models such as media mix models (MMM), revenue forecasting, customer segmentation, etc.· Identify opportunities for new model designing/implementation· Work with Strategy teams to identify and develop project-based initiatives· Develop audiences, sometimes using large datasets, and provide guidance to clients and internal teams on audience insights· Contribute to test design and setup, including writing proposals and coordinating with internal and external parties

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewThe Canadian Credit Card Group is responsible for strategy, product development, customer lifecycle management, and financial performance of all Canadian Credit Card products. Canadian Credit Cards leads the market in retail volume by providing a diverse suite of products and services.The Credit Risk and Exposure Management Team for Canadian Credit Cards is responsible for the development and optimization of programs and services that drive customer engagement, improve profitability, while constantly striving for improved customer experience. The team leads strategies that grow the Canadian Card business by driving compelling offers for TD Card holders, providing customers attractive borrowing options and leading opportunities to improve employee and customer experience, while contributing to bottom-line results. Some of the strategies managed include: Balance Transfers, Credit Line Increases, Acquisition Risk Strategy, Loss Mitigation, Customer Monitoring & Remediation, and Regulatory Projects & Controls.Job DescriptionAs a member of the Credit Risk and Exposure Management Team within Canadian Credit Cards, the Senior Analyst, Credit Limit Increase Strategy will report to the Senior Manager, Consumer Card Account Management Strategies, and will focus on proactive identification of opportunities for the credit limit increase program for Canadian Credit Cards as we look to grow market share, right size customer lines and manage exposure riskThe Senior Analyst reports directly to the Senior Manager Account Management Strategies and is accountable for analyzing program profitability, setting and tracking financial commitments, leveraging profitability tools and data sets to extract insights, and presenting recommendations to senior management. The credit limit increase program is critical to TD Cards and MBNA Cards growth and manages material P&L contributions in retail volume, RAR, and NIAT. This role will work closely with numerous partners including Marketing, Operations, Direct Channels, PBDA, Legal, Technology, Finance and Risk partners, as well as external partners as needed to achieve business objective.KeyAccountabilitiesThe Senior Analyst, Credit Limit Increase Strategy is responsible for:Identify opportunities across the TD and MBNA portfolio for Credit Limit IncreasesCoordinate with Risk, Marketing, PBDA and Finance partners to balance risk and reward to achieve portfolio NIAT and growth targetsAccess and analyze date to monitor CLI performance to develop recommendations for strategy optimizationProven interpersonal and relationship management skills, with ability to obtain consensus among multiple stakeholders Support the team in identifying opportunities to continuously evolve, enhance, and grow CLI program, including test & learns and new growth opportunities to drive portfolio engagement, while improving the customer and employee experienceOversee business analysis / business case development to support delivery of strategic initiatives Lead cross-functional teams to implement initiatives by providing direction and alignment with overall business goalsManage delivery of team goals and promote teamwork within the groupLead control and monitoring of campaigns Partner with marketing to optimize target, creative and channelsJob RequirementsQualifications / Skills / Experience:Results-focused individual with proven ability to execute with Bachelor's Degree in business/accounting/finance/computer science, math or engineering or equivalent work experienceStrategic thinker with proven analytical and problem-solving skills who can see the “big picture” to propose solutionsDevelop, business case, and implement Account Management offers to grow loans and revenue for Canadian Credit Cards. Ability to autonomously pull data and complete in-depth analysisDeep understanding of credit card profitability and financial modeling Demonstrated analytical skills and an ability to identify insights on opportunities to improve Account Management offers from data and analysis Proven interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills to various levels of managementStrong organizational skills, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple deadlines and prioritiesSuperior Microsoft Excel and Power Point skillsDeveloping and running SQL Codes, SAS Datasets and familiarity with Tableau is considered an asset Knowledge of the credit card business is an assetInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
