job_desc: Job Description :Data Management Analyst - Information Technologist 3 (AESES)New Budget-Funded Continuing Full-Time 35.00 hours/week; Monday - Friday; 8:00 am - 4:00 pmSalary Range: $31.63 - $45.64 per hour ($57,566.60 - $83,064.80 per annum)Proposed Start Date: June 13, 2022Trial/Probation Period: 840.00 work hoursFor more information, please contact:Andrea Toyne753 McDermot Aveandrea.toyne@umanitoba.caResponsibilities :- Consults and provides services to principal investigators, research staff, and all others who seek clinical research data management solutions through CHI. - Provides guidance on the process of accessing clinical research data management software (e.g. REDCap) available through CHI. - Provides information and resources on setting up and maintaining clinical research databases at CHI.- Enforces REDCap project management processes and account management processes- Investigates software solutions for development and maintenance of electronic databases.- Documents clinical research data management processes and solutions.- Ensures that technical assistance is provided throughout the database development and implementation phases of a research project.- Liaises with stakeholders and establishes clinical studies and administrative databases in REDCap, maintains the databases within the secure environment, and provides ongoing technical support.- Ensures quality data is collected by monitoring the usage of established REDCap databases and adhering to data lifecycle management principles.- Provides training in clinical research data management. - Develops and delivers workshops, seminars, and other training events and materials to existing and potential users of clinical research data management software.- Schedules and co-ordinates training events in consultation with relevant user and stakeholder groups.- Responds to REDCap enquiries from the research community and troubleshoots research database issues.- Participates in activities to oversee implementation and maintenance of CHI's clinical research data management software.- Works with CHI staff to define the mandate, priorities, key activities, and structures of clinical research data working groups established by CHI. - Provides support for clinical research data working groups established by CHI, sets sagendas, and ensure that meeting minutes are maintained.- Attends and participates in clinical research data user group meetings.- Stays up to date on current developments in clinical research data management software and applications.- Ensures that CHI staff have up to date information about CHI's clinical research data management activities.- Performs other related duties as assigned.Qualifications :MINIMUM FORMAL EDUCATION/TRAINING:- Master's degree in computer science, epidemiology, biostatistics, or a related discipline is required. EXPERIENCE:- A minimum of one year experience in the development of database management and/or data collection forms is required. - Experience with clinical trials and the associated data collection is an asset.- An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. SKILLS AND ABILITIES:- Knowledge of electronic data collection processes and software, such as REDCap, is an asset.- Expertise in principles and practices of clinical data and databases management is required.- Working knowledge of research data management software (e.g. REDCap), MS-Office, and statistical software (e.g. SAS and/or R) is required. - Working knowledge of programming languages/systems (e.g. SAS, R, Visual Basic for Applications) is required, - Familiarly with data validation methods is an asset.- Familiarly with the Personal Health Information Act and the Tri-Council Policy on the Ethical Conduct for Research Involving Humans is an asset.- Good oral and written communication skills and strong analytical skills are required.- Ability to set priorities, multi-task and work effectively under time-constrains is required. - Must be able to work in complex team environment with researchers, clinicians, and representatives from external agencies, such as government departments. - Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.- Ability to diagnose and resolve software and system problems is required. - Ability to develop strong interpersonal working relationships is required. - Demonstrated ability to provide excellent customer service is required.- Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory attendance and punctuality, is required. Additional Information :The University of Manitoba is committed to the principles of equity, diversity & inclusion and to promoting opportunities in hiring, promotion and tenure (where applicable) for systemically marginalized groups who have been excluded from full participation at the University and the larger community including Indigenous Peoples, women, racialized persons, persons with disabilities and those who identify as 2SLGBTQIA+ (Two Spirit, lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, questioning, intersex, asexual and other diverse sexual identities). If you require accommodation supports during the recruitment process, please contact UM.Accommodation@umanitoba.ca or 204-474-7195. Please note this contact information is for accommodation reasons only.Application materials, including letters of reference, will be handled in accordance with the protection of privacy provisions of "The Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act" (Manitoba). Please note that curriculum vitae will be provided to participating members of the search process.

About UsAt HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.Watch Our 'About Us' VideoWe believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.Primary ResponsibilitiesIn the role of Transportation Data Analyst, we'll count on you to:Provide transportation planning services for transit, highway, municipal and provincial agenciesTake responsibility for corridor studies, forecast modeling, multi-modal transportation analysis, transportation planning, and project issue trackingAssimilate and manage dataCollect project-related data as needed, which may include research, interviews with government agencies and clients, map reviews, land use surveys, and socioeconomic analysisPrepare land use conceptsPrepare constraints mappingPrepare required documents such as environmental assessments and other technical reportsAssist in preparation for and participate in stakeholder meetings, public information meetings and hearingsPerform other duties as neededRequired QualificationsBachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Planning or closely related field2 years experience with transportation planning and designExcellent communication and technical writing skillsMS Suites, ArcGIS ProAn attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a mustPreferred QualificationsMaster’s degreePython, EMME, Synchro, VISSIM, Adobe Creative SuiteWhy HDRAt HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.Primary LocationCanada-Ontario-TorontoIndustryHighway + RoadScheduleFull-timeEmployee StatusRegularBusinessClassTransportation PlanningJob PostingMar 8, 2022At HDR, we are committed to the principles of employment equity in all of our offices. USA: We are an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider all qualified candidates regardless of minority, veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or any other status protected by law. CANADA: We welcome applications from all qualified individuals. AUSTRALIA: We consider all qualified candidates regardless of gender, ethnicity, country of birth, political or religious affiliation, health status, or any other status protected by law.Health and safety is also our priority. For some positions, you may be required to provide drug and alcohol testing, before or during employment, based on our Drug Testing and Drug Free Workplace Policy. If you are required to drive for us, we require a valid driver's license and compliance with our vehicle policy.

theScore, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Penn National Gaming, empowers millions of sports fans through its digital media and sports betting products. Its media app ‘theScore’ is one of the most popular in North America, delivering fans highly personalized live scores, news, stats, and betting information from their favorite teams, leagues, and players. theScore’s sports betting app ‘theScore Bet’ delivers an immersive and holistic mobile sports betting experience and is currently available to place wagers in New Jersey, Colorado, Indiana, Iowa and the company’s home province of Ontario. theScore also creates and distributes innovative digital content through its web, social and esports platforms.About The Role & TeamOn the Reporting team at theScore, our mission is to develop high-quality and sustainable automated solutions to meet the financial and regulatory reporting requirements for our iGaming business. As a Reporting Analyst, you’ll work hand-in-hand with the Data Engineering team to build, validate and deliver reports to meet the specific requirements in each betting jurisdiction. The ideal candidate has strong SQL skills, a passion for data, a background in automated reporting and an interest in professional sports, betting & eSports.About The WorkAs a key member of our Reporting team you will:Work with finance, executives and engineering teams to create new reports or make updates to existing reports as required.Manage automated regulatory, financial and executive reporting processes.Create and manage validations testing suites on all reporting processes.Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications to existing databases.Work with Data Engineers to design and manage automated processes using principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand.Provide timely responses and solutions on issues that arise in day to day automated reporting processes.Continuously improve reporting implementation and adapt to changing technologies.About YouUniversity degree in Business, Finance, Computer Science or related field.3+ years of related experience.Exceptional knowledge of relational databases and SQL.Ability to understand and report on complex data and handle all edge casesMust have an analytical mind set and strong attention to detail.Ability to focus in a fast paced environment and multitask.Familiarity with automation tools such as Airflow, DBT or Cron jobs.Familiarity with analysis tools (R or Python) is an asset.Excellent written and oral communications skills.What We OfferCompetitive compensation package.Comprehensive Benefits package.Fun, relaxed work environment.Education and conference reimbursements.Opportunities for career progression and mentoring otherstheScore is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age.

With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. Join the team that is building a trusted internet for Canadians! CIRA is best known for managing the system that keeps more than 3 million .CA domains running smoothly, but we do so much more to help Canadians thrive on the internet.  Whether it’s our cybersecurity products that protect Canadians online; our advocacy work that fights for better internet access; or our Community Investment Program that supports dozens of community-based internet projects across Canada—we work every day to keep the internet strong and free! Join us! What you’ll do: This is a new role, and as an organization, we’ve just scratched the surface on data analysis. You will have the opportunity to build, shape and expand CIRA’s data-driven activities, helping improve program delivery and raise CIRA’s profile on key internet issues.Working closely with internal stakeholders like product or program managers and our public affairs team, this role will help make sense of vast amounts of data generated by CIRA’s Internet Performance Test, Canadian Shield and DNS Firewall and other services.Explore: dig into our various sources to understand the gold we can mine from our data.A creative approach to problem solving. Help design and construct data analysis pipelines and workflows that link and correlate multiple data sources.Derive insights: use advanced statistical analysis (correlation, time series analysis, forecasting, supervised learning, etc.) to analyze data and lay the groundwork to telling a data-driven story.Visualize: build dashboards and visualizations that help our program and public affairs team quickly understand the insights and more easily and visually tell data-based stories.Empower: implement analytics dashboards and systems that will enable your colleagues to access the data they need independently.Keep our house in order: Assess CIRA’s digital ecosystem and sources of data to help improve our data hygiene and reporting processes.What you bring:A deep curiosity. You’re an investigator, and not afraid to keep digging into information to answer questions like “why,” “how,” and “so what.”A love of numbers and statistical analysis.Experience with big data tools including ELK, Kabana, or Athena.Previous work with visualization tools such as Qlik, Graphana, or QuickSight . Extra points if you have experience with a mapping/GIS system.Knowledge of/interest in internet issues including connectivity, access, and cybersecurity.Who we are:We are a not-for-profit, purpose-driven organization with a dynamic team that helps shape the internet in Canada. Our team is full of high performers and creative thinkers who come to work every day and ask, “What more can we do?” because they believe in the CIRA mission to build a trusted internet for Canadians. It is our team and our mission that has led CIRA to be named one of the National Capital Region’s Top Employer seven years in a row.  While our beautiful office at Lansdowne Park in the Glebe is temporarily closed, we have developed a dynamic remote work environment and culture that has made the past few months about as enjoyable as can be expected. We hope to return to the office when the coast is clear but will be adopting a hybrid model of in-person and remote work going forward. At CIRA, we foster relationships and build communities - online and off. We strive to be a place where talented people come, stay and do their best work. We are committed to employment equity and encourage anyone who can contribute to the diversification of ideas and perspectives to apply. If you require a reasonable accommodation during any part of the CIRA candidate experience process, please contact us at peopleandculture@cira.ca. COVID-19 Information:In accordance with our mandatory vaccination policy, we will only interview people who have been fully vaccinated, or who have a valid medical exemption.

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewTD applies the “Three Lines of Defence” model to risk management. Risks are owned and managed by the business (first line of defence) and they are responsible to develop, operate and monitor a control framework to mitigate them. Risk Officers and other governance roles form the second line of defence while Internal Audit make up the third.TD Securities Operational Risk Management (TDSORM) is a second line of defence function providing operational risk management oversight and challenge to TD Securities businesses and support functions.TDSORM's mandate is to independently guide and challenge the business' implementation of and ongoing compliance with the TDBG ORM Framework. The team is also responsible for providing a broad range of risk management counsel, risk analyses, reporting and support to business partners and senior management on a range of risk-related matters.Job DescriptionThis role will support the execution, oversight, and challenge of ORM Programs across the TD Securities portfolio. Through partnering with the Global TDS ORM team, it will assist with identifying, reporting, and mitigating, operational risk issues. It will support the management, administration, and governance of global risk committees, including facilitating the preparation of materials and, the creation of central reporting and quality control testing hubs for the global team.Other AccountabilitiesExecute on opportunities to streamline, automate, and improve processes to gain efficiencies, improve reporting and, increase the value gained through the team's execution of ORM ProgramsBuild and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with the global TDS ORM team and our business partnersHelp drive initiatives forward related to the team's reporting and data analytics capabilities and technologyJob RequirementsStrong attention to detail and organisational skillsAbility to gather, organize, transform, and analyse dataExcellent written and verbal communication with stakeholders of all levelsAbility to work independently and as part of a larger teamCreative thinking and problem-solving skillsProficient in Word, Excel and PowerPointExperience with Tableau would be an assetOperational Risk Management and/or Wholesale Banking experience would be an assetInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Who We AreBasis Technologies delivers software and services to automate digital media operations for more than 1,000 leading agencies and brands.Our comprehensive ad tech platform, Basis, supports the planning, reporting, and financial reconciliation of direct, programmatic, search, and social media, all in one place.We are deeply committed to building software that will change the ad tech industry for the better and are equally dedicated to building an inclusive culture of highly motivated individuals who create a positive and supportive environment together. Our employees have the flexibility to work in one of our office locations, completely remote, or a hybrid of the two. Data Operations is the ideal place for someone who thrives on working in a fast-paced growth environment, has a passion for working with data and technology, and is not afraid to take on some of the most complex challenges that Basis has to offer.WAYS YOU’LL CONTRIBUTEReporting into the Director of Data Operations, you will be responsible for working with stakeholders to define and prioritize critical business questions, build ETLs, and automated reports to support answering the aforementioned business-critical critical questions. Design and maintain BI reports: data extracts, visualizations, dashboards, etc.Create documentation for data sources, ETL processes and reporting solutions.Learn to understand our data sets and the KPIs that drive business success.Gather product requirements from internal stakeholders and suggest reporting solutions.Collaborate with internal clients, enabling them to understand and leverage our data.Help identify and execute on technology evolutions to improve capabilities.Identify and recommend product improvements with the goal of bettering data intelligence.WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE3+ years of professional experience, ideally in a similar role.3+ years’ experience working with Relational Databases including SQL.3+ years’ experience working experience with Python, or similar language for data analysis.3+ years' experience working with data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau).Experience with ETL software (e.g. Pentaho, Talend, Tableau, Domo, etc.).Post-secondary education with a strong analytical component, e.g. statistics, business, social sciences, sciences.Experience with version management software (e.g. Git).Experience solving problems using data analysis and modelling.Capable of working with engineers on technical design tradeoffs including platforms, frameworks, scalability and performance.Experience with entire development and project life cycles and doing so in a fast-paced workplace.Resourceful and self-reliant; a strong self-teacher with a passion for learning.Excellent communicator with an ability to clearly explain complex technical subjects.Passionate about problem solving and engaging the team to arrive at a solution.BONUS POINTS Knowledge of the digital advertising industry (e.g. AdWords, DSP, ad serving).Experience with product requirements gathering and documentation.Experience with HTML, JavaScript, Java and web development.Experience with Linux based operating systems.OUR TECH STACKHadoop, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDBPython, PentahoJIRA, Confluence, Stash, GitANYTHING ELSE?Don't think you have all the skills required for this role? That's okay, we recognize that experience can be built in many ways. If you have relevant skills that are not reflected in your resume, we welcome your candidacy and encourage you to share more in an optional cover letter, even if your experience doesn’t match our exact requirements.LIFE WITH BASIS TECHNOLOGIESWe take care of our people and believe that our success depends on the growth and well-being of each one of our team members.We provide a thoughtful perks and benefits package including competitive 401k/RRSP matching, mental health support, a funded health savings account, paid sabbatical, generous parental leave, a flexible work environment and time off policy, and more.We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer are committed to building teams that are diverse in thought, perspective, and culture. We celebrate all team members regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, race or cultural background, religion, disability, and age. Our  employee-led communities  enrich our culture of uniqueness, inclusivity, and empowerment.

At Elastic, we see endless possibility in a world of endless data. And we use the power of search to help people and organizations turn that possibility into results. Elastic is the leading platform for search-powered solutions. With solutions in Enterprise Search, Observability, and Security, we help improve customer and employee search experiences, keep critical applications running smoothly, and protect against cyber threats. Elastic enables organizations worldwide to use the power of Elastic, including Netflix, Uber, BBC, Microsoft, and thousands of others.Elastic was built on a foundation of being free and open, which trickles down to how we work. We’re a distributed organization and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn’t just a way of doing business—it’s a mentality that is at the core of our culture.The Elastic Security Machine Learning team is looking for a Data Scientist to contribute to the maturation of our endpoint malware detection models, and help build models for entity analytics in the Elastic SIEM. You will work closely with ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Managers, and UX teams, to build and deploy new models, identify model blindspots, detect drift patterns, confidently label never-before-seen samples, and address questions like:How to expose model outputs to users?How does the performance of our models change over time?What can we do to improve our models?If you are ready to solve these challenges and more, we look forward to hearing from you!What You Will Be DoingYou will have the opportunity to build models within the Elastic Stack, leveraging Elastic Security telemetry data, while collaborating with other teams at ElasticYou will also have the opportunity to work with machine learning engineers on the team, to prototype and productionize models for the Elastic Endpoint Security malware detection productYou will participate in regular production deployments and model validation tasksWhat You Will Bring Along2+ years of machine learning experienceExperience using or developing ML pipelinesPython programming skillsAbility to synthesize evaluation metrics, customer feedback, and internal analysis to communicate model performanceEnthusiasm for providing novel contributions to the information security research community on machine learning techniquesBonus PointsExperience with javaExperience writing production-quality codeMalware or security backgroundExperience with any part of the Elastic stackAdditional Information - We Take Care Of Our PeopleAs a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave

Help Us Shape the Future of HealthcareAt League, we’re big on building connections - both through our product and with each other. Our platform is consumer centric, personalized and always on. We’re reimagining the health benefits experience to give people a more consumer-centric way to manage their health: immediate, seamless, and tailored to their unique needs. It’s a front door to healthcare that empowers people to live healthier, happier lives. Every day.As a Senior Data Analyst, you will help us create an engaging product that improves the health outcomes of our users. In this role, you will use in-depth analysis and governance of business intelligence, to enable and drive our product managers and marketing team to improve the user experience and engagement on our platform.People who have worked within cross-functional and multi-disciplined teams (and enjoyed doing so) will thrive in this role. Furthermore, you have experience in tying numbers to a larger, more strategic, business context. You enjoy communicating with non-technical stakeholders, using the art of converting simple questions into complex analysis and translating them back into meaningful and actionable insights.Our data team also manages an internal Business Intelligence product that primarily leverages a SQL-based ETL to surface key performance indicators company-wide within Looker. You will be working closely with data engineers and data scientists on the team to build and maintain our data pipelines to ingest and transform data from a variety of sources to support these BI tools.In This Role, You Will Develop analytics strategies and frameworks to monitor and analyze product performance and business KPIs related to application usage, and user engagement & conversion.  Provide insights through analysis to help inform decisions in all parts of the business, including Product Management, Marketing, and Healthcare.  Work closely with internal stakeholders to define the work you take on in support of their teams, as well as communicate data considerations and issues they need to consider in their work.  Work closely with data-engineers and data-scientists on data requirements, reporting and forecasting of metrics.  Regularly conduct tagging audits and analysis to ensure the accuracy of reports, in particular of the client events generated by user button clicks and screen loads within the app. Attributes You care deeply about using information and data in decision-making and have experience in communicating that logic to stakeholders.  You are a strong problem solver and can communicate the challenges and solutions effectively  You are a strong communicator and comfortable collaborating with groups and at times, training or educating teams to use data tools or to understand results  You drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.  You like working in a fast-paced environment and are comfortable managing multiple tasks to tight deadlines.  You are eager to learn from others and help others grow with you. Desired Outcome Ownership of stakeholder relationship, where your consistent and impactful analysis and business intelligence work is aligned with company objectives.  Empower your stakeholders to make data driven decisions by guiding and assisting them to use our data products and by providing them with data insights. Required Education/Experience/Certificates Strong SQL skills and experience working with a modern ETL framework  Experience working as a data analyst or data scientist  Undergraduate or Masters degree in business administration, statistics, computer science or similarly quantitative discipline, or equivalent practical experience Nice To Have ExperienceData analysis and data manipulation in Python (Pandas, PySpark, etc)Healthcare industry experienceAt League, everyone is welcome. We believe individuals should not be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status If you are an individual in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at recruitinginfo@league.com.Here are some additional resources to learn more about League:Learn more about us in this short video!League, Cleveland Clinic collaborate to make employees healthier across North AmericaLeague and Loblaw bring next-generation digital health platform to customersLeague Completes Workday Approved IntegrationGiven the current public health guidance on COVID-19 and to help support office health and safety, at this time, it is our company policy to require all Leaguers to be fully vaccinated to attend our offices in person.Recognize and Avoid Employment scams. Vetsource is a health care information technology company that provides innovative pharmacy, technology, and business services to veterinarians. As the largest Home Delivery pharmacy provider to veterinarians, it sources products directly from the manufacturers and ships them to clients’ front doors. Vetsource’s Home Delivery services, including AutoShip and RemindMe, empower practices and their clients to schedule medications and nutritional products—including individual doses—for convenient home delivery with no shipping charges. More than 9,000 veterinary practices in the United States use Vetsource’s full suite of pharmacy services, with an additional 12,000 practices using its prescription management platform. Vetsource also offers additional software solutions, including veterinary data analytics through VetSuccess and a client engagement app via Vet2Pet.General Position Summary: The VetSource Analytics Team (VAT) is responsible for providing other teams at Vetsource internal analytics and plays a key role in helping the organization understand itself. Your focus as a Data Analyst will be in helping the rest of the business to interpret data, measure performance and make VetSource a more data driven organization. Excellence in this position requires a drive to be as helpful as possible towards your teammates in other parts of the organization, a willingness to understand their needs and rigorous thinking to build sustainable solutions to address them.You will be expected to dig into data and tackle some of the hardest problems facing the team. Staying on top of new tools and processes, developing a keen understanding of the organization’s overall business goals and constantly thinking about how to automate more processes will be part of your day to day as well.ResponsibilitiesDig deep with business partners in order to understand their needs and gather requirementsSynthesize and visualize data clearly while retaining context necessary for decision makingDevelop well thought-out metrics to measure business goalsBuild robust automated reporting and processes to minimize repetitive workBuild ML models to clean and augment dataIdentify and explore useful data sources to then integrate them into our data warehouseModel disparate data sources into a common data layerEvaluate analysts’ models and other output for completeness and relevanceOther duties as assignedQualifications3+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, statistics or similarProficient in any variety of SQLBA in engineering, economics, math or similar qualificationExperience building dashboards with Tableau, PowerBI, Looker or similarExperience with Agile, Kanban, Scrum or similarProficient with Python or RFamiliarity with DBT or other data modeling softwareBackground in operations, finance, marketing, sales, veterinary medicine or other business areas is a plus.

Data Analyst II, Data Science & AnalyticsAbout Realtor.comAt http://realtor.com , we have the most comprehensive and accurate coverage of real estate listings and the most engaged users across all the online real estate portals. Our mission is to make buying, selling, renting, and living in homes easier and more rewarding for everyone.The Data Science and Analytics organization at http://realtor.com sits at the heart of this mission. We process and analyze terabytes of data every day that enable decisions for millions of home buyers, sellers, renters, dreamers, and real estate professionals. Our goal is to use this data to make the home buying experience a breeze for our consumers. We empower them with the most up-to-date information on properties, help them find their dream homes in the least amount of time, and match them with the most suitable realtor to meet their unique, individual needs.Role DescriptionWe are looking for the best data and analytical minds to help us build our next-generation analytics platform. To accomplish that task, we are looking for a Data Analyst with a technology background to join our Metrics and Reporting team within the Data Science and Analytics organization. We’re building a centralized, state-of-the-art metrics data mart and automation on top of it to enable fast, accurate reporting across the business. This is a job for hands-on executors/do-ers/owners who possess not only the technical skills required but also a strategic, business-oriented mindset.We are looking for a Data Analyst II to join our Metrics team within Analytics with the goal of centralizing a metrics data mart and building the tools to enable self-service metric reporting across the business. The mission of the Metrics and Reporting team would be very strategic and pivotal to streamline the KPI definition, standardize the measurement methodology, documentation, and in a word democratize the access and adoption of the metrics across different business units of Realtor. We are also responsible to build some new metrics and estimated KPIs (e.g., predictive analytics) through discovery work and statistical rigors.ResponsibilitiesBuild trust in all interactions and with Trusted Data DevelopmentBe responsible for monitoring the success of visitors' engagement and conversion by tracking metrics and building new estimated KPIs if necessary (e.g., revenue metrics)Be part of the center of excellence by spearheading documentation on metrics hub initiatives (metrics definition, measurement, methodology, Datamart)Build relationships with other products and analytics to get all business metrics requirements and the right definition/measurement methodology Conduct quantitative analysis, ad hoc reports, & statistical models to understand the health and latest trends among engagement and conversion consumer metricsCreate impactful data reports from conceptualization, through data extraction, data analysis, and data mining, to the delivery of clear and actionable data. Be a champion to understand the Source tables and build data marts code to meet our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices (such as the SQL Style Guide) for a high-scale database environment. Maintain the metrics catalog and play a pivotal role to direct analysts and product community to the existing scalable resource to support Self-Service and Single-source-of-truth analyticsApprove data model changes as a Data Team Reviewer and code owner for specific database and data model schemas.RequirementsEducational Requirements: MS with a focus in Analytics, Statistics, Applied Math, Data Science, Economics, or related field. Experience within real estate tech, consumer search, and/or two-sided marketplaces is a plus. Ability to use GitLab Ability to thrive in a fully remote organizationPositive and solution-oriented mindsetComfort working in a highly agile, intensely iterative environmentSelf-motivated and self-managing, with task organizational skillsDemonstrated capacity to clearly and concisely communicate complex business activities, technical requirements, and recommendationsProven track record of translating business problems into analytical frameworks and developing analytical plans for answering complex problems and delivering analytic insights.Experience applying advanced analytical disciplines and statistics in financial, consumer audience/user experience, and/or product-level modeling, forecasting, regression, time series, etc.2+ years experience SQL skills 2+ years Excellent experience R/Python skills for data analysis2+ years working with a large-scale (1B+ Rows) Data Warehouse, preferably in a cloud environment2+ years experience building reports and dashboards in a data visualization tool (e.g., Tableau, Data studio)2+ years creating project plans to identify tasks, milestones, and deliverablesAbout Realtor.comAt realtor.com®, we believe that everyone deserves a home of their own. We’re a community of nearly 2,000 employees who work hard to ensure that from the moment someone starts dreaming about a new home, to the moment they walk in the door and beyond, we’re there to lend a helping hand. Every month, over 85 million people trust us with their journey home by visiting our site and mobile apps, and we’d love to have you join our team to help.We’ve got great offices in the U.S. and Canada with lots of sweet jobs to choose from, so we’re hoping you’ll join us on our journey to make buying, selling, renting, and living in homes easier and more rewarding for everyone.Let’s make a difference, together. For Real.

and accurate estimates towards the development, testing, and implementation of proactive threat detection capabilities.Contribute to successful completion of projects by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.What do you need to succeed?Must-have:A background in Computer Science, Computational Science, Mathematics, or a related field.Solid knowledge of general Machine Learning concepts both in theory and application and experience with advanced topics like Deep Learning, NLP, etc.Experience with data preprocessing, feature and representation learning, and anomaly/outlier detection.Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, R, Scala.Experience with big data processing technologies like Spark.Knowledge of Parallel Programming and High-Performance Computing.Nice-to-have:Knowledge of network and information security. Job CategorySoftwareOpportunity Awaits at Altus Group! The next stage in PropTech solutions: Unlocking the value of data and predictive analytics Altus Group is embarking on the next evolution of data, software and technology-enabled services delivered through cloud-native architecture. As pioneers in the Proptech and real estate analytics spaces, we are growing our offerings to enable our global clients to unlock the value of data and leverage predictive analytics for better decision-making. Building on established market-leading software and incorporating new connected technologies, we are embarking on a transition of our product-focused architecture to a platform of connected capabilities to serve the real estate investment industry. The opportunity The Data Scientist will work as part of the Development organization to build data science and machine learning solutions for commercial real estate (CRE). At Reonomy and Altus Group, Data Scientists have access to unique talent and data to build new models as part of a growing team. Data Scientists collaborate with engineers and data architects to integrate their models into pipelines for internal and client consumption. In this role, you will work as part of the cross-functional team to build and embed analytics, Machine Learning and AI to better serve our customers with the information that will change the way they do businessWho You AreYou are a business-minded Data Scientist with an extensive technical toolkit and a couple of years of experience working with real-life data (co-op, internships, or work-study experience is acceptable). Ideally, you have startup experience and you thrive in an ambiguous environment, building the infrastructure as you need it. You have exceptional communication skills with an ability to ask questions, probe further, and present insights clearly in non-technical language. What’s in it for you? Expanding the Reonomy Knowledge Graph to build property, market, and portfolio intelligence for CREBuild analytics and machine learning solutions that create outsized investment performance for CRE clients (e.g., rent and income modeling, explainable predictions of returns) Unparalleled exposure and impact.  You will work alongside development, architecture, and product teams who are at the top of their game, solving problems that have never been looked at before. As part of a platform team specifically assembled to collaborate on new work, you will have the freedom to create from the ground up, and work unrestricted accessing the information, tools, and technology you need. This is an opportunity to make your mark and truly accomplish something exciting as we focus on defining and driving our data and SaaS strategy. Growth and career development.  Altus fosters a culture of professional development and promotion from within. With retention rates double the tech industry average, and dozens of promotions within and across teams, this is a place to truly expand your skills and grow your exposure. As we move from building to scaling; from platform to product; and from storage to application, the opportunities to grow your skills, gain exposure, try new things, and make an impact will grow too.Our New Data Scientists WillAs part of a data team, design, build and improve Reonomy and Altus Group data science and machine learning modelsCollaborate with development resources to define and scope data science solutionsBuild new features, perform feature selection and model choice, and implement production-ready modelsParticipate in model and code reviews and contribute to a team consistently shipping new or updated analytics solutionsDefine and implement metrics that will track model performance over time to identify risks and opportunitiesOur New Data Scientists Will Have2-5 years of combined education and experience in a Data Science capacityYou have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or Computer Science, or a related technical field and applied work experience designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems, data models, and data lakesDemonstrated work experience with data transformation and cleaning, feature building, model implementation, and model performance evaluationAbility to write clean, well-organized Python code that will integrate easily into the production pipelineAdvanced knowledge in SQL and strong data analysis skills; including collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting dataAbility to build successful ML projects with a strong engineering focusPreferably experience with distributed computing: PySpark and/or ScalaA commitment to collaboration. Location  : Work is what you do, not where you go.For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in the United States or Canada.About The OpportunityThe Senior Data Analyst is responsible for building and deploying advanced data capabilities to assigned business function(s) across Ceridian.What You’ll Get To Do Partners with a business function(s) to enable reporting and analytics for that domain  Works collaboratively with the business to intake, plan and prioritize enterprise data and integration requests  Understands the data needs and functional requirements for the business  Is a subject matter expert for the data sources available  Collaborates with the Data Engineers and Integration Engineers to deliver the required data capability  Coordinates with Data Governance and Enablement team to ensure data quality, compliance and efficacy. Ability to work with a collaborative team in a fast-paced, multi-faceted environment  Experience with enterprise business software (Salesforce and Netsuite preferred)  An understanding of machine learning concepts is beneficial Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. LI - RemoteWhy We Need You – The MissionATP is a global information services and software company that exists to make flying safer and more reliable. Our products help reduce operating costs, improve aircraft reliability, and support technical knowledge sharing and collaboration within the general and business aviation, military/defense, commercial aviation, and OEM industries. We have deployed solutions for multiple Fortune 100 companies, supporting more than 75,000 aircraft maintenance professionals worldwide. As a global company, ATP has more than 7,500 customers in 137 countries, with nearly 50 years of experience in the information services and software industries.As a Data Analyst on our Services & Operations team, you will be helping internal and external customers, working across many departments, including engineering, operations, and customer success. This work can be accomplished from a remote location.The ideal candidate will be responsible for working with customers' IT departments to implement data feeds from their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds for use with our product – which performs knowledge extraction from these data feeds using a variety of Natural Language Processing algorithms backed by general, industry-specific, and customer-specific dictionaries and word lists. The successful candidate will manage and adjust these dictionaries to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives.What You’ll Accomplish - Your Performance ObjectivesPerformance Objective #1:Within your first 30 days, work with other analysts to build a solid understanding of the data sets required for onboarding and maintaining customers. Work with the customer’s IT department to implement data integration with their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds Extract required data from different databases using SQL queries Work on deployment procedures of our products to the customers Perform data analysis on large and technical datasetsPerformance Objective #2Within your first 6 months, successfully onboard new customers while maintaining current customers through monitoring and support. You will be able to analyze existing queries for performance enhancements; suggest new queries Be able to do reporting and analysis using Tableau, Excel, and PowerBI Work with and attend status meetings with customers to support users and identify possible improvements to their instancesPerformance Objective #3Within your first 12 months, innovate and improve current business processes and configurations. Provide suggestions for product improvement to the development team, supporting continuous improvement and optimization of the onboarding toolset used by analysts and the specific algorithms. Manage and adjust configurations to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives Data analysis and development to support the setup, deployment, evaluation, customization, and the go-live of SaaS web application Consult and influence the design of business processes. Identify process improvements. i.e. customer training, customer experience, and customer support.Who We’re Looking For - The Personal Competencies That MatterTechnical Skills You have experience working in Python You have experience with s/FTP, AWS, and SaaS web applications You have experience with SQL relational databases and are capable of writing SQL statements and procedures You have a good understanding of data gathering, processing, and validation You have experience with data modeling and a good understanding of big data engineering You have experience with Jira and Confluence You have knowledge of Java and an understanding of debugging You have experience or interest in Natural Language processing (Regular Expressions), text data processing, and machine learning technologies.Interpersonal SkillsSuccess in this role requires excellent analytical abilities with a keen eye for details to easily identify errors. You should have a technical competency to identify, investigate and resolve complex, technical issues. You must thrive in working in a fast-paced environment and have a proven history of delivering top-tier customer service. A successful candidate is a team player who has a strong sense of ownership and accountability for their work.Project Management & Organizational PlanningThe best candidate will have excellent project and time management skills. You do exceptionally well at multitasking and juggling several tasks at once. You will be responsible for maintaining and prioritizing your own queue, so you must excel at planning, executing, and closing all projects on or before deadlines.How we work – The Core Values that Define Our CultureWe Are At Our Best When We are selfless team players. We work together to achieve our goals and we put the team ahead of ourselves. are driven to succeed exceed. We take pride in our work and in exceeding expectations. find a better way. By seeking to understand the challenge, we work to improve the process and solution. are simplifiers (not complicators). We focus on solutions and not obstacles. We take action and ownership. We gather the right people in the room and drive to a solution.

DescriptionJoin our team and what we'll accomplish togetherThe Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI solutions, high quality data, and a data-product oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.We are entrepreneurial, and live by our AI Manifesto of failing fast and being outcome vs technology driven, creating value for our customers, team members, communities, and the environment. The team takes pride in our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities and takes ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing novel AI techniques to discover insights, to developing automation pipelines and web-visualizations, we do it all!Always wanted to work with a team of innovators touching all business units within TELUS, and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!You’ll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out various data sources to help identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. As a Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skills to automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, functions and libraries.Here's How Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML modelsCollaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to productionWork with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insightsVisualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organizationInfluence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindsetDevelop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliablySupport and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technologyBuild and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities What You BringQualifications You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experienceYou are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization and bring 2 to 5 years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areasYou are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiencesYou have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business mattersYou are comfortable in and with a Jupyter environment and infrastructure, and familiar with GitHubYou possess advanced knowledge in SQL and distributed computingYou are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, AzureYou are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML OpsYou are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fastGreat-to-havesMasters or PhD degree Posted by                  Laura Campbell             Scientific Recruiter at AbCellera                                     Send InMail                                  AbCellera is a young, energetic, and rapidly growing tech company with an amazing team that searches, decodes, and analyzes natural immune systems to find antibodies that its partners can develop into drugs to prevent and treat disease. We are seeking a highly motivated Data and Automation Analyst, well-versed in the analysis of complex biological data, to join our dynamic Discovery team.The successful candidate will interact with a diverse team, liaising between wet-lab scientists, bioinformaticians and software engineers, in a fast-paced and focused environment. derived from medium- and high-throughput experiments, including flow cytometry, spectrophotometry, spectrofluorimetry and high-content imagingImplementing and maintaining these analysis pipelines (typically in Python), ensuring data integrity, correctness and clarityDeveloping and implementing software solutions for improving data flow and maintaining data standards across multiple teamsOrganizing, supporting and collaborating with other team members to meet project deliverables and timelinesAnalyzing and presenting data and analysis methods to colleagues and partnersWe'd love to hear from you if:You are passionate about data science and want to work in an interdisciplinary environmentYou thrive in a collaborative environmentYou enjoy bringing out the best in your teammatesYou enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment with multiple prioritiesYou take pride in being self-motivated, a fast learner, a team player and a creative problem solverYou can effectively communicate scientific ideas across disciplines and levels of experienceRequired qualifications and experience:MSc in bioinformatics or computational biology with two or more years of related work experience, or BSc in a relevant field with five or more years of related experienceProficiency in at least one programming language for analysis and data visualization (Python & SQL preferred)Background in life sciences: Cell Biology, Immunology, or Molecular Biology preferredDemonstrated ability to create flexible data analysis pipelines intended for use by others, such as:Building and deploying user-friendly interactive data analysis applications, using tools such as Dash or R-ShinyDesigning standardized statistical analysis and visualizations of complex multifactorial dataDesigning data analysis pipelines integrating multiple data sources, using tools such as Redshift & Bigquery or Spark & DaskExcellent communication skills, and the ability to identify key issues and succinctly describe themDriven to learn and master new technical skillsExcellent documentation and organizational skillsImpeccable attention to detailOffers & benefits:The opportunity to work with an inspired team on challenging problems that matterAn attractive compensation package, including health and lifestyle benefitsA minimum of 3 weeks of vacationOpportunities high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation. We’re revolutionizing how our scientists can explore antibodies and the scale at which they can do so. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.You’ll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Pet Acquisition Analytics
job_desc: DescriptionTrupanion is a leading provider of medical insurance for cats and dogs in North America. Our mission is to help the pets we all love receive the veterinary care they need. At Trupanion, we offer a collaborative, casual, and pet-friendly environment where everyone is encouraged to be themselves.Position SummaryThe Pet Acquisition Analytics team at Trupanion is looking for a curious and pet loving Senior Data Analyst to join our team. We need a driven senior analyst who can creatively come up with data-focused solutions to problems through inquiry, data collection, analysis and collaboration with business stakeholders. Successful candidates will have unbridled curiosity, enjoy solving complex problems and share our love of data and pets!This position is an entirely remote role open to candidates anywhere in Canada. Candidates who prefer an in-office option may choose to work a hybrid schedule out of our North Vancouver office.Key Responsibilities IncludeFoster effective working relationships with fellow analysts and business partners to create an environment of knowledge sharing Ability to see to the core of a problem, understanding the “why” behind a question Observant and inquisitive, discovering opportunities to use data to better understand our customers Extract and reconcile data from our robust data warehouse or identify and strategize new data to be collected Apply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to derive meaning from data with a focus on impact Present findings to business partners, often collaborating to develop and implement action plans Monitor results through performant dashboards QualificationsPlease include a cover letter with your application.Experience5+ years’ experience of data extraction and manipulation (eg SQL), statistical analysis and other modeling techniques 3+ years leading or mentoring junior analysts 3+ years using data to drive strategy Skills, Knowledge & AbilitiesComfortable working on complex and ambiguous problems Highly driven and motivated to work in a fast-paced, high-growth environment Advanced experience with data analysis including applying statistical methods and modeling techniques Advanced experience with data visualization platforms (Tableau preferred) Experience with research and survey methodology preferred Flexible to work independently and in a team-based environment Education, Registration & CertificationBachelor's degree in finance, mathematics, statistics, or another quantitative field.Benefits And PerksBonus opportunities Employer-paid extended health coverage for you and your family Four weeks paid time off Five weeks, paid, sabbatical after five years of employment Restricted Stock Units Employer-paid medical insurance for one pet (cat or dog) Paid time off to volunteer at nonprofit organizations Open, casual, pet-friendly, and fun work environment About TrupanionWe’re all about helping pets. We promote a cohesive and nimble team environment, and we hire, develop and promote team members. We trust each other. We are transparent and honest. We care about one another and want to see our team members succeed, personally and professionally. We strive to promote from within and reduce bureaucracy to allow creative thinking. We’re focused on providing continuous training and support to all team members to encourage long-term happiness and success.Take a look inside our office and see for yourself:https://www.facebook.com/Trupanion/videos/10155423763702974/We’re more than insurance – we’re a tech company too! Inclusive: We welcome and value all people and perspectives. Nimble: We readily adapt and evolve in pursuit of progress and innovation. Posted by                  Adam Bishop             Senior Talent Attraction Specialist at BC Transit                                     Send InMail                    Are we right for you...We’re passionate about people and creating sustainable, safe and affordable solutions to BC. We are an organization that has a People First approach and considers people first in every business decision that we make. We are part of the solution and what we do matters; from fighting climate change with battery electric buses, to affordability through cost effective transportation, to connecting remote communities, we bring the heart, soul and innovation to public transportation.It’s an exciting time to be in the transit industry and we’re looking for creative and passionate people to join our team. Not only would you be joining an engaged organization, but you’d also get to enjoy flexible work arrangements, extended benefits and a pension plan as just a few of the benefits BC Transit employees are eligible for. Keep reading to find out if this role is meant for you!What you'll be doing...Acting with a customer-centric focus, the Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing and presenting data collected from BC Transit’s onboard technology, with this data impacting ridership, fare revenue and on-time performance. The Data Analyst will be required to present data to a variety of internal and external stakeholders, including through the development of dashboards and reports to support decision making.We're looking to build our data literacy and we're excited that your experience with database programming languages, including Python, SQL and R will give you the ability to showcase your knowledge of data acquisition, processing and analysis, along with strong relational and dimensional data modeling and database design.What you'll bring to the table...We love lifelong learners! We’ve found people with the following mix of education, certifications or experience to be successful in this role in the past:A Degree in computer science, information management, statistics, or an equivalent mix of the following knowledge and experience:Knowledge of data acquisition, processing and analysisExperience in using database programming languages, including Python, SQL and R3 years of data mining, analysis and reporting experienceDemonstrated expertise with reporting software and business intelligence tools (especially Power BI and Tableau)Experience with GIS mapping software (preferably ArcGIS and QGIS) would be considered an assetExperience with ETL, SQL, relational & non-relational databases and data warehouse solutionsFamiliarity with cloud data platforms and big data tools (Azure preferred)Familiarity with machine learning concepts and predictive modelling.What we'll bring to the table...Comprehensive medical, dental and group plan benefits to support you and your family, regardless of what life throws at youMembership in a “Gold Plated” defined benefit pension plan, meaning it’s the best in the province and one of the best in the country; putting you in a strong position when it comes time to retirementAccess to Fitness and Lifestyle Centers to help you take care of your physical fitness and healthVarious programs that support employees such as an Employee Assistance Program and Health and Wellness initiatives and events aimed at fostering your mental healthA complimentary employee Bus Pass (plus taxable dependent passes)A Corporate Learning and Development Program to help you in continuous career growthMaternity and parental leave employer paid top-up to support you and your familyAn Employee Recognition Program where we all recognize each other's successes (not just your Leaders!)A Social Club that gives you access to events throughout VictoriaWhat next steps could look like...Interviews will be conducted from June 8 – 10th, with an assignment forming part of the competitive process for those who are short-listed.An eligibility list for similar future full-time regular and temporary full-time vacancies may be establishedThe position requires the competition of a Criminal Record Check or Vulnerable Sector SearchIf you have a disability which requires accommodation during any stage of our recruitment process, please let us know how we can assist you

job_title: Data Analyst – Product and Partner Management

We cover a wide range of industries, and our customers vary from consumers to professionals. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence, and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus provides TTI with a platform for sustainable leadership and growth.Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance, and compelling innovation. Our customers have access to leading brands such as Milwaukee®, RYOBI®, Hoover®, and HART®.TTi is where culture meets opportunity. We are fast-paced, our team is highly energetic, and we reward innovative thinking. TTi is a place to explore your potential, where wins are celebrated, and leaders are visible and accessible.We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced individual to fill the role of Data Analyst. The Data Analyst is responsible for working closely with project sponsors to deliver enhanced reporting standards and operational efficiency for the business group.This individual will be accountable for preparing and modelling data, creating visualizations, analyzing information, and managing Power BI assets to ensure projects accurately reflect our stakeholder requirements.The successful candidate must communicate clearly, think strategically, be creative, solve problems, pay close attention to detail, and be a team player!What you will do:The Data Analyst will manage end-to-end project work assignments to deliver best in class reporting solutions.In this position, the Data Analyst will:Profile, clean, and transform raw data into trustworthy and meaningful information.Ensure data integrity standards by identifying and correcting variances in source data.Manage user profile groups and maintain object/row level security assignments.Provide actionable insight by creating well-designed tabular model structures.Monitor dataset refresh schedules and troubleshoot gateway/connection failures.Optimize performance of tabular models and custom measure calculations.Create stunning visualizations that help decision makers solve business problems.Analyze, interpret, and communicate report information, patterns, and trends.Improve current dashboard reporting by integrating Power BI AI capabilities.Manage distribution and sharing of report publications, dashboards, and datasets.Who you are:Enthusiastic about your career path and eager to learn new and emerging technologies.Results driven and detail oriented with the ability to deliver projects ahead of schedule.A collaborator who can prioritize and multitask on individual and shared assignments.Resilient, patient, and determined to overcome complicated business challenges.An excellent communicator who embraces change and motivated to do the right thing.Someone who sets lofty expectations of themselves and continually pursues excellence.What you have done:Bachelor’s Degree preferably in Statistics, Mathematics or Computer Science.2-3 years of demonstrated work experience as a Data Analyst or equivalent.Solid understanding of Business Intelligence tools including Microsoft Power BI.Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and advanced knowledge Excel.Experience with SQL, Python, R-Scripting and other programming languages.

Job DescriptionAs a Data Scientist, you’re in great company, working alongside some of the brightest and unpretentious data scientists and strategy consultants. You will be a part of the journey that brings a service and customer centric view of operations to life. Our objective is to develop a Wireless Service Operations Centre that provides a customer centric view of service performance, improve likelihood to recommend by our customers, improve customer retention and acquisition.You will combine your expert knowledge of wireless networks and analytics in applying machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) to drive actions and decisions. Our partnership with the Vector Institute will ensure you can leverage leading research in AI. In close collaboration with teams across the company, you’ll seek out various data sources and identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. A pre-requisite for any data jobPython – Main language to be used in the team to code in our environmentsPredictive modeling experience – They will help improving the existing models we have in our company, so we want to be sure they have built some in the past to be able to bring additional valueSAS : Advanced experience - environment we are migrating from and still used to access a lot of our dataNice To Have SkillsGCP : Environment we work in. job_title: Sector Data Analyst, Data Driven Investing
job_desc: Company DescriptionMake an impact at a global and dynamic investment organizationWhen you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leadersStimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environmentAccelerated exposure and responsibilityGlobal career development opportunitiesBeing motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principlesA deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High PerformanceIf you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.Job DescriptionThe Investment Research team within Active Equities is responsible for conducting data-driven investment research and implementing investment strategies leveraging this research. We are currently seeking driven and intellectually curious individuals who want to be part of a growing and passionate team that is developing industry leading approaches to discretionary investment research.We are recruiting for a Sector Data analyst to develop insights by analyzing alternative data. The goal is to help make better investment decisions by generating novel insights for companies leveraging alternative data.Role Specific AccountabilitiesAct as sector data domain expert by becoming deeply familiar with industry datasets including conducting trials, building research products and conducting bespoke researchWork closely with investment teams in understanding the KPI’s for the industry and companies of interestDevelop novel insights on core datasets and maintain datasets and associated forecasts as the key data ownerWork closely with investment teams by analysing the key research questions and then sourcing and analyzing the relevant data to best answer the questionsProactively seeks ways to advance investment research by sourcing new data and analyticsQualificationsAdvanced degree in Statistics/Economics/Computer Science/Mathematics/Engineering or other quantitative field preferred with at least 3 years of applied experienceStrong research, analytical, problem solving skills and ability to think creativelyProficiency with one or more programming languages such as Python (pandas), R, SQL and very proficient working with datasets/API’s to conduct researchExperience analyzing large datasetsMust be highly industrious and motivated to deliver resultsDetail-oriented with an ability to produce high quality workAbility to work in an entrepreneurial environment and be a self-starterAdditional InformationVisit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.Our Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity:In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.Disclaimer:CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.Mandatory Vaccine PolicyAll employees in the Toronto, New York, San Francisco, Mumbai, Sydney, and Sao Paulo offices will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Accommodations to this policy will be made for medical or other protected grounds. Please contact us to discuss any accommodation needs.
