TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment Overview<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">The Workforce Management (WFM) team is part of the North American Shared Services model supporting the customer and employee experience across all North American Phone Channel lines of business, including TD Canada Trust, TD Wealth, TD Insurance and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank. Workforce management is a trusted Advisor to our partners through proper workforce planning & management ensuring the right people are in the right spot at the right time providing our customers with legendary service. WFM supports and manages the operational and Workforce Management functions in various geographical locations, ensuring scheduling, forecasting, enterprise capacity planning and workforce management process optimization.Job Description<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">We are looking for someone who will be an ambitious and dedicated contributor to business management -related research, evaluation, operational reporting and analytical support. Not only is this an opportunity for promising career growth, but meaningful work awaits both on business and technology fronts. Curious yet? Read on.<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. <span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Participate in Scheduling CoE Workforce Management activities across TD including establishment of an industry leading CoE which, can be extended to other areas of the bank<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Partner with business stake holders and operations to plan and schedule employees to support workload demand. <span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Provide planning support to optimize scheduling deliver best in class customer experience. <span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Develop recommendations for management team that identify and profile high impact, forward looking strategies, opportunities and action plans to maximize productivity and efficiencies<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Proactively make recommendations to management for improvement in both efficiency in operations and opportunities optimize contact volume.<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Conduct ongoing analysis, assessment and review of business performance, processes and initiatives.<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Help develop high-quality, high-impact presentations and communications.<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Contribute to various operational activities (e.g. report production, system queries, process mapping, tracking, analysis and procedural support, premises, onboarding).<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Remain informed of emerging issues, industry trends and/or relevant changes.<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Respect enterprise frameworks and methodologies that relate to business management activities. Job Requirements<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">What can you bring to TD?<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"=""> Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">1-2+ years relevant Workforce Management experience.<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Knowledge of Workforce Management tools, e.g. NICE IEX, Genesys, etc. is preferred<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">A self-motivator with excellent organizational and communications skills to prioritize and multi-task in a collaborative or independent setting<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Attention to details, accuracy with analytical mindset<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Actively lead and manage COE relationships & interactions to maintain shrinkage loads are scheduled within target plan/budget<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Confidence and ability to work on projects within short time horizons (generally weekly to monthly), under management direction.<span style="font-family:" inherit",serif"="">Experienced in conducting standard reporting, analysis and operational support. TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewData governance and management at TD is part of an enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Adaptability is key. You may be part of the data and analytics professional community managing data assets aligned to TD's overarching policies or strategies, or you may find yourself directly immersed in various lines of business. Data stewardship at TD spans the enterprise and welcomes experts like you to help drive our business forward while protecting the interests of our organization, customers and shareholders.Job DescriptionUnder the supervision of the Manager, Data Governance. This position is focused on business analysis, data lineage and data management.This position requires excellent technology and business acumen, as well as demonstrated data management ability, excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. The chosen candidate must be a mature individual who is able to work with minimal supervision, contribute to a positive work environment, and produce high quality deliverables which require precision and attention to details. Maintain TDI General Insurance (GI) information flow blueprints which show data flow for each TDI department into the TDI GI Data Warehouse Work with business stakeholders from various TDI departments to assess their business as usual activities, document any impact on the data flow and lineage. Work closely with the Reporting Center of Excellence and Projects team to stay abreast on upcoming projects and their potential impact on data lineage Lead the Committees to present upcoming functional changes in data flow to Lead Data steward and other senior stakeholders. Work with access management team to manage the access privileges of users into the data warehouse. Work with the technology team to ensure only the right users have access to the Data Warehouse Participate in EDGO (Enterprise Data Governance Office) training and socialization session; represent the TDI data governance team. Capture data access and data lineage evidence to support audit requirements Support and contribute in data governance projects and initiatives. Business analysis accreditation considered an asset Project coordination experience considered an assetJob Requirements Bachelor’s degree or Certificate degree in computer science, data management or in any other related field. At least 3 years of relevant experience in business analysis or business intelligence. Experience in information management and data governance. Interest and curiosity to learn data management and governance best practices Must have analytical skills and possess a critical faculty and an ability to synthesize information (written and oral). Excellent written and verbal communication skills must be comfortable to lead meetings and present to stakeholders. Spoken/written French is a strong asset. A strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills Knowledge of SAS, Big data, ML language, Cognos, SQL, Windows and Unix operating system would be strong asset. Proficient in Visio, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau and any other reporting analysis, and collaboration Tools (Jira, Confluence).InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

job_title: Scientifique de données - Prévention de la fraude (R2212078)
job_desc: Posted by                  Jordan Le Corvec             Talents Acquisition Advisor                                     Send InMail                    La Direction Valorisation des données en sécurité apporte une expertise pointue en science des données à la Direction principale (Stratégie, performance et analytique en sécurité) pour supporter, maximiser et automatiser la prise de décisions en sécurité, en s’appuyant sur l’intelligence artificielle et l’apprentissage automatique. Elle vise à :Maximiser l’utilisation des données dans les solutions de détection et de réponse aux menaces de fraudeConcevoir, développer et optimiser des solutions d’intelligence artificielle et d'automatisation facilitant les décisions opérationnellesContribuer à l’évolution, l’industrialisation et la démocratisation des méthodologies en analytique de sécurité en collaboration avec les différentes équipes d'experts en sécurité (plateforme/outils, investigations/opérations, stratégie/risque, ingénierie, enquêtes, académique, industrie, etc.).À titre de Scientifique de données - Prévention de la fraude, vous contribuez à :Transformer et analyser des données complexes à grande échelle afin d’en extraire des connaissances nécessaires à la prise de décision. Ceci inclut l’exploration et l’évaluation (portée, qualité, etc.) des données disponibles par rapport aux besoins de détection ou de prédictionConcevoir des approches analytiques (diagnostiques, prédictives, prescriptives) de sécurité novatrices en collaboration avec des experts en risques associés aux processus applicatifs et d’affairesImplanter, évaluer, documenter et faire le suivi de solutions d’intelligence artificielle adaptées aux besoins de surveillance et aux équipes d’opérations de sécuritéContribuer à l’industrialisation et l’évolution des méthodologies en analytique de sécurité, entre autres par la participation à des projets de recherche entre le monde industriel et académique.Profil recherchéBaccalauréat en informatique, en statistique, en mathématiques ou dans une discipline appropriée (maîtrise ou doctorat un atout)Un minimum de six ans d'expérience pertinente en analyse quantitative ou modélisationExpérience dans le développement et la mise en production de solutions d’analytique avancée ou prédictivesExpérience d’analytique avec des données transactionnellesVeuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considéréesPour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaireConnaissances spécifiquesExcellente connaissance de communication, d’organisation, de présentation et de collaboration entre équipes multidisciplinairesTrès bonne connaissance en programmation pythonTrès bonne connaissance des méthodologies de science des données et de leurs limites (scikit-learn, pandas, matplotlib, numpy, scipy, etc.)Connaissance des plateformes cloud telles que Microsoft Azure (un atout)Connaissance de l’apprentissage profond (keras, tensorflow, pytorch, etc.) (un atout)Connaissance de Apache Spark (via pyspark ou scala, connaissance de Databricks) (un atout)Connaissance de SAS (un atout)Connaissance de l'anglais de niveau intermédiaireConditions particulièresLieu de travail : Place d’affaires Montréal ou Lévis, selon la préférence du candidat retenu. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride #LI-HybridNombre d’emplois disponibles : 2Compétences transversales DesjardinsApprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’actionCompétences clés au profil recherchéGérer la complexité, Maîtriser les relations interpersonnelles, Stimuler l’innovationLieu de travail1, Complexe Desjardins Bureau 2822 MontréalDate de fin d'affichage2022-06-8Niveau d'emploiNV-10Famille d'emploisDonnée (GF)Desjardins valorise la diversité et l’équité en emploi et s’engage à répondre aux besoins des personnes handicapées en adaptant, au besoin, son processus de recrutement.Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.

job_title: Senior Fraud Data Analyst (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
job_desc: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know Our Team The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.The OpportunityAs a Senior Data Analyst, you will be driving our features research in our fraud domain, build experiments to test your hypothesis, and get your hands on experience in ML.This role will allow you to communicate your findings with the different stakeholders (Product, Devs, and Business) and make an impact at Agoda.In This Role, You’ll Get toApply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to understand fraud, how it relates to Agoda’s strategy and products, and how to prevent itBuild advanced predictive models to understand the impact of specific fraudulent behaviors, trends, and patternsWork closely with cross-functional teams of data and backend engineers, analysts, user researchers, product managers, and designers who are passionate about Agoda’s successUnderstand how user fraud affects other consumers of our data, including insights and feature teams, and work across the data landscape to minimize impact and drive influence wherever possibleCommunicate data-informed insights and recommendations to key stakeholders, engineering and product partnersWhat You’ll Need To Succeed2+ years of experience in a data driven role in payment fraud detection and prevention, with an understanding of the impact that fraud prevention has on other areas in the company where business and product decisions are madeExtensive experience in detecting and analyzing fraud at the individual transaction level as well as across large data setsBachelor’s Degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, a similar quantitative discipline, or equivalent industry experienceCoding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or your weapon of choiceStrong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendationsFluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)It’s Great If You HaveKnowledge of machine learning algorithms including classifiers, clustering algorithms, and anomaly detection is a plus #sanfrancisco #washdc #sydney #london #tokyo #amsterdam #munich #berlin #toronto #vancouver #moscow #dublin #seoul #hcmc #telaviv #taipei #IT #4 Equal Opportunity Employer At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Creating an inclusive digital worldJoin the team that’s transforming the digital accessibility industry! We support global Enterprise hallmark brands such as Merck, Estée Lauder, Samsung, Macy’s, Marriott & Hootsuite to deliver inclusive and accessible web, mobile, and product experiences through accessibility testing, evaluation and remediation — allowing organizations to enhance the digital experience for people with disabilities, ensuring each digital asset they create complies with accessibility standards, and projects an inclusive and disability-friendly presence. We’re very proud to be recognized as a Great Place to Work® (GPTW) and we’re growing! We’ve recently announced $55 million in funding to accelerate our mission to make the digital world accessible. Learn more about eSSENTIAL Accessibility https://www.essentialaccessibility.com/ Our Values are Unity, Accountability and Resolve. We look for candidates who exemplify these values and will contribute to our culture of inclusivity with their unique perspectives There’s never been a better time to be a part of the accessibility industry, and we’re on a mission to be the primary engine that fuels innovation in this space.Data AnalystIf you are passionate about data, you clearly visualize the business story and enjoy crafting intelligence reports that drive today’s successful businesses, then we want to speak with you!The eSSENTIAL Accessibility Product Team places an emphasis on meaningful experiences that result in a phenomenal work environment that fosters success for all our employees.Traits and experiencesYou are a mix of a data analyst, business analyst, analytics translator, visual presenter, and data artist, who is equally at home discussing business use cases with project owners and talking shop with the product and development team. You’re deeply driven about accelerating growth through data-driven decision support across all our business functions.Through a combination of outstanding analytical and storytelling skills, you’ll help us better understand the value we deliver to our customers and partners and drive key decisions that will craft the future of eA.We are a software company that is driven toward digital inclusion and accessibility for people with disabilities. Your role as a data analyst will impact positively, enabling a better digital environment for all.Objectives and Responsibilities• Partner with our outstanding product team and senior leadership, to understand their objectives and build data product experiences. Offering practical insights, that illuminate and accurately steer product direction, roadmaps, documentation efforts, training content, growth goals and retention strategies• Produce insights (e.g., performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioural personas) to accelerate adoption and business growth, and illuminate product strategy• Translate numbers, trends, and data into consumable insights, both explanatory and exploratory.• Build, deploy, and maintain data management systems and back-end data infrastructure for our business intelligence pipeline• Perform data mining, exploration, and analysis• Build data visualizations; reports, dashboards, and data audits• Leverage data models to optimize internal and customer experiences• Take full advantage of off-the-shelf as well as in-house technologies to build a best-in-class data management and presentation pipeline• Partner with product management and engineering to understand product instrumentation needs for insights and analytics• Bring intelligence to customer data through the power of: structured data (workflow state evolution, database tables), unstructured data (utterances, descriptions, documents, etc.) adapting to their outstanding, often sophisticated configurations and working at scale.• Design and drive to deliver a process and data strategy for ongoing product usage analytics• Design and implement repeatable frameworks to measure the impact of releases and experiments. This will include upcoming releases, product leadership decision support by providing periodical data driven visualization.• Develop a framework for data maintenance for business reporting.• Communicate, design / build a reporting repository to be consumed and used on a periodic basis by the Product team• Design and build a dashboard / real-time reports to gauge and monitor rapid growth patterns.• Excellent knowledge with transfer management, through mentorship and applying your Domain Expertise, to all Product team members• Ability to see the story behind the data and work with product managers to craft effective narratives about our value that we’re creating for our customers with our products• Passionate about automating data analysis, business intelligence and a drive to grow beyond Bi as we grow into a significantly data driven future together.Qualifications and technical expectations• BS/MS degree• 5+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis• 3 + years of business analysis/product analytics• Experience building and maintaining data analysis pipelines• Highly knowledgeable with end-to-end data development, including data model design, quality review, deployment, and maintenance, especially in a Cloud environment• Proficient with common analytical programming languages and processes (Python, SQL, R, ETL, Adobe Analytics, Looker etc.)• Familiarity with analytical data presentation and visualization suites (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, Cognos)Interview ProcessWe respect your schedule and don’t want to drag out the hiring process. We’re moving and growing quickly, and reflect that in our general approach to hiring.• Phone call/Zoom call with our Talent Team to assess mutual fit• Phone call/Zoom call with hiring manager• Phone call/Zoom call with team• Phone call/Zoom call to go over offer and further questions*Please note that we may ask you to prepare a presentation or complete an assignment for some positions.eSSENTIAL Accessibility’s OfferingsAlong with joining a tight-knit community of passionate, purpose-driven professionals advancing inclusivity and digital accessibility, you are eligible for the following:• Remote-work culture - You can work anywhere from the comfort of your home! We’re proud to say we’re a digital-first tech outfit, and have no intention of ‘forcing’ our eA teAm back to an office.• Flexible working hours to accommodate work-life balance.• Interesting and purposeful mission and challenging work.• Competitive Salary Package, including Employee Grant Options.• Generous Healthcare, Dental and EAP Benefits• Fun and inclusive culture to be proud of • Friendly and highly skilled team that support each other• Professional development and accessibility learning• One-time stipend for at-home IT setup• Paid parental leave programs• eA Company swag!• Growth opportunity as the company scales for Series C• The best team working the accessibility space!Accommodation NoticeAccommodations, including alternative formats and communications support for persons with disabilities, are available upon request.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Programmatic Partnerships & Business Solutions Team. As a Data Analyst, you will provide quantitative analyses, market & industry expertise and strategic recommendations to cross-functional teams within StackAdapt. You will articulate business questions, pulling numbers from multiple & large datasets to provide meaningful business insights and become a subject-matter expert on programmatic landscape and supply side dynamics.StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in the GTA for this position.What you'll be doing: Responsible for developing automated, scalable reporting and analytics solutions for the Programmatic Partnerships TeamContinuously and meticulously monitor, report & review business metrics and supply quality with internal stakeholdersAssist Partnerships as well as Sales Team members to analyze campaigns performance, identify internal & external trends from data, troubleshoot issues, identify new supply opportunities and address ad hoc data requestsOwn and drive initiatives that improve internal efficiencies, attain supply optimization rapidly adopting and keeping up with latest industry trends & initiativesPartner closely with Inventory & Data Partnerships, Product Solutions, Platform Quality Teams, as well as work cross-functionally on data analysis providing meaningful and strategic recommendations to teamsWhat you’ll bring to the table:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field, with a proven academic track record (e.g., finance, economics, statistics, math, etc.)Minimum 1+ years of working experience in a quantitative or analytics-driven environment with solid understanding of statistical techniquesExperience working with large datasets with strong technical skills (SQL, Python, R, etc.)Experience scripting with SQL, extracting large sets of data and designing ETL flowsMinimum 1+ years of experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Qlik, Looker, Google Data Studio, etc.)Strong verbal and written communication skills, comfortable presenting detailed technical and statistical analyses to senior stakeholders.Programmatic Advertising experience/expertise in working with RTB, DSPs, SSPs, publishers or other related platforms is a plus. StackAdapters Enjoy: Competitive salary Full benefits from League on day one of employment RRSP Matching Work from home reimbursements Coverage and support of personal development initiatives (conferences, courses, etc) An awesome parental leave policy A weekly $15 lunch credit via Ritual A friendly, welcoming, and supportive culture Our social and team events (virtually!) About StackAdaptStackAdapt is a self-serve programmatic advertising platform used by the most exceptional digital marketers. This state-of-the-art platform is where some of the most progressive work in machine learning meets cutting-edge user experience. Ad buyers plan, execute, and manage data-driven digital advertising campaigns across all devices, inventory, and publisher partners. StackAdapt is a Top 100 Software Product on G2, being the only DSP on the Best Software Products and Highest Satisfaction lists.We've been recognized for our high performing campaign conversion rates, award-winning customer service, and innovation by numerous industry publications including:#1 DSP on G2 and leader in the Video and Cross-Channel Advertising CategoriesTop 5 on Ad Age's 2022 Best Places to WorkGreat Place to Work® named StackAdapt as one of Canada’s Best Workplaces for Start-ups in 2021A Top Growing Company in Canada based on the Globe and Mail's 2020 Business ReportNamed a Technology Fast 50™ Program Winner for 2021StackAdapt is a diverse and inclusive team of collaborative, hardworking individuals trying to make a dent in the universe. No matter who you are, where you are from, who you love, follow in faith, disability (or superpower) status, ethnicity, or the gender you identify with (if you’re comfortable, let us know your pronouns), you are welcome at StackAdapt. If you have any requests or requirements to support you throughout any part of the interview process, please let our Talent team know.

Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining data within these databasesData collection from Mitel’s operations systems that optimize and streamline efficiencies with quality valueSkilled in Microsoft Office, to include expert level skillset with ExcelAbility to consolidate diverse business requirements and facilitate realistic, common sense solutionsAbility to perform repetitive tasks with a high degree of accuracyExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong attention to detail, able to proofread and spot mistakesSAP Knowledge of Master data is an assetAgile and or Jira experience a plusAPICS Certification is a plusWork independently with minimal supervision on the followingFor more information, visit Why Mitel or follow us on LinkedIn here.Mitel is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. Posted by                  Emma Delli Fraine, CHRP             Talent Acquisition Specialist at Maples Group                                     Send InMail                    Position: Financial Data and Reporting AnalystLocation: Montreal, Canada The Maples Group has operated in Montreal since 2009. The Group is a standard bearer in financial services, trusted by many of the world’s largest hedge fund managers, private asset firms and international corporations. In 2022, the Group was again recognized as one of Montreal's Top Employers by the publisher of Canada's Top 100 Employers list.Our distinction flows from our carefully curated team: 2,000+ professionals characterised by tenacity, ethics and exacting excellence. We hire smart and sharpen smarter, arming talent with best-in-class resources and skills. With 18 locations across the Americas, Asia, Europe and the Middle East, our international presence offers a unique springboard for career development and cross-cultural immersion. Our side-by-side financial and legal services are similarly ripe for interdisciplinary learning and growth.The Maples Group looks to add Montreal, Canada-based Financial Data and Reporting Analyst to our team and invites eager and qualified candidates to apply. We are committed to diversity, inclusion and equality of opportunity as we attract, retain and develop world-class talent. Who We SeekOur merit-based culture suits professionals in pursuit of boundless careers and lives. Beyond their acumen, team members are collaborative and conscientious, bringing a healthy sense of drive and purpose to each interaction and to all aspects of their work. About the RoleThe Financial Data and Reporting Analyst will join a global team that is responsible for supporting portfolio accounting, operations and reporting functions in Montreal in order to provide services to our global Middle Office clients. Primary responsibilities include:reporting directly to the Vice President, the successful candidate will be involved in the day-to-day operational support of our institutional clients;the Senior Data and Reporting Analyst will be responsible for supporting all aspects of portfolio accounting and performance, as well as elements of process analysis and re-engineering;He/she will ensure that portfolio accounting data is maintained in relevant systems in a timely and accurate manner;design and implement automated processes for accounting and reporting; assist in client on-boarding process for new clients; assist in gathering client requirements and reporting;demonstrate keen awareness of industry and technology;work with internal and external parties to resolve issues and further develop bespoke client solutions.translate business requirements into technical specifications for developers.participate in various projects of technical nature.complete periodic regulatory and risk reporting for a diverse set of clients.What You BringIn addition to indisputably high ethical standards and autonomy, the ideal candidate possesses the following:the ideal candidate will have a university degree in finance or accounting;a minimum of 1 years’ work experience in finance or financial services;fund accounting or fund administration specific experience is an asset;strong technical and systems skillsexperience in relationship management and client service;Key skills for this role are as follows:strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including VBA macros.SQL or other programming languages, an assetknowledge of project management framework;excellent time management, organizational, prioritization, and communication skills.autonomous/self-starter  Benefits & RewardsThe most enduring professional relationships are reciprocal relationships. The Maples Group prioritises employee health and wellbeing. Depending on your location, we offer a range of benefits, including:Comprehensive health coverage (medical, dental and optical)Competitive vacation packagesEducational assistance and professional development programmesSavings or pension planLife insuranceTravel insuranceGlobal mental wellness programmeSports clubs and social events Disclaimer: All personal information collected during the application process will be used for recruitment-related purposes only. Please refer to our Job Applicant Privacy Notice at maples.com/privacy for details on how we handle personal information relating to job applicants.Poste : Analyste des données financières et des rapportsEmplacement : Montréal, Canada Le Groupe Maples est un porte-étendard des services financiers et juridiques auquel font confiance de nombreux gestionnaires de fonds de couverture, sociétés de capital-investissement et entreprises internationales parmi les plus importants au monde.Notre distinction est établie grâce à notre équipe soigneusement formée : plus de 2 000 professionnels qui font preuve de ténacité, d’éthique et d’excellence. Nous recrutons des personnes intelligentes et perfectionnons leurs talents en leur fournissant les meilleures ressources et en développant leurs compétences. Répartie dans 18 emplacements en Amérique, en Asie, en Europe et au Moyen-Orient, notre présence internationale offre un tremplin unique pour le perfectionnement professionnel et l’immersion interculturelle. Nos services financiers et juridiques sont également favorables à l’apprentissage et à la croissance interdisciplinaires.Le Groupe Maples cherche à ajouter un analyste des données financières et des rapports à son équipe de Montréal, au Canada, et invite les candidats enthousiastes et qualifiés à poser leur candidature. Nous nous engageons à favoriser la diversité, l’inclusion et l’égalité des chances en attirant, en maintenant en poste et en perfectionnant des talents de classe mondiale. Candidats recherchésNotre culture axée sur le mérite convient aux professionnels en quête d’une carrière et d’une vie sans limites. En plus de leur expertise, les membres de l’équipe sont coopératifs et consciencieux. Ils possèdent une grande motivation et se fixent des buts à atteindre, ce qui se reflète dans chacune de leurs interactions et dans tous les aspects de leur travail. À propos du posteL’analyste principal des données et des rapports se joindra à une équipe mondiale responsable du soutien des fonctions de comptabilité de portefeuille, d’exploitation et de production de rapports à Montréal afin de fournir des services à nos clients internationaux du suivi du marché. Les principales responsabilités du candidat retenu seront les suivantes :relevant directement du vice-président, le candidat retenu participera au soutien opérationnel quotidien de nos clients institutionnels;l’analyste principal des données et des rapports sera responsable du soutien de tous les aspects de la comptabilité et du rendement du portefeuille, ainsi que des éléments d’analyse et de refonte des processus;veiller à ce que les données relatives à la comptabilité du portefeuille soient tenues à jour dans les systèmes pertinents de manière opportune et précise;concevoir et mettre en œuvre des processus automatisés pour la comptabilité et la production de rapports; participer au processus d’intégration de nouveaux clients; aider à documenter les exigences et à produire des rapports relatifs aux clients;mettre en œuvre sa connaissance approfondie de l’industrie et de la technologie;collaborer avec des parties internes et externes pour résoudre des problèmes et élaborer des solutions personnalisées pour les clients;traduire les exigences de l’entreprise en spécifications techniques pour les développeurs;participer à divers projets de nature technique;remplir des rapports périodiques sur la réglementation et les risques pour un ensemble diversifié de clients.Votre contributionEn plus d’une autonomie et de normes en matière d’éthique incontestablement élevées, le candidat idéal possédera les caractéristiques suivantes :le candidat idéal sera titulaire d’un diplôme universitaire en finance ou en comptabilité;au moins un ans d’expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de la finance ou des services financiers;une expérience en comptabilité ou en administration de fonds, un atout;de solides compétences sur les plans des techniques et des systèmesde l’expérience en gestion des relations et en service client.Les principales compétences pour ce poste sont les suivantes :solide connaissance de Microsoft Excel, y compris les macros VBA;SQL ou autres langages de programmation, un atout;connaissance du cadre de gestion de projet;excellentes aptitudes en matière de gestion du temps, d’organisation, d’établissement de priorités et de communication;autonomie et sens de l’initiative.  Avantages sociaux et récompensesLes relations professionnelles les plus durables sont les relations réciproques. Le Groupe Maples accorde la priorité à la santé et au bien-être des employés. Selon votre lieu de résidence, nous vous offrons une gamme d’avantages sociaux, notamment :une protection complète en matière de santé (soins médicaux, soins dentaires et soins de la vue);des offres de vacances compétitives;des programmes d’aide à l’éducation et de perfectionnement professionnel;un régime de retraite ou d’épargne;une assurance vie;une assurance voyage;un programme global de bien-être mental;des clubs sportifs et des activités sociales. Clause de non-responsabilité : tous les renseignements personnels recueillis au cours du processus de candidature seront utilisés uniquement aux fins de recrutement. Veuillez consulter notre avis sur la protection de la vie privée des demandeurs d’emploi à l’adresse maples.com/privacy (en anglais seulement) pour en savoir plus sur la manière dont nous gérons leurs renseignements personnels.

Come join Canada’s fastest growing grocery retailer in an exciting and challenging Data Analyst role! With a team of 22,000 of the world’s best grocers at more than 180 stores from B.C. to Manitoba, Save-On-Foods is one of BC’s Top Employers, B.C.’s Most Loved Brand, and a great place to grow your career. Our legacy of outstanding value and customer service dates back more than 100 years and continues in every community we serve, every day.We value service, people, innovation, fun and integrity, and we strive to provide the best customer experience in every market where we do business. At Save-On-Foods we provide opportunities for continuous development, competitive total compensation and a fun working environment. We demonstrate corporate responsibility by living our core values supporting local and celebrating our world class team.We currently have multiple opportunities across our organization for Data Analysts to join our world class data team in Langley, BC.With one of the largest, most comprehensive data sets in Canada, we use data to support all functions of the business (retail operations, supply chain, finance, customer, marketing, etc.) with the goal of providing the best customer experience in every market where we do business.As a Data Analyst, you will use all aspects of data & analytics and drive large-scale, continuous experimentation initiatives to guide decision making and deliver high-quality insights. Each day you will face new challenges and learning is a necessary part of the job – where predictive modeling, big data technologies and statistical analysis are part of your daily routine.You will be responsible for:Working closely with stakeholders to understand business questions, processes, and KPIs. Formulating testable hypotheses that align with business questions and executing statistical experiments in a live environment. Writing SQL scripts to automate data pipelines and workflows. Building modular data structures and models in collaboration with data engineers to support continuous experimentation. Writing Python scripts in a Jupyter Notebook environment to conduct exploratory data analysis, data wrangling, statistical testing, and predictive modeling. Mentor and cross-train data analysts in experimentation best practices and statistical designs. Building dashboards and visualizations to convey insights and deliver reports on KPIs and test results using Power BI. Learning cloud-based analytics environments and big data tools to build analytics workflows on terabytes of data. Collaborating with IT and the Data Scientists to identify technical & data requirements to deploy analytic solutions catered to the business. Finding unique and creative insights that identify new opportunities to drive business value. Becoming the resident expert in the relevant datasets within your analytics domain. In order to qualify for this role, you will have a degree in a STEM discipline and at least 1 year of relevant experience in data analytics and/or data science. You have:Experience with coding in Python. Experience in other programming languages such as Java, Scala, or JavaScript is a plus. Expertise in SQL. Knowledge of experimental design principles such as A/B and multivariate testing, as well as experience working with business stakeholders to formulate testable hypotheses. An understanding of advanced analytics and data science methods such as anomaly detection, forecasting, as well as supervised and unsupervised learning. Experience with a visualization and reporting tool, such as Power BI and Tableau. A working knowledge of cloud environments, such as Azure, GCP or AWS. Experience with cloud environments and big data tools, such as Spark and Databricks is a plus. You are: A quick learner. An exceptional written and verbal communicator with the ability to communicate a story with data and insights to non-technical stakeholders. A problem solver with strong analytical, and critical thinking skills. Effective in task management and deliver high quality work. Able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment. Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaboratively. What we offerIn addition to a highly competitive salary, we offer a great range of benefits, a company pension plan, free parking, exclusive team member offers, and opportunities for development and career progression.Save-On-Foods is an inclusive team-oriented environment where we recognize achievements and celebrate them.If you want to be part of an organization that makes an impact every day in our local communities, apply online today!This position is based at Save-On-Foods’ Langley office and the successful candidate is expected to work in person at the office. While we’re currently operating with a hybrid work-from-home and in-office schedule, Save-On-Foods has a long history of innovation and collaboration, and we look forward to the day provincial health guidelines allow us to all work together in the office again. Ensuring the well-being of our team members remains our top priority as we transition back to working in the office, and as always, we will continue to follow the guidelines set by our Provincial Health Officer.

job_title: Analyste de données marketing /Marketing Data Analyst
job_desc: English version below***Possibilité de travail à distance***Smardt Chiller Group Inc.Le groupe Smardt Chiller est le pionnier et le leader mondial dans la fabrication de refroidisseurs sans huile à haut rendement. En tant que plus grand utilisateur mondial de compresseurs centrifuges Turbocor®, Smardt dispose d'une base d'installation de plus de 10 000 refroidisseurs, dont beaucoup dans des bâtiments emblématiques comme le Grand Palais du Peuple à Pékin ; l'Opéra de Sydney et le Carnegie Hall de New York.Les réseaux de vente et d'assistance de Smardt s'étendent dans le monde entier, en plus des installations de fabrication de sa gamme innovante de refroidisseurs à Stuttgart, en Allemagne ; Melbourne, Australie; Plattsburgh, États-Unis ; Canton, Chine ; Nankin, Chine ; São Paulo, Brésil; et Montréal, Canada. L'entreprise s'engage à fournir des solutions de refroidissement écoénergétiques et durables pour l'environnement bâti ; minimisant le coût total de possession pour ses clients et améliorant la planète pour les générations futures.L'analyste de données marketing relève du directeur marketing mondial.Résumé de la positionSmardt est à la recherche d'un analyste de données marketing pour être basé au siège social du groupe à Montréal. Le candidat retenu travaillera en étroite collaboration avec une équipe de marketing centrale nouvellement structurée pour exécuter les objectifs de développement commercial et de communication. Il s'agit d'un poste permanent à temps plein.Responsabilités du poste Recueillir des informations et examiner les tendances d'achat pour développer des plans marketing réussis :surveiller les activités et les résultats marketing des concurrents.analyser les stratégies de marché concurrentiel en examinant les tendances, les marchés et les produits qu'ils ont en commun ;communiquer avec les clients, les concurrents, les organisations professionnelles et les fournisseurs afin d'obtenir des informations sur les tendances de l'industrie ;compiler les références et retours clients ;utiliser des techniques d'analyse marketing pour recueillir des données sur les médias sociaux, l'analyse Web et les classements ; Segmenter le public cible et déterminer les marchés appropriés à approcher ; et Fournir une assistance à l'équipe des ventes en compilant tous les détails pour les marques, produits ou services à venir. Préparer des rapports détaillés sur le volume des ventes, l'expérience client, les tendances du marché et les résultats des concurrents : Préparer des rapports mensuels, trimestriels et annuels sur toutes les activités susmentionnées et leurs résultats Collecter des données d'intelligence d'affaires à partir de rapports de l'industrie ou de sources achetées pour délimiter les tendances et mesurer l'impact des activités de marketing des concurrents. Assurer l'alignement des principales parties prenantes à tous les niveaux de l'organisation sur les programmes stratégiques de la planification, l'exécution et l'optimisationQualifications Du Poste Cours en marketing d'entreprise, mathématiques, économie, informatique, gestion de l'information ou statistiques, obtention d'un baccalauréat de préférence Expertise technique concernant les modèles de données, le développement de la conception de bases de données, l'exploration de données et les techniques de segmentation Connaissance et expérience des progiciels de création de rapports, des bases de données, de la programmation et de la visualisation des données Connaissance des statistiques et expérience de l'utilisation de progiciels statistiques pour analyser des ensembles de données (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.) Compréhension des outils de tableau de bord/visualisation tels que PowerBI, Tableau Capacité à gérer des projets et des échéanciers, alignement avec les principales parties prenantes Le sens des affaires Solides compétences en mathématiques, intérêt/expérience en science des données marketing Approche curieuse et interrogative de l'analyse Excellentes compétences en communication écrite ainsi que la capacité de présenter les résultats de l'analyse à un public non technique Excellentes compétences interpersonnellesRémunération Salaire concurrentiel Primes de performance Régime d'avantages sociaux complet, y compris l'assurance médicale, dentaire, invalidité de longue durée et vie Cotisation REERPour en savoir plus, visitez le site Web de notre entreprise à l'adresse www.smardt.com***Possibility of remote work ***Smardt Chiller Group Inc.The Smardt Chiller Group is the pioneer and world leader in manufacturing high-efficiency, oil-free chillers. As the world’s largest user of Turbocor® centrifugal compressors, Smardt has an installation base of more than 10,000 chillers, many in iconic buildings like the Great Hall of the People, Beijing; the Sydney Opera House, and New York’s Carnegie Hall.Smardt’s sales and support networks extend worldwide, in addition to manufacturing facilities for its innovative range of chillers in Stuttgart, Germany; Melbourne, Australia; Plattsburgh, USA; Guangzhou, China; Nanjing, China; São Paulo, Brazil; and Montreal, Canada. The company is committed to providing energy-efficient, sustainable cooling solutions for the built environment; minimizing the total cost of ownership for its customers, and enhancing the planet for future generations.The Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Global Marketing Director.Position SummarySmardt is seeking a Marketing Data Analyst to be based at the group’s head office in Montreal. The successful applicant will work closely with a newly structured central marketing team to execute business development and communications objectives. This is a permanent full-time position.Position ResponsibilitiesGathering information and examining buying trends to develop successful marketing plans: monitoring the competitors’ marketing activities and outcomes. analyzing competitive market strategies by examining the trends, markets, and products they have in common; communicating with customers, competitors, professional organizations, and suppliers in order to get information on the industry’s trends; compiling customers’ references and feedback; using marketing analytics techniques to gather social media, web analytics, and rankings data;Segmenting the target audience and determining the appropriate markets to be approached; andProviding assistance to the Sales team by compiling all details for upcoming brands, products, or services.Preparing detailed reports on sales volume, customer experience, market trends, and competitors’ outcomes:Preparing monthly, quarterly, and annual reports on all of the aforementioned activities and their resultsCollecting business intelligence data from industry reports or purchased sources to delimit trends and to measure the impact of competitors’ marketing activities.Ensure alignment of key stakeholders throughout various levels of the organization on strategic programs from planning, execution, and optimizationPosition QualificationsCoursework in Business Marketing, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics, completion of bachelor’s degree preferredTechnical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniquesKnowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases, programming, and data visualizationKnowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)Understanding of dashboarding/visualization tools such as PowerBI, TableauAbility to manage projects and timelines, alignment with key stakeholdersBusiness acumenStrong math skills, marketing data science interest/ experienceCurious, questioning approach to analyticsExcellent written communication skills along with the ability to present results of analysis to a non-technical audienceExcellent interpersonal skills RemunerationCompetitive salaryPerformance bonusesComprehensive benefits plan, including medical, dental, long-term disability and life insuranceRRSP contributionTo learn more, please visit our company website at www.smardt.com

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment Overview Canadian Credit Cards is the largest dual issuer of Visa and MasterCard Products and holds the position of #1 market share in Canada. TD Consumer and Business credit cards are distributed nationally, leveraging our retail network direct responses and key co-brand partnerships including Aeroplan, Amazon and Air Canada.  The Proactive Monitoring Team applies advanced data analytics and automatic testing to support the Canadian Credit Cards business to proactively identify potential risk and enhancement opportunities, as well as supporting the remediation efforts of identified issues and/or incidents.  We understand the business, its risks and regulatory requirements and are the Subject Matter Experts on the related data across the Credit Card Business systems. We perform appropriate monitoring and/or testing activities and remediation support through two distinct pillars using a risk-based approach and report out to the business partners and control partners on the results/outcomes. Regulatory Requests for Information : Support Issue and Incident Management teams through the ICARUS POD by providing reporting based on business requirements to determine impacted customer populations and/or financial impacts for issues and incident resolution. Provide subject expertise and recommendations on data and business requirements to ensure the desired objectives for remediation are achieved. Proactive Monitoring Testing : Proactively research, investigate and detect to identify potential Regulatory, policy, process, operational and customer experience opportunities before an issue or incident is identified. Support new project implementation and process verification at the account level to identify potential anomalies early on. Risk Partner and Regulatory Information : Provide account level reporting requirements for internal or external partners to support audit, Regulator and control monitoring requests - Audit/BG&C/Compliance/GAML/ORM etc. and Regulators (FCAC, OSFI etc.).Job Description As a member of the Customer Monitoring and Remediation Team within Canadian Credit Cards, as a Senior Business Insights Analyst, your primary responsibility will be to support the preventive monitoring activities in order to increase customer experience, business processes and ensure adhere to bank regulations. You will play a key role in supporting various business partners with issue and/or incident remediation on complex reporting to identify impacted population and financial impacts and, providing secondary reviews. the primary accountabilities of the role are:  Creation and delivery of complex requests for information (RRFIs) reports primarily based on credit card processor account data or transactional data to support various Business Units (Product, Incident Management, Issue Management, ICARUS, Business Governance and Control, Audit, etc.)   Provide consultation for Business Units regarding complex report requirements data   Support timely reporting for issue and/or incident investigations investigation and remediation Design solutions for data retrieval to best meet the needs of the business in an effective manner  Assist with delivery of new business metrics and operational efficiencies within the CM&R Team  Participate in the development of new proactive monitoring activities through detail research and understanding of current bank regulations, policies and processes  Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and conduct secondary reviews  Participate fully as a member of the team, participate/assist in departmental committees providing insight and recommendations, and contribute to a positive work environment  Willingness to broaden and increase knowledge of new reporting tools and systems Job Requirements Demonstrate knowledge of SQL, Python and cloud computing programming Good understanding of the TD Card and/or MBNA Card portfolios and the lines of business supported  Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Excel Ability to work and research/resolve issues independently while sharing best practices and knowledge with colleagues Superior time management skills; be able to manage multiple assignments with competing priorities successfully Ability to quickly understand, acquire and apply new technical skills and apply those understandings to diverse requirements and cross-relational problems and solutions Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Innovative, results oriented and conceptual thinker Observed leadership abilities and desire to assume responsibility for deliverables  Flexibility to adapt and manage within a dynamic and fast paced environment  Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to develop strong relationships with peers, internal and external customers and IT partners Ability to analyze scenarios to reach acceptable compromises between technology impacts and customer service  Additional Skills: Knowledge of TS2 and the Account Management Triad technical environment and applications supported is an asset Experience with the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) is an asset Experience in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Access is an asset Experience with JIRA and Confluence is an asset  University Degree or College Diploma, with specialty in computer sciences, computer programming, mathematics, engineering or related field would be considered an asset InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

TD DescriptionAll companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer. Why TD?TD's Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That’s our unique and inclusive culture.Department OverviewOur Associate Programs offer new graduates the opportunity to work in one of TD's many lines of business, and the chance to work on challenging projects and assignments, alongside experienced colleagues, and receive coaching and mentorship from business leaders and the Early Talent Experience team, to set you up for success in your career at TD. As an Associate, you will also have access to programming, tools and a community of support for your pursuits and interests beyond the 9-5. This includes leadership talks, lunch and learns, self-development workshops, TD sponsored conferences, socials, team challenges, volunteer opportunities, career coaching and more. You will be part of a cohort along with other TD Associates from across Canada! defect-free programming by testing and debugging using available/appropriate tools and participate in reviewing peer coding Design, develop and deploy system enhancementsPerform Unit and System Integration testsDocument system deployment plans for system implementation and code deploymentParticipate in Proof-of-Concept (POC) on new technologies and document findings Provide recommendations subsetting, data archiving, data virtualization, project management, management reporting, data modelling, and/or database developmentTest Data Tools Knowledge (CA TDM or Delphix)Familiarity with source code management such as GITFamiliarity with Jira and ConfluenceA thirst for constantly exploring emerging technologySkills that would be an asset, but not requiredFamiliarity with RDBMS, Big dataFamiliarity with Data Warehousing, ETL, ELT conceptsFamiliarity with Pandas, Numpy Scikit-learn, Matplotlb, Ruby, LinuxInterest or aptitude in Financial Systems and the Financial IndustryFamiliarity with Cloud technology (Azure, AWS, GCP)Additional InformationPlease note: This role will have varying start dates as applications are being reviewed on an ongoing basisApplications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).
