Tally is on a mission to automate people’s entire financial lives so they can be less stressed and better off financially. In our first step towards that mission, we have launched the first and only fully automated credit card payoff app to put billions of dollars back into people’s pockets. We are currently backed by some of the world’s top investors, including Andreessen Horowitz and Kleiner Perkins, and were named Forbes' “Next Billion Dollar Startup” in 2020.We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support our growth and product functions. This is a role with broad exposure to many facets of the business and ideal for someone who is excited to wear many hats in a fast-paced startup environment.Role ImpactYou will work with large amounts of data to conduct research and analysis to help product, growth, and other business functions make data informed decisionsYou will work closely with cross functional groups to define, measure, and report on core product and feature performance to guide strategyYou will partner with product and growth teams to design and analyze experiments to drive growth and improve user experienceYou will collaborate with data engineering to build out our data science tools to accelerate our insight generation and ability to deliver user valueWe’re a financial product which relies on data and optimizing that data so your work will directly impact the success of the businessIn This Role We ValueRelevant professional experience as an analyst or consultantExpert knowledge and speed with SQL and Excel. Ability and willingness to learn other toolsAbility to concisely present your analysis and put together well-structured reports to support decision making within the companyPrior experience with interpreting large data sets and finding actionable insightsAbility to quickly grasp and creatively solve complex problemsSomeone who is quick to learn new skills and willing to tackle problems outside their comfort zone. This is a startup role and you have to be comfortable wearing many different hats.Strong teamwork capabilities and ability to collaborate with stakeholders a variety of business functions effectivelyMeticulous attention to detailBA or BS in a quantitative field of study such as Math, Science, Engineering, Business, etc.Prior exposure to advanced data analysis and visualization software a plus (Tableau, R, Python, etc.)A Message From Our Leadership"One of our core values at Tally is 'Change shoes often.' We do this with our peers and our customers every day, and we want candidates to share in our commitment to empathy. Empathy really is the foundation of inclusion, and Tally prides itself in being a company that prioritizes inclusion and diversity. We’re dedicated to creating a workplace culture where people are included and treated equitably.– Jason Brown, Cofounder and CEOThis organization participates in E-Verify. See more information here.

Wood is looking for a Sensor Data Analyst to join their team in St. John’s Newfoundland to support an exciting new project aimed at reducing carbon emissions and enhancing safety through the use of autonomous robotics. Sensor Data analyst role shall use tools to analyze the data streamed or collected fromthe robot sensors that provide Photographs, LIDAR, IR, thermal, gas detection, acoustic and other sensor modalities.  The data is analyzed to give insight into the current status of the plant/facilities equipment using different metrics (these metrics are set based on the organization’s needs).  Preparing reports for the client stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.  Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies Skills / Qualifications String physics background is required.  Experience with Linux, Windows and python scripting.  Experience with thermal imaging and methane detection would be helpful.  BSc/MSc in Physics, Math, Engineering or related discipline.  Good oral and written communication skills.  Ability to work in a multi-disciplinary team. Company OverviewWood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com Diversity Statement (EEO) We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Pet Acquisition Analytics
job_desc: DescriptionTrupanion is a leading provider of medical insurance for cats and dogs in North America. Our mission is to help the pets we all love receive the veterinary care they need. At Trupanion, we offer a collaborative, casual, and pet-friendly environment where everyone is encouraged to be themselves.Position SummaryThe Pet Acquisition Analytics team at Trupanion is looking for a curious and pet loving Senior Data Analyst to join our team. We need a driven senior analyst who can creatively come up with data-focused solutions to problems through inquiry, data collection, analysis and collaboration with business stakeholders. Successful candidates will have unbridled curiosity, enjoy solving complex problems and share our love of data and pets!This position is an entirely remote role open to candidates anywhere in Canada. Candidates who prefer an in-office option may choose to work a hybrid schedule out of our North Vancouver office.Key Responsibilities IncludeFoster effective working relationships with fellow analysts and business partners to create an environment of knowledge sharing Ability to see to the core of a problem, understanding the “why” behind a question Observant and inquisitive, discovering opportunities to use data to better understand our customers Extract and reconcile data from our robust data warehouse or identify and strategize new data to be collected Apply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to derive meaning from data with a focus on impact Present findings to business partners, often collaborating to develop and implement action plans Monitor results through performant dashboards QualificationsPlease include a cover letter with your application.Experience5+ years’ experience of data extraction and manipulation (eg SQL), statistical analysis and other modeling techniques 3+ years leading or mentoring junior analysts 3+ years using data to drive strategy Skills, Knowledge & AbilitiesComfortable working on complex and ambiguous problems Highly driven and motivated to work in a fast-paced, high-growth environment Advanced experience with data analysis including applying statistical methods and modeling techniques Advanced experience with data visualization platforms (Tableau preferred) Experience with research and survey methodology preferred Flexible to work independently and in a team-based environment Education, Registration & CertificationBachelor's degree in finance, mathematics, statistics, or another quantitative field.Benefits And PerksBonus opportunities Employer-paid extended health coverage for you and your family Four weeks paid time off Five weeks, paid, sabbatical after five years of employment Restricted Stock Units Employer-paid medical insurance for one pet (cat or dog) Paid time off to volunteer at nonprofit organizations Open, casual, pet-friendly, and fun work environment About TrupanionWe’re all about helping pets. We promote a cohesive and nimble team environment, and we hire, develop and promote team members. We trust each other. We are transparent and honest. We care about one another and want to see our team members succeed, personally and professionally. We strive to promote from within and reduce bureaucracy to allow creative thinking. We’re focused on providing continuous training and support to all team members to encourage long-term happiness and success.Take a look inside our office and see for yourself:https://www.facebook.com/Trupanion/videos/10155423763702974/We’re more than insurance – we’re a tech company too! Learn more about how you can use Trupanion to pay your vet directly here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vdWZ4KHiPTQTrupanion Team DNAAt Trupanion, we achieve great things together when we are:Caring: We are kind to each other and assume positive intent. Collaborative: We work together to achieve company goals (we not me). Courageous: We are determined, take risks, and make bold moves. Curious: We seek new information to continually better ourselves and our work. Honest: We believe candid communication leads to successful teamwork. Inclusive: We welcome and value all people and perspectives. Nimble: We readily adapt and evolve in pursuit of progress and innovation. For more information about Trupanion, visit http://trupanion.com/aboutTrupanion is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, abilities, perspectives, and skills.We will ensure that individuals are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job DescriptionLocation: Markham, ONWork Schedule: HybridRef ID:REF15604SOur NielsenIQ teams empower our clients to make bold decisions and transform their businesses with trusted data, solutions, and insights designed to drive innovation and growth. The NielsenIQ North America Data Science team is passionate about solving complex client challenges and providing data-driven, actionable, timely, and innovative solutions. This Sr. Data Scientist position was created to support our Canada Data Science initiatives. This position requires someone who is passionate about learning, multi-sourced data, data quality, statistical measurement, automation, efficiency, and consumer behavior.ResponsibilitiesLead detailed analysis.Simultaneously balance multiple projects.Represent Data Science in interactions with other functions.Support end-to-end implementation of solutions.Ability to evaluate current methodologies quickly.Document and present findings and recommendations.Detect, troubleshoot, and resolve system anomalies.Provide explanations to teams in a format that meets their level of understanding.Continually developskill set.ExperienceBachelor’s or Master’s Degree with a quantitative discipline.Skills3-6 Years of professional experience in a quantitative field.Curiosity to learn and continually upgrade skills.Disposition to understand processes and methodologies.Quantitative aptitude with proven data analysis and problem-solving skills.Proficiency with Python or R, and SQL.Experience with working on large amounts of data.Strong verbal, presentation, and written skills.Strong planning and organizational skills.Ability to work independently as well as in a team environmentAbout NielsenIQAdditional InformationNielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment Overview Canadian Credit Cards is the largest dual issuer of Visa and MasterCard Products and holds the position of #1 market share in Canada. TD Consumer and Business credit cards are distributed nationally, leveraging our retail network direct responses and key co-brand partnerships including Aeroplan, Amazon and Air Canada.  The Proactive Monitoring Team applies advanced data analytics and automatic testing to support the Canadian Credit Cards business to proactively identify potential risk and enhancement opportunities, as well as supporting the remediation efforts of identified issues and/or incidents.  We understand the business, its risks and regulatory requirements and are the Subject Matter Experts on the related data across the Credit Card Business systems. We perform appropriate monitoring and/or testing activities and remediation support through two distinct pillars using a risk-based approach and report out to the business partners and control partners on the results/outcomes. Regulatory Requests for Information : Support Issue and Incident Management teams through the ICARUS POD by providing reporting based on business requirements to determine impacted customer populations and/or financial impacts for issues and incident resolution. Provide subject expertise and recommendations on data and business requirements to ensure the desired objectives for remediation are achieved. Proactive Monitoring Testing : Proactively research, investigate and detect to identify potential Regulatory, policy, process, operational and customer experience opportunities before an issue or incident is identified. Support new project implementation and process verification at the account level to identify potential anomalies early on. Risk Partner and Regulatory Information : Provide account level reporting requirements for internal or external partners to support audit, Regulator and control monitoring requests - Audit/BG&C/Compliance/GAML/ORM etc. and Regulators (FCAC, OSFI etc.).Job Description As a member of the Customer Monitoring and Remediation Team within Canadian Credit Cards, as a Senior Business Insights Analyst, your primary responsibility will be to support the preventive monitoring activities in order to increase customer experience, business processes and ensure adhere to bank regulations. You will play a key role in supporting various business partners with issue and/or incident remediation on complex reporting to identify impacted population and financial impacts and, providing secondary reviews. the primary accountabilities of the role are:  Creation and delivery of complex requests for information (RRFIs) reports primarily based on credit card processor account data or transactional data to support various Business Units (Product, Incident Management, Issue Management, ICARUS, Business Governance and Control, Audit, etc.)   Provide consultation for Business Units regarding complex report requirements data   Support timely reporting for issue and/or incident investigations investigation and remediation Design solutions for data retrieval to best meet the needs of the business in an effective manner  Assist with delivery of new business metrics and operational efficiencies within the CM&R Team  Participate in the development of new proactive monitoring activities through detail research and understanding of current bank regulations, policies and processes  Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and conduct secondary reviews  Participate fully as a member of the team, participate/assist in departmental committees providing insight and recommendations, and contribute to a positive work environment  Willingness to broaden and increase knowledge of new reporting tools and systems Job Requirements Demonstrate knowledge of SQL, Python and cloud computing programming Good understanding of the TD Card and/or MBNA Card portfolios and the lines of business supported  Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Excel Ability to work and research/resolve issues independently while sharing best practices and knowledge with colleagues Superior time management skills; be able to manage multiple assignments with competing priorities successfully Ability to quickly understand, acquire and apply new technical skills and apply those understandings to diverse requirements and cross-relational problems and solutions Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Innovative, results oriented and conceptual thinker Observed leadership abilities and desire to assume responsibility for deliverables  Flexibility to adapt and manage within a dynamic and fast paced environment  Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to develop strong relationships with peers, internal and external customers and IT partners Ability to analyze scenarios to reach acceptable compromises between technology impacts and customer service  Additional Skills: Knowledge of TS2 and the Account Management Triad technical environment and applications supported is an asset Experience with the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) is an asset Experience in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Access is an asset Experience with JIRA and Confluence is an asset  University Degree or College Diploma, with specialty in computer sciences, computer programming, mathematics, engineering or related field would be considered an asset InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Job Description – Senior Analyst Pharmacy Planning And InsightsReporting directly to the Manager, Pharmacy Planning & Insights, and the incumbent is responsible for providing insights on LCL retail pharmacy performance and supporting the financial reporting processes for pharmacy. The ideal candidate is someone with an analytical mindset and a proven ability to quickly grasp an unstructured situation, drive insights from both quantitative and qualitative information available, and present results and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to senior level stakeholders.What You Will DoSupport the financial and planning processes for pharmacy – annual and multiyear plans, periodic forecast and analysis of actual resultsPerform analyses on key drivers (e.g., payor, services, etc.) of overall and/or store-specific pharmacy performanceProvide insights and recommendations on the impact to the business of pricing/reimbursement changes, third party contracts and regulatory changes through analysis and modelingSynthesize large amounts of complex data from multiple sources, extrapolate appropriate information and develop concise and easy to understand explanations of business results, opportunities and recommendations for senior level stakeholdersDevelop complex models to assess LCL’s total pharmacy market performance, category trends and market share and to assist in strategic business decision makingAdvance departmental capabilities and team efficiency and performance through:developing and enhancing the analytical techniques of the Pharmacy Planning teamenhancing the reporting systems and software capabilitiesCollaborates closely with internal departments and subject matter experts to proactively identify & resolve issues, identify opportunities and process improvementsWhat You Will NeedStrong analytical skills - the ability to leverage data, experience and industry knowledge to provide actionable insights and recommendations, as well as to identify financial/business implications to senior managementDemonstrated attention to detailsClear and concise communication and presentation skillsHigh level of initiative to take projects from start to finish with minimal supervisionAdvanced computer skills to produce reports, documents and presentations, as required:Expert knowledge MS Office software (including Excel and PowerPoint)Programming experience (e.g., VBA macro), knowledge of relevant database and Business Intelligence software applications (including MS Access, SQL and Microstrategy), and/or experience with statistical software (e.g., R, SAS, etc.) would be an assetAbility to set and prioritize work amid competing demandsAbility to work with diverse personalities and stylesTwo (2) to (4) years of business analysis, finance or planning experienceKnowledge of pharmaceutical or retail industry is an assetPost secondary education equivalent to a university degree in business, finance or economicsAccounting designation (or enrollment in program) is an assetRelevant directement du gestionnaire, Planification et analyses de la pharmacie, le titulaire est responsable de fournir des renseignements sur le rendement des services pharmaceutiques de détail de LCL et de soutenir les processus de présentation de l’information financière pour la pharmacie. Le candidat idéal est une personne ayant une attitude analytique et une capacité éprouvée à saisir rapidement les situations non structurées, à obtenir des renseignements à la fois sur les quantitatives et qualitatives disponibles et à présenter les résultats et les recommandations de manière claire et concise aux intervenants de niveau supérieur.Ce Que Vous FerezSoutenir les processus financiers et de planification pour la pharmacie – plans annuels et pluriannuels, prévisions périodiques et analyses des résultats réels.Effectuer des analyses sur les facteurs clés (p. ex., le payeur, les services, etc.) du rendement global des services pharmaceutiques ou du magasin.Fournir des renseignements et des recommandations sur l’incidence sur l’entreprise des changements de prix et de remboursement, des contrats avec des tiers et des changements réglementaires par l’analyse et la modélisation.Synthétiser de grandes quantités de données complexes provenant de sources multiples, extrapoler les renseignements appropriés et élaborer des explications concises et faciles à comprendre des résultats commerciaux, des occasions et des recommandations pour les intervenants de niveau supérieur.Élaborer des modèles complexes pour évaluer le rendement total du marché des services pharmaceutiques, les tendances de la catégorie et la part de marché de LCL et pour aider à la prise de décisions commerciales stratégiques.Améliorer les capacités du service et l’efficacité et le rendement de l’équipe en :développant et améliorant les techniques analytiques de l’équipe de planification de la pharmacie;améliorant les systèmes de production de rapports et les capacités logicielles.Collaborer étroitement avec les services internes et les experts en la matière afin de cerner et de résoudre les problèmes de façon proactive, de repérer les occasions et d’améliorer les processus.Ce Dont Vous Aurez BesoinSolides compétences analytiques – capacité de tirer parti des données, de l’expérience et des connaissances du secteur pour fournir des renseignements et des recommandations pratiques, ainsi que pour déterminer les répercussions financières et commerciales pour les cadres.Souci du détail démontré.Compétences en communication et en présentation claires et concises.Initiative de haut niveau pour mener les projets du début à la fin avec un minimum de supervision.Aptitudes informatiques avancées pour produire des rapports, documents et présentations, au besoin.Connaissance approfondie des logiciels MS Office (y compris Excel et PowerPoint).Expérience en programmation (p. ex., macro VBA), connaissance des bases de données pertinentes et des applications logicielles de veille stratégique (y compris MS Access, SQL et MicroStrategy), ou expérience avec les logiciels statistiques (p. ex., R, SAS, etc.), un atout.Capacité à effectuer et à établir les priorités du travail dans le cadre de demandes concurrentes.Capacité à travailler avec divers personnalités et styles.Deux (2) à quatre (4) ans d’expérience en analyse commerciale, en finances ou en planification.Connaissance de l’industrie pharmaceutique ou de la vente au détail, un atout.Diplôme d’études postsecondaires équivalent à un diplôme universitaire en administration des affaires, en finances ou en économie.Titre de comptable (ou inscription au programme), un atout.

At Elastic, we see endless possibility in a world of endless data. And we use the power of search to help people and organizations turn that possibility into results. Elastic is the leading platform for search-powered solutions. With solutions in Enterprise Search, Observability, and Security, we help improve customer and employee search experiences, keep critical applications running smoothly, and protect against cyber threats. Elastic enables organizations worldwide to use the power of Elastic, including Netflix, Uber, BBC, Microsoft, and thousands of others.Elastic was built on a foundation of being free and open, which trickles down to how we work. We’re a distributed organization and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn’t just a way of doing business—it’s a mentality that is at the core of our culture.The Elastic Security Machine Learning team is looking for a Data Scientist to contribute to the maturation of our endpoint malware detection models, and help build models for entity analytics in the Elastic SIEM. You will work closely with ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Managers, and UX teams, to build and deploy new models, identify model blindspots, detect drift patterns, confidently label never-before-seen samples, and address questions like:How to expose model outputs to users?How does the performance of our models change over time?What can we do to improve our models?If you are ready to solve these challenges and more, we look forward to hearing from you!What You Will Be DoingYou will have the opportunity to build models within the Elastic Stack, leveraging Elastic Security telemetry data, while collaborating with other teams at ElasticYou will also have the opportunity to work with machine learning engineers on the team, to prototype and productionize models for the Elastic Endpoint Security malware detection productYou will participate in regular production deployments and model validation tasksWhat You Will Bring Along2+ years of machine learning experienceExperience using or developing ML pipelinesPython programming skillsAbility to synthesize evaluation metrics, customer feedback, and internal analysis to communicate model performanceEnthusiasm for providing novel contributions to the information security research community on machine learning techniquesBonus PointsExperience with javaExperience writing production-quality codeMalware or security backgroundExperience with any part of the Elastic stackAdditional Information - We Take Care Of Our PeopleAs a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. job_title: Scientifique de données spécialisé(e) en détection de la fraude (R2211833)
job_desc: Posted by                  Jordan Le Corvec             Talents Acquisition Advisor                                     Send InMail                    À titre de Scientifique de données spécialisé(e) en détection de la fraude, vous contribuez à répondre au besoin des données en soutien à la prise de décisions d’affaires, au développement de solutions et de services adaptés aux enjeux d’affaires et à la compréhension des comportements des membres et clients.Vous assumez un rôle de leadership auprès des différents intervenants dans le cadre de projets de développement de modèles adaptés à des besoins d'affaires dans le domaine de la détection de la fraude. données.La nature des dossiers exige des connaissances étendues et approfondies dans le domaine de la détection de la fraude.Responsabilités principalesDévelopper et mettre en production des visant à prévenir et détecter la fraudeOffrir des conseils sur des projets visant à améliorer les outils de gestion des risques de fraudeAgir à titre de conseiller auprès des équipes de gestion des risques et des secteurs d'activité de votre domaine d'expertiseJouez un rôle de vigie pour comprendre et anticiper les tendances dans votre domaine d'expertise en vue de développer et de mettre à jour (GF)Desjardins valorise la diversité et l’équité en emploi et s’engage à répondre aux besoins des personnes handicapées en adaptant, au besoin, son processus de recrutement.Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.

contributeur-clé de la stratégie d’intelligence artificielleConcevoir des solutions d’Intelligence Artificielle innovatrices permettant de supporter les opérations d’entrainement dans les domaines de et des stratégies commerciales.Évaluer l'efficacité et l'exactitude des nouvelles sources de données et techniques de collecte de données.Développer des solutions et des algorithmes d'IA personnalisés à appliquer aux ensembles de données.Expérimentez des méthodologies de modélisation avancées qui visent à augmenter et à optimiser l'expérience client, la génération de revenus, le ciblage publicitaire et d'autres résultats commerciaux.Développer un cadre de test A/B pour l'expérimentation de l'IA et l'analyse des résultats.Coordonner avec différentes équipes fonctionnelles pour mettre en œuvre des modèles et suivre les résultats.Développer des processus et des outils pour surveiller et analyser les performances du modèle et la précision des données.Être un contributeur-clé dans la transformation de l’entreprisePiloter la recherche sur les tendances de l'industrie de l'aviation et des soins de santé et les applications commerciales de l'apprentissage automatique pour être un différenciateur sur le marché.Mener plusieurs projets liés à l'apprentissage machine à grande échelle et orientés services: du plan fonctionnel au plan de mise en œuvre.Diriger une équipe pour le développement rapide et itératif d'une solution minimale viable validée.Développer et prototyper de nouvelles techniques d'apprentissage automatique, exécuter des expériences pour améliorer la compréhension et modéliser le taux d'efficacité.Être un collègue inspirant et motivantPartager vos connaissances avec l’équipe et initier des activités de partage des connaissances.Être un agent de changement et un promoteur de la mentalité agile.Contribuer au milieu de travail collaboratif et stimulant.Communiquer avec la communauté d'intelligence artificielle de Montréal et d'ailleurs pour trouver de nouvelles possibilités de collaboration et pour injecter de nouvelles idées dans notre pipeline.Vos QualificationsUne volonté d'apprendre et de maîtriser les nouvelles technologies, méthodologies et techniques.Expérience à piloter des initiatives dirigées par le client.Expérience de travail dans un environnement Agile un atout.Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale pour la coordination entre les équipes.Compétences techniquesAvoir une maîtrise ou un doctorat en statistique, informatique, analyse commerciale ou un domaine connexe.Posséder au moins 5 ans d'expérience en science des données ou en statistiques appliquées.Solides compétences en résolution de problèmes en mettant l'accent sur le développement de produits.Expérience de l'utilisation de langages informatiques statistiques (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) pour manipuler des données et tirer des enseignements de grands ensembles de données.Expérience dans la manipulation d'ensembles de données et dans l'élaboration de modèles statistiques.Connaissance d'une variété de techniques d'apprentissage automatique (forêts aléatoires, machine à vecteur de support, amplification de gradient, réseaux de neurones artificiels, réseaux bayésiens, etc.) et leurs avantages / inconvénients réels.Connaissance des techniques et concepts statistiques avancés (MLG / régression, séries chronologiques, Power BI, Business Objects, D3, ggplot.Ce que nous avons à offrirAvantages sociaux : entièrement flexibles pour que vous puissiez choisir ce qui est important.Retraite : Régime de retraite à sociales et communautaires tout au long de l’année!Joignez-vous au moteur de changement à CAE - notre prochain horizon de croissance passe avant tout par l’innovation numérique afin d’appuyer la réussite de nos clients.If you’ve taken a plane to any destination in the world, chances are, your pilot was trained by CAE. About UsFounded in 2017, Coalition is on a mission to solve cyber risk and create a safer digital economy where everyone can thrive. Digital risk is now a part of every business and it’s no longer solely the domain of technical teams. That’s why we combined comprehensive insurance with proactive cybersecurity tools to help organizations stay resilient to digital risks like cyber attacks, funds transfer fraud and much more.Our team works collaboratively across North America and Europe to prevent security failures and provide both technical and financial help when incidents do occur. Today, Coalition is the world’s largest commercial insurtech serving over 130,000 customers including many small businesses that rely on Coalition to help them chart a path forward in the new digital world.As of September 2021, Coalition has raised $520 million from leading global technology investors as well as highly-regarded institutional investors including: Index Ventures, Ribbit Capital, Valor Ventures, Durable Capital, T. Rowe Price Advisors, and Whale Rock Capital, valuing the company at more than $3.5 billion.Coalition has experienced tremendous growth by helping organizations of all sizes solve real-world problems and by remaining true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, authenticity and diversity. That’s why we are proud to be named one of Inc’s Best Places to Work in 2021.About The RoleCoalition is looking for a data scientist to join our rapidly growing data science team to solve underwriting challenges. You will use analytics, experimentation, and modern statistical techniques to help us understand and improve our underwriting system. you will be responsible for growing our revenue in a safe and efficient manner, from informing pricing strategies to better market segmentation to identifying/executing on further automation opportunities.This role requires an ability to partner with our head of underwriting and other key stakeholders to quickly identify emerging trends in our underwriting data and effectively communicate clear, actionable strategies across the company.ResponsibilitiesEvaluate our current underwriting practices and compare them against industry trendsAnalyze complex processes and workflows to identify and implement improvements to increase productivity and improve cycle time.Support reporting, analytics, and machine-learning needs of the entire Underwriting teamProactively lead conversations with key business stakeholders to drive continuous underwriting improvementsManage the company's underwriting + pricing KPIs, analyses, and data visualizationsSupport the company's governance, risk, and compliance programs as they relate to our pricing/underwriting systemsCreate and maintain documentation that will support the effective implementation of repeatable processes and workflowsSpread data science best practices to both data science and underwriting teamSkills And Qualifications2+ years of experience in a professional analytics / data science capacityExperience writing SQL queries to extract and prepare data for modeling and analysesStrong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyAbility to think objectively and interpret meaningful themes from quantitative and qualitative dataAbility to build constructive and effective relationships with a broad and diverse group of business partnersComfortable guiding others, recommending tools and standard methodologies to improve the efficiency of the teams workStrong communication skills and ability to convey complex topics to non-technical audiencesPassionate about subjects such as experimental design, data visualization, and statistical analysis techniquesBonus PointsExperience working in Tableau/Looker or similar data visualization tool a big plusExperience within the insurance or financial services industry, with a focus on underwritingExperience with Python or RA Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics or related technical fieldWhy Coalition?Coalition's culture is one that strongly values humility, authenticity, and diversity. We want to work with people of different backgrounds and different paths in life, and we trust our team members to take responsibility, share ownership and work for one another. We are always looking for collaborative, inquisitive and dedicated individuals to join our team.Coalition EngineeringOur culture is one of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, and authenticity. We are growing rapidly and that growth is enabled by strong teamwork, communication, and mentorship. We want people who are passionate about becoming experts in both the business and the technologies that support it. Our core platform is written mostly in Python with some services in Java and Go. We prefer to use the right tool for the job and make pragmatic decisions about how to scale and de-couple systems as we continue to grow. We’re looking for someone who can navigate a cloud environment (AWS) with many moving pieces and systems to help the team understand how they fit into the broader puzzle.Recent press releases:Coalition Closes $205 Million Series E, Valuing the Cyber Insurance Provider At More Than $3.5 BillionCoalition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

DescriptionJoin our team and what we'll accomplish togetherThe TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customer’s privacy and to earn and maintain their trust. We see compliance with the law as our starting point and we passionately pursue opportunities to demonstrate respect for our customers and their data through transparent, robust, and ethical data practices.Our team takes pride in earning a reputation for being innovative thought-leaders, strategic business partners and subject-matter experts in privacy and data governance.TELUS recognizes the great potential of data to meet business needs in our world today, consistent with our position on social capitalism. Data governance supports TELUS’ commitment to respectfully treat data in a manner that fosters innovation and at the same time mitigates the array of privacy, security and ethical risks. We earn our stakeholders trust- across the business and with our customers- using the data governance principles of accountability, ethical use and transparency to deliver value from data, in accordance with the TELUS Trust model.As the Data Governance Analyst, reporting to the Director of Data Ethics & Governance, you will materially influence the ongoing development of TELUS’ data governance program. You will work with a cross-functional group focused on enabling the growth of the business along with the responsible use of data. At the same time, you will be an integral member of the Data Ethics & Governance team. This team is tasked with solving some of our organization's most complex challenges while building a thriving community of practice around data ethics and data governance.You will be a champion for data governance and you will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS’ mission. Your contributions on the data governance program will be an integral part of our commitment to leverage data in a respectful manner and our thought-leadership on anticipating challenges at the intersection of privacy, ethics, technology and data.Here's HowContribute to the implementation of a data governance program that helps TELUS organize and understand data to exceed stakeholder customers while simultaneously ensuring TELUS’ ability to respectfully leverage data assets to deliver value.Support TELUS’ records management program, including educating and advising business primes on best practices for records retention, the information management life cycle and data governance.Facilitate and continuously improve the development and implementation of data governance policies, best practices and adoption across the enterprise.Collaborate with team members to develop processes for documenting and understanding data flows and lineage in adherence to TELUS’ data governance policies. Facilitate the implementation of the Data Steward program and support the Enterprise Data Council and Architecture and Data Governance Steering Committee. Oversee document management processes, including maintenance of data governance documentation, templates, meeting logs, metrics and progress reports.Support business units across TELUS by coordinating stakeholder engagement, input and dialogue on data governance and ensure data is managed in accordance with policies and processes.Partner with various stakeholders within TELUS and external partners, as required, to provide data and information management control advice or promote TELUS’ thought leadership in data governance as part of key strategic projects, special investigations or ad-hoc initiatives.Learn continuously, innovate every day and seek opportunities to develop and demonstrate thought-leadership. What You BringQualificationsStrong understanding of best-in-class principles for data management, data analytics, business intelligence and records management.Recognized for your leadership capabilities to collaborate and accomplish goals with others.Demonstrated track record of defining and delivering measurable outcomes in a highly complex stakeholder environment.Effective in written communication and verbally communicating progress on initiatives in leadership forums. Trusted as a collaborative partner who will act with integrity to fulfill TELUS’ commitments to its customers.Recognized for your excellent interpersonal skills to build and foster relationships across all levels of the organization.Known for your ability to influence and negotiate effectively, to be a persuasive advocate.Sought after for your excellent and problem solving skills and your ability to distill complex and/or ambiguous problems into clear, actionable requirements.Highly adaptable, and comfortable working in a demanding and fast-paced environment.University degree and/or 3-5 years of working experience in information management.Knowledge of industry best practices including: DAMA International Body of Knowledge; ARMA; IAPP.Great-to-havesBilingualism in English & French, verbal and/or written;Project management experience;Experience working in a large, matrixed organization.

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Pet Acquisition Analytics
job_desc: DescriptionTrupanion is a leading provider of medical insurance for cats and dogs in North America. Our mission is to help the pets we all love receive the veterinary care they need. At Trupanion, we offer a collaborative, casual, and pet-friendly environment where everyone is encouraged to be themselves.Position SummaryThe Pet Acquisition Analytics team at Trupanion is looking for a curious and pet loving Senior Data Analyst to join our team. We need a driven senior analyst who can creatively come up with data-focused solutions to problems through inquiry, data collection, analysis and collaboration with business stakeholders. Successful candidates will have unbridled curiosity, enjoy solving complex problems and share our love of data and pets!This position is an entirely remote role open to candidates anywhere in Canada. Candidates who prefer an in-office option may choose to work a hybrid schedule out of our North Vancouver office.Key Responsibilities IncludeFoster effective working relationships with fellow analysts and business partners to create an environment of knowledge sharing Ability to see to the core of a problem, understanding the “why” behind a question Observant and inquisitive, discovering opportunities to use data to better understand our customers Extract and reconcile data from our robust data warehouse or identify and strategize new data to be collected Apply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to derive meaning from data with a focus on impact Present findings to business partners, often collaborating to develop and implement action plans Monitor results through performant dashboards QualificationsPlease include a cover letter with your application.Experience5+ years’ experience of data extraction and manipulation (eg SQL), statistical analysis and other modeling techniques 3+ years leading or mentoring junior analysts 3+ years using data to drive strategy Skills, Knowledge & AbilitiesComfortable working on complex and ambiguous problems Highly driven and motivated to work in a fast-paced, high-growth environment Advanced experience with data analysis including applying statistical methods and modeling techniques Advanced experience with data visualization platforms (Tableau preferred) Experience with research and survey methodology preferred Flexible to work independently and in a team-based environment Education, Registration & CertificationBachelor's degree in finance, mathematics, statistics, or another quantitative field.Benefits And PerksBonus opportunities Employer-paid extended health coverage for you and your family Four weeks paid time off Five weeks, paid, sabbatical after five years of employment Restricted Stock Units Employer-paid medical insurance for one pet (cat or dog) Paid time off to volunteer at nonprofit organizations Open, casual, pet-friendly, and fun work environment About TrupanionWe’re all about helping pets. Your Opportunity:The Data and Research Analyst is a key position reporting to the Site Executive Director, Site Administration, Royal Alexandra Hospital (RAH), with supervision by the Sr. Consultant, Patient and Provider Experience Office (PPEO), providing data and research analytics expertise for multiple portfolios across the RAH campus.Description:This position creates and develops surveys in liaison with AHS Clinical Quality Metrics, launches surveys, collects and analyzes survey results. Analyzes quality and experience information (i.e. HCAHPS - Hospital Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems), interprets, develops trending reports, and provides recommendations. Works with databases, spreadsheets and other analytical software packages, using analytic techniques to extract data from source information systems (e.g. writes scripts or queries to extract the right data and organize into a logical format for subsequent interpretation). Establishing and/or operationalizing the strategic direction for analytical methodologies and ensuring the quality of analytical outputs. Applies rules to obtain reliable results and ensures consistent and correct use and interpretation of data, working with clients to meet their needs. The Data and Research Analyst will be accountable for data collection, inputting data, analyzing data and providing timely report utilizing data. The Data and Research Analyst will liaise and collaborate with with AHS Provincial Clinical Quality Metrics. Candidates must have excellent writing and presentation skills and a willingness to develop an in-depth understanding of several related fields of research and data analysis. Critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills are requisite.Additional Required Qualifications: 3-5 years experience working within a healthcare organization or quality-related organization. Programs and Systems utilized (not limited to): Epic/Connect Care, Excel, Access, Crystalworks. Strong communication skills (both written and verbal) for information gathering and the ability to interact with various business groups. Overview:The Business Information Competency Centre (BICC) at Loblaw is responsible for handling analytical reporting for Finance teams within Canada's largest and most successful retailer. These reports are accessed on multiple platforms including web and mobile and have a vast audience ranging from analysts to c-level executives. strong time management skills.Solid experience in developing and providing accurate reportingExcellent verbal and written communication skills.Experience in Agile, Scrum, and Agile tools (Confluence and Jira preferred)Demonstrable ability to respond and adapt to new situations and work in a constantly evolving and fast-paced environmentSophisticated knowledge of MS Excel

Our mission is to deliver the best travel deals available to our customers. This role is critical for us to fulfill this mission.Why Is This Job a Big DealAs a Senior Analyst you will influence and challenge Pricing decisions made within the Strategic Pricing and Analytics team by delivering insightful analysis, predictive models and innovative strategies. The ideal candidate for this role has prior Pricing experience in an e-commerce or marketplace environment, strong analytical skills with an excellent track record of execution.In This Role You Will Get ToExecute and improve upon Priceline.com's strategy for Hotel pricing & competitive intelligenceLearn, upgrade and automate various pricing initiatives within Priceline.com, partnering with the Marketing, Finance and other analytical teamsDevelop innovative solutions and techniques to ensure Priceline.com's pricing remains competitive, profitable and innovativeInfluence and challenge decisions made by the team through timely & insightful analysis, modeling and experimentsIdentify appropriate reports to support decision making, recommend and build enhancements to our Pricing reporting infrastructureWho You AreStrong analytical, statistical and problem-solving skills are requiredStrong, hands on SQL experience, preferably with Oracle or BigQuery, but other relational databases are OKExperience building or enhancing reports using Tableau and/or excelExperience working with R/Python strongly preferredExperience with hypothesis testing and A/B testingA ‘can-do’ attitude and a passion for analytics/data.Strong communication skills, both written and oralTakes responsibility for results, “owning” assignments and projectsBachelor of Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics4 years of experience in analytics, consulting or technologyExperience in data science, pricing, travel & e-commerce experience desiredWho We AreWE ARE PRICELINE.Our success as one of the biggest players in online travel is all thanks to our incredible, dedicated team of talented employees. Priceliners are focused on being the best travel deal makers in the world, fueled by our passion to help everyone experience the moments that matter most in their lives. Whether it’s a dream vacation, your cousin’s graduation, or your best friend’s wedding - we make travel affordable and accessible to our customers.Our culture is unique and inspiring (that’s what our employees tell us). We’re a grown-up, startup. We deliver the excitement of a new venture, without the struggles and chaos that can come with a business that hasn’t stabilized.We’re on the cutting edge of innovative technologies. We keep the customer at the center of all that we do. Our ability to meet their needs relies on the strength of a workforce as diverse as the customers we serve. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.Priceline is part of the Booking Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: BKNG) family of companies, a highly profitable global online travel company with a market capitalization of over $80 billion. Our sister companies include Booking.com, BookingGo, Agoda, Kayak and OpenTable.If you want to be part of something truly special, check us out!Flexible work at PricelineWhen we return to the office we will be in a fully flex mode, meaning you decide when to come to the office when it makes sense for you to do so - no minimum number of days in the office. Until then we are all working from home and will return to our flex mode when it is safe to do so.Diversity and Inclusion are a Big Deal!To be the best travel dealmakers in the world, it’s important we have a workforce that reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to cultivating a culture where all employees have the freedom to bring their individual perspectives, life experiences, and values-driven passion to work.Priceline is a proud equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate the unique lenses through which our employees see the world. We’d love you to join us and add to our rich mix!Applying for this positionWe're excited that you are interested in a career with us. For all current employees, please use the internal portal to find jobs and apply.External candidates are required to have an account before applying. When you click Apply, returning candidates can log in, or new candidates can quickly create an account to save/view applications.

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewWhat does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data. Job DescriptionAbout this RoleAs an expert in data and analytics, you will provide in depth expertise, analytical interpretation, key insights and action items to your multi-functional business partners across the organization. Those insights will be brought to bear to enable informed and enabled business decisions enterprise wide or help to solve the increasingly complex business problems they face. In this role, TD will look to as a thought leadership as well as a leader in your space, coaching, mentoring, empowering and educating your peers to collaborate and bring TD into the future of banking.As a Senior Business Insights Analyst, you will: Apply understanding of respective business strategies to produce relevant and substantial data analysis to support business goals and objectivesDevelop analysis to illustrate business trends and identify areas of business opportunitiesProduce insights and recommend business actions to align with strategy and/or solve business problemsProvide seasoned specialized knowledge, advice and/or mentorship to various business and working partnersExecute on data requests accurately and within a timely mannerRepresent functional area as an analytics & insights professional and key resource; build positive and productive working partnershipsAct as a bridge to translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domainProvides day-to-day support and delivery of analyticsWork independently as the senior analyst/subject matter expert and may coach and educate othersConsidered an authority within a given areaOversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to end Job RequirementsWhat can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes: Undergraduate degree or technical certificateFive (5) or more years relevant experience Additional InformationMust have skills:SQLAdobe Analytics or Google Analytics #businessintelligence  InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

A Little Bit About UsAt Nestlé, our values are rooted in respect - for our employees, our customers and our consumers. That’s why championing diversity and inclusion is so important to us. We embrace different perspectives and give everyone the chance and flexibility to reach their fullest potential, allowing us all to think in new and creative ways that enhance our business and allow us to grow together both professionally and personally. At Nestlé, you are provided with the opportunity to make a mark and stand out, as long as you seek it. Bringing our brands to life and making them as relevant for today’s consumers as they’ve always been takes vision, passion and an innovative mind-set. If you can bring that into the mix, we know the magic will happen.Position SnapshotBusiness areas: Nestlé CanadaJob title: Marketing Data AnalystLocation: North York, ONGrade: 16Position SummaryWe are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst based out of our North York office reporting into the Leader of Analytics. This position is accountable for developing analytically-driven Insights that will result in greater consumer, shopper and customer engagement plans, ensuring the consumer and shopper are at the centre of decision making, by supporting all aspects of 3 key areas: 1) Category, Brand and Customer Analytical process and insight integration; 2) Effective and efficient tools and systems that deliver business intelligence to Marketing, Sales and Executive Leaders and 3) Partner Management and Best-In-Class analytical approaches. Insight sources include: Customer Transactional data, Loyalty Card Data, Nielsen, Numerator, other Syndicated data sources and Internal data.A day in the life of...This position is accountable for delivering support against agreed-upon business objectives for the portfolio, including proactively identifying issues and solutions. You will be providing assistance to the Businesses by leading specialized, division-wide projects relevant to the role.You will also: Provide data analytics to the Businesses and CSD teams driving discipline in fact-based decision making: Integrated insight and recommendations across Category, Brand and Customer to build consumer/shopper loyalty and Customer engagement (category & brand leadership) Contribute to the development of annual business and customer plans Lead KPI measurement and “how to win” actions (category, brand, customer score-carding) Lead the development and maintenance of fact-based tools and reports from initial concept to testing, launch and final implementation Use advanced analytical and technical expertise to enable reports and tools addressing key business issues for ongoing and ad hoc requirements. Synthesize multiple data sources in Tools and Analytic Initiatives. Leverage full suite of Nielsen, Numerator, POS, Loyalty, internal shipment data, qualitative/quantitative research with a focus on driving growth. Automation of causal, tracking reports (exception reporting, analytical reporting). Integrated KPI scorecards (internal, external data) Be the "Go-to" Expert in Numerator and POS/Loyalty Data for Marketing/CSD/Insight Teams. Develop insights/analyses using all Numerator and loyalty data tools (Dunnhumby, Precima, IRI, etc.) to identify and address business issues and questions Track performance of key launches through delivering: tracking tools, compelling Insight decks, competitive cross-Category benchmarks and presenting regular updates to relevant teams Support Partnerships with all 3rd Party Syndicated Data Engagements. Leverage Partners to understand best-in-class use of Nielsen, Numerator, POS/Loyalty Data, Flyer Tracking Data, etc. Manage day-to-day relationships with Vendor Partners – bi-weekly meetings, regular updatesWhat Will Make You SuccessfulAs the successful candidate, you will be an integral partner to the Division. You will use your curiosity and analytical experience to proactively uncover business issues, leveraging data sets to help make better business decisions. You will also leverage your story-telling skills to communicate compelling insights and build great relationships with the Marketers and other Divisional members.You will also have: Education: Completion of a University Degree in business or marketing focus and/or equivalent combination of education and experience Minimum 5 years Analytics experience (multi-category CPG experience preferred) Experience in Nielsen, Numerator and POS/Loyalty Data Demonstrated ability to generate actionable insights out of big data Ability to disseminate and synthesize diverse and vast data while communicating simply to non-analytic audience Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to develop optimized tools/solutions in a complex environment and across multiple stakeholders.What You Need To KnowWhat can we offer in return? Great benefits you’d expect from a business the size of Nestlé including a comprehensive total rewards benefits package including Health and Dental benefits that start on day one as well as a Company matched retirement savings plan, Excellent training and development programs as well as opportunities to grow within the company.The closing date for applications is June 14th , 2022. We will be considering applicants as they apply, so please don’t delay in submitting your application.Nestlé is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. If you are selected to participate in the recruitment process, please inform Human Resources of any accommodations you may require. Nestlé will work with you in an effort to ensure that you are able to fully participate in the process.
