job_title: Research Data Scientist | Scientifique chargé des données de recherche
job_desc: The Infrastructure Quantitative Engineering group uses statistical and machine learning techniques to support the operations and enable the continued growth of Facebook’s infrastructure. We partner with teams supporting all of Facebook’s infrastructure, focusing on long-term strategic initiatives that make Facebook infrastructure more efficient, reliable, and scalable. We are “full-stack” data scientists, helping to establish product requirements, gather data, design experiments, create models, build software tools and communicate findings. We are looking for hands-on experienced data scientists who can collaborate effectively with partner engineering organizations, fellow data scientists and leadership.As a Research Data Scientist, you will need to develop subject matter expertise, build trust with partners, recognize the biggest opportunities, create and drive strategy, and leverage data science methodologies to solve hard problems. In your work, you may provide guidance and coordinate with other data scientists to help achieve the goals in broad areas of operation.-------Le groupe d'ingénierie quantitative de l'infrastructure utilise des techniques statistiques et d'apprentissage automatique pour soutenir les opérations et permettre la croissance continue de l'infrastructure de Facebook. Nous travaillons en partenariat avec les équipes qui soutiennent l'ensemble de l'infrastructure de Facebook, en nous concentrant sur les initiatives stratégiques à long terme qui rendent l'infrastructure de Facebook plus efficace, plus fiable et plus évolutive. Nous sommes des scientifiques de données « full-stack », qui aident à établir les exigences du produit, à recueillir des données, à concevoir des expériences, à créer des modèles, à construire des outils logiciels et à communiquer les résultats. Nous recherchons des scientifiques de données expérimentés et pratiques qui peuvent collaborer efficacement avec les organisations d'ingénierie partenaires, leurs collègues scientifiques de données et la direction.En tant que scientifique chargé des données de recherche, vous devrez développer une expertise en la matière, établir une relation de confiance avec les partenaires, reconnaître les plus grandes opportunités, créer et diriger une stratégie, et tirer parti des méthodologies de science des données pour résoudre des problèmes difficiles. Dans votre travail, vous pouvez fournir des conseils et coordonner avec d'autres scientifiques des données pour aider à atteindre les objectifs dans de vastes domaines d'activité.Research Data Scientist | Scientifique chargé des données de recherche Responsibilities:Identify how data science can be applied to improve, optimize, and expand Facebook’s infrastructure across a variety of domains, with emphasis on long-term and strategic initiatives. | Identifiez comment la science des données peut être appliquée pour améliorer, optimiser et étendre l'infrastructure de Facebook dans divers domaines, en mettant l'accent sur les initiatives stratégiques et à long terme.Work cross-functionally as a strategic partner to define priorities and develop project roadmaps in synergy with partner teams. Build consensus and earn commitment from partners. Drive execution through fast iteration. | Travailler de manière transversale en tant que partenaire stratégique pour définir les priorités et développer les feuilles de route des projets en synergie avec les équipes partenaires. Susciter un consensus et obtenir l'engagement des partenaires. Favoriser l'exécution par une itération rapide.Ensure coordination of theirs and others’ projects across related workflows, to maximize impact and avoid duplication and overlaps. | Assurer la coordination de ses propres projets et de ceux des autres dans les flux de travail connexes, afin de maximiser l'impact et d'éviter les doublons et les chevauchements.Employ languages and tools like Python, R, SQL, and others to drive efficient data exploration and modeling. | Employer des langages et des outils tels que Python, R, SQL et d'autres pour favoriser une exploration et une modélisation efficaces des données.Build pragmatic, scalable, and statistically rigorous solutions to large-scale web, mobile and data infrastructure problems by leveraging or developing statistical and machine learning methodologies. | Élaborer des solutions pragmatiques, évolutives et statistiquement rigoureuses pour résoudre des problèmes d'infrastructure Web, mobile et de données à grande échelle en exploitant ou en développant des méthodologies statistiques et d'apprentissage automatique.Generalize methodologies for broader application within and outside their domain. | Généraliser les méthodologies pour une application plus large au sein et en dehors de leur domaine.Lead and provide technical mentorship to data scientists, to ensure continuous up-leveling of our expertise. | Diriger et fournir un encadrement technique aux scientifiques des données, afin d'assurer une mise à niveau continue de notre expertise.Minimum Qualifications:Degree in quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or other related field)6+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis including experience with SQL, other programming languages (e.g, Python) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g, R, SAS, MATLAB)6+ years of experience with statistics methods such as forecasting, time series, hypothesis testing, classification, clustering or regression analysis4+ years experience developing production software systems such as data pipelines, deployed machine learning models, or dashboardsExperience answering big picture questions by framing the question, turning it into an analytical plan, executing and communicating to stakeholdersExperience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidancePreferred Qualifications:Advanced degree (Master’s or PhD or equivalent experience) in quantitative field | Diplôme supérieur (maîtrise ou doctorat ou expérience équivalente) dans un domaine quantitatif.4+ years of experience doing complex quantitative analysis and working with distributed (i.e. Hive, Hadoop or similar databases) or highly complex datasets | Plus de quatre ans d'expérience dans la réalisation d'analyses quantitatives complexes et dans l'utilisation d'ensembles de données distribuées (par exemple, Hive, Hadoop ou des bases de données similaires) ou très complexes.4+ years experience communicating complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner | Plus de quatre ans d'expérience dans la communication de recherches complexes de manière claire, précise et exploitable.2+ years experience leading teams of other data scientists | Plus de deux ans d'expérience dans la direction d'équipes d'autres scientifiques des données.

Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale.Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity.How do we make work life better? By delivering an award-winning product, conceptualized and developed by award-winning leaders, that result in award-winning customer employee experiences  By hiring highly innovative, diverse talent that fully embraces and embodies our core values in everything they do: Customer Focus, Equity, Shared Ambition, Agility, Transparency, Optimism  By using modern technology, such as voice-activation with Dayforce Assistant and access to your money as soon as you earn it with Dayforce Wallet to stay in rhythm with the evolving demands of our 4 million global users  We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you! Location  : Work is what you do, not where you go.For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in the United States or Canada.About The OpportunityThe Senior Data Analyst is responsible for building and deploying advanced data capabilities to assigned business function(s) across Ceridian.What You’ll Get To Do Partners with a business function(s) to enable reporting and analytics for that domain  Works collaboratively with the business to intake, plan and prioritize enterprise data and integration requests  Understands the data needs and functional requirements for the business  Is a subject matter expert for the data sources available  Collaborates with the Data Engineers and Integration Engineers to deliver the required data capability  Coordinates with Data Governance and Enablement team to ensure data quality, compliance and efficacy.  Coaches and advises the business on data analytics and methodologies to drive insights into their business decisions  What's in it for you Encouragement to be the best version of yourself at and away from work:  YOUnity diversity and inclusion programs  Amazing time away from work programs  Support for your total well-being through our Live Well, Work Well programs targeting all aspects of your life  Recognition for your contributions through excellent pay, perks, and rewards  Giving where you’re living: volunteer days, Ceridian sponsored events, and our very own charity, Ceridian Cares  Opportunities to fuel your career growth through numerous internal and external programs and events Skills And Experience We Value Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, engineering or business or equivalent degree and experience  5+ years of related experience in a similar role  Solid experience in at least one reporting tool, preferably Power BI  Experience with data platforms including Power BI, Azure and SQL Server  Solid software development skills (SQL, DAX, R, PYTHON)  Understanding of data modeling and database structure   What would make you really stand out  Business, analytical and critical thinking skills.  Ability to work with a collaborative team in a fast-paced, multi-faceted environment  Experience with enterprise business software (Salesforce and Netsuite preferred)  An understanding of machine learning concepts is beneficial Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions.We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.Apply Now

At Parallel Domain, we believe that autonomous systems – from self-driving cars to contactless delivery drones – have the opportunity to drastically improve the quality of life for billions of people. That is why we love what we do: enabling our customers to develop their technology safely using the Parallel Domain data generation platform. Our platform revolutionizes the way our customers generate sensor data for AI development. We're looking for people like you to join us in pushing the boundaries of artificial intelligence and synthetic data.We ship data, APIs , visualizers and more to help machine learning, perception and simulation teams accelerate the deployment of their autonomy stack. Ideally, we are looking for someone with a technical background (machine learning / computer vision / graphics) with experience delivering complex software engineering projects. This role will work closely with engineering, computer graphics content, and sales to and build and manage internal processes to ensure that we are shipping on time and within scope.We’re looking for a Data Quality Analyst to ensure the integrity and quality of our data and content. You will be responsible for creating and scaling testing processes, reviewing raw and annotated computer vision / LiDAR data sets, identifying errors and reporting bugs. You will also work closely with our engineering and content teams to follow through and ensure that all identified bugs are resolved.This position is based out of our Vancouver office, with remote work options available.We don't define ourselves by the boxes we check, we define ourselves by how we can develop and face challenges that elevate our true potential. As an applicant, we do not expect you to check all of the boxes below. We expect you to apply to an opportunity that aligns with your skills, professional goals and core values.About YouYou have a background in QA testing, in game development or in large-scale dataset testingYou have a strong understanding of what it takes to write detailed, informative tickets and have a deep familiarity with JIRA workflowsYou always look to find ways to improve workflows, either by automation, streamlining a process, or smarter ways of workingBeyond data testing, you also have an interest in growing your skillset to improve development processes that benefit teams and projects at-largeWhat You Bring2+ years experience working on a QA / testing team in the video game / tech industryStrong written and oral communication skills Demonstrated ability to pay close attention to detailExperience working with bug tracking software (e.g. Jira)Experience building testing playbooks / guideline documentsCollaborative attitude, humble, and eager to make a large impactBonus PointsExperience testing and validating labeled camera and LiDAR datasets for machine learning and computer vision tasksExperience working with commercial game engines (e.g. Unreal Engine)Experience working with AWSComfortable navigating through large datasets by reading through a schemaWhy join Parallel Domain?We are assembling a team of talented visionaries crafting a new technology that will change the world. You will be able to learn, build, and scale in a collaborative, creative culture that values every team member.We offer: Flexibility to work from our office in Yaletown, Vancouver or your home office Competitive compensation Employer-paid supplemental medical, dental, and vision benefits Paid vacation and sick time, winter shutdown, and 11 stat holidays each year Paid parental leave New hire equipment + accessories budget to optimize your setup $2,000 CAD annual learning and development allowance

Be part of the transformation!NAVBLUE is in the midst of transforming into a data first company and the Data and Analytics team is at the forefront of this transformation! Our team tackles a variety of exciting projects, from building machine learning pipelines, to automating log analyses, identifying objects in images, visualizing data, and good old data analytics. Our data is just as exciting as our projects. The aviation domain is vast and produces an enormous amount of data from text messages, to flight schedules, satellite images, charts and maps, and flight routes, to name just a few! When you join our team, you can expect to be part of projects in any area of data science from computer vision, to natural language processing, and other areas of machine learning. There is always a new adventure right around the corner!What You Will DoResearch, design and develop data science models. Areas may include, but not limited to, computer vision, NLP, anomaly detection, and predictive analytics.Develop ML pipelines for data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model training and deployment.Tell the story: analyze data to generate unique insights about the domain and the users.Document and share your findings on a regular basis.Other ResponsibilitiesParticipate on Development Team Support On-Call rotation.Provide technical direction for services and products within your area of expertise.Ensure testability and implement suites for unit and other kinds of required tests for your new code.Able to propose design and coding standards and support the implementation of features according to such designs and specifications.Review internal and external sourced data for quality and applicability.Participate in the creation and estimating of stories and features.Maintain/create documentation for applications, tools, or systems as required.Propose and review test cases, test strategies and test automation for a feature or product.Communicate ideas and plans verbally and written in support of a squad.Use problem solving skills to make progress on implementations and issues with very little or no supervision of senior team members.Able to coach / mentor junior members of the team. Solving well defined issues for support and customers as needed.Support agile development concepts and participate in our SAFe process.Driven to self-learn technical and non-technical skills.Support squad and self-based continual improvement.Actively participate in all squad activities with a positive encouraging attitude.What You Need To SucceedAbility to apply various analytical models to business use cases (Computer Vision and/or NLP and/or neural networks, etc.)Proficiency with Machine Learning concepts and modeling techniques to solve problems such as clustering, classification, regression, anomaly detection, and predictive modeling on large scale data sets.Strong experience in Python Strong knowledge of Python ML tools.Excellent communication skills in English.Outstanding analytical skills and an entrepreneurial mindset.Bonus SkillsExperience with SQL and NoSQL databasesExperience with AWS cloud services.Knowledge of DevOps / MLOps.Experience with PySpark.Knowledge of various areas of Aviation data a big plus.In your application, please include a list of projects you have worked on along with a brief description of each project, as well as the languages and ML libraries used. A link to your Github profile is also encouraged. Build your case with facts to show why you will succeed in this role.Perks:Located in the heart of University of Waterloo’s David Johnston Research + Technology Park, NAVBLUE is close to shops, restaurants, gyms, daycare, and many other amenities, and only 10 minutes away from Hwy 85. The modern design of our suite on the second floor of the Accelerator Centre draws its inspiration from airport terminals, and features bright, open work stations, rather than boxed-in cubicles. As part of our family, you will enjoy:Flexible hoursHybrid working environment (2 days in office)Free parking Strong work-life balance Casual dress code Competitive flexible group benefits plan Strong focus on mental health support benefits RRSP matching program Employee stock ownership planReferral programRewards and Recognition program Training and Development Support Monthly Lunch and Learns Fitness & Wellness reimbursementAn active social committee Lunch hour sporting activities (hockey, soccer, volleyball etc.) with a shower on siteAnd much more!Not to mention, the aviation industry’s ongoing digital transformation means we must continually innovate and rise to the many challenges faced by our geographically diverse customers. We are always looking for creative ways to improve our processes and technologies to be a leader in the highly competitive aviation market.How to Apply:Candidates who are interested in joining the NAVBLUE team are invited to submit their resume and cover letter, highlighting their work experiences and skills via email to talent@navblue.aero.We thank all applicants for applying. Only selected applicants will be contacted.NAVBLUE, an Airbus company, welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations will be available on request for candidates throughout the entire recruitment and selection processAbout Us:NAVBLUE is proud to have been recognized as one of Waterloo Area’s Top Employers for 2021. Based on eight criteria: physical workplace, work atmosphere and social, health financial and family benefits, vacation and time off, employee communication, performance manager, training and skills development and lastly community involvement, it was determined that we offer some of the most progressive and forward-thinking programs within the area.NAVBLUE was also recognized as one of Canada’s Best Employers for Recent Graduates in 2021. We are excited and grateful for both these recognitions. We realize that it is our employees that have allowed us to succeed and will allow us to continuing succeeding.NAVBLUE, an Airbus Company, is a leading global provider of flight operations solutions, including aeronautical charts, navigation data solutions, flight planning, aircraft performance software (take-off/landing, weight and balance), and crew planning solutions. These products directly support millions of flights each year and help NAVBLUE customers maximize efficiency, reduce costs, ensure compliance with complex national and international safety regulations, and effectively deliver their services.Through digital and collaborative innovation, our passionate and customer-focused team develops solutions to enhance the safety and efficiency of air transport. Over the last few years, Airbus has been supportive of various initiatives such as Going Digital, Performance Based Navigation Services, Air Traffic Management Modernization Programs, FlySmart on iOS and other digital projects related to new aircraft technologies; the launch of NAVBLUE was therefore a natural step to further develop its Flight Operations and Air Traffic Management Portfolio.NAVBLUE is a fully owned subsidiary of Services by Airbus, fueled by the agility of Airbus ProSky and Navtech (acquired in 2016), and the pioneering spirit of Airbus, NAVBLUE was created in July 2016 with one mission: lead aviation into the digital age.NAVBLUE is based in Hersham (UK), Cardiff (UK), Toulouse (France), Waterloo, ON (Canada), Bangkok (Thailand) and Malmö (Sweden), with other offices all around the world.

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Pet Acquisition Analytics
job_desc: DescriptionTrupanion is a leading provider of medical insurance for cats and dogs in North America. Our mission is to help the pets we all love receive the veterinary care they need. At Trupanion, we offer a collaborative, casual, and pet-friendly environment where everyone is encouraged to be themselves.Position SummaryThe Pet Acquisition Analytics team at Trupanion is looking for a curious and pet loving Senior Data Analyst to join our team. We need a driven senior analyst who can creatively come up with data-focused solutions to problems through inquiry, data collection, analysis and collaboration with business stakeholders. Successful candidates will have unbridled curiosity, enjoy solving complex problems and share our love of data and pets!This position is an entirely remote role open to candidates anywhere in Canada. Candidates who prefer an in-office option may choose to work a hybrid schedule out of our North Vancouver office.Key Responsibilities IncludeFoster effective working relationships with fellow analysts and business partners to create an environment of knowledge sharing Ability to see to the core of a problem, understanding the “why” behind a question Observant and inquisitive, discovering opportunities to use data to better understand our customers Extract and reconcile data from our robust data warehouse or identify and strategize new data to be collected Apply advanced statistical 161 Bay Street (93021), Canada, Toronto,Toronto, Ontario,Senior Associate, Data AnalystSenior Data AnalystsOur Capital One Data Team.Data is at the centre of everything we do. It started in 1988, when we launched as a startup with the goal of using data to deliver personalized credit card products. Fast-forward a few years — we’re a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.As a Data Analyst on our team, you’ll be curious enough to ask questions and brave enough to blurt out a cool idea. You approach problems with creativity, and you love exploring new ways of doing things. But most importantly, you enjoy collaborating, and you’re always willing to share your knowledge with your peers — because you know that’s how the best ideas are made.A day in the life of a Capital One Data Analyst.You’ll work alongside a team that’s leading the next wave of change, using the latest in distributed computing technologies to uncover new ways to help everyday people feel confident about credit.Curious: You ask why, you explore, and you’re not afraid to blurt out your disruptive idea. You know SQL and are constantly exploring new open source tools, and hitting up stack overflow on a regular basis.A Wrangler: You know how to programmatically extract data from a database or an API, bring it through a transformation or two, and convert into a human-readable form (Matplotlib, QuickSight, Tableau, etc.).Creative: Big, undefined problems and petabytes of data don’t frighten you. You’re used to working with abstract data, and you love discovering new narratives in unmined territories.Proactive: You will want to share your knowledge with your peers and contribute back to inner/open source projects which you might consume.Be ready to join a community of the smartest people you’ve ever met, who see the customer first, and want to use their data skills to make a difference.We’re all-in on the cloud and leaders in the adoption of open source, RESTful APIs, microservices, and containers. We build our own products and release them with a speed and agility that allows us to get new customer experiences to market quickly. And, as a founder-led company, we’re inspired to make, break, do, and do good. So, let’s do something great together.Want to learn more? Check out life at Capital One as a Data Analyst!ResponsibilitiesWrite SQL to clean, transform, investigate, and augment large, complex database tablesWork closely with business partners to make sure our business strategy is as data driven as possibleDesign rich data visualizations to communicate complex ideas to customers or company leadersEnsure data and intent integrity by automated data quality verification pipelinesSupport and consult with the business to propagate data management best practicesInvestigate the impact of new technologies on the future of digital banking and the financial world of tomorrowBasic QualificationsAt least 1 year of experience with relational databases and programming in SQLAt least 1 year of experience with version control systems like GitHub.Preferred QualificationsExperience working with AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, etc.)Experience working with advanced Git Workflows (Pull Requests, Code Reviews, Issues, and Branching)At least 1 year of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis (Python or Scala)At least 3 years’ experience with SQLAbout Capital One CanadaWe've been helping millions of Canadians for over 20 years by providing them with access to credit when others wouldn’t. We're on a journey to put our customers first, and keep them there, by building modern technology solutions to simplify and humanize the world of credit cards. We have the positive energy of a startup, with the advantages of a big company.Working with usHow do we do things at Capital One? We listen — to our people, and to our customers. We change with the times, currently working remotely with plans to move to a flexible hybrid model (remote and/or in-office) in the future. A flexible hybrid working model is one that creates the opportunity to match the work that we do to the environment that best supports that work. We recognize that everyone has a unique working pattern so we’re open to discussing flexible working arrangements that will best accommodate you.At Capital One Canada the health and safety of our associates, customers and communities are our highest priorities and as a result, our offices are currently closed. When and how we transition from virtual to flexible hybrid will be guided by local government and health authority guidance.We want our associates to have a voice, and we’re committed to diversity, inclusion and belonging. We give everyone a seat at the table, bringing together different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences to help challenge the status quo and create the best outcomes for everyone.We’re focused on helping associates live well—physically, financially and emotionally. When you join us, we support you and those who are most important to you, offering full coverage for spouses, domestic partners, and dependents. We’ve designed our benefits program to be flexible, comprehensive and consistent across our organization. From health and fitness centers and discounts, to training and professional development programs—and much more—you’ll discover that Capital One is committed to helping you live your best life.Capital One Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. Posted by                  Iyad Hamed             Staff Recruiting Partner | Realtor.com 'Your Home for Home Search!'                                     Send InMail                    Data AnalystAbout The JobWe have the most comprehensive and accurate coverage of real estate listings and the most engaged users across all the online real estate portals. Our mission is to make buying, selling, renting, and living in homes easier and more rewarding for everyone.The Data Analytics team at Realtor.com sits at the heart of this mission. We process and analyze terabytes of data everyday that enable decisions for millions of home buyers, sellers, renters, dreamers, and real estate professionals. Our goal is to use this data to make the home buying experience a breeze for our consumers. We empower them with the most up-to-date information on properties, help them find their dream homes in the least amount of time, and match them with the most suitable realtor to meet their unique, individual needs.The Role: We’re looking for the best data and analytical minds to help lead a variety of our biggest efforts. Real estate is the largest asset class in the world and we have the best data and visibility into that market. As a member of the Data Analytics team, not only will you be building sophisticated tools, insights, and models, but also you will serve as a trusted advisor to surface data driven insights to our Finance and Revenue teams. Therefore, we want the hands-on executors/do-ers/owners who also possess the strategic, business oriented mindset.What will you do?ResponsibilitiesSupport the Finance and Revenue organizations at Realtor.com in their analytic and reporting needsDrive insights through rigorous analysis and translate them into strategic recommendations for stakeholders in the Finance and Revenue organizations.Understand stakeholder information needs and develop reports and dashboards that enable them to “run the business” and make data driven decisions.Collaborate with stakeholders and peers on experimentation ideas, finalize hypotheses, design experiments, synthesize results and make recommendations based on experiment outcomes.Collaborate with teammates to continually enhance and optimize team processes and operating norms.What will you bring?RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in a business-related or quantitative field 2+ years of experience as a Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Business Analyst or similar role Experience as an “analytic consultant” highly preferred.SQL fluency with experience using a scripting language like Python or R.Experience building dashboards and using data visualization tools. Tableau experience is preferred.Strategic mindset that enables one to learn how the Finance and Revenue organizations operate, understand their pain points and opportunities, and deliver data driven recommendations that drive business value. Strong communication skills to effectively communicate complex information and strategies to non-technical audiences.About Realtor.comAt realtor.com®, we believe that everyone deserves a home of their own. We’re a community of nearly 2,000 employees who work hard to ensure that from the moment someone starts dreaming about a new home, to the moment they walk in the door and beyond, we’re there to lend a helping hand. Every month, over 85 million people trust us with their journey home by visiting our site and mobile apps, and we’d love to have you join our team to help.We’ve got great offices in the U.S. and Canada with lots of sweet jobs to choose from, so we’re hoping you’ll join us on our journey to make buying, selling, renting, and living in homes easier and more rewarding for everyone.Let’s make a difference, together. For Real.

Job Description Metrolinx  is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you!Our Bridges & Structures, Engineering and Asset Management Team is seeking an Infrastructure Data & System Analyst. Reporting to the Senior Project Officer, Bridges & Structures, the Data Analyst will be responsible for performing and coordinating planning and analytical functions, assisting in the development of recommendations, and implementing direction to improve the asset management maturity of the Bridges & Structures department. The role will manage the EAM system and associated database for Bridges and Structures assets, provide recommendations and interpretation of key performance indicators (KPI) and coordinate interdepartmental data reports. What will I be doing?  Develops data management strategies and data collection systems including the design and development of relational databases for information management and retrieval that optimize statistical efficiency, data quality and supports evidence-based decision making.  Carries out and/or strategizes the analysis of Bridges & Structures asset performance to improve availability and, resiliency and assist in the overall planning, execution, and quality assurance of the department’s Asset Management Plan and asset management maturity growth.  Imports, cleans, transforms, validates, and models data to improve data quality and ensure data is accurate and relevant and fosters understanding of operational, business and system issues/trends.  Manages the corporate Infor EAM database systems with the department and provides updates and analysis based on information obtained from field level inspections and reports.  Collaborates with dedicated Bridge Inspectors to strengthen our Enterprise Asset Management registry by providing technical and analytic support in navigating proprietary documentation platforms.  Presents data in dashboards, charts, graphs and/or tables by building, designing, and maintaining online applications such as data input/data collection screens to capture and present meaningful information/data for reporting, analysis and presentation purposes, using tools such as Power BI and PowerPoint.  Liaise with various internal/external business units to consolidate necessary asset document changes, revise data registry mapping within our Asset Management system, and submit notice of change to affected stakeholders for appropriate implementation  Coordinates the development, implementation, and on-going monitoring of KPI performance measures for departmental operations including (NPM) Negative Performance Metric, Lost Workblock time & (OTP) On-Time Performance targets  Providing asset management handover support for Metrolinx State of Good Repair (SOGR), Rapid Transit and GO Expansion B&S projects, including all new LRT and subway lines.

Economical fait partie de Definity, ce qui regroupe certaines des marques d’assurance les plus établies et innovatrices au Canada, soit Assurance Economical, Compagnie d’assurance Sonnet, Family Insurance Solutions et Compagnie d’assurance Petline. Depuis nos débuts en 1871, nous sommes devenus un chef de file numérique au sein de l’industrie de l’assurance de dommages. Nous sommes fiers d’aider nos clients et communautés à s’adapter et à s’épanouir dans un monde en constante évolution.Notre promesse : Ici, nous faisons évoluer l’assurance. Pourquoi? Parce que NOUS TENONS À VOUS et nous vous offrons une expérience collaborative, ambitieuse, valorisante et stimulante.Notre ambition est d’être un des assureurs de dommages les plus importants et innovateurs au Canada. Joignez-vous à notre parcours et ayez plaisir à travailler.PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉSÉlaborer des modèles d’apprentissage machine et appuyer la gestion de ces modèles tout au long de leur cycle de vie.Élaborer, surveiller et améliorer les solutions analytiques en collaboration avec les parties prenantes des catégories d’affaires et les professionnels des technologies de l’information.Planifier et gérer efficacement les projets d’analytique et orienter le travail technique des membres de l’équipe.Acquérir une bonne compréhension de l’assurance par l’apprentissage indépendant et la collaboration étroite avec les parties prenantes des catégories d’affaires.Mettre continuellement l’accent sur l’innovation et l’amélioration des processus pour promouvoir des pratiques de pointe et l’efficacité dans l’ensemble de l’entreprise.EXIGENCESDiplôme universitaire en science informatique, génie logiciel, mathématiques ou une discipline connexe.Expérience en matière d’élaboration et de mise en œuvre de solutions d’analytique.Excellentes aptitudes en matière de communication et d’organisation.Capacité d’élaboration de solutions créatives à des problèmes complexes.COMPÉTENCES TECHNIQUESMinimum de trois ans d’expérience en langages de programmation statistique comme Python, ainsi qu’en langages d’interrogation de bases de données comme SQL, Hive ou Pig. La connaissance de Scala, Java ou C++ est un atout.Grande expérience des techniques d’apprentissage machine comme GLM, GAM, XGBoost, Neural Networks, k-NN. SVM, etc.Connaissance des technologies de données massives comme Hadoop et Spark.Une expérience des plateformes infonuagiques comme le GCP ou AWS est fortement souhaitée.Il est hautement souhaitable de connaître les systèmes d'intégration et de distribution continues (CI/CD) pour le déploiement de modèles de données et d’apprentissage machine.La connaissance de Git pour le contrôle de versions et la collaboration est un atout.Nous tenons également compte du potentiel. Donc, si vous n’avez pas exactement ces compétences, mais que vous avez les atouts qu’il faut, indiquez-les dans votre curriculum vitæ et votre lettre de présentation.Allez-y, attendez-vous à plus — vous le méritez et nous l’offrons : Un horaire de travail hybride pour la majorité des rôlesUn régime d’actionnariat de la compagnieUn programme de retraite et d’épargne, avec des cotisations au REER égalées par l’entrepriseDes journées de bénévolat payées et des dons à des organismes de bienfaisance égalés par l’entrepriseDes ressources éducatives, le remboursement des frais de scolarité et du temps d’étude payéUn accent sur l’inclusion par l’entremise de groupes d’employés, de soutien pour les interventions pour l’affirmation du genre, de conseillers des communautés autochtones, noires et de couleur, et d’un accès à des programmes pour les parents.Des programmes de reconnaissance et de bien-êtreDes rabais sur des produits et services.Notre environnement de travail inclusif accueille la diversité et soutient l’accessibilité. Si vous avez besoin de dispositions particulières en matière d’accessibilité au cours du processus de recrutement, veuillez envoyer un courriel à l’adresse mailto: [email protected].Vérification des antécédentsLa vérification des antécédents (dont la vérification du casier judiciaire et des références des gestionnaires) du candidat est nécessaire pour ce rôle.

Remote: CanadaWhy We Need You – The MissionATP is a global information services and software company that exists to make flying safer and more reliable. We are back by two private equity firms—Accel-KKR and Parker Gale—both with a strong history of growth. Our products help reduce operating costs, improve aircraft reliability, and supports technical knowledge sharing and collaboration within the general and business aviation, military/defense, commercial aviation, and OEM industries. We have deployed solutions for multiple Fortune 100 companies, supporting more than 75,000 aircraft maintenance professionals worldwide. As a global company, ATP has more than 7,500 customers in 137 countries, with nearly 50 years of experience in the information services and software industries.The ChronicX product provides an innovative approach for detecting and managing recurring defects. ChronicX identifies, consolidates, and ranks recurring and potential chronic defects across aircraft fleets, regardless of the aircraft. It is currently in use on 25% of the world’s commercial airline fleet.The ideal candidate will be responsible for working with customers' IT departments to implement data feeds from their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds for use with our product – which performs knowledge extraction from these data feeds using a variety of Natural Language Processing algorithms backed by general, industry-specific, and customer-specific dictionaries and word lists. The successful candidate will manage and adjust these dictionaries to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives.What You’ll Accomplish - Your Performance ObjectivesPerformance Objective #1:Within your first 30 days, work with ChronicX team to build a solid understanding of the data sets required for onboarding and maintaining customers. Perform ongoing application data monitoring and analysis for proactive customer support Identify and resolve incidents through ticketing system and provide business support Perform data analysis on large and technical datasetsPerformance Objective #2Within your first 6 months, successfully onboard new customers while maintaining current customers through monitoring and support. Work with the customer’s IT department to implement data integration with their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds for use with ChronicX Learn (or apply existing knowledge of) SQL and Python programming to write and maintain data processing and cleansing scripts used during customer data import into CX Work on deployment procedures of our products to the customers Work with and attend status meetings with ChronicX customers to support users and identify possible improvements to their instancesPerformance Objective #3Within your first 12 months, innovate and improve current business processes and configurations. Provide suggestions for product improvement to the ChronicX development team, supporting continuous improvement and optimization of the onboarding toolset used by analysts and the ChronicX algorithms. Manage and adjust configurations for ChronicX to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives Data analysis and development to support the setup, deployment, evaluation, and customization, and go-live of SaaS web application Consult and influence design of business processes. Identify process improvements. i.e. customer training, customer experience and customer support.Who We’re Looking For - The Personal Competencies That MatterTechnical Skills You have experience working in Python You have experience with s/FTP, AWS and SaaS web applications You have experience with SQL relational databases and capable of writing SQL statements and procedures You have good understanding of data gathering, processing and validation You have experience with Jira and Confluence You have knowledge of Java and an understanding for debugging You have experience in Natural Language processing (Regular Expressions) and text data processingInterpersonal SkillsSuccess in this role requires excellent analytical abilities with a keen eye for details to easily identify errors. You should have a technical competency to identify, investigate and resolve complex, technical issues. You must thrive in working in a fast paced environment and have a proven history of delivering top tier customer service. A successful candidate is a team player who has a strong sense of ownership and accountability for their work.Project Management & Organizational PlanningThe best candidate will have excellent project and time management skills. You do exceptionally well at multitasking and juggling several tasks at once. You will be responsible for maintaining and prioritizing your own queue, so you must excel at planning, executing and closing all projects on or before deadlines.How we work – The Core Values that Define Our Culture One ATP : By thinking beyond myself, my department, my product Find a Better Way : For today and tomorrow (when we are twice the current size!) Assume Positive Intent : Through interactions, healthy conflict, opportunities and different points of view Driven to Exceed : We take pride in our work and exceeding expectations.

job_title: Data Scientist (Operations Research and Optimization) - Scientifique des données – Recherche opérationnelle et optimisation
job_desc: Data Scientist (Operations Research and Optimization) Band CLocation: Open but preferably YUL or YYZ May 2022As a Data Scientist - Operations Research and Optimization at Air Canada, you will drive the analytical scope and methodology for projects using Optimization, Data Science, Simulation, Mathematics, Statistics, and Business Acumen to derive structure and knowledge from raw data and business rules. We are looking for an Operations Research Scientist to help us formulate business problem, objective, and constraints into solvable model and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products and services. Your primary focus will be in applying Operation Research techniques integrated with our products and services.In this role, you will join the AI-CoE (Center of Excellence), a central group within Air Canada’s IT organization that builds Machine Learning and Optimization solutions to internal business units including Revenue Management, Network Planning, Operations, Maintenance, and Cargo organizations. The team primarily comprises of Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Operations Research Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and Delivery Leads. As you join a project to deliver a deployable production-grade application to one of our business stakeholders, you will collaborate with Business Sponsors, Product Owners, Business Analysts and SEM(s), DevOps, Solution Architects, UX Designers, Full-stack Developers, and QA engineers. All projects are executed in agile mode, following 2-3 weeks sprints, with incremental releases leading to the final production release. Key FunctionsUse optimization techniques to formulate, solve business problems, and build in-house decision-support systems.Apply decomposition methods as needed to solve very large-scale models.Develop and implement scalable quantitative mathematical models and collaborate with engineers to deploy these models.Perform quantitative, economic, and numerical analysis of the performance of these systems to find both exact and heuristic solution strategies for optimization problems.Apply mathematical optimization techniques, including Linear Programming, Integer Programming, Dynamic Programming, Network Optimization algorithms to design optimal or near optimal solution methodologies to be used by in-house decision support tools and software.Apply Machine Learning and regression techniques to tackle predictive modeling problems.Create software prototypes to verify and validate the devised solutions methodologies.Investigate the conflict behind infeasible datasets and add appropriate handling to resolve such infeasibilities. Establish processes for large-scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation.Develops complex models and algorithms that drive innovation throughout the organization.Can objectively weigh trade-offs of different algorithms and models.Guide data engineering efforts to ensure alignment with future optimization engine needs.Performing quality assessments of analytical solutions, particularly simulation and optimization models.Lead requirement and systems analysis efforts, including translating business requirements into quantitative mathematical models.Establish and maintain effective business relationships.QualificationsA Master’s Degree or PhD in Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or Quantitative Methods and/or relevant experience commensurate to the role.3 - 5 years of related work experience.Proficiency in using one of the commercial solvers like Cplex, Gurobi, or Fico Xpress, or non-commercial solvers like Coin-OR or SCIP.Strong background in optimization techniques to solve Mixed Integer Programming (MIP), Quadratic Programming (QP), or Non-Linear Programming (NLP). Fluency in at least one programming or scripting language (e.g. Python, Java, C, C++, C#).Experience in SQL and querying large datasets.Experience in applying Operations Research, advanced analytical and/or statistical methods to solve business problems.Experience with fast prototyping.Familiarity with Network Optimization, Large Scale Neighborhood Search.Familiarity with Machine Learning models and algorithms. Excellent presentation and verbal/written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields.Self-motivated and highly independent.Strong problem solving and data analysis skills.Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination RequiredPlease refer to the Air Canada Careers page for full job details.

Invesco is one of the world’s leading global investment managers, entrusted with managing $1.5 trillion* in assets on behalf of clients worldwide. We are the 6th largest US retail asset manager and the 13th largest investment manager globally, and our more than 8,000 employees worldwide are dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. We are purely focused on managing a comprehensive range of active, passive and alternative investment capabilities, which we draw on to provide customized solutions aligned to client needs, our most important benchmark. (*As of October 31, 2021)The Department:Global Portfolio Services (GPS) provides global end to end trade processing, portfolio administration/operation and data management support to Invesco. The group mission is to provide quality service with highly disciplined operations; deliver responsive portfolio support for investment process, new products, and instruments; be responsive to changing economic, regulatory and risk environment; manage and deliver quality data.The Support Services function within the Global Portfolio Services provides proactive, 6x24 follow-the-sun first line support to business partners. The group ensures GPS data integrity and coordinates GPS response to new business as well as support requests. We provide proactive end-to-end support to our business partners throughout the day by ensuring all business as usual (BAU) requests are handled in a timely manner and in accordance with agreed SLA. We work with GPS functional teams to ensure items are resolved. Our data integrity measures include ensuring accuracy of data delivered by GPS and promptly communicating exceptions that impact our business partners. We liaise with business partners to capture new business requirements, coordinate GPS prioritization and responses; and work with GPS functional and strategic initiative groups on delivery of the business requirements.GPS Support Services operates under four functional areas: First Line Support Product Support Data Integrity Project & Process IntegrityYour Role:The Data Management Analyst II is generally responsible for providing first line client support, product support as well as data, project & process integrity support. The incumbent primarily focuses on one of the four functional areas within GPS Support Services and is expected to spend no less than 70% of his/her time in the assigned focus area and up to 30% in the other three areas.In general, an Analyst II is expected to be self-motivated, work independently with minimal supervision, escalates issues when appropriate to provide Security Master and Portfolio Support to Invesco's internal business partners globally. The incumbent liaises and works jointly with team members in global locations to provide 6x24 support coverage; including participation in research and analysis of non-standard GPS related data concerns (e.g. security master, new instruments implementation, reconciliation, portfolio position / cash) and acting as first point of contact on data reconciliation issue resolution escalation; oversees data reconciliation resolution to completion. The Analyst II exercises business focused judgment while researching and resolving time critical and risk sensitive issues. The Analyst II will appropriately involve others for guidance as needed. Furthermore, the Analyst II acts as data steward to ensure data standards, quality and integrity are maintained. The Analyst II recommends and participates in automation as well as continuous improvement of daily operational processes. The incumbent also shares knowledge within the global team.You will be responsible for:Acts as the first point of contact for queries and requests from business partners. Proactively follows up; coordinates within GPS groups and ensures resolutionsTakes initiative to raise issues where appropriate, suggest possible solutions and knows when to escalateProactively participates in all stages of continuous improvement initiatives as well as new business requirements / projects.Stays current on industry trends and learns complex product. Share knowledge with and potentially train global colleagues.Maintains and updates documentation for global and regional operational procedures.Supports global operation by executing tasks outlined in the Service Catalogue accurately and in a timely manner that meets established SLAProvides data support for security masters, brokers, and associated reference data. Validates and ensures data override requests conform to Invesco’s Data Standards.Takes ownership, with some guidance (if needed), on complex escalated position, cash, coupon payment and security master related reconciliation breaks requiring non-standard research and problem solving abilities.Responsible for cash management support and resolves all escalated position exceptions prior to market open and informs the investment teams.Maintains an overall understanding of the assigned investment strategy.Participates in new instruments analysis and supports the associated data and process flow end-to-end testingParticipates in Product Shelf changes.Continues to learn and enhance knowledge in complex instruments. Documents complex instrument support procedures, shares knowledge and trains the global team.Participates in new data requests and data standards change requests.Liaises with other GPS functions to ensure integrity of portfolio related data via reconciliation resolution oversight, coordination, and escalation globallyActs as the escalation point for critical reconciliation breaks and is responsible for daily cash and claims management oversightContributes to the reports on the health of GPS reconciliation. Escalates and keeps GPS Support Services Leadership Team informed of any critical reconciliation breaks and data issues globally.Informs stakeholders on critical data integrity issues that impact them in a timely manner.Supports reconciliation and audit process for specific accounts as per SLAs defined.Project & Process Integrity:Contributes ideas to process integrity and effectiveness enhancement opportunities; participates in delivering the enhancementsParticipates in the prioritization, organization, and monitoring of business requests for Support Services globallyEngages in process improvements and project coordination globally within Support ServicesContributes to the definition, delivery and the communication of efficiency and data quality measurementsThe experience you bring:Certify Financial Analyst (CFA) or Professional accounting designation (CMA, CGA, CA, CPA) an assetRequire a University degree in Accounting, Finance, Math or business area of concentration (or an equivalent combination of education, training, experience that would provide the knowledge, skills and ability required)MBA an assetMinimum 3 years' financial services industry experience in a data analysis capacityStrong knowledge of investment products and global security markets is requiredKnowledge of market data services such as Bloomberg and Reuters is requiredMust have previous knowledge & work exp with data management apps, order management systems, portfolio admin apps, fund accounting apps, reconciliation tools, & data warehouse platforms (CADIS, Charles River, Aladdin, Eagles STAR, Eagle PACE, TLM)Must have a solid understanding of end-to-end investment services processes, including trade entry, trade process, settlement, security master set up/maintenance, valuation, corporate action processing, fund accounting & reconciliation resolution.Must have a good understanding of the Invesco data flow and the impact of different characteristics of GPS owned data on downstream data consumers and business functionsDemonstrated ability to process and assimilate data and information into meaningful management and reporting information.Strong interpersonal, conflict resolution, written and verbal communication skills to effectively build business relationships with internal and external stakeholders at all levelsCustomer focus and with a keen interest in providing superb services to clientsStrong organization skills and detail orientation, with an ability to understand the big picture and work under pressure with tight deadlinesStrong research, analytical as well as problem solving skillsSelf-motivation and ability to work independently under minimal supervision in a cross-functional global team environment is criticalMust show the ability for good judgment, establish priorities, and concentrate on detailed information under pressure on a daily basis. This includes the ability to handle time critical situations while meeting rigorous deadlinesAn independent thinker with keen interest, curiosity, and strong desire to research problems, analyze issues, challenge status-quo, lead projects as well as the perseverance to bring issues to a satisfactory closure without close supervisionAptitude for mathematical calculations and ability to analyze detailed numerical dataGood Microsoft Office skills - in particular Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Project and VisioAptitude for learning new technology and adapting to rapid changesDesire to learn new and complex financial instruments and processesValues diversity of thoughts, participates in constructive debate and feedbackWhat’s in it for you?Our people are at the very core of our success and we strive to provide employees with a competitive total rewards package which includes:RRSP ContributionsHealth & Wellness BenefitsWork flexibility ProgramsParental Leave BenefitsStudy SupportThe above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time.All Invesco employees are subject to Invesco’s COVID-19 VACCINATION POLICY FOR EMPLOYEES, which provides that employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. An exemption may be granted based on a medical contraindication or sincerely held religious belief. Fully vaccinated means that an individual has received all recommended doses of a COVID-19 vaccine that has received Emergency Use Authorization or full approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and that it has been at least two weeks since the final recommended dose.Invesco's culture of inclusivity and its commitment to diversity in the workplace are demonstrated through our people practices. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, or veteran status. Our equal opportunity employment efforts comply with all applicable U.S. state and federal laws governing non-discrimination in employment.

Posted by                  Daniel Liadsky             Managing Director at Purpose Analytics                                     Send InMail                    About UsPurpose Analytics is dedicated to building a data-informed non-profit sector. We do this by assisting non-profits to use data to support decision-making and communicate impact; and by cultivating a community of practice for people in the sector who work with data. Incorporated as a non-profit in October 2020, we have experienced steady growth.About the RoleWe are looking for a skilled data scientist who is interested in supporting non-profits to put their data to good use and contributing to the development of our social enterprise. You will work closely with clients to translate their needs into reproducible workflows that are sustainable and scaled appropriately to their size.While you will write code most days, you will readily adopt other technologies (including low-code and low-tech) to best meet client needs. You will also be a thoughtful relationship manager, recognizing that data projects are one of many tasks that non-profit administrators juggle and that taking on project management and other duties is a way that we add value for our clients. In short, you are capable of filling many roles and you know when to offer help. Finally, as part of a small team, you will have an interest in working with your colleagues to shape Purpose Analytics’ strategic direction and organizational culture as we grow.Our work with non-profits is direct and highly applied – we are not a tech company or an innovation lab – and our day-to-day work will appeal to candidates who enjoy hands-on involvement in delivering the data pipelines and analysis that non-profits need right now while being mindful of future opportunities to scale solutions more broadly.RequirementsProficiency in R or Python is a necessityKnowledge of the Microsoft Power Platform and similar low code solutionsExperience working with real-world data (and real-world people)Skilled in exploratory analysis and mapping data flowsExperience with integrating datasets and reviewing data sources, tools, and methodologiesSolid relationship management skills including the ability to translate client needs into component parts, articulate clear solutions, and the flexibility to support projects where neededGood communications skills with an aptitude for translating technical outputs into compelling storiesCompetent documentation skills including code commenting and writing user guide materialsExperience with software development tools and practices (e.g. version control)Understanding of legislation around privacy and best practices for securing dataNice to havePrevious non-profit experienceGIS and spatial analysis experienceDesign sensibilityFamiliarity with container-based deployment (e.g. Docker)Knowledge of Microsoft 365 apps (since 90% of our clients use this platform)You tell us!This is a full-time position based remotely in Canada with a salary range of $75,000 to $90,000. We offer a group benefits plan and choice in the computing equipment you use.We strongly encourage applications from members of Black, Indigenous, and other racialized communities; people reflecting diverse sexual orientations and gender identities; people with disabilities; and members of other equity seeking groups that face systemic discrimination.How to applyPlease visit https://careers.risepeople.com/purpose-analytics/en/4778_data-scientist to submit your cover letter and resume. Posting closes on June 7, 2022.We are committed to barrier-free, inclusive recruitment. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process.

At ACV, we are driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and rewarded with a work environment that enables each teammate to impact the company from day one. ACV’s network of brands includes ACV Auctions, ACV Transportation, MAX Digital and ACV Capital within its Marketplace Products as well as True360 and Data Services.What you will do: Quickly and accurately identify and address data quality concerns.  Quickly and accurately apply data change requests within defined SLA  Work directly with MAX users and MAX Support team to capture details of data quality  concerns and understand use cases.  Conduct root cause analysis on data quality concerns to determine scope and priority.  Communicate case status to appropriate internal and external constituents. TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewWhat does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data. Job DescriptionAbout this RoleAs an expert in data and analytics, you will provide in depth expertise, analytical interpretation, key insights and action items to your multi-functional business partners across the organization. Those insights will be brought to bear to enable informed and enabled business decisions enterprise wide or help to solve the increasingly complex business problems they face. In this role, TD will look to as a thought leadership as well as a leader in your space, coaching, mentoring, empowering and educating your peers to collaborate and bring TD into the future of banking.As a Senior Business Insights Analyst, you will: Apply understanding of respective business strategies to produce relevant and substantial data analysis to support business goals and objectivesDevelop analysis to illustrate business trends and identify areas of business opportunitiesProduce insights and recommend business actions to align with strategy and/or solve business problemsProvide seasoned specialized knowledge, advice and/or mentorship to various business and working partnersExecute on data requests accurately and within a timely mannerRepresent functional area as an analytics & insights professional and key resource; build positive and productive working partnershipsAct as a bridge to translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domainProvides day-to-day support and delivery of analyticsWork independently as the senior analyst/subject matter expert and may coach and educate othersConsidered an authority within a given areaOversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to end Job RequirementsWhat can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:Undergraduate degree or technical certificateFive (5) or more years relevant experienceProven experience working with analytics tools: data mining with SQL, Python; data modeling with Python, PySpark, Experience working in analytical environments such as Hadoop, HIVE, Cloud, Impala; and understanding of data mining/analytical techniques InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. theScore, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Penn National Gaming, empowers millions of sports fans through its digital media and sports betting products. Its media app ‘theScore’ is one of the most popular in North America, delivering fans highly personalized live scores, news, stats, and betting information from their favorite teams, leagues, and players. theScore’s sports betting app ‘theScore Bet’ delivers an immersive and holistic mobile sports betting experience and is currently available to place wagers in New Jersey, Colorado, Indiana, Iowa and the company’s home province of Ontario. theScore also creates and distributes innovative digital content through its web, social and esports platforms.About The RoleOn the Marketing team at theScore, our mission is to develop high-quality and sustainable data-driven marketing channels to improve profitability, growth and user adoption. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you’ll support all marketing stakeholders to implement high quality, data-driven decisions. You will ensure data accuracy and consistent reporting by designing and creating optimal processes and procedures. You will use analytical techniques to interpret key findings from company data and leverage these insights into initiatives that will support business outcomes within the Marketing team. Your analysis will play a key role in developing initiatives emphasizing customer acquisition/retention, conversion rates, optimization, and performance tracking. The ideal candidate has strong communications skills, exhaustive knowledge of data analysis, a passion for leveraging data to solve real-world problems, and an interest in professional sports, betting & eSports.Typical Workday at theScoreWork with Marketing teams to design, test and analyze user behavior data on our apps & websites to solve challenges across UA, CRM, cross-sell, activation, referral, promotional strategy and other marketing initiativesDesign, create, execute and measure results from A/B and multivariate testingAnalyze complex data sets to extract actionable insights used for various marketing optimization, exploration, performance, and user behaviors opportunitiesPerform ongoing analysis of audience segmentation, offer performance, retention, and core KPI optimization to uncover opportunitiesSynthesizes data, insights, and user behavior research to create presentations that make fact based recommendationsBuild dashboards & develop backend capabilities using our data exploration tools to support Marketing stakeholdersCritique existing workflows & data pipelines to identify opportunities for optimization or improved efficiencyLiaise with business stakeholders to identify data driven projects and opportunitiesPerform deep dive analysis using appropriate advanced analytics techniques to give marketing business insights & recommendationsLiaise with data engineering to build data pipelines and solve related issuesStay on top of emerging trends, competitive insights and analysis in the gaming industry and overall digital marketing landscapeOther duties as requiredRequirementsUniversity degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Marketing, Business, or related field2+ years of experience in an analyst or insights role, data analysis, or related fieldStrong knowledge of relational databases, proficiency with Excel, SQL and data visualization toolsExperience with data optimization, data visualization, digital & performance marketingA passion and curiosity for solving analytical problems using quantitative approachesAbility to take complex data and present it in a clear and simple mannerDemonstrated ability to influence decision makers and work with cross-functional partnersComfort working in a fast-paced, matrixed organization, with multiple stakeholders across time zonesExperience with BI tools such as Periscope, Looker, ThoughtSpot, SQL, Tableau, Appsflyer, Branch, Google Analytics, etc.Excellent written and oral communications skillsWhat We OfferCompetitive salaryComprehensive Benefits packageFun, relaxed work environmentEducation and conference reimbursementstheScore is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
