At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.We operate or service some 470 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated employees to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills.So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.Our expectationsReporting to the Operations Efficiency Supervisor and partnering with various store support centre departments, the Operations Excellence(Data) Analyst is responsible for creating the distribution centre long range plan including understanding risks related to the capacity of the building and recommending a labour plan to support the projected volume. The Operations Excellence (Data) Analyst is also responsible for developing the short-range direction that will enable us to execute the standards set by our Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s).Your roleCreate short-term inbound & outbound projections/reports utilizing historical data and Supply Chain dataCreate labour and building utilization forecasts by analyzing historical data and sales forecastsPartner with Operations to efficiently maximize building capacity by providing inbound/outbound forecasting, analyzing inventory levels and/or needs for external storageUsing Supply Chain reports models potential labour plan by period and quarter. Partners with Operations to forecast labour hiring needs.Analyze forecast accuracy to provide input on misses and inaccuraciesProduce consolidated weekly Operational metrics for regionCreate ad-hoc reportsCollaborate with Continuous Improvement by providing and analyzing data to support integrating improvement opportunitiesSupports optimal flow of product (vendor solutions) – vendor scorecards, master data, refining minimum order quantitiesPartners with Supply Chain, Master Data Management, Merchandising, and Operations to ensure data integrity across systemsThe Qualifications We Are Looking For2-4 years previous experience in a supply chain analyst rolePrior experience with data analysis and managing large amount of data preferredPost-secondary education in Supply Chain Management, Business, or equivalent experienceExperience with a WMS is a strong assetExperience with SQL is preferredAdvanced knowledge of software applications including Excel, Power BI and Access is requiredPrevious inventory experience within a distribution environment is an assetStrong analytical and troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve complex problems; creative problem-solvingSuccessfully manages multiple tasks simultaneously while still being detail-orientedPlaces high value on customer (store) serviceAbility to work independently as well as with a teamStrong communication and interpersonal skillsThe masculine generic is used without discrimination and only in order to simplify the text. Lowe’s Canada is committed to encouraging diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, or any other status protected by law.

job_title: Data Analyst / Fraud/ Subject Matter Expert
job_desc: Posted by                  Russell Goodright             f5 Technical Recruiting Group                                     Send InMail                    Job DescriptionData Analyst / Fraud/ Subject Matter ExpertFTE/ RemoteToday, F5 identifies and stops automated attacks and fraud in web and mobile applications for the Fortune Global 2000. In the future, we’ll need to fight even more sophisticated adversaries while helping human users experience frictionless digital experiences. Come be a part of our unparalleled team that is responsible for making the Internet a safer place for everyone.The PositionF5 is seeking a driven, analytical, articulate, and highly professional data analyst to help deliver anti-fraud solutions and communicating the value of our products to external audiences. The Data Analyst / Fraud SME will work specifically on data analysis and build summaries to drive improved performance of our products and understanding for our customers.We are looking for an analyst who has a nose for identifying fraud and anomalous patterns in huge and often messy datasets who is also adept at using these insights to craft compelling narratives for external audiences. The ideal candidate also has a penchant for working closely with enterprise customers, gaining a deep sense of customer empathy, and a desire to deliver outstanding value to them in content.Responsibilities:Work with the data science team to instrument products, build models, interpret, and visualize data sets.Using your strong analytical skills, you will find insights in data to develop both internal and external communication. You will be responsible for translating data insights into narratives that speak to your audiences’ experiences and pain points. Audiences include customers, technologists in the security and fraud space, internal stakeholders and beyond.Develop your own strong voice to promote thought leadership on behalf of Shape Security and F5.Work closely with customers to quickly understand their fraud challenges and identify how F5 might be able to help them successfully fight fraud.Identify useful data from customers’ web and mobile applications and engineer relevant features for fraud models.Communicate clearly and effectively with internal teams (sales, customer success, product, engineering, etc.) and with customers on the performance of machine learning models, as well as other fraud and data science issues.Provide feedback to internal Shape teams on data science, product, engineering issues, and suggest process improvements.Requirements:The ideal candidate has:Strong analytical skills including the ability to manipulate, model, interpret, and visualize large quantities of structured data.Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.Experience building and deploying machine learning models on large-scale data. Experience working with highly unbalanced data (e.g., commonly found in fraud use cases) a strong plus.A passion for delighting customers and an aptitude for engaging with customers on fraud, security, and machine learning issues on a regular basis.Prior experience working with customers on complex fraud or security issues.Familiarity with common web and mobile technologies.Strong interpersonal and communication skills with ability to interpret complex data insights into digestible information for internal stakeholders and customers.Self-motivation, drive and persistence when tackling the most difficult problems.Ability to work well both independently and as part of an agile team.A demonstrated enthusiasm and capacity to learn new technologies quickly.A scrappy yet meticulous approach and a love for problem solving!#LI- HybridThe Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.Phishing AlertPlease note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).Equal Employment OpportunityIt is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability,marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

job_title: Data Scientist, Bidding Operations/ Scientifique des données, Opérations d’enchère
job_desc: Expert(e) en apprentissage automatique IIIEst-ce que l’utilisation de la science des données vous passionne? Aimeriez-vous améliorer les indicateurs commerciaux du marketing de moteurs de recherche, comme la proportion de clics reçus (« click share ») et le rendement publicitaire (« return on advertising spend » ou ROAS)?Souhaitez-vous travailler dans le monde riche en données et en constante évolution des voyages en ligne?Notre équipe responsable de la science des données recherche un(e) expert(e) chevronné(e) en science des données pour utiliser des techniques simples, complexes et évolutives visant à aider l’optimisation des millions d’enchères du marketing des moteurs de recherche (« SEM »).Cette occasion passionnante vous permettrait de résoudre un large éventail de problèmes d’importance grâce à la science des données.Votre MissionLe poste est offert aux personnes cherchant à appliquer la science des données pour simplifier les stratégies d’enchères du marketing des moteurs de recherche d’Expedia Group dans un environnement d’apprentissage en ligne.En tant qu’expert(e) principal(e) en science des données pour les opérations d’enchères, vous serez responsable de la surveillance des statistiques relatives aux enchères, des opérations hebdomadaires de réglage des enchères, de l’optimisation des enchères en fonction des prédictions du modèle et de la prise en compte des commentaires des gestionnaires de campagne.Votre objectif sera d’automatiser autant que possible les opérations d’enchères à l’aide de systèmes de contrôle de façon à réduire au maximum les frais généraux des opérations d’enchères. Cela vous permettra ensuite de vous concentrer sur des projets de recherche d’importance, comme l’amélioration des statistiques relatives aux enchères à l’aide de l’apprentissage adaptatif pour guider les changements de modificateurs d’enchères.Si les problèmes d’analyse et d’optimisation d’importance vous intéressent, et que la rareté des données, les tendances en constante évolution et les millions d’enchères et de modificateurs ne vous font pas peur, saisissez l’occasion de faire avancer votre carrière.En étroite collaboration avec nos équipes d’opérations d’enchères (Bidding Operations), vous soutiendrez notre stratégie d’enchères pour nos partenaires, comme Bing et Google.Notre équipe de recherche, composée de huit personnes, gère des milliers de dollars de dépenses en marketing des moteurs de recherche par jour.Votre ProfilExcellentes compétences interpersonnellesCapacité d’analyse des données et de présentation de visualisations pour fournir des informations commercialesExpérience avec les systèmes de contrôle en boucle fermée pour les pipelines d’apprentissage en ligneBonne compréhension de la théorie et de la pratique relatives aux probabilités et aux statistiquesExpérience en création et en maintenance de pipelines d’extraction, de transformation et de chargement (« ETL ») à grande échelle à l’aide d’outils comme PySpark, Apache Airflow, SQL, DataBricks et NotebooksBonnes pratiques de programmation, capacité à écrire des codes lisibles et performantsCapacité à appliquer la méthode scientifique pour suggérer des améliorations à partir de donnéesExpérience dans l’optimisation d’enchères de marketingExpérience en apprentissage par renforcementExpérience en production d’applications d’apprentissage automatique à grande échelle dans le monde réelExpérience pratique en apprentissage automatique : préparation d’ensembles de données, sélection et développement de fonctionnalités, conception et optimisation d’algorithmes d’apprentissage, évaluation des résultats par rapport aux références de productionCuriosité intellectuelle et volonté d’apprendre, notamment en ce qui a trait aux nouvelles techniques et technologiesMachine Learning Scientist IIIAre you passionate about using data science to improve SEM business metrics like click share and Return on Advertising Spend (ROAS)?Would you like to work in the fast-paced and data-rich world of online travel?Our Data Science team is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to use simple, sophisticated and scalable techniques to help optimize millions of SEM bids.This exciting opportunity would allow you to solve a broad range of high-impact problems using Data Science.What You’ll DoThis position is open for people looking to apply data science to streamline Expedia Group SEM bidding strategies in an online learning settingAs the lead bidding operations data scientist, you will be responsible for bidding performance monitoring, weekly bid tuning operations, bid optimization given model predictions and taking input from campaign managersTo minimize bidding operations overhead, your focus will be to automate bidding operations as much as possible using control systems. This will allow you to later concentrate on high-impact research projects like improving bidding performance using adaptive learning to guide bid modifier changesIf you are interested in high impact analytics and optimization problems that involves dealing with data scarcity, constantly evolving trends, and millions of bids and modifiers, this is a great opportunity to further your careerWorking closely with our Bidding Operations teams, you will support our bidding strategy for our partners, such as Bing and GoogleOur 8-person research team handles thousands of dollars of SEM spend per dayWho You AreExcellent interpersonal skillsAbility to investigate data and present visualizations to provide business intelligenceExperience with closed loop control systems for online learning pipelinesGood understanding of Probability and Statistics theory and practiceExperience building and maintaining large-scale Extract Transform and Load (ETL) pipelines using tools such as PySpark, Apache Airflow, SQL, DataBricks, NotebooksGood programming practices, able to write readable, performant codeAbility to apply the scientific method to suggest improvements from dataExperience optimizing Marketing auctionsExperience with Reinforcement LearningExperience productionizing real-world large-scale ML applicationsHands on experience in machine learning: preparing datasets, selecting and engineering features, building and optimizing training algorithms, evaluating results against production baselinesIntellectual curiosity and desire to learn new things, techniques and technologiesAbout Expedia GroupExpedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.© 2021 Expedia, Inc. All rights reserved. Trademarks and logos are the property of their respective owners. CST: 2029030-50Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.

Posted by                  Cheryl Slusarchuk                                  2nd                            CEO at NumerixSQuant                                     Send InMail                    We are a data-driven company with a collegial atmosphere looking for team members who can do great work for application in the algorithmic trading industry.  Our ideal candidate is a recent or soon to be PhD graduate with experience in an academic or post-doc research workplace looking to apply their capabilities to the real world. Our approach is to train successful candidates about our industry, markets and products, as such we are looking for people seeking their initial entry position in the financial markets. About You:You are driven by intellectual challenges, curiosity, and solving problems. You continuously seek to understand new and better approaches to analyze and interpret ‘dirty’ data to improve investment results. You love to see your work put into practice. For individuals currently living outside of Vancouver, we offer relocation assistance. What You’ll Do:● Developing and bringing research and other projects to completion for use in an existing trading strategy● Researching ‘dirty’ data sets to identify possible investment signals● Developing predicative quantities and reporting for use in our trading system● Working independently on your own projects, collaboratively with your colleagues, and with the portfolio manager to integrate your solutions into the trading system What You Bring:● Required: Ph.D. in mathematics, physics or related fields in quantitative disciplines with a Masters in the hard sciences (including if you will be graduating with a Ph.D. within the next 12 months)● Highly analytical, keen attention to detail● Innate curiosity and an exceptional critical thinker who is results-oriented● Demonstrated expertise in statistics and mathematical modelling● Strong communications skills (both verbal and written)● Thrive in a performance-based environment● Require excellence of yourself and in the work you produce Nice to Have:● Experience participating in national or international math, physics or computer science competitions is strongly preferred● Strong experience with Python, C++, R and kdb+ (Linux environment) and coding concepts● Legally entitled to work in Canada (however for exceptional candidates we can provide immigration assistance)How to Apply:Apply online to see if you’re our newest Data Scientist today!https://numerixsquant.com/careers.php

job_title: Portfolio Valuations/ OTC Derivatives Market Data Analyst
job_desc: Markit Portfolio Valuations (PV) provides an independent, post-trade valuation service to buy-side institutions globally, covering vanilla and exotic OTC derivatives, cash instruments and structured notes across all asset classes. The service also offers clients the ability to receive an aggregated set of counterparty marks for their trades.We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic individual with experience in derivative pricing and the related market datasets to be part of a team of analysts that supports the creation, maintenance and delivery of derivatives market data sets, servicing our Portfolio Valuations product.PV market data Product Services analysts will monitor market data feeds/alerts and will resolve market data issues in order to ensure that accurate market data is captured for use in the PV processes. They will work closely with Market Data Ops colleagues in other locations, the Market Data Product team and with GPS Analysts in support of clients of the global PV Business.RequiredEducation & experienceMinimum bachelor’s degree in a finance/accounting or STEM discipline.Demonstrable experience of manipulating and validating large and complex sets of traded market information such as prices, rates and volatilities.Some previous exposure to market data objects such as yield curves, forward curves or volatility surfaces is preferable.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Proficiency in Excel, VBA.DesirableRelevant practical experience (1-3 years).Experience with SQL.Experience with Python and/or C# and/or any scripting language.Good understanding of market and reference datasets used in the valuation of OTC derivatives across asset classes.Familiarity with Market Data Providers such as Refinitive, SIX Telekurs, etc.Commercial AwarenessMust have general understanding of financial markets and be keen to extend knowledge of OTC derivatives across all asset classes.Must embrace the importance of high service levels as part of a commercial relationship.Understanding of derivative trading / quoting conventions in one or more asset classes would be desirable.Appreciation of the business criticality of ODD quality, gained within previous roles.Must be detail-oriented, thorough and able to use own initiative to solve problems.Must have the ability to work well in a team to ensuring that tasks are completed, and issues are followed up and closed.Excellent time management and organizational skills are essential.Ability to work calmly and effectively under pressure.Strong skills required to be able to communicate effectively with external clients and across business units within the company. This will include email, phone and face-to-face meetings.Clear, structured and professional in both writing and speech.Must gain a clear understanding and appreciation of the other functional and regional teams in the valuation group.Must respect and apply the various control activities required to maintain and monitor the quality of the service.Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of IHS Markit, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category. For more information on the many ways in which we enthusiastically support inclusion and diversity efforts for both candidates and employees, please access our Inclusion & Diversity Statement here.We are proud to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with IHS Markit and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please contact or call +1 212 849 0399. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are considered on a case-by-case basis. This contact information (email and phone) is intended for application assistance and accommodation requests only. We are unable to accept resumes or provide information about application status through the phone number or email address above. Resumes are only accepted through the online application process, and only qualified candidates will receive consideration and follow-up.IHS Markit maintains a substance-free workplace; employees may be asked to submit to a drug test (where permitted by law). In addition, as a federal contractor in the United States, the company participates in the E-Verify Program to confirm eligibility to work.For Information Please Click On The Following LinksIHS Markit Business Code of ConductRight to WorkEEO is the LawEEO is the Law SupplementPay TransparencyCurrent ColleaguesIf you are currently employed by IHS Markit, please apply internally via the Workday internal careers site.

We need a driven analyst who can creatively come up with data-focused solutions to problems through inquiry, data collection, analysis and collaboration with leaders in customer experience and marketing to drive change. CanadaKey Responsibilities IncludeFoster effective working relationships with fellow analysts and business partners to create an environment of knowledge sharingAbility to see to the core of a problem, understanding the “why” behind a questionObservant and inquisitive, discovering opportunities to use data to better understand our customersExtract and reconcile data from our robust data warehouse or identify and strategize new data to be collected through third party partnerships, surveys and moreConduct primary and secondary customer research with focus on both quantitative and qualitative analysisApply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to derive meaning from data with a focus on impactPresent findings to business partners, often collaborating to develop and implement action plansMonitor results through performant dashboards, rinse and repeat QualificationsPlease include a cover letter with your application.Experience5+ years’ experience of data extraction and manipulation (eg SQL), statistical analysis and other modeling techniques3+ years leading or mentoring junior analysts3+ years using data to drive strategySkills, Knowledge & AbilitiesComfortable working on complex and ambiguous problemsHighly driven and motivated to work in a fast-paced, high-growth environmentAdvanced experience with data analysis including applying statistical methods and modeling techniquesAdvanced experience with data visualization platforms (Tableau preferred)Experience with research and survey methodology preferredFlexible to work independently and in a team-based environmentBenefits And PerksBonus opportunities Employer-paid extended health coverage for you and your family Four weeks paid time off Five weeks, paid, sabbatical after five years of employment Restricted Stock Units Employer-paid medical insurance for one pet (cat or dog) Paid time off to volunteer at nonprofit organizations Open, casual, pet-friendly, and fun work environment About TrupanionWe’re all about helping pets. We promote a cohesive and nimble team environment, and we hire, develop and promote team members. We trust each other. We are transparent and honest. We care about one another and want to see our team members succeed, personally and professionally. We strive to promote from within and reduce bureaucracy to allow creative thinking. We’re focused on providing continuous training and support to all team members to encourage long-term happiness and success.Take a look inside our office and see for yourself:https://www.facebook.com/Trupanion/videos/10155423763702974/ We’re more than insurance – we’re a tech company too! At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions.Neo Financial is looking for a full-time Data Developer to join our team in Calgary.We believe that data is our competitive advantage. As a Data Developer at Neo, you'll be building out cutting edge data transformation, transmission, and storage systems for a team of data analysts & scientists. You’ll be hands-on working with the data lake and populating the store from a diverse and ever-changing set of sources. You are curious about all things Neo, passionate about developing others and creating a culture of excellence and have the ability to build consensus around your vision for how data can be used to build better financial services for all Canadians coast-to-coast. Responsibilities will include coaching & mentoring junior team members, instilling a high-performance dev culture, advancing Neo’s Data & Analytics roadmap and jumping in to get your hands dirty when necessary.We use tools like Kafka, Spark, Airflow and AWS in our everyday work, but we believe that a good data engineer can learn any tech stack. Use Spark (PySpark) in Databricks to perform data ingestions, transformations, and augmentations on large sets of data  Create and orchestrate data pipelines from a variety of different sources using Airflow  Supporting BI/analytics through building out an explorable data-lake in S3  Work with product management and analytics teams to take new ideas to production  Help integrate diverse systems into our data lake or data warehouse  Assist with the development of automated reports and delivery of analytics data  2+ years of experience working in a data-intensive environment, preferably using Python and SQL  Experience using Apache Spark (PySpark)  Experience working in AWS  Able to create and maintain data pipelines in a production environment  Strong understanding of data engineering principles  Familiarity with BI/analytics tools such as Looker  Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada and willing to relocate to Calgary  Adaptable, high-achievers energized by a startup environment  Team players who love being part of an agile ecosystem  Project owners who can engage with developers or other stakeholders  Makers with a drive to finish, impress users, and delight customers At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future.Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Job DescriptionGiven the current circumstances, employee will be working from home, 100% of time. As working conditions return to normal, they will shift to a hybrid working arrangement.Who We AreEstablished in 1987, Fidelity Investments Canada Inc. (FIC), provides Canadian investors with a full range of mutual funds, ETFs and alternative funds. Fidelity funds are available through a number of distribution channels, including financial planners, investment dealers, banks and insurance companies.FIC manages over $168 billion (CAD) in mutual fund and institutional assets, as at December 15, 2020. This includes $41 billion in assets for institutional clients, including public and corporate-defined benefit pension plans, endowments, foundations and corporate assets on behalf of clients across Canada.FIC has more than 1000 full time employees and is headquartered in Toronto, with regional offices in Montreal, Calgary and Vancouver.Business OverviewThe mandate of the Data Protection Office (DPO) in Fidelity Canada is to establish a Proactive and Collaborative framework that ensures Personal Data of Fidelity Canada customers, employees and all other individuals-data subjects is Identified and adequately ProtectedWhat You Will DoAs the member of the DPO team, the Data Protection Analyst provides an excellent service in supporting Fidelity Canada’s data protection & data privacy culture through pro-active management of data privacy risks and continuous focus on understanding and improving our data protection controls. Oversight of data protection controls within Fidelity Canada Collaborate with functional owners to review use of Personal data in Fidelity systems and business processes, assess data protection controls, identify required enhancements, and monitor their implementationMaintain well documented inventory of data privacy reviews and findingsSupport timely execution of DPO initiatives, and implementation of new and enhanced data protection controlsMaintain DPO quarterly scorecards and prepare presentations on progress of DPO initiatives and company wide data privacy enhancementsConduct formal DPO review and attestation processes on existing controls Conduct Privacy Impact Assessment for Fidelity Canada projects, systems and business process enhancements Maintain Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) questionnaire, keeping it up to date with data protection controls and data privacy requirements, regulatory and technology changesPerform PIA assessments for new projects, systems, or business process enhancements, including onboarding of third-party service providers with access to personal data of Fidelity customers or employeesDocument and prioritize findings, outlining current state of data protection controls, required enhancements, and accountability for their implementationTrack all agreed-upon changes in DPO inventory, monitoring progress against target implementation timelines, and supporting accountable business/technology owners as needed Promote adherence to data privacy regulatory requirements, information security and technology standards and ethical use of customer data Support organizational awareness of Data Privacy requirements, through company-wide communication and trainingClosely collaborate with technology teams to ensure continuous alignment with Fidelity Canada Information Security, Infrastructure, Data Governance, Architecture and Development standards and best practicesPartner with Risk, Compliance and Legal teams to ensure adherence of PIA and Data Protection controls to Canadian regulatory requirements, Fidelity Canada Privacy and Ethical Use of Customer Data policies Participate in resolution of Personal data privacy breaches Collaborate with the Fidelity Canada Chief Privacy Officer and their team in the analysis and remediation process handling personal data privacy breachesInclude any remediation action items in the overall inventory of Fidelity Canada data protection controls and related enhancementsWhat We Are Looking ForPost-secondary education in the areas IT, Business or related field are preferredA minimum of 1 years of work experience in the data privacy field inBusiness role - working with business controls related to collection and handling of customers’ personal data, orTechnology role - including analysis, development, testing on data related initiatives, work in data architecture, data governance, or information security roles.Strong interest in data privacy and data protectionExperience and demonstrated ability to manage multiple project assignments, with strong attention to details, and efficient time managementDemonstrated organizational technology skills to maintain detailed tracking inventories, and produce required reports and analytic summaries Demonstrated interest in data privacy/data protection roleDemonstrated understanding of Canadian Data Privacy requirementsCompletion of Data Privacy training and/or certification is considered an asset The Expertise You Bring Data Privacy subject matter expertiseStrong organizational skills, attention to detailsDrive for resultsStrong written and verbal communication skillsSolid understanding of technology and information security trendsSolid understanding of financial industry and related regulatory/privacy requirementsGood teamwork and relationship building skillsCurrent work authorization for Canada is required for all openings. Key AccountabilitiesJob Description Develop machine learning models and support the management of models throughout the model lifecycle. Develop, monitor, and enhance analytical solutions in collaboration with business stakeholders and IT professionals. Effectively plan and manage analytics projects, leading team members through technical work. Develop a strong understanding of the insurance business through independent learning and working closely with business stakeholders. Continually focus on innovation and process improvement to promote leading practices and efficiency across the organization.Job Requirements University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or a related discipline. Experience with developing and implementing analytics solutions. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Ability to develop creative solutions to complex problems.TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES 3+ years of experience with statistical programming languages like Python, and database query languages like SQL, Hive or Pig. Familiarity with Scala, Java, or C++ is an asset. Significant experience with machine learning techniques like GLM, GAM, XGBoost, Neural Networks, k-NN and SVM, etc. Familiarity with Big Data Technologies such as Hadoop and Spark. Experience with cloud computing platforms such as GCP or AWS is highly desired. Experiencing with CI/CD pipelines for deploying data and machine learning models is highly desired. Knowledge of Git for version control and collaboration is an asset.About UsWe also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parents Wellness and recognition programs Discounts on products and servicesOur inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. With strong roots that date back to 1871, Definity has grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. Job DescriptionNumerator is a data and tech company bringing speed and scale to market research. Headquartered in Chicago, IL, Numerator has more than 2,000 employees worldwide. The company blends proprietary data with advanced technology to create unique insights for the market research industry that has been slow to change. The majority of Fortune 100 companies are Numerator clients.Here at Numerator, we've made all corporate roles have maximum flexibility between office and remote work, except for rare situations when the role requires coming into an office regularly. In those situations, the recruiter of that role will clarify at the beginning of the process if that is the case. In fully remote situations, the company will provide technical equipment necessary to be successful in the role. In addition to maximum flexibility of return-to-office, the company also provides generous PTO, Internally Quiet Focus Time, and other recharge efforts to give time back to employees.Job DescriptionNumerator is looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our Data as a Service (DaaS) team. As part of our DaaS team, you will be a vital member ensuring on-going excellence in delivery of our data feed solutions. You will be responsible for the technical delivery of our data feeds product to a myriad of clients and strategic partnerships, as well as work on on-going improvements and extensions to this capability. This is an opportunity to collaborate with a cross-functional team in one of our fastest growing business areas.ResponsibilitiesDevelop expertise in Numerator datasets with deep understanding of data schema and storage systemsDefine queries for data feed deliveries via interpretation of data requirements and scoping documentsMaintenance of technical documentation as it relates to DaaS delivery processesAssist in development and maintenance of Airflow dependent processesFirst level support for operational triage and bug fixes in codeImplement extensions of pre-defined code and architectureRegularly communicate progress and timing implications for directed tasksWhat You BringSkills & RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related fieldsIntermediate to advanced experience with SQLExperience with ETL tooling (particularly Airflow)Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and comfort with shifting environmentsStrong database skillsExperience with version control systems (Git, etc.)An eagerness to learn new things, and improve upon existing skills, abilities, and practices.Nice To Have'sPrior experience with Snowflake Data WarehouseKnowledge of engineering best practices and coding standardsAirflow -- Experience building and monitoring DAGs, developing custom operators and using script templating solutionsScripting experience with PythonCPG and/or retail industry knowledgeWhat We OfferAn inclusive and collaborative company cultureAn opportunity to have an impact on our growing teams and organizationOwnership of platforms and environments with industry leading productMarket competitive total compensation packageVolunteer time off and charitable donation matchingStrong support for career growth, including mentorship programs, leadership training, access to conferences and employee resources groupsGreat benefits package including health/vision/dental, unlimited PTO, 401k plus matching, and more! If this sounds like something you would like to be part of, we'd love for you to apply! Don't worry if you think that you don't meet all the qualifications here. The tools, technology and methodologies we use are constantly changing and we value talent and interest over specific experience.While this position can be remote, Numerator is only able to hire in many, but not all, states and provinces. In certain cases, if you are not located in a specific area where Numerator is able to hire, you may not be eligible for employment.We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law

job_desc: TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewLayer 6 is a leading machine learning research company, developing advanced deep learning systems that have the power to uplift large populations while advancing the field of artificial intelligence.Our research is supported by access to massive datasets, close collaboration with world renowned academic faculty, and a uniquely scalable machine learning platform. Research areas include deep learning, computer vision, time series analysis, natural language processing and recommendation systems etc.Our technical capabilities have been publicly recognized through a number of wins in various international machine learning competitions, including the prestigious ACM RecSys Challenge (the only repeat winner in 2017 and 2018 and runner-up in 2019), Google’s Landmark Retrieval Challenge (2nd place in 2018, 3rd place in 2019), Kaggle: RSNA Pneumonia Detection Challenge (4th place in 2018) and the Stanford Question Answering Dataset (2nd place in 2019).Layer 6 was founded in Toronto in 2016 and backed by some of the most successful technology entrepreneurs in Canada. Layer 6 was acquired by TD Bank Group in 2018 and we continue being based in Toronto’s Discovery District – MaRS Centre.Job DescriptionWe are looking for world-class engineers to help us develop a system that will serve as the main interface to our machine learning platform. The goal of this system is to help in all stages of model development, from feature engineering all the way to production monitoring.We empower our machine learning scientists to build better models by helping them understand the data and trained models. We also provide the tools necessary for analyzing and visualizing machine learning algorithms in an effort to extract valuable business insights in a transparent and comprehensive manner.As ML Engineer at Layer 6, you’ll work with ML scientists to learn about different machine learning algorithms and ways to analyze them. On the back end, you’ll work with the team to architect systems and design a API for the front-end web application which will visualize data and answer questions about machine learning models.You’ll also have the opportunity to work with the engineering team to tackle the challenge of developing high performance, robust and scalable systems.RequirementsJob RequirementsBSc+ in Computer Science or similar5+ years of programming experienceProven experience in designing and delivering a complex web applicationExperience as a key contributor and leader on projectsStrong experience in Java and its ecosystemPassionate about creating maintainable and performant softwareStrong desire to learn and solve problemsWhat We Consider An AssetExperience with databases such as ElasticsearchExperience with microservice architectureFamiliarity with data analysis or machine learningExperience with Docker and KubernetesComfortable with math (linear algebra, calculus)InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewCanadian Credit Cards is the largest dual issuer of Visa and MasterCard Products and holds the position of #1 market share in Canada. TD Consumer and Business credit cards are distributed nationally, leveraging our retail network direct responses and key co-brand partnerships including Aeroplan, Amazon and Air Canada.The Proactive Monitoring Team applies advanced data analytics and automatic testing to support the Canadian Credit Cards business to proactively identify potential risk and enhancement opportunities, as well as supporting the remediation efforts of identified issues and/or incidents.We understand the business, its risks and regulatory requirements and are the Subject Matter Experts on the related data across the Credit Card Business systems. We perform appropriate monitoring and/or testing activities and remediation support through two distinct pillars using a risk-based approach and report out to the business partners and control partners on the results/outcomes.Regulatory Requests for Information: Support Issue and Incident Management teams through the ICARUS POD by providing reporting based on business requirements to determine impacted customer populations and/or financial impacts for issues and incident resolution. Provide subject expertise and recommendations on data and business requirements to ensure the desired objectives for remediation are achieved.Proactive Monitoring Testing: Proactively research, investigate and detect to identify potential Regulatory, policy, process, operational and customer experience opportunities before an issue or incident is identified. Support new project implementation and process verification at the account level to identify potential anomalies early on.Risk Partner and Regulatory Information: Provide account level reporting requirements for internal or external partners to support audit, Regulator and control monitoring requests - Audit/BG&C/Compliance/GAML/ORM etc. and Regulators (FCAC, OSFI etc.).Job DescriptionAs a member of the Customer Monitoring and Remediation Team within Canadian Credit Cards, as a Senior Business Insights Analyst, your primary responsibility will be to support the preventive monitoring activities in order to increase customer experience, business processes and ensure adhere to bank regulations. You will play a key role in supporting various business partners with issue and/or incident remediation on complex reporting to identify impacted population and financial impacts and, providing secondary reviews. the primary accountabilities of the role are:Creation and delivery of complex requests for information (RRFIs) reports primarily based on credit card processor account data or transactional data to support various Business Units (Product, Incident Management, Issue Management, ICARUS, Business Governance and Control, Audit, etc.) Provide consultation for Business Units regarding complex report requirements data Support timely reporting for issue and/or incident investigations investigation and remediationDesign solutions for data retrieval to best meet the needs of the business in an effective mannerAssist with delivery of new business metrics and operational efficiencies within the CM&R TeamParticipate in the development of new proactive monitoring activities through detail research and understanding of current bank regulations, policies and processesParticipate in knowledge transfer within the team and conduct secondary reviewsParticipate fully as a member of the team, participate/assist in departmental committees providing insight and recommendations, and contribute to a positive work environmentWillingness to broaden and increase knowledge of new reporting tools and systemsJob RequirementsDemonstrate knowledge of SQL, Python and cloud computing programmingGood understanding of the TD Card and/or MBNA Card portfolios and the lines of business supported Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft ExcelAbility to work and research/resolve issues independently while sharing best practices and knowledge with colleaguesSuperior time management skills; be able to manage multiple assignments with competing priorities successfullyAbility to quickly understand, acquire and apply new technical skills and apply those understandings to diverse requirements and cross-relational problems and solutionsExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsInnovative, results oriented and conceptual thinkerObserved leadership abilities and desire to assume responsibility for deliverables Flexibility to adapt and manage within a dynamic and fast paced environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to develop strong relationships with peers, internal and external customers and IT partnersAbility to analyze scenarios to reach acceptable compromises between technology impacts and customer serviceAdditional SkillsKnowledge of TS2 and the Account Management Triad technical environment and applications supported is an assetExperience with the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) is an assetExperience in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Access is an assetExperience with JIRA and Confluence is an assetUniversity Degree or College Diploma, with specialty in computer sciences, computer programming, mathematics, engineering or related field would be considered an assetInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Who We AreMetrie is a multi-national leader in the millwork industry with over 30 locations that produces and sells interior finishings across North America. We’re passionate about making a difference by helping our customers transform their houses into homes and love where they live! You’ve probably seen our products in the media featured on tv shows and magazines such as HGTV, Style At Home and House & Home, or by one of our Instagram influencers.Why should you work for Metrie? With us, you’re more than just a number. We work hard to create a home for our Metrie family where you are empowered to be your best every day. Your contributions matter to us! We take pride in our culture of learning, ownership, and one team, and are committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone.What You'll DoAs a Master Data Analyst, you will work with a fantastic team of Analysts who know our SAP data inside and out. If you have worked with Master Data on SAP for both Customer, Vendors, and Materials… you might be the right person for this job!You will be one of the primary users of “Decisions for Metrie”, a master data workflow tool. You will review and analyze the data change requests, verify for completeness and accuracy, and then work with people all over the company in order to make sure our SAP data is correct before it goes into SAP. Key Relationships:  A Master Data Analyst reports to the Supervisor, Master Data & Governance. This role is a key member of a high-performance Master Data team. Location:  We are open to accepting applicants based out of any of our Metrie branches (see Metrie.com for a full list of branches).Your day-to-day activities will include: Responsible and accountable for the data quality, completeness, and consistency within a specific strategic data area; Customer, Vendor, Materials  Review incoming requests for all Customer/Vendor/Material changes (New, Change, Update, Delete) that come in from the business units using our new “D4M” software. You will then verify the accuracy and completeness of that data and upload to SAP.  Working with the team on various MDM data related projects to improve the quality of our data in SAP, which has a direct impact on everyone using SAP.  Exporting data from SAP and using excel to analyze, sort, vlookup, and identify data issues that need to be addressed.  Continuous learning in your data area (Customers/Vendors/Material) to become one of our Metrie experts around customers, vendors and materials  Strive to achieve established SLA for workflows Who You AreWe would love to hear from you if you have:  High attention to detail  Experience/understanding of an advanced ERP system within Sales, Purchasing, Accounts Receivable or Payables, Inventory.  Moulding Industry knowledge and or strong experience within the specific data area (Customer, Vendor, Inventory)  Experience with Windows, MS Office, Exchange, Citrix, SAP Medium to Advanced experience with Excel  Excellent interpersonal, communication,  Ability to multi task and have a disciplined approach towards data project  Passionate about delivering results, and determined to be the best in your field It would be an added bonus if you: Experience with SAP/ECC/S4  Experience with Decisions for SAP  Interested? If you'd love to work with us, send us your resume by clicking "Apply Now". We look forward to seeing your application! Metrie embraces diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and customers feel like they belong. We are an equal opportunity employer and invite any and all qualified applicants. SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.Job DescriptionData Analyst - Market Data Operations - SS&C Technologies CanadaToronto, ON CanadaSS&C Technologies Holdings, Inc. is a global provider of financial services software and software-enabled services. North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Africa, and Australia.Primary Responsibilities:Essential responsibilities of the job include, but are not limited to:Establishing new and maintaining existing procedures in order to meet company requirements.Conducting research and providing information/answers to internal/external parties in regard to SVC’s data services, products, procedures, policies and documentation.Assisting in the research and resolution of department related problems.Creating and testing of change requests as required.Actively participating in regular team status meetings to ensure information is effectively and appropriately shared.Acting as a resource in areas of expertise for others in the team.Assisting team members as required to ensure daily operational requirements are met.Keeping informed of internal products, processes and initiatives.Ensuring department related documentation and training materials are kept current.Participating in the on-call rotation as requested by Team Leader or Manager.Developing and assisting in strategies for continued self and team development.Additional FunctionsEnsuring complete coverage of data operations during staff holidays or absences.Monitoring, analyzing and maintaining the quality and accuracy of data in SVC databases.Working closely with Sales and Client Support for new client implementations.Assisting in improving and developing SVC products and services.Working closely with required SVC and FMC departments to achieve common goal of customer satisfaction by providing superior support and service.Continuous interaction with data suppliers to stay informed of products and services and to ensure that data services SVC subscribes to are timely, accurate and reliable services.Ensuring the Client Support group is made aware of any SVC related activities or changes in data services that may affect clients.Position Requirements: College diploma in Business, Math, Economics, or Finance-related field, other financial service qualifications or equivalent experience.Securities data and/or investment-related experience is an asset as well as the completion of the Canadian Securities Course.A solid understanding of financial instruments and assets classes including fixed income, equities, corporate actions, reference data and security identifiers.Proficient in MS Office (with accent on Excel).Excellent knowledge of SQL, Mongo query tools and Jira are an asset.Organizational Relationships:Data Analyst reports to the Team Leader, who in turn reports to the Department Manager.Data Analyst has a support responsibility to all functional Directors and Managers within the organization.Data Analyst will have paralleled responsibility and accountability with other team members within the group.Data Analyst may be asked to assist in other areas of SVC as required.Data Analyst works with Team Leaders, Managers and FMC staff as needed to successfully complete assigned projects/tasks and resolve department related problems.Why SS&C?Working at SS&C is balanced and fair – especially in challenging times. We offer flexible work schedules, time off, and so much more to keep you healthy, safe, and productive. SS&C offers:Hybrid Schedule featuring 4-6 days in the office monthly combined with working from homeCompetitive base salary plus EXCELLENT benefits (including medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD and more)!RRSP Matching ProgramGlobal Flexible Time Off Policy (personal/vacation time)Sick Leave PolicyEligible for an annual performance-based bonus programTuition Reimbursement up to 70% and Professional Development up to 100%Candidate Referral ProgramBusiness Casual dress code (includes jeans)SS&C Technologies Canada Corp. fosters a positive, equitable and progressive workforce and is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. We will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process. If you require any accommodation during the application and hiring process, please contact: tacanada@sscinc.comTo further explore this opportunity, please apply through our careers page on the corporate website at www.ssctech.com/careers.No phone calls or email applications please. Build Your Career at Aecon Aecon is proud to build some of the most impactful infrastructure projects of this generation. From the roads and transit systems that connect our communities, to the communication networks that link us from coast-to-coast, and the water infrastructure that supplies our businesses and homes. Our integral work includes constructing the pipelines that join provinces with the energy that fuels the nation, and the airports and ports that connect us all. Aecon is there, safely and sustainably building the future.We lead the infrastructure industry with purpose, and our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our business success relies on strong execution and continuous improvement – driven by the diversity , expertise and teamwork of our employees. We are always searching the globe for exceptional candidates to join the Aecon family and be a part of our forward-thinking, innovative, best-in-class organization!What is the Opportunity?Reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Data Integration & Analytics, the Data Analyst is responsible for implementing procedures for effective data management and data governance within the Business Program Management Office (BPMO).What You’ll Do Here Work (independently) with business units to understand business problems; identify root causes and design metrics that improve processes.  Translate metrics into technical documentation that IS will use to update and modify data warehouses, and data lakes.  Create data visualizations for business process owners and operations teams, with a clear understanding of the different needs of different analytic consumers.  Improve awareness within Aecon of the benefits and use cases for reporting, dashboards, and mobile analytics.  Work closely with the data scientist to create regression and predictive data models.  Work closely with the data engineer and data warehouse team to create business datasets for analysis in SAC, BO, and Power BI.  Perform mapping activities for enterprise data integration.  Assist with development of data management strategies.  Champion data governance and reporting governance with business units.  Support the implementation of rules and procedures for data sharing.  Guarantee adherence to legal and company regulations.  Assist with recognizing and upholding digital security systems to protect delicate information. What You Bring To The Team Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.  A minimum of 3+ years’ experience in data management or analysis.  Ability to decipher and organize large amounts of data.  An analytical mindset with superb communication and problem-solving skills.  Ability to identify complex problems, and to discuss resolutions resolutions clearly and in nontechnical terms.  Experience in Business Objects / SAC / Power BI operational processes and systems.  Willingness to follow strict user experience guidelines.  Committed to following a standard intake and prioritization process  Strong interpersonal skills  Strong skills in performing cost/benefit analysis.  An ability to manage multiple assignments with minimal supervision.  Strong support experience and excellent documentation skills.  Ability to sit for extended periods of time.  Ability to work in an extremely fast paced environment. Aecon fosters diversity , inclusion and belonging within and across our organization. We welcome all to apply including, women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.We are committed to adhering to the objectives and requirements outlined in the Accessible Canada Act (ACA), and to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in a timely manner, through the implementation of the requirements of the ACA and its applicable regulations. If you require accommodation under the ACA Act during any step of the application process please click here.

At Lyft, our mission is to improve people’s lives with the world’s best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.Lyft knows that transportation isn’t just about cars, it’s about enjoying the ride no matter the method. That’s why in 2018, Lyft leaned into micromobility (including bikeshare) in order to provide mobility solutions that people love and cities need.Our Montreal office developed the first automated bikeshare system in America, a system that has since deployed in multiple cities around the world (London, Montreal, New York, San Francisco to name a few). These are also some of the biggest bike-share systems in the world!Montreal Lyft is looking for a Data Analyst on Revenue Growth as part of our Rider team. This analyst will own all of our internal revenue reportings inside TBS. This person will be building self-served revenue performance dashboards but also help prepare and present our recurring internal revenue performance review with the leadership team. They will also conduct multiple analysis on various product performances and pricing analysis to provide cross-functional teams (including Finance, General Managers, Policy) with actionable insights on improvements and problem areas.Responsibilities:Create and maintain Revenue dashboardsHelp maintain and monitor the health of our Revenue data (work on documentation, classifications, etc…)Prepare and present our revenue performance during recurring presentations to the leadership teamImpact size and model the impact of new revenue sources or pricing changes to our business to provide actionable insightsInvestigate and create deep-dive analysis on specific product health or potential issues that might impact our revenue collection healthProvide support to cross-functional partners (Finance, General Managers, Policy) for their specific needsExperience:3+ years of experience in a high-growth environment in data and/or financial analyticsVery strong attention to detail, experience developing processes to remove human errorProficient in SQL and quantitative analysis, you can deep dive into large amounts of data, draw meaningful insights, dissect business issues and draw actionable conclusionsOutcome-driven approach to developing recommendations and demonstrated ability to develop a story and execution plan to support our goals and objectivesGood communication (listening, written, and oral) skills with the ability to present findings and recommendations targeted to the audience in questionAbility to write thorough, scalable, and clear documentationMust be fluent in spoken and written EnglishBenefits:Extended health and dental coverage options, along with life insurance and disability benefitsMental health benefitsFamily building benefitsAccess to a Health Care Savings AccountIn addition to provincial observed holidays, team members get 15 days paid time off, with an additional day for each year of service 4 Floating Holidays each calendar year prorated based off of date of hire10 paid sick days per year regardless of province18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligibleLyft proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Come Work with Us!At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.Job TitleData ScientistJob DescriptionWhat is the opportunity?In this role as a Data Scientist you will analyze, design and implement data science / machine learning solutions using RBC’s enterprise suite of analytics tools. The group specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics. Leveraging leading-edge technologies and capabilities, the group applies machine learning and statistical modelling techniques to help RBC understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities and determine where business improvements can be made.What will you do?Analyze data using statistical, machine learning and analytics techniques to solve complex problems, discover insights and identify business opportunities.Build statistical and machine learning models to test business hypotheses.Collaborate with business partners to produce insights from business-defined requirements and hypothesesQuickly learn new methods, tools and technologies presented in research communities to implement, adapt and innovateEffectively communicate findings to business partners and executives.What do you need to succeed?Must-have Bachelors degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Sociology, Psychology1+ year of experience in data solutions and applying data techniques.Knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data science technologies.1+ year of experience in machine learning, predictive analytics, and statistical modeling.Experience with programing and scripting languages Python, R, Java and SQL.Excellent analytical, problem solving, time management and organizational skills.Nice to have:Familiar with a range of data tools.Experience in programming, scripting languages and data visualization.Familiar with a Linux environment and shell scripting.Familiar with data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types.What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensationLeaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunitiesWork in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing teamOpportunities to do challenging workRBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.RBC exige, à titre de condition d'emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d'entrée en fonction.
