job_title: Senior Associate Data Analyst -Monetization (Google Ad Manager & Google Analytics)
job_desc: As a Sr. Associate, your role is to maintain and advance our data monetization and audience capabilities for our client using first- and third-party customer traits. You will be responsible for the defining, collating and activating customer segments using trait dimensions from across marketing & customer platforms to empower our client’s businesses with valuable insights that help them make better, more informed decisions.You will also help with strategy, creation and activation of data monetization campaigns using tools like Google Ad Manager. You will work closely with Data engineering, media and analytics team members. You will provide inputs and strategy on what’s needed to define required customer’s segments for activation on multiple marketing channels and follow-through to get the same implemented by either internal PS team or the client IT team. You will provide input in the construction of client decks and status documentation.Most importantly, you must possess a strong inner drive to support a growing, enjoy working with some of the finest minds in the industry, and want to be a part of something truly unique that will have a lasting impact. Day to day your role includes · Accountability for daily monitoring and management of customer attributes and dimensions in Google Analytics, Google Ad Manager and LiveRamp for assigned client account(s) and working in partnership with analytics and media teams for reporting on customer segments performance· Stitch customer data points together to create, share and activate audiences so customer’s experiences can be personalized in real time for products and services they interact with on client’s digital properties· Review all customer traits available in given platforms and help define audience strategies for top audience segments based of affinity, demographics, seasonality, and re-targeting· Review current Google Analytics set-up to understand customer behavior, conversion and opportunities on how they engage with media ads and campaigns· Review current Google Ad Manager set-up to identify how campaigns are being delivered for what audiences and how campaigns and audiences can be tweaked for them to perform better· Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, QlikView or Looker) and relational databases· Knowledge in any of the following areas: Programmatic (DMP, DSP, SSP), Cross-Device Measurement, Attribution Modelling· Knowledge of broad range of online advertising media channels from Search, Display Banners, Email, Contextual, Social, CRM· Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points· Interfacing with media strategy and media tech teams to build strategic campaign plans, communicate recommendations, and identify and deliver new solutions in a collaborative fashion· Prepare client deliverables ensuring quality, and that recommendations and work products are sound and viable· Understanding and effectively communicating our value proposition, technology, and processes as related to the growth of current and prospective agency accounts· Participating in forecasting exercises for senior management· Analyzing online user behavior, conversion data and the customer journeys· Strong analytical skills to investigate and understand the opportunities of where A/B testing may be required and analyses the success of tests that have been run· Assisting in training, mentoring, and developing team members· Contributing to the development and documentation of best practices for improving communication and collaboration within the team and the group· Developing and maintaining quality control procedures for audience and campaign implementations· Participating in regular sessions to share and learn new strategies for optimizing and enhancing campaign and audience performance· Embracing and encouraging a culture based on teamwork, collaboration, and intellectual curiosity· Keep up to date with industry trends that are relevant to targeted vertical market markets, as well as general media news We’re looking for a rising data strategist, which typically includes:· In depth understanding and experience working in Google Ad Manager & Google Analytics· Strong experience in data strategy with CDP platforms like mParticle, Adobe Audience Manager etc.· Strong Experience in BI platforms (Tableau, Power BI and/or Looker)· Strong knowledge of DSP platforms and active campaign optimization experience· Experience with data connectivity platforms like LiveRamp· Strong analytical thinking and mathematical/quantitative skills· Solid presentation skills and comfortable presenting to key stakeholders· Excellent communication and writing skills—you’re poised, precise, and above all, kind when relating to others Additional InformationBenefits of Working Here: Flexible vacation policy; time is not limited, allocated, or accrued15 paid holidays throughout the yearGenerous parental leave and new parent transition programTuition reimbursement Corporate gift matching program

POSITION SUMMARY:The Data Insight and Reporting Analyst will work closely with cross-functional leaders within Mortgage Operations to help support the group’s many initiatives. The successful candidate will play a critical role in developing reporting dashboards, monitoring Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and supporting leaders in making timely, data driven decisions. This role will be accountable to help build and execute Business Intelligence (BI) insights, data science models on client behavior, Operations reporting and other financial reporting in addition to business performance metrics. MAJOR ELEMENTS OF THE ROLE  Key accountabilities of this position include:  Provide business intelligence insights and dashboards to leaders in a timely manner  Manage executive reporting, working with leaders to develop relevant metrics and highlight accomplishments  Support Operations group in planning and reporting on, annual plan/performance, projects and initiatives. Working with various business units to align on goals and output  Develop content for executive level presentations regarding business updates, opportunities and risks  Drive business case development for key initiatives through quantitative analysis  Support project and initiative implementation and ongoing reporting and analysis  Support bank business reporting, data and analytics projects Skills And Experience Required Qualifications:  Completed post secondary education in Analytics, Business, Finance or equivalent  Demonstrated experience with SQL, report creation and automation (Celonis)  Advanced Excel skills  Quantitative analysis and financial modeling skills  Attributes:  Detail oriented and organized  Displays integrity and concern for accuracy and ownership of processes and tasks  Strong Verbal, written and presentation skills  Natural collaborator and motivated by team success  Self-starter who will thrive in fast-paced work environment  Working Conditions Unique to Job:  Standard office environment #LL-AA1Apply Now

job_title: Business Information Management Analyst II- EN
job_desc: TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewBusiness Information Management (BIM) at TD is part of a creative, enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Roles in BIM are highly professional and valued, specialized yet inter-connected and focused on making the availability of business information to designers, developers and decision-makers a priority, all with a united purpose to serve customers and continually build a better bank.We're looking for analytical and agile professionals who can merge and translate data into technology and business information, serving today's business needs and setting in motion TD's longer-term goals and strategic objectives.If you get data, its power and potential, we think you'll love working at TD, where data knows no bounds and where your professional expertise will help to drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.Job DescriptionAre you an experienced analytical thinker, at ease working on your own or driving forward the success of your team? If so, this role offers a hands-on and high-career growth opportunity to provide business information management support for a range of activities in data and analytics.Enjoy partnering with and learning from experts? In this experienced professional role, you'll work within your team as well as lead projects or work streams within broader projects, to help design, develop and support key business information management solutions for TD.As Business Information Management Analyst II, You WillFocus on providing specialized business support, in your area of specialtyLead projects or work streams within broader projects of moderate risk and be accountable for managing own work, while acting as contact point for raised issues and ongoing activities, processes and functional programsConduct a range of data analyses, demonstrating your experience with very large datasets and big data technologies; assessing business information-related data requirements aligned to business needs and for specific data platforms, applications systems and serversPartner and collaborate with internal team and business and technology partners to elicit information / data requirements and articulate requirementsResolve data / application issues and support the user community by helping them interpret dataDevelop and maintain knowledge of data available from upstream sources and data within relevant platform / applications (e.g. through data profiling, data quality reporting tools, business metadata capture)Define, build and manage data dictionary / catalogue for data platforms, systems, servers, applicationsGather, review, analyze, profile, validate and map system data warehouse to meet reporting needsRun quality assurance reports and ensure metadata and data lineage is captured, compatible and maintained in compliance with data management tools and processes as well as enterprise data standards, policies and guidelinesParticipate fully as a team member, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality and innovation and, ensure timely communication of issues/points of interestJob RequirementsWhat can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:Undergraduate degree or technical certificateThree (3) or more years relevant experience from a business administration, statistical, mathematical, scientific or financial backgroundSound conceptual knowledge in your area of specialtyFluent in one or more programming languagesStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsSolid knowledge of various data sources, tools and technologies used in preparing summaries/reportsKnowledge of competitor and market trendsStrong ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlinesExpertise in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis methods and reporting techniquesProficient to work together and independently, communicate positively and professionally (both in speaking and writing), follow instructions/direction, and help building positive relationships across teams and functionsAct as a brand champion for our business area / function and TD, both internally and externallyAdditional InformationPreferred candidate available and identifiedInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to design a more enlightened way of working. From our headquarters in San Francisco to eight dedicated Studios and a worldwide team of employees who choose where they work best, our Virtual First approach is leading the way into the future of work.Team DescriptionAt Dropbox, we aim to put the customer at the center of everything we do. With over 500 million users, the Customer Experience (CX) team is at the forefront of simplifying how our users and customers interact with Dropbox. We focus on solutions that work for our customers as well as implementing technologies that will simplify our customers’ journey. We bring the customer voice across the organization to ensure Dropbox delivers the best possible customer experience.Role DescriptionAs a Data Scientist on the Customer Experience (CX) team, you will provide strategic leadership on crafting data-driven solutions that improve the customer experience. You will analyze our vast survey, support ticket, and product usage data sets to identify areas of opportunity and effectively communicate your findings to leadership. You will partner with stakeholders to understand their evolving requirements, collaborate with other analysts and engineers on the team, and craft innovative solutions that are more personalized, more efficient, and more delightful to our customers.You have a passion for customer advocacy and making a big impact. You have a strong understanding of, and real-world experience in, the fields of statistics and NLP. You're a self-starter with an affinity for problem-solving and deep knowledge of data and advanced statistical tools. You have a curious and analytical mindset and are always eager to learn new things.ResponsibilitiesUse machine learning and other advanced statistical methodologies to extract actionable insights from large multi-dimensional customer behavior data sets.Translate complex concepts to a non-technical audience via excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the use of compelling data visualizations.Gather and share best practices and insights internally. Promote a data-driven culture at Dropbox.Utilize natural language processing (NLP) tools to identify trends and patterns from unstructured text data.Proactively engage with stakeholders across Customer Experience (CX) to ensure relevant and accurate delivery of business requirements.Leverage your knowledge of statistics and programming to transform the way CX provides support.RequirementsBS in the field of Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other technical discipline. Master’s degree a plus.5 years of relevant work experience (e.g., as a data scientist) or equivalentProficiency in querying relational databases. Experience with Hive or Snowflake a plus.Proficient in statistical programming languages (e.g.Python and/or R).Solid hands-on experience working with unstructured text data and many different NLP tools.Practical experience with using and understanding algorithms for classification, regression, dimensionality reduction, and clustering.Highly detailed-oriented and exceptional organizational and follow-through skills a must.Excellent at planning and project management.Ability to quickly prototype ideas and use creative approaches for solving complex problems.Strong desire to take initiative, thrives on change, and is comfortable with ambiguity.Independent learner with a keen interest in continuous learning.Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

job_title: Scientifique des données - Client Engineering IBM
job_desc: 558825BRIntroductionVoulez-vous utiliser vos nouvelles compétences techniques et en programmation pour élaborer des projets rapides d'une durée de 6 semaines pour les plus grandes entreprises du monde? Voulez-vous mettre au point certaines des solutions les plus innovantes et les plus marquantes dans le domaine du cloud, de l'IA de confiance, de la sécurité et bien d'autres encore? Si c'est le cas, rejoignez nous au garage technologique d'IBM!Le garage technologique d'IBM est une équipe technique agile d'avant-vente, qui aide nos clients à transformer leur secteur. Nous travaillons directement avec nos clients en petites équipes de développeurs cloud, de scientifiques des données, d'architectes de solutions, de concepteurs et d'autres experts pour développer ensemble de véritables solutions commerciales. Vous bénéficierez non seulement d'une expérience dans les plus grandes marques et industries, mais vous aurez également accès à l'ensemble des équipes de recherche, de services et de produits d'IBM pour aider nos clients à réussir.Cette fonction est pratique. Vous pourrez enrichir vos compétences techniques dans les solutions IBM Cloud et IA les plus récentes, tout en tirant parti des codes source libres pour les industries de pointe. Vous intégrerez des équipes qui travaillent directement avec les clients, définissent des solutions et leur processus de conception à l'ère du cloud et de l'IA.Votre rôle et vos responsabilitésLe Client Engineering d'IBM est une équipe passionnée au service de l'innovation et de la transformation numérique pour nos clients. Les ingénieurs cloud du Client Engineering font partie d'une petite équipe entrepreneuriale qui réalise des projets cocréés avec les clients en mettant à profit des compétences en matière de cloud, de science des données et de programmation. Vous serez l'expert pratique en matière de science des données et d'apprentissage automatique et mettrez à profit vos compétences pour résoudre des problèmes commerciaux réels. Vous pourrez vous spécialiser dans des domaines tels que le NLP/NLU, l'analyse et l'optimisation prescriptives, les MLOps, les solutions d'IA, la vision industrielle, la visualisation des données, etc. Vous travaillerez avec des technologies IBM de pointe, telles que Watson, et vous aurez accès à des bibliothèques et à des frameworks open-source.Programme du sommet d'IBM + formation au Client Engineering technologique :Au cours du programme de perfectionnement, nous fournissons une formation exceptionnelle sur la technologie et les solutions du secteur, accompagnée d'opportunités d'observation et d'une expérience en vente-conseil grâce à une combinaison de cours en classe, de ressources en ligne, d'expériences pratiques sur le terrain et d'accompagnement structuré. Nous vous doterons des connaissances et des compétences nécessaires pour avoir un impact immédiat et atteindre une croissance individuelle en tant que leader.La présente opportunité est offerte à Montréal & Calgary.Le sommet sur la formation nécessite jusqu'à 10 % de deplacements.Jusqu'à 50 % de déplacements (formation post-Sommet) requis comme exemplaire des projets des clients GarageTechnologies De Garage Réussies D' IBMDémontrer une mentalité axée sur la croissance et l' apprentissage continu ; rester au courant des IBM avec une croissance technique pratique en sciences des données et en service informatique du cloudUtiliser les pratiques de développement moderne et méthodes pour planifier et créer des cloud et d'applications d'intelligence artificielleAyez connaissance des tendances technologiques, ainsi que la manière dont la technologie est appliquée pour relever les défis commerciaux.Faire preuve de compétences solides en analyse, en résolution de problèmes et en dépannage combinées à un processus agileMotivation à diriger des projets réussis, objectifs techniques et d'entreprisesSolides compétences professionnelles verbale, écrite et inter - personnelle;Doit être légalement en mesure de se rendre aux États-Unis pour la formation et jusqu'à 50 % des déplacements (post-formation) requis dans le cadre des projets clients de Client Engineering.Pour plus de détails sur le programme du sommet d'IBM , visitez le site : http://www-03.IBM.com/employment/summitSommet 2022Expertise professionnelle et technique requiseLicence ou master en informatique, science des données, mathématiques, statistiques, ingénierie ou disciplines similaires ( DOIT AVOIR OBTENU UN DIPLÔME AU DÉBUT DU PROGRAMMEExpérience en programmation avec Python (de préférence), R , Spark, ou langage dans une discipline similaireDémontrer de la capacité à caractériser un problème opérationnelDémontrer d'une connaissance des concepts statistiques descriptifs et inférentielsDémontrer de la capacité à manipuler et à visualiser des données, à extraire et à communiquer des informations.Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.Doit être capable de voyager aux États-UnisMaîtrise de l'anglais;Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégiéExpérience en développement d'applicationExpérience dans les bibliothèques et cadres de science des données tels que Jupyter Notebooks, scikit-learn, pandas, spark et les technologies de développement telles que Git, REST, pipelines CI/CD, ligne de commande Linux, conteneurs, KubernetesDoit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.Doit avoir les documents de voyage / VISA nécessaires pour voyager aux États-Unis.A propos de l'unité commercialeIBM est présente mondialement, elle exerce ses activités dans plus de 175 pays et la distribution de ses revenus est géographiquement généralisée. L'organisation des marchés mondiaux de l'entreprise est constituée d'une unité commerciale des ventes stratégiques, responsable de la gestion de l'empreinte mondiale d'IBM et étroitement liée avec des unités d'exploitation présentes dans chaque pays pour servir les clients locaux. Ces équipes nationales comptent des directeurs de la relation client à la tête d'équipes intégrées de conseillers, des spécialistes de la solution et des professionnels de la prestation afin de générer la croissance et l'innovation chez le client. En jumelant l'expertise locale à l'expérience mondiale et aux capacités numériques, IBM élargit et approfondit ses relations avec les clients. Cet objectif de gestion locale favorise l'accélération de soutien aux clients, en abordant de nouveaux marchés et en réalisant des investissements dans les opportunités émergentes. De plus, l'organisation des marchés mondiaux sert les clients grâce à son expertise dans leur secteur, ainsi qu'aux produits et services fournis par IBM et ses partenaires. IBM s'appuie également sur les marchés numériques pour étendre sa portée vers des clients nouveaux et existants.Votre vie chez IBMEnvie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.À propos d'IBMLa plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.Énoncé du lieu de travailPour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.Vous et IBM

Reference Number:  9992Department: IT Service ManagementLocation:  Halifax, NSType of Employment: Regular, Full-timeNova Scotia Power’s greatest source of energy is our people. In a culture focused on safety, we’re committed to providing exceptional service to our customers and rewarding jobs to our employees. We’re hiring solution-minded people excited to help us grow into the future. We are currently looking to fill the position of CMDB Asset Data Analyst within our IT Service Management practice.Reporting to the Manager, IT Service Delivery, the CMDB Asset Data Analyst understands and has proven experience with ITIL service asset and configuration management processes in an operational environment and will take the stewardship of NSPI’s centralized IT/OT hardware and software asset repository, CMDB and the enabling technology.This role is a key player contributing to the health and maturity of CMDB and IT/OT asset management. This role also contributes to NSPI's cyber security program success, improves the alignment of IT service asset and configuration management practice within ITIL best practice framework.Key Responsibilities Process ownership of Hardware Asset Management (HAM) and Software Asset Management (SAM) practice. Ensures these processes deliver business values, documented, clearly communicated, understood across the enterprise, and continue growing Asset Management maturity across IT/OT domains.  Contributes to and enables a long-term roadmap of technology capabilities and process improvements related to the HAM and SAM practice  Performs day to day ServiceNow platform administration work specifically related to CMDB, asset management, IT contract management and SAM modules  Primarily responsible for overseeing and driving the integrity and completeness of CMDB asset data  Closely works with other ITSM process owners to perform day-to-day CMDB and technology hardware and software asset data administration;  Works with all the groups within IT operations and across the enterprise where technology assets are captured and managed within the CMDB;  Works with NSPI IT MSP service providers to ensure Asset and Configuration Management processes and policies are being followed;  Delivers regular management report and continually manages the CMDB health dashboard and analytics reporting of measurements and KPI results;  Responsible for the continual improvement of CMDB and asset management related standard, process and procedures. You will be responsible for your personal safety and that of your co-workers by observing all Occupational Health and Safety Rules and Regulations.Skills, Capabilities And Experience Thorough and detail-oriented professional with passion of IT operations data;  2+ years experience in a Service Management discipline with direct exposure and understanding to personal computing, business applications, mobile & telecom and infrastructure support services;  Experience with CMDB/Discovery technology and hands-on experience in using and maintaining CMDB health (CI data and CI relationship completeness and integrity validation) would be considered an asset;  Ability to collect, evaluate and consolidate data and information from multiple sources, resolve conflicts and streamline solutions and tactics;  Proficient in using Microsoft Office software such as Excel, Word, PowerPoint, email and collaboration software to perform data analysis, create reports and process spreadsheets;  Experience with data analytics and/or dashboarding technology would be considered an asset;  Experience in using ITSM solutions and/or ServiceNow platform would be considered an asset;  Effective written and oral communication skills. At Nova Scotia Power, our employees are our greatest strength. Our Leadership Competencies set standards that advance our business strategy, deliver results for customers, and provide career development for employees. As the ideal candidate for this position, you speak up on health, safety, and environment issues, and demonstrate a belief that all injuries are preventable. You support flexibility in the workplace and embrace change. You build strong collaborative relationships with a commitment to a respectful, inclusive, and productive work environment while demonstrating integrity and a commitment to operational excellence for our customers. Lastly, we encourage you to proactively ask questions and seek information to understand how your work relates to the business goals and make well informed decisions.Reports to: Manager, IT Service DeliveryForm of Application: Click the APPLY button at the end of the online job posting. Complete all required information fields, and copy and paste your cover letter and resume into the online form.Salary: Commensurate with qualifications and experience.Must Be Received By: All interested candidates should apply no later than June 1, 2022. Late applications may not receive consideration.Recruitment and Promotion Policy: When filling vacant positions, we are determined to hire the best candidates available. We're committed to providing employees with a fair and equal opportunity to compete for jobs. Hiring and promotion of employees is based on skills, capabilities, knowledge and demonstrated abilities.In accordance with Emera’s occupational health and safety program and the Emera Vaccine Program, subject to any approved accommodation, all employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. For clarity, “fully vaccinated” means 14 days since having the number of doses or combination of doses of a vaccine approved by Health Canada or local public health agencies in the jurisdiction in which they will be employed.At Emera we value diversity, equity, and inclusion. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including persons who identify as racially visible, Indigenous, persons with disabilities, women in underrepresented roles and members of the LGBTQ+ community. Applicants from these equity groups may self-identify through the on-line application process. Emera supports candidates and employees with access and accommodation needs.If you are selected for an interview and require a specific accommodation, please advise our Talent Acquisition team and we will support you with the recruitment process.

Course Hero is scaling! Help us build a world where every student graduates, confident and prepared, through innovative applications of Analytics and Data Science.Are you our dynamic Senior Data Analyst ? You will build statistical models, drive actionable insights, and tackle high-impact business problems. You will tell the story behind your insights – painting a picture to our cross-functional partners, explaining what the numbers are telling us, and recommending new and enhanced product features and A/B tests for implementation.Responsibilities: Define and regularly monitor KPIs, success metrics, and highlight insights to optimize our user experience across all platforms  Lead the analytics roadmap for one of our core business units  Set up and evaluate A/B tests results and push forward next steps at a rigorous pace  Deliver reports and strategic insights through analysis and manual data extractions from various ad platforms, data tools, and internal tracking to drive OKRs  Size the value of different product strategies and initiatives  Effectively communicate findings to internal and external team members  Manage research, development, and delivery of analytical models to be used for strategizing and testing new product enhancements and features Requirements: BS/BA degree in Statistics, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research or related quantitative field  5+ years of experience conducting quantitative product/business analysis  Highly proficient with SQL and visualization tools (e.g. Tableau) and at least one scripting/statistical language (R, Python preferred)  Create analytical frameworks to measure team success: partner with cross-functional teams to define success metrics, create approaches to track the data and troubleshoot errors, quantify and evaluate the data, then develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these KPIs  Excellent communication skills, both written and oral. You are able to establish causal relationships and meaningful insights using statistical methodologies and data  Hands-on experience with experimentation, including design, implementation, and methodologies (e.g. hypothesis testing and regression analysis) for analyzing and interpreting results to stakeholders  Experience with statistical modeling using R (tidyverse, ggplot2,dplyr etc.) or Python with packages such as pandas, statsmodels, and scikit-learn  Experience in querying and manipulating raw datasets for analysis  Comfortable functioning in spaces with high ambiguity and adapt easily to changing environments Bonus Points: Advanced degree in Statistics, Information System & Management, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research or related quantitative field  You understand end-to-end user journeys for web platforms and the challenges of managing user funnels that have multiple attribution touchpoints  Previous experience with a (two-sided) marketplace or fraud detection  Previous experience in the field of education or e-commerce Benefits & Perks!Competitive salary, annual bonus, and RSUsMedical coverage, including full dental and visionLife and disability benefits401(k) program (US) / retirement savings plan (Canada) with company matchOne month paid sabbatical after 5 years at the companyEducation reimbursementProfessional development workshops & industry conferencesPaid parental leaveFlexible work scheduleSocial responsibility program (volunteer time off and donation matching)Annual wellness stipendMonthly tech stipendAnnual family planning stipendMonthly snack boxes delivered to your doorCell phone allowanceFor positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Other locations: IL, MA, NJ.#USCanadaEqual Employment Opportunity Statement (EEO)We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion within our company. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or ability status. job_title: Business Data Analyst - Consumer, Omnia AI
job_desc: Job Type: PermanentPrimary Location: Multiple Locations, Ontario, CanadaAll Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Montreal; Ottawa; VancouverLearn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coachingPartner with clients to solve their most complex problemsBe empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office. Are you passionate about data and technology solutions, driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution? Are you enthusiastic about all things data, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a solid understanding of software development? If you answered yes, then we have an opportunity waiting for you! What will your typical day look like?As a Customer Business Analyst in our Data Modernization & Analytics team within the Omnia AI practice, you are passionate about data and technology solutions, are driven to understand the latest business challenges and its enablement using technology platforms. You will play an active role to architect and design data & technology solutions using industry-leading platforms on client’s ecosystem. You are enthusiastic about large-scale data transformation programs, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a techno-functional experience with ability to engage the Business as well as IT teams with ease.Specifically, in this role, you will: Lead, define, design and implement end-to-end customer data-oriented solutions to solve business challenges, use-cases and features to enrich customer experiences for clients Collaborate with enterprise architects, business architects, marketing analysts, ETL designer and developers to lead data integration requirements and solutions Conduct analysis and incorporate findings, feedback and insights from customer and business research Own solution design and delivery of significant subject areas covering the functional requirements, and co-relate to solution architecture Define and develop solution architectures, lead teams through program delivery journey and mentor junior colleaguesAbout The TeamOmnia AI, Deloitte's Artificial Intelligence practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.As a member of our Data Modernization & Analytics team within our Omnia AI practice, you will help our clients design and implement the data platform architectures that are focused on customer domain, consumer industry – be it in the cloud or on-premises – required to enable cutting-edge AI solutions. You will be part of a practice to deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems, with a focus on Customer Data Platforms, Big Data, BI/DW, Data Integration, Data Governance, Master Data and Analytics applications. Each of these applications leverages a different mix of traditional and innovative technologies to achieve business outcomes.Enough about us, let’s talk about youYou are someone who is: 2+ years of experience working in the consumer industry (Retail, CPG, FMCG, Supply Chain, and other customer related areas) on data and technology delivery programs; understanding of customer 360, loyalty, personalization, marketing related architecture and data flows 2+ years of experience in data lifecycle and ETL design; strong understanding of data management principles, data profiling, and SQL Experience liaising with both the business and technology teams with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts into easy-to-understand non-technical language in order to facilitate, communicate and interact with business stakeholders, working with Agile development methods on data-oriented projects Completed Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Marketing and consumer related areas such as Computer Science, Supply Chain and FMCG, Information Management, Big Data & Analytics, or related field is desired; customer 360 or digital marketing background is an asset; certifications or experience in customer data platforms, cloud data platforms, mar-tech, supply chain, retail, digital marketing technologies is an assetIf you believe you have what it takes to be a successful member of our team please apply now. We know your career is important to you and it's important to us, too. This role is just the first step of a highly successful career we can help you build.Why Deloitte?Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you: You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster. You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful. You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.The next step is yoursSound like The One Firm. For You?At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

EA Sports is hiring an Advanced Data Analyst to support our Football games as part of our Studio Data, and Insights (SDI) team. Reporting to an Analytics Director, you will be part of an analytics team that provides impactful analysis with relevant takeaways for our studio partners.As an Advanced Data Analyst, you will oversee the design, implementation and presentation of major analytical projects such as: feature analysis, player segmentation, predictive modeling, developing data model and dashboards, and more. You will share your findings directly with the development team. You have a natural curiosity, a passion for uncovering insights from data, and enjoy working with a diverse group of partners and collaborate.ResponsibilitiesNavigate ambiguous problems, determine causes and constraints, translate qualitative/quantitative data into applicable insight, and create recommendationsPartner with development teams, brand management, and commercial groups on the creation of a sustainable, longer term strategy for EA's Football products using known and forecasted data about our playersPerform market and business model analysis on other sports titles to help guide strategy and feature planningProvide data-driven insights, with polish, to senior leaders/executives that influence important product decisionsBuild partnerships across the organization, becoming a trusted partner that can manage expectations, timelines, and risks throughout a project life cycleRequirements 6+ years experience in an analytical role working performing quantitative analysis with big data. 3+ years experience managing your deliverables and producing high-quality results, building analysis delivery plans with clear deliverables, ownership, and communication plansA bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, mathematics, engineering, or economics)Expertise in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources with differing structures.Proficiency with a statistical analysis tool (such as R or Python) to perform analysis.Experience with data visualization software packages, e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewThe TD Securities Capital and Liquidity Management Group is part of the Wholesale Banking Finance group and is accountable for all capital reporting/management and capital project initiatives, as well as providing subject matter expertise in liquidity, funding and balance sheet to TDS businesses to ensure the business is making decisions to optimize the financial resources of the Bank. The group is involved in leading or supporting consultations and industry discussions regarding current and upcoming OSFI Capital and Liquidity requirements. This includes preparing a variety of reports, schedules, variance analysis, and commentariesProvide accurate analysis, interpret findings, identify and refer complex issues / situations beyond own level of expertisePerform daily reporting of Leverage, working with the business to understand key movements and ensuring limits are not breachedSupport Capital and Liquidity Management Group, Wholesale Banking in the implementation of the new Basel III reforms, updating processes , and on-going business unit reporting and analysis functionsProvide support to the Group by working with the business to understand growth expectations during the Plan cycle and Forecast submission periodsAct as a subject matter expert and provide guidance and recommendations to Capital and Liquidity Management Group, Wholesale Banking on leverage related mattersBusiness OperationsWork with technology, middle office, operations, accounting and risk management groups to ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness of the leverage processes in accordance with the OSFI Basel III guidelinesFollow up on outstanding issues that ensures proper calculation of leverage to minimize errorIdentify and remediate inefficiencies and process gaps, implement/lead optimization through technological tools (e.g. Alteryx, Tableau, VBA, SQL) and maintain process documentation for existing processesCustomerPartner with Capital and Liquidity Management Group, Wholesale Banking to satisfy ad hoc requests from senior management, front office, and other usersEmployeeAssist in leading the team by leveraging knowledge and sharing experience with junior members of team. Contribute to a positive work environment that encourages development, productivity, professionalism, and teamworkContribute to a positive work environment that encourages development, productivity, professionalism, and teamworkShare knowledge and ensure ongoing and timely communication with the team and management on the status of projects and relevant points of interestParticipate in identification of personal development needs and pursue development / career opportunitiesAdhere to established guidelines of conductJob RequirementsQualifications / Skills / Experience: The Ideal Candidate Will PossessStrong verbal and written communication skills who engages colleagues and business partnersStrong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize, multi-task and maintain strong attention to detailStrong business acumen with a “value-added” mindset - ability to consolidate information into clear and concise analysis3 to 6 years of related work experience in accounting or finance and large data setsAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft AccessAbility to stay resilient under pressure and during times of changeWorks effectively in teams and with multiple partnersAbility to work in a demanding environment and handle deadlines and prioritiesKnowledge of SQL, VBA, Alteryx, TableauSpecific Educational Requirements / AccreditationsDegree in Business Management, Accounting, or FinanceSound understanding of Wholesale banking businesses and productsProfessional accounting / finance designation (CPA/CFA) or pursuing would be an asset#Additional InformationInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers.Join us in driving the next revolution in games.The Challenge AheadAs a Data Analyst you will focus on identifying patterns, risk and opportunity. You are curious and creative with a passion for diving into our data. Can work with our partners along with a tool belt of advanced technical knowledge with SQL and Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets).ResponsibilitiesYou will report to the Development Director and partner with your game team to design interactive and real-time dashboards and provide insights to influence game quality through data-informed insightsAssemble data from multiple sources, conduct analyses, perform research, designs, documents and implement analytical solutionsYou develop scripts and queries to import, manipulate, clean, and transform data from different sourcesYou present analysis conclusions to the game team in a clear, understandable, and valuable way. Tell compelling stories supported by data using Power BIYou oversee your active project, always looking for new problems to solve and new concepts to implementYou build metrics reporting systems and track process improvements across the teamYou converse with your team members and partnersBuild relationships and share knowledgeQualifications2+ years in a past analytical role that involved thinking of big pictures, suggesting changes to process, identifying risks and potential opportunities for data improvement2+ years' experience building dashboards, developing data models and generating visualizationsExpert SQL skills including experience querying complex data sets, NoSQL and elastic search is a bonusUniversity degree in a technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, Operations Research, etc.)You are creative when approaching challenges and solving problemsStrong numeracy skills including statistics, simulation, and optimizationIdeally would have worked in an Agile environment with multiple partners

Join a team of passionate thought leaders in a dynamic and collaborative environment! Cognizant Microsoft Business Group’s Applied Innovation team is hiring now and we’re looking for our next Data Analyst to join us.The Microsoft Business Group (MBG) is a cloud-first, full-service Microsoft partner committed to delivering innovative technology solutions that solve human challenges. We are compelled by our core values to drive transformational results for clients across all company sizes, geographies and industries. The MBG team delivers full lifecycle solutions—from project inception and planning, through deployment to ongoing support and maintenance.Why should you work at Microsoft Business Group?Multi Award Winning Business Official and Award-Winning Microsoft Partner Award Winning Databricks Partner Official GitHub Partner Cloud Native Organization Growing International and Diverse teams Hugely collaborative environment, where ideas and knowledge sharing is actively encouraged What impact will you have in this role?As a Data Analyst in the MBG, your goal will be to enable businesses to maximize the value of their data assets. You will be responsible for designing and building scalable data models, cleaning, and transforming data, and enabling advanced analytics capabilities through reports and visualizations. You will process raw data into relevant insights based on identified business requirements to deliver relevant insights.What will the Data Analyst be doing day-to-day?Commanding a strong understanding of the strategic infrastructure (preferably Azure) required to make Business Intelligence rollout a success in the business at scale Development of presales package and drive Business Intelligence and Data Modelling offering in the consultancy business Contribute to or lead large scale DW/BI projects delivering an end-to-end Data Analytics delivery for customers Data modelling capabilities including designing effective BI data models Shaping an approach for governance and deployment of DW/BI in an array of organizations Making large or complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable.Creating charts and graphs, histograms, geographical maps, and other visual models that help to explain the meaning of large volumes of data, and isolate areas of interest.Transforming, improving, and integrating data from many sources, depending on the business requirements.Combining the data result sets across multiple cloud and on-premises sourcesFinding hidden patterns using dataDelivering information in a useful and appealing way to users by creating rich graphical dashboards and reportsWhat type of experience does the Data Analyst need to be successful in this role? Being a natural leader with strong experience of end to end roll out of DW/BI solutions with a vision of how this technology can transform business Drive cultural change within businesses both externally and internally Working collaboratively internally with senior leads and with partners to deliver solutions and drive an integrated vision of DW/BI and cloud technology Embedding tangible and accessible data led change in a business. Strong understanding of Microsoft DW/BI enterprise methodologies and roll-out methodologies Strong understanding of dimensional modeling concepts – facts vs. dimensions, surrogate keys, and data granularityAbility to lead and guide discussions about conceptual, logical, and physical modellingStrong experience as a Business Intelligence developer using the Microsoft BI stack (Power BI)Expert knowledge of DAX/MDX and Analysis Services in large deployments of Power BIWorking experience of SQL including writing, debugging, and tuning T-SQL queries, creating SQL tables, views and stored procedures and a strong understanding of relational databasesExperience in designing ETL processes including knowledge of data warehousing strategies and theories Articulate and document architectural solutions and processes Establish and maintain collaborative relationships with stakeholders Knowledge of cloud computing, preferably of Azure Excellent and confident communication and presentations skillsCertifications (desirable) Exam DA-100: Analyzing Data with Microsoft Power BI or Exam PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data AnalystDoes the Data Analyst role require travel?The role is currently 100% working from home, however some travel to our local office may be required in the future.Security ResponsibilityAll employees must act in accordance with Cognizant Microsoft Business Group’s corporate security standards.About The Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (mbg)The Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG) has a singular purpose—advancing your cloud modernization journey with focus, simplicity and scale. The Microsoft Business Group is an end-to-end Microsoft-centric cloud solutions and managed services provider that leverages extensive experience and IP to deliver constant innovation and business value, powered by the Microsoft Cloud platform. We are designed to reflect how you think about cloud transformation from a platform native perspective. Our dedicated experts and trusted blueprint deliver your digital difference through the Microsoft Cloud: Azure, Microsoft 365 and Dynamics 365. We turn digital potential into real business performance at speed.Who We AreWe are the destination employer for Microsoft-committed professionals, providing depth of specialization and differentiated career paths. We have authentic conversations, build connections and grow careers while centering ourselves around our employees. We are a global team of certified consultants across all relevant technologies, coupled with cloud focused advisory consultants. With our supercharged talent, we are the world’s best Microsoft partner. We prioritize investing and expanding.EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITYAs a Global Cloud Transformation Consultancy business, the Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG) understands diversity and inclusion in the workplace brings benefits to our customers, our business and most importantly, our people. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and we provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment.The Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG) prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other factors protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including all aspects of the recruiting and employment life-cycle at Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG).

At Saputo, our best comes from our people. We’re a talented and caring team with a longstanding history of excellence. Since our first days delivering cheese on a bicycle, we’ve grown into a leading global dairy processor by staying true to the culture that defines us. Each of our employees is committed to uphold our tradition of care, quality, and passion through food, and together, we foster an environment where we can all make contributions that matter–from our manufacturing plants to our office locations and everywhere in-between.Overview Of The RoleReporting to the Sr. Director of Global Service Delivery, this role leads the design and implementation of reporting and KPI tracking to support Global Service Delivery. This role is responsible for contributing to continual improvement by identifying reporting requirements, gathering and analyzing data, preparing ad-hoc and regular reporting, developing recommendations and analysis based on reporting, and introducing process improvements throughout the reporting process.How You Will Make Contributions That Matter:Lead the establishment of reporting processes and definition of KPIs to optimize service, efficiency, and cost.Conduct analysis on reporting and KPIs and drive continuous improvement of service management operations.Responsible for collecting data, analyzing data, and developing service management reports and dashboards.Provide reporting to support integrated service management governance processes and meetings.Create ad-hoc reporting to support decision making and identify opportunities related to service management.Work with third party vendors to share reporting requirements, establish reporting & KPIs, and monitor and track KPIs.Develop, monitor, and track KPIs related to Global Service Delivery, and identify areas of gaps.Train teams in the use of reporting systems and how to prepare and analyze reports.Identify risks, issues, and opportunities, and implement recommendations related to reporting.Continuously evaluate reporting needs, process gaps, automation opportunities and training/support needs to support the Global Service Delivery strategic roadmap.You Are Best Suited for The Role If You Have the Following Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business, or a quantitative major.3-5+ years’ experience designing and developing reporting processes (e.g., scorecards, dashboards)Strong quantitative analysis experience and high attention to detail; ability to analyze reports, diagnose opportunities, develop recommendations, and drive follow ups.Knowledge of common ITSM processes, tools, and best practices.Proficient knowledge and experience using BI reporting tools (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau), Excel, programming, and data management skills.Ability to understand complex reporting requirements and propose reporting solutions.Strong interpersonal skills and team orientation.We support and care for our employees and their families by providing:Competitive salariesAdvantageous corporate agreementsFull range of group insurance benefitsGroup retirement pension plan with employer contributionPurchase option of company stocksGroup RRSPHealth and wellness program in the workplaceAssistance program for employees and their familiesSaputo products at a discounted priceWe support employment equity. Saputo strives to embed diversity and inclusion in its operations and invites candidates from all horizons to join its family.Our story began in Canada in 1954, when the Saputo family's hard work and dedication created a thriving dairy business. More than 65 years later, our roots in this country remain strong with our Corporate Headquarters in Montréal. Today, we are a leading cheese manufacturer and fluid milk and cream processor in Canada with well-loved brands, such as Saputo, Alexis de Portneuf, Armstrong, Baxter, Dairyland, Joyya, Milk2Go, Milk2Go Sport, Neilson, Nutrilait, Scotsburn* and Woolwich Goat Dairy. Thanks to our national footprint, we're proud to bring our best to our customers and consumers, and have plenty of opportunities for our employees to grow in their own way. And we do it while also striving to build a healthier future for our people and the communities where we operate, guided by our values and the Saputo Promise. To learn more about Saputo in Canada, please click here. (http://saputo.com/en/our-products/canada-sector)Join the Saputo Dairy Products Canada team to make your contributions matter every day! Team-oriented and demonstrates collaborative skills. job_title: Senior Financial Data and Reporting Analyst
job_desc: Posted by                  Emma Delli Fraine, CHRP             Talent Acquisition Specialist at Maples Group                                     Send InMail                    Position: Senior Financial Data and Reporting AnalystLocation: Montreal, CanadaThe Maples Group has operated in Montreal since 2009. The Group is a standard bearer in financial services, trusted by many of the world’s largest hedge fund managers, private asset firms and international corporations. In 2022, the Group was again recognized as one of Montreal's Top Employers by the publisher of Canada's Top 100 Employers list.Our distinction flows from our carefully curated team: 2,000+ professionals characterised by tenacity, ethics and exacting excellence. We hire smart and sharpen smarter, arming talent with best-in-class resources and skills. With 18 locations across the Americas, Asia, Europe and the Middle East, our international presence offers a unique springboard for career development and cross-cultural immersion. Our side-by-side financial and legal services are similarly ripe for interdisciplinary learning and growth.The Maples Group looks to add Montreal, Canada-based Senior Financial Data and Reporting Analyst to our team and invites eager and qualified candidates to apply. We are committed to diversity, inclusion and equality of opportunity as we attract, retain and develop world-class talent.Who We SeekOur merit-based culture suits professionals in pursuit of boundless careers and lives. Beyond their acumen, team members are collaborative and conscientious, bringing a healthy sense of drive and purpose to each interaction and to all aspects of their work.About the RoleThe Senior Data and Reporting Analyst will join a global team that is responsible for supporting portfolio accounting, operations and reporting functions in Montreal in order to provide services to our global Middle Office clients. Primary responsibilities include:reporting directly to the Vice President, the successful candidate will be involved in the day-to-day operational support of our institutional clients;the Senior Data and Reporting Analyst will be responsible for supporting all aspects of portfolio accounting and performance, as well as elements of process analysis and re-engineering;He/she will ensure that portfolio accounting data is maintained in relevant systems in a timely and accurate manner;design and implement processes for accounting and reporting; assist in client on-boarding process for new clients; assist in gathering client requirements and reporting;demonstrate keen awareness of industry and technology;work with internal and external parties to resolve issues and further develop bespoke client solutions.participate in various projects.complete periodic regulatory and risk reporting for a diverse set of clients.What You BringIn addition to indisputably high ethical standards and autonomy, the ideal candidate possesses the following:the ideal candidate will have a university degree in finance or accounting;a minimum of 2-3 years’ work experience in finance, accounting or financial services;fund accounting or fund administration specific experience is an asset;strong technical and systems skillsexperience in relationship management and client service;skills for this role are as follows:strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel. VBA macros, a big asset.excellent time management, organizational, prioritization, and communication skills.autonomous/self-starterBenefits & RewardsThe most enduring professional relationships are reciprocal relationships. The Maples Group prioritises employee health and wellbeing. Depending on your location, we offer a range of benefits, including:Comprehensive health coverage (medical, dental and optical)Competitive vacation packagesEducational assistance and professional development programmesSavings or pension planLife insuranceTravel insuranceGlobal mental wellness programmeSports clubs and social eventsAbout the Maples Group Over five decades, the Maples Group has grown from modest beginnings into one of the world's preeminent professional services firms, offering specialised fiduciary, fund administration, regulatory and compliance, entity formation and management and legal services on the laws of the British Virgin Islands, the Cayman Islands, Ireland, Jersey and Luxembourg.You can learn more about the Maples Group on our corporate website. Experience our culture and our people on our Careers Page or on LinkedIn.Disclaimer: All personal information collected during the application process will be used for recruitment-related purposes only. Please refer to our Job Applicant Privacy Notice at maples.com/privacy for details on how we handle personal information relating to job applicants.Poste : Analyste principal des données financières et des rapportsEmplacement : Montréal, CanadaLe Groupe Maples est un porte-étendard des services financiers et juridiques auquel font confiance de nombreux gestionnaires de fonds de couverture, sociétés de capital-investissement et entreprises internationales parmi les plus importants au monde.Notre distinction est établie grâce à notre équipe soigneusement formée : plus de 2 000 professionnels qui font preuve de ténacité, d’éthique et d’excellence. Nous recrutons des personnes intelligentes et perfectionnons leurs talents en leur fournissant les meilleures ressources et en développant leurs compétences. Répartie dans 18 emplacements en Amérique, en Asie, en Europe et au Moyen-Orient, notre présence internationale offre un tremplin unique pour le perfectionnement professionnel et l’immersion interculturelle. Nos services financiers et juridiques sont également favorables à l’apprentissage et à la croissance interdisciplinaires.Le Groupe Maples cherche à ajouter un analyste principal des données financières et des rapports à son équipe de Montréal, au Canada, et invite les candidats enthousiastes et qualifiés à poser leur candidature. Nous nous engageons à favoriser la diversité, l’inclusion et l’égalité des chances en attirant, en maintenant en poste et en perfectionnant des talents de classe mondiale.Candidats recherchésNotre culture axée sur le mérite convient aux professionnels en quête d’une carrière et d’une vie sans limites. En plus de leur expertise, les membres de l’équipe sont coopératifs et consciencieux. Ils possèdent une grande motivation et se fixent des buts à atteindre, ce qui se reflète dans chacune de leurs interactions et dans tous les aspects de leur travail.À propos du posteL’analyste principal des données et des rapports se joindra à une équipe mondiale responsable du soutien des fonctions de comptabilité de portefeuille, d’exploitation et de production de rapports à Montréal afin de fournir des services à nos clients internationaux du suivi du marché. Les principales responsabilités du candidat retenu seront les suivantes :relevant directement du vice-président, le candidat retenu participera au soutien opérationnel quotidien de nos clients institutionnels;l’analyste principal des données et des rapports sera responsable du soutien de tous les aspects de la comptabilité et du rendement du portefeuille, ainsi que des éléments d’analyse et de refonte des processus;veiller à ce que les données relatives à la comptabilité du portefeuille soient tenues à jour dans les systèmes pertinents de manière opportune et précise;concevoir et mettre en œuvre des processus automatisés pour la comptabilité et la production de rapports; participer au processus d’intégration de nouveaux clients; aider à documenter les exigences et à produire des rapports relatifs aux clients;mettre en œuvre sa connaissance approfondie de l’industrie et de la technologie;collaborer avec des parties internes et externes pour résoudre des problèmes et élaborer des solutions personnalisées pour les clients;traduire les exigences de l’entreprise en spécifications techniques pour les développeurs;participer à divers projets de nature technique;remplir des rapports périodiques sur la réglementation et les risques pour un ensemble diversifié de clients.Votre contributionEn plus d’une autonomie et de normes en matière d’éthique incontestablement élevées, le candidat idéal possédera les caractéristiques suivantes :le candidat idéal sera titulaire d’un diplôme universitaire en finance ou en comptabilité;au moins deux à trois ans d’expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de la finance ou des services financiers;une expérience en comptabilité ou en administration de fonds, un atout;de solides compétences sur les plans des techniques et des systèmesde l’expérience en gestion des relations et en service client.principales compétences pour ce poste sont les suivantes :solide connaissance de Microsoft Excel, y compris les macros VBA;SQL ou autres langages de programmation, un atout;connaissance du cadre de gestion de projet;excellentes aptitudes en matière de gestion du temps, d’organisation, d’établissement de priorités et de communication;autonomie et sens de l’initiative.Avantages sociaux et récompensesSelon votre lieu de résidence, nous vous offrons une gamme d’avantages sociaux, notamment :une protection complète en matière de santé (soins médicaux, soins dentaires et soins de la vue);des offres de vacances compétitives;des programmes d’aide à l’éducation et de perfectionnement professionnel;un régime de retraite ou d’épargne;une assurance vie;une assurance voyage;un programme global de bien-être mental;des clubs sportifs et des activités sociales.Clause de non-responsabilité : tous les renseignements personnels recueillis au cours du processus de candidature seront utilisés uniquement aux fins de recrutement. Veuillez consulter notre avis sur la protection de la vie privée des demandeurs d’emploi à l’adresse maples.com/privacy (en anglais seulement) pour en savoir plus sur la manière dont nous gérons leurs renseignements personnels.

POSTE À L'INTERNE : Conseiller(ère) principal(e) en gouvernance de donnéesTrouvez votre idéal LÀ!Vous désirez libérer votre potentiel dans une équipe dynamique et soudée? Vous êtes à un tournant de votre vie professionnelle? Vous voulez des défis stimulants dans un environnement favorisant l’équilibre et l’épanouissement? Chez Promutuel Assurance, nous nous distinguons par notre approche humaine, tant à l’égard de nos employés que de nos membres-assurés. Participez au succès d’une fière mutuelle d’ici qui protège les gens d’ici.Un aperçu de ce qui vous attend chez nous :Vous évoluerez dans une organisation en pleine transformation qui mise sur l’agilité et l’innovation.Vous profiterez d’une réelle considération humaine, où l’écoute et l’entraide sont au cœur des décisions.Vous travaillerez avec des personnes passionnées et dévouées dans un esprit d’équipe hors du commun.Votre quotidien sera rythmé par les défis et les projets.Vous bénéficierez d’un accompagnement dans l’atteinte de vos objectifs professionnels.Des avantages qui changent tout :Rémunération concurrentielle avec échelles évolutivesHoraire flexible permettant de conserver un équilibre travail-vie personnelleCongés mobiles dès la première annéePossibilité de télétravail en mode hybrideAssurance collective pour vous et votre familleTélémédecine gratuite pour vous et votre familleRégime de retraite à prestations déterminées avec participation de l’employeurActivités sociales organisées par l’employeur et initiatives de bénévolatRabais sur vos assurances auto et habitationProgramme d’aide aux employésÀ propos du posteVous entrerez en fonction à notre bureau de Québec ou de Longueuil (possibilité de télétravail ou en mode hybride).Dans ce nouveau rôle de conseiller(ère) principal(e) en gouvernance de données, vous aurez le mandat de veiller à l’implantation de la feuille de route et des activités d’intendance, de superviser la collecte, l’accès et l’utilisation des données, tout en gérant leurs conformités aux lois en vigueur.À quoi ressemblera votre semaine de travail?Proposer des orientations sur les axes stratégiques et opérationnelsSuperviser les travaux effectués et s’assurer du bon déroulement des activitésParticiper au comité directeur sur
