job_title: Scientifique des données - Client Engineering IBM
job_desc: 558825BRIntroductionVoulez-vous utiliser vos nouvelles compétences techniques et en programmation pour élaborer des projets rapides d'une durée de 6 semaines pour les plus grandes entreprises du monde? Voulez-vous mettre au point certaines des solutions les plus innovantes et les plus marquantes dans le domaine du cloud, de l'IA de confiance, de la sécurité et bien d'autres encore? Si c'est le cas, rejoignez nous au garage technologique d'IBM!Le garage technologique d'IBM est une équipe technique agile d'avant-vente, qui aide nos clients à transformer leur secteur. Nous travaillons directement avec nos clients en petites équipes de développeurs cloud, de scientifiques des données, d'architectes de solutions, de concepteurs et d'autres experts pour développer ensemble de véritables solutions commerciales. Vous bénéficierez non seulement d'une expérience dans les plus grandes marques et industries, mais vous aurez également accès à l'ensemble des équipes de recherche, de services et de produits d'IBM pour aider nos clients à réussir.Cette fonction est pratique. Vous pourrez enrichir vos compétences techniques dans les solutions IBM Cloud et IA les plus récentes, tout en tirant parti des codes source libres pour les industries de pointe. Vous intégrerez des équipes qui travaillent directement avec les clients, définissent des solutions et leur processus de conception à l'ère du cloud et de l'IA.Votre rôle et vos responsabilitésLe Client Engineering d'IBM est une équipe passionnée au service de l'innovation et de la transformation numérique pour nos clients. Les ingénieurs cloud du Client Engineering font partie d'une petite équipe entrepreneuriale qui réalise des projets cocréés avec les clients en mettant à profit des compétences en matière de cloud, de science des données et de programmation. Vous serez l'expert pratique en matière de science des données et d'apprentissage automatique et mettrez à profit vos compétences pour résoudre des problèmes commerciaux réels. Vous pourrez vous spécialiser dans des domaines tels que le NLP/NLU, l'analyse et l'optimisation prescriptives, les MLOps, les solutions d'IA, la vision industrielle, la visualisation des données, etc. Vous travaillerez avec des technologies IBM de pointe, telles que Watson, et vous aurez accès à des bibliothèques et à des frameworks open-source.Programme du sommet d'IBM + formation au Client Engineering technologique :Au cours du programme de perfectionnement, nous fournissons une formation exceptionnelle sur la technologie et les solutions du secteur, accompagnée d'opportunités d'observation et d'une expérience en vente-conseil grâce à une combinaison de cours en classe, de ressources en ligne, d'expériences pratiques sur le terrain et d'accompagnement structuré. Nous vous doterons des connaissances et des compétences nécessaires pour avoir un impact immédiat et atteindre une croissance individuelle en tant que leader.La présente opportunité est offerte à Montréal & Calgary.Le sommet sur la formation nécessite jusqu'à 10 % de deplacements.Jusqu'à 50 % de déplacements (formation post-Sommet) requis comme exemplaire des projets des clients GarageTechnologies De Garage Réussies D' IBMDémontrer une mentalité axée sur la croissance et l' apprentissage continu ; rester au courant des IBM avec une croissance technique pratique en sciences des données et en service informatique du cloudUtiliser les pratiques de développement moderne et méthodes pour planifier et créer des cloud et d'applications d'intelligence artificielleAyez connaissance des tendances technologiques, ainsi que la manière dont la technologie est appliquée pour relever les défis commerciaux.Faire preuve de compétences solides en analyse, en résolution de problèmes et en dépannage combinées à un processus agileMotivation à diriger des projets réussis, objectifs techniques et d'entreprisesSolides compétences professionnelles verbale, écrite et inter - personnelle;Doit être légalement en mesure de se rendre aux États-Unis pour la formation et jusqu'à 50 % des déplacements (post-formation) requis dans le cadre des projets clients de Client Engineering.Pour plus de détails sur le programme du sommet d'IBM , visitez le site : http://www-03.IBM.com/employment/summitSommet 2022Expertise professionnelle et technique requiseLicence ou master en informatique, science des données, mathématiques, statistiques, ingénierie ou disciplines similaires ( DOIT AVOIR OBTENU UN DIPLÔME AU DÉBUT DU PROGRAMMEExpérience en programmation avec Python (de préférence), R , Spark, ou langage dans une discipline similaireDémontrer de la capacité à caractériser un problème opérationnelDémontrer d'une connaissance des concepts statistiques descriptifs et inférentielsDémontrer de la capacité à manipuler et à visualiser des données, à extraire et à communiquer des informations.Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.Doit être capable de voyager aux États-UnisMaîtrise de l'anglais;Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégiéExpérience en développement d'applicationExpérience dans les bibliothèques et cadres de science des données tels que Jupyter Notebooks, scikit-learn, pandas, spark et les technologies de développement telles que Git, REST, pipelines CI/CD, ligne de commande Linux, conteneurs, KubernetesDoit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.Doit avoir les documents de voyage / VISA nécessaires pour voyager aux États-Unis.A propos de l'unité commercialeIBM est présente mondialement, elle exerce ses activités dans plus de 175 pays et la distribution de ses revenus est géographiquement généralisée. L'organisation des marchés mondiaux de l'entreprise est constituée d'une unité commerciale des ventes stratégiques, responsable de la gestion de l'empreinte mondiale d'IBM et étroitement liée avec des unités d'exploitation présentes dans chaque pays pour servir les clients locaux. Ces équipes nationales comptent des directeurs de la relation client à la tête d'équipes intégrées de conseillers, des spécialistes de la solution et des professionnels de la prestation afin de générer la croissance et l'innovation chez le client. En jumelant l'expertise locale à l'expérience mondiale et aux capacités numériques, IBM élargit et approfondit ses relations avec les clients. Cet objectif de gestion locale favorise l'accélération de soutien aux clients, en abordant de nouveaux marchés et en réalisant des investissements dans les opportunités émergentes. De plus, l'organisation des marchés mondiaux sert les clients grâce à son expertise dans leur secteur, ainsi qu'aux produits et services fournis par IBM et ses partenaires. IBM s'appuie également sur les marchés numériques pour étendre sa portée vers des clients nouveaux et existants.Votre vie chez IBMEnvie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.À propos d'IBMLa plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.Énoncé du lieu de travailPour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.Vous et IBM

job_title: Data Analyst / Fraud/ Subject Matter Expert
job_desc: Posted by                  Russell Goodright             f5 Technical Recruiting Group                                     Send InMail                    Job DescriptionData Analyst / Fraud/ Subject Matter ExpertFTE/ RemoteToday, F5 identifies and stops automated attacks and fraud in web and mobile applications for the Fortune Global 2000. In the future, we’ll need to fight even more sophisticated adversaries while helping human users experience frictionless digital experiences. Come be a part of our unparalleled team that is responsible for making the Internet a safer place for everyone.The PositionF5 is seeking a driven, analytical, articulate, and highly professional data analyst to help deliver anti-fraud solutions and communicating the value of our products to external audiences. The Data Analyst / Fraud SME will work specifically on data analysis and build summaries to drive improved performance of our products and understanding for our customers.We are looking for an analyst who has a nose for identifying fraud and anomalous patterns in huge and often messy datasets who is also adept at using these insights to craft compelling narratives for external audiences. The ideal candidate also has a penchant for working closely with enterprise customers, gaining a deep sense of customer empathy, and a desire to deliver outstanding value to them in content.Responsibilities:Work with the data science team to instrument products, build models, interpret, and visualize data sets.Using your strong analytical skills, you will find insights in data to develop both internal and external communication. You will be responsible for translating data insights into narratives that speak to your audiences’ experiences and pain points. Audiences include customers, technologists in the security and fraud space, internal stakeholders and beyond.Develop your own strong voice to promote thought leadership on behalf of Shape Security and F5.Work closely with customers to quickly understand their fraud challenges and identify how F5 might be able to help them successfully fight fraud.Identify useful data from customers’ web and mobile applications and engineer relevant features for fraud models.Communicate clearly and effectively with internal teams (sales, customer success, product, engineering, etc.) and with customers on the performance of machine learning models, as well as other fraud and data science issues.Provide feedback to internal Shape teams on data science, product, engineering issues, and suggest process improvements.Requirements:The ideal candidate has:Strong analytical skills including the ability to manipulate, model, interpret, and visualize large quantities of structured data.Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.Experience building and deploying machine learning models on large-scale data. Experience working with highly unbalanced data (e.g., commonly found in fraud use cases) a strong plus.A passion for delighting customers and an aptitude for engaging with customers on fraud, security, and machine learning issues on a regular basis.Prior experience working with customers on complex fraud or security issues.Familiarity with common web and mobile technologies.Strong interpersonal and communication skills with ability to interpret complex data insights into digestible information for internal stakeholders and customers.Self-motivation, drive and persistence when tackling the most difficult problems.Ability to work well both independently and as part of an agile team.A demonstrated enthusiasm and capacity to learn new technologies quickly.A scrappy yet meticulous approach and a love for problem solving!#LI- HybridThe Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.Phishing AlertPlease note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).Equal Employment OpportunityIt is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability,marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

job_title: People Services Data Analyst - GO Rail Expansion (RER)
job_desc: Build Your Career at Aecon Aecon is proud to build some of the most impactful infrastructure projects of this generation. From the roads and transit systems that connect our communities, to the communication networks that link us from coast-to-coast, and the water infrastructure that supplies our businesses and homes. Our integral work includes constructing the pipelines that join provinces with the energy that fuels the nation, and the airports and ports that connect us all. Aecon is there, safely and sustainably building the future.We lead the infrastructure industry with purpose, and our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our business success relies on strong execution and continuous improvement – driven by the diversity, expertise and teamwork of our employees. We are always searching the globe for exceptional candidates to join the Aecon family and be a part of our forward-thinking, innovative, best-in-class organization!What is the Opportunity?Aecon Concessions and Deutsche Bahn International Operations have formed a partnership to operate and maintain the Regional Express Rail (RER) network in the Greater Hamilton and Toronto Area (GHTA), Canada.The partnership will be called ONxpress Operations Inc and the combined experience and capability of the ONxpress partnership enable us to bring the international experience of designing, constructing, and operating rapid transit solutions in high-density population and urbanization locations.Reporting directly to the Head of People Services, the People Services Data Analyst will be responsible for compiling and analyzing ONxpress Operations and Maintenance Company’s workforce data in order to develop a process and dashboard to monitor workforce planning analytics on an ongoing basis. This includes providing support for all organizational workforce analytics, HR Technology and Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) programs.What You’ll Do Here Oversee the accuracy of data and deliverables of reporting to various stakeholders  Troubleshoot data issues as required  Coordinate and support the data/report requests for the HR team and the business  Create and run moderate to complex queries and data requests to support management in making decisions related to human capital management, succession planning and strategic business initiatives. Also provide scenario planning, forecasting, and future state modeling of workforce analytics  Support the team in addressing HR issues that require new approaches, complex solutions and involve expertise and knowledge of HR data, information systems, and analysis  Act as a key contributor to the workforce planning processes, ensuring integration with business planning and operational staffing plans  Contribute to HR system implementations, ensuring all current and future reporting and analytics requirements are considered and planned for  Provide technical guidance and training to HR on appropriate use of HRIS and reports  Contribute to cross-functional teams to address complex people resources issues  Optimize existing workforce planning tools and provide recommendations on attaining efficiencies and use of alternate tools  Develop performance measures and monitoring tools to support the forecasting, reporting, and analysis of key measurements, trends, and benchmarks assisting the business in making employee-related decisions and demonstrating the return on investment of HR initiatives What You Bring To The Team A degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related area of study with emphasis in the business planning and/or data analytics field  3-5 years of relevant experience in the areas of Workforce Planning, Reporting and HR Analytics  Experienced in the use of HRIS systems and applications, implementation experience highly desirable  Highly process oriented with developed quantitative and qualitive analytical skills, problem solving ability and critical thinking skills  Demonstrated technical competence in creating complex reports, dashboards, and visualizing effective metrics  Advanced research and data analysis skills and a demonstrated ability to draw associated insights and make effective recommendations  Demonstrated ability and confidence in presenting complex technical information to end users  Progressive and forward thinking with the demonstrated ability to develop clear and concise recommendations  Ability to successfully navigate a fast-paced, complex, and changing work environment, while managing multiple and shifting priorities  Knowledge of statistical methods (i.e. regression analysis, forecasting and modelling etc.)  Advanced capability with all Microsoft Office related products  Strong ability to collaborate with others in order to achieve the best results and deliver the most value Aecon has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.If you require accommodation during any step of the application process please click here.

Led by funding from Crosslink Capital, Bullpen Capital and Y Combinator, Roofr started as a managed marketplace for roofing providing roofing estimates in seconds through satellite imagery. We’re now building an all-in-one sales platform for roofers to grow their business- from fast and accurate satellite roof measurements to project-winning proposals. Our mission is to ensure every family across North America has access to protect their home with an affordable roof. As the Data Analyst, you will work with various teams to turn data into information, insights, and actionable business decisions.What You’ll Do:Interpret data and analyze results and provide ongoing and expanding reporting;Implement, maintain, clean, and transform data sources into well organized data structures for fast, repeatable reporting and analysis;Cleaning and reorganizing data for analysis;Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets;Presenting findings in an easy-to-understand way to inform data-driven decisions.What You’ll Bring:4+ years of proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst;Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques;Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Metabase, Tableau, Looker, Business Objects, etc), databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL etc), programming (Python, Javascript, or ETL frameworks);Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.Who You Are:A strong communicator with great presentation skills;Analytical with a demonstrated ability to utilize data to make informed decisions;Highly organized and able to prioritize and juggle multiple projects at once;You are a critical thinker who doesn’t settle for the status quo;You are obsessed with customer experience.What You’ll Get:Competitive compensation and equity;Health benefits from day 1;Flexible PTO;Remote-first culture with home office set-up.PS: Even though we're a remote company, we still manage to do kick ass retreats twice a year! Roofr is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building an organization that empowers inclusion and diversity. We encourage candidates and employees to be true to themselves and express all aspects of their identities.

Description Job Summary: The M&A Data Integrity Analyst will be responsible for the data quality and data integrity in our portfolio accounting systems and other platforms. Essential Job Functions for this position will include:  Build positive relationships with internal customers and Acquisitions; develop rapport with teams in different functional areas across the organization to provide high quality service.  Migrate all Acquisition assets on platform and off platform to Mercer systems.  Build positive relationships with custodians and portfolio accounting vendor and other platforms.  Regularly communicate and collaborate with Acquisitions, employees, and external business partners to solve data issues and problems.  Ensure all custodial data is linked and feeding to the portfolio accounting systems and/or relevant systems.  Identify and correct data feed/links and data quality issues.  Ensure portfolio accounting reports and statements are accurate including cost basis, valuation, investment performance (IRR and TWRR).  Apply functions and advanced formulas to chart, analyze, and interpret large data sets. Qualifications Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:  Bachelor's degree in Business, or equivalent in work experience.  Previous experience in financial services industry preferred.  Strong customer service and communication skills.  Portfolio Accounting system experience preferred; Envestnet, Orion, Black Diamond.  Strong understanding and experience with financial reporting: cost basis, valuation, investment performance (IRR and TWRR)  Experience with large amounts of data, and proven technical skills.  Passionate about client services and client satisfaction.  Passionate about effective problem solving.  Detail oriented and the ability to prioritize issues for appropriate escalation.  Possess excellent organizational skills and documentation methodologies.  Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required.  SQL, query writing, and SQL Server Reporting Services experience a plus.  Working Conditions:  Professional office environment. Working inside. Standing and sitting. Will be assigned to a workstation. No heavy lifting over 25 lbs.

LIFE AT BRPWe create innovative ways to move - on snow, water, asphalt. In the air, on the ground and everywhere in between.Built on a 75-year tradition of ingenuity and intensive customer focus, BRP is headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec and operates manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, and Austria. We have a total workforce of more than 14 500 driven, resourceful people.Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex, Stacer and Savage boats, Evinrude and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts, motorcycles and recreational aircraft. We support our lines of product with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business to fully enhance your riding experience.Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.We are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve within an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.www.brp.com.Follow Us OnLinkedIn @BRP;Twitter @BRPnews;Facebook @BRPinfo.WHY JOIN THE TEAM?As a People Data Business Analyst at BRP, you will support the transformation of the company by delivering People reporting and insights visibility to the HR team and company leadership.In this high-visibility role, you will work with HR, business leaders and data consumers to identify reporting and analytical requirements, independently developing business and technical requirement documentation while also leading in developing reports, dashboards and analytics to meet these requirements.If you love wrangling HR data to deliver insights, digging into processes and becoming a lead on the data domain(s) you support, all while exercising creative freedom to shape a growing next gen people data platform in a fast-paced environment, you will have a blast with us.Your Key ResponsibilitiesTake lead in designing, building, delivering and maintaining world-class People reporting for all areas of the business using Snowflake and Power BI (or other Data Visualization Tools)Collaborate alongside a cross-functional team (data engineering, analysis, data science, etc.) that is 100% focused on People Analytics prioritiesLead and participate in business-facing meetings to gather requirements and make recommendations around reporting / analytics solutionsPlay a key role in the daily support of end-users’ ability to access reports and/or effectively utilize the reporting platformPrioritize work with the team in an agile methodology, ensuring there is a forward looking roadmap for features to be delivered for the data products People DomainParticipate or lead activities that ensure redundancies for the People Analytics function (documentation, automations, etc.)Develop deep understanding of the various HR and business processes, data sets and data deliverablesYour Qualifications And Skills5+ years of related to business and/or data analyst experience (preferably in a highly confidential domain)Working knowledge of BI and data warehouse concepts and terminology (ideally in a Snowflake environment)Experience building reports and dashboards in PowerBI (experience in Tableau, Qlik, BOBJ, MSTR or similar platforms will be considered)Proven experience with business and technical requirements documentation (ideally in Confluence), analysis, modeling, verification, and methodology developmentExperience as an HR professional or with HR process considerationsExposure to ticketing systems (salesforce) an assetExperience in SQL and/or Python an assetSelf-motivated and able to work independentlyCapable of prioritizing multiple projects while still achieving deadlinesExcellent business acumen, with an ability to connect the dots and tell stories using data Detail-oriented person who is passionate about quality and enthusiastic about new technologyProficiency with Microsoft Word, PPT, and Excel (or equivalent G-Suite products)

job_title: Senior Business Insights Analyst, Fraud Strategy & Resiliency- EN
job_desc: TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewTD Fraud Performance Management strives to protect TD Bank Customers, shareholders and employees from financial crimes and fraud. Aligned with TD strategy and risk appetite, TD Fraud Performance Management develops analytics capabilities, processes, and layers of defense to mitigate fraud. The team operates within Enterprise Protect requiring both strategic and tactical responses to ever-changing fraud patterns and provides a unique opportunity to apply critical thinking and analytical skills in a fast-paced environment.Job DescriptionThe Senior Business Insights Analyst, Fraud Strategy & Resiliency will lead a unique and new mandate for the Canadian Performance Management team. The Manager will lead a platform and process resiliency mandate across all current and future fraud platforms and processes at TD. A forward-looking role, this role will ensure appropriate oversight, early warning frameworks, incident playbooks, linkages to upstream and downstream systems are in place for critical run the bank fraud processes. The role will provide ample exposure working across various internal and external stakeholders in the bank and opportunity to make a big impact.You will build on your deep analytics experience and process mindset to :Anticipate and explain potential fraud risks Identify and develop defenses against emerging fraud trends Understand and actively manage the operational impacts of our fraud defense strategiesThe Successful Candidate WillEvaluate current early warning reporting, identify gaps and lead remedial action. Leads development of new monitoring reports, dashboards using interactive dashboardsAssists senior members of the Fraud Resiliency group in current/target state process assessmentIdentifies and escalates gaps in process or technology hindering efficiency and/or effectiveness of the Analytics or Operations teamsAssists in review of new technologies and assesses reasonableness of business cases to understand potential investment opportunitiesProvide insights and ad-hoc analyses to support decision-making at the executive levelLeverage subject matter expertise to independently investigate new, high-risk exposures under tight timelinesProduce timely diagnostics to identify system, strategy, and operational issuesParticipate in defect analysis to identify and remediate coverage gapsJob RequirementsPassion in analytics with a Customer-first mindset Ability to effectively manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environmentDetail oriented, tech-savvy, and proficient working with big data Advanced SQL and Excel hands on experienceAutomation experience is an assetAbility to "tell the story" to both technical and non-technical team members Ability to take initiative and work independently under tight timelinesAbility to work collaboratively and build relationshipsUndergraduate degree or technical certificate (e.g., engineering, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or analytics)Three or more years of work experience in an analytical capacityPreferableExperience in fraud management, fraud engines is an assetProcess engineering and/or Lean Six Sigma background preferred Automation experience is an assetInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

CGI has an immediate need for Sr Data Technical Analyst / Developer to join our life sciences practice area. This is an exciting full-time opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment supporting one of the largest leaders in the pharmaceutical industry. We take an innovative approach to supporting our client, working side-by-side in an agile environment using emerging technologies.As an Sr Data Technical Analyst / Developer, you will act as a key participant in data analysis, data development, execution, defect tracking, and reporting. Provides on-going technical support for all related IT deliverables Knowledge or familiarity in software development, Software deployment, Server & hardware installations, platform configuration, DevOps, Agile-Scrum and PM principles would be a nice to have Familiarity or knowledge of automation testing environments would be a nice to have Identifying areas of improvement across the program Goal oriented with high standards for quality and performanceRequired Qualifications: Exposure and familiarity to SDLC, Agile and Waterfall models Hands on knowledge and experience with data quality tools like Infomatica, Cognos Tibco, BI & ETL capabilities required Strong skills in SQL, Oracle Familarity with process automation tools would be a plus Familarity in TDD (Test Driven Development) would be a nice plus (not required) Familiarity with various automated testing environments would be a nice to have (not required) Familiarity in test automation, test cases, defecting management tools would be a nice to have. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. job_title: Business Data Analyst - Financial Services, Omnia AI
job_desc: Job Type: PermanentPrimary Location: Multiple Locations, Ontario, CanadaAll Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Montreal; Ottawa; VancouverLearn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coachingPartner with clients to solve their most complex problemsBe empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office. Are you passionate about data and technology solutions, driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution? Are you enthusiastic about all things data, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a solid understanding of software development? If you answered yes, then we have an opportunity waiting for you! What will your typical day look like?As a Finance Business Analyst in our Data Modernization & Analytics team within the Omnia AI practice, you are passionate about data and technology solutions, are driven to understand the latest business challenges and its enablement using technology platforms. You will play an active role to architect and design data & technology solutions using industry-leading platforms on client’s ecosystem. You are enthusiastic about large-scale data transformation programs, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a techno-functional experience with ability to engage the Business as well as IT teams with ease.Specifically, in this role, you will: Collaborate with finance function of client (Actuaries, Accountants, Finance system analysts) Conduct analysis and incorporate findings, feedback and insights from financial systems Gather requirements and managing delivery of banking/insurance systems and integrations Work with scrum masters in agile environment, e.g. sprints, product backlogs, user stories Own solution design and delivery of significant subject areas covering the functional requirements, and co-relate to solution architecture Lead teams through program delivery journey and mentor junior colleaguesAbout The TeamOmnia AI, Deloitte's Artificial Intelligence practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.As a member of our Data Modernization & Analytics team within our Omnia AI practice, you will help our clients design and implement the data platform architectures that are focused on customer domain, consumer industry – be it in the cloud or on-premises – required to enable cutting-edge AI solutions. You will be part of a practice to deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems, with a focus on Customer Data Platforms, Big Data, BI/DW, Data Integration, Data Governance, Master Data and Analytics applications. Each of these applications leverages a different mix of traditional and innovative technologies to achieve business outcomes.Enough about us, let’s talk about youYou are someone who is: 2+ years of experience working in the Banking/Finance industry on data and technology delivery programs;Banking – Wealth Management, Payment Modernization, Advanced analytics, KYC, Digitization initiatives, etc.Insurance – Admin system modernization, contributed to regulatory engagements, advanced analytics programs eg: Fraud detection, customer retention, etc. 2+ years of experience in data lifecycle and ETL design; strong understanding of data management principles, data profiling, and SQL Experience liaising with both the business and technology teams with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts into easy-to-understand non-technical language in order to facilitate, communicate and interact with business stakeholders, working with Agile development methods on data-oriented projects Completed Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in quantitative areas such as Computer Science, Finance & Banking, Information Management, or related field is desired; certifications or experience in leading admin system data platforms, cloud data platforms, is an asset Passion to make an impact in statutory and regulatory aspects of Banking/Insurance industryIf you believe you have what it takes to be a successful member of our team please apply now. We know your career is important to you and it's important to us, too. This role is just the first step of a highly successful career we can help you build.Why Deloitte?Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you: You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster. You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful. For You?At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! We’re the technology leader building the modern home management platform. Today, millions of people use Thumbtack to effortlessly manage their homes. We help them confidently know what to do, when to do it and who to hire.Our goal is simple: to be the only platform homeowners need to fix, maintain and improve their homes. As a long-term partner for homeowners, our promise is to turn what was once confusing and intimidating into something straightforward — and a lot less stressful.At Thumbtack, we're not just creating a new era of homeownership. We’re supporting local economies and building stronger communities. Each day, we connect local professionals across America with busy homeowners so they can grow their businesses.Thumbtack is for everyone. Our customers and pros come from all walks of life and every county in the country. We want our team to reflect that. If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply.Our North Star is bright and our ambitions are big. We’ve been at this for over a decade, but the way we see it: we’re just getting started.Thumbtack by the Numbers Available in all 3,143 U.S. counties.  Nearly 4.5 million customers in the last 12 months  Hundreds of thousands of local professionals on our platform  65 million projects started on Thumbtack  Over 7.5 million 5-star reviews left for stellar pros About The Business Analytics TeamThe Business Analytics team’s mission is to unlock strategic opportunities and enable Thumbtack to achieve its full business potential. To accomplish this mission, we focus on:Strategic insights: Analytics to uncover insights that will be game-changers for our business, and that inform company strategy and team execution. Business performance: Metrics, dashboards, and forums that help us measure progress towards our goals and foster deep understanding of our business. Telling Thumbtack’s story: Using metrics and data visualization to tell Thumbtack’s story to investors, board members, our team, and the world. Building a world-class team: hiring the best, and investing in coaching, learning, and team building. We are a tight-knit group that is passionate about driving business impact through analytics.About The RoleAs a Business Analytics team member, you’ll drive insights and action across the breadth of the marketplace. You’ll be a steward of key company metrics and dashboards, and dive deep on analytical questions that are critical to Thumbtack’s success. You’ll partner with our leadership team to develop company strategy and goals, share performance updates with the Board, and work with teams across the business to drive actionable insights and business impact. This particular role will focus on deep-dive analyses to uncover insights that can influence company strategy and help with revenue forecasting.Responsibilities Define, measure, and track the key metrics that measure Thumbtack’s success  Design and build key company data tables, dashboards, and insights tools that power decisions across the company, and evolve them as our product and business change  Conduct in-depth analyses to answer key questions that are critical to Thumbtack’s strategy  Support and improve company revenue forecasting model, and forecasting/planning process  Partner effectively with teams across the company, including Product, Engineering, Marketing, Operations, Finance, as well as Thumbtack’s leadership team  Contribute to our team and company data culture through peer collaboration, training, coaching, and more  Must-Have Qualifications BA/BS degree, preferably in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics, or Computer Science  4+ years of experience in a highly analytical role, preferably with experience in tech analytics  Proficiency using SQL to analyze large data sets  Basic knowledge of statistics  Exemplary analytical problem solving skills, including strong business judgment and the ability to identify and synthesize insights from analysis  Ability to work with company executives to understand the company’s business needs and drive decisions  Strong communicator, attentive listener, and compelling explainer  Nice-to-Have Qualifications Prior work experience at a marketplace  Strong statistics knowledge / experience  Experience with R or Python Thumbtack is a virtual-first company, meaning you can live and work from any one of our approved locations across the United States, Ontario or the Philippines*. When it is safe to gather, we will begin to host in-person events on a regular basis. Remote employees will be expected to travel occasionally for these events to a Thumbtack library or offsite team-building location. In cities with 5+ employees, we are establishing local communities, where employees can gather for local events. Additionally, employees in the San Francisco, Salt Lake City, Toronto and Manila areas will have opt-in access to communal workspace at one of our Thumbtack libraries. We always prioritize the health and safety of our employees. Currently, participation in these events and Thumbtack library use are optional. Both require employees to be fully vaccinated.More About UsThumbtack is a technology leader building the modern home management platform. Through the Thumbtack app, homeowners can effortlessly manage their homes — confidently knowing what to do, when to do it, and who to hire. Bringing the $500 billion home services industry online, Thumbtack empowers millions of homeowners to fix, maintain, and improve their most valuable asset.Founded in 2008, Thumbtack is backed by over $500 million in funding from folks that include Sequoia Capital, CapitalG, Tiger Global Management, Javelin Investment Partners, Baillie Gifford. See what it’s like to work here  Meet the pros who inspire us  Follow us on LinkedIn  Discover our virtual first plan Thumbtack embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.If you are a California resident, please review information regarding your rights under California privacy laws contained in Thumbtack’s Privacy policy available at https://www.thumbtack.com/privacy/ .Currently, Thumbtackers can live anywhere in Ontario or British Columbia, Canada or the Philippines or in any of the following US states: AZ, CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, HI, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, MD, MA, MI, MN, MO, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI, Washington DC. Our long term vision is to hire across all of the United States and Canada, but this expansion will take a few years.

DescriptionTiger Analytics is looking for experienced Data Scientists to join our fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. Our employees bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning and AI. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world.As a Data Scientist, you will apply strong expertise in AI through the use of machine learning, data mining, and information retrieval to design, prototype, and build next generation advanced analytics engines and services. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and business partners to define the technical problem statement and hypotheses to test. You will develop efficient and accurate analytical models which mimic business decisions and incorporate those models into analytical data products and tools. You will have the opportunity to drive current and future strategy by leveraging your analytical skills as you ensure business value and communicate the results.Key ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with business partners to develop innovative solutions to meet objectives utilizing cutting edge techniques and tools.Effectively communicate the analytics approach and how it will meet and address objectives to business partners. Advocate and educate on the value of data-driven decision making; focus on the “how and why” of solutioning.Lead analytic approaches; integrate solutions collaboratively into applications and tools with data engineers, business leads, analysts and developers.Create repeatable, interpretable, dynamic and scalable models that are seamlessly incorporated into analytic data products.Engineer features by using your business acumen to find new ways to combine disparate internal and external data sources.Share your passion for Data Science with the broader enterprise community; identify and develop long-term processes, frameworks, tools, methods and standards.Collaborate, coach, and learn with a growing team of experienced Data Scientists. Stay connected with external sources of ideas through conferences and community engagements.RequirementsMasters Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or related field4+ years of Data Science and Machine Learning experience requiredProficiency in Python or R. Ability to write complex SQL queriesProficiency with Machine Learning concepts and modeling techniques to solve problems such as clustering, classification, regression, anomaly detection, simulation and optimization problems on large scale data sets. Ability to implement ML best practices for the entire Data Science lifecycleAbility to apply various analytical models to business use cases (NLP, Supervised, Un-Supervised, Neural Nets, etc.)Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to understand business partner needs and deliver solutionsBias for action, with the ability to deliver outstanding results through task prioritization and time managementExperience with data visualization tools — Tableau, Power BI, etc. preferredBenefitsThis position offers an excellent opportunity for significant career development in a fast-growing and challenging entrepreneurial environment with a high degree of individual responsibility.

Help us boldly shape retail in CanadaCanadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.The Triangle Engagement Analytics team is focused on deepening customer engagement with the Triangle program by upselling customers to our credit and subscription products and by driving cross banner shopping behaviour.Reporting to the Manager, Triangle Engagement (and AVP Triangle Engagement for an interim period), the Data Scientist role provides analytical and technical support in the scope of executing targeted campaigns for our customers. The Data Analyst will be the subject matter expert in combining customer-related data sources, collaborating with teams that produce customer insights, deploying data to execution platforms, and measuring lift in campaigns.The dynamic environment requires individuals with a cross functional background, excellent organizational skills, experience working in an agile project environment, advanced analytical ability, strong communication skills to deal effectively with stakeholders and the ability to work effectively in a team as well as independently.Statistics is your strong suit. You have a strong command of machine learning, data science and software engineering. You’re analytical, a problem-solver, detail-oriented and enjoy working in a high-volume work environment. You’re ambitious, balance technical and business acumen to offer strategic counsel to senior leadership and stakeholders. Thriving in a fast-paced environment, you network on all levels and work with an ‘automate first’ mindset to continuously strive towards efficiency.To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Data Scientist position is categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.What You’ll Do Partner with business stakeholders to ingest and utilize new data sources as they become available, provide ad hoc business reporting and analysis as requested  Work hand-to-hand with stakeholders to understand business problems, developing data-driven solutions to overcome these problems ultimately adding tangible business value  Provide insights and analytics on customer segments that influence test designs and hypotheses.  For example, you may identify that for a target segment X, they over-index on attribute Y which may be important to include in the creative for campaign Z.  Measure post-campaign performance of campaigns, identify potential opportunities, and report on statistical significance.  For example, using sales data, measure whether the campaign exposed group spent significantly more than the control group and report the relevant p-values.  Write queries that efficiently and accurately integrate customer data from a variety of organizational systems.  Ensure generated insights meet standards of analytical and statistical rigour, highlighting gaps where necessary.  Provide mentorship to team members on data, code, and data science best practices.  Lead the creation of efficient, cost-effective high-availability pipelines.  Provide ad hoc analytics and recommendations for action as needed. What You Bring M.S degree in Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or a related field  +2 years of relevant work experience  Experience with data science disciplines, including hypothesis testing, statistical modeling, machine learning, recommendation systems, artificial intelligence, cognitive science, deep learning, etc.  In-depth experience with Python, SQL and R  Experience using advanced tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc. and working knowledge with relational and non-relational modeling, database applications and integrations, ETL tools, client/server solutions, and modern query languages  Experience with cloud (e.g. AWS, Azure and GCP) and industry standard data warehousing technologies (Cloudera, Snowflake, etc.)  Experience in working with Big Data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, HIVE, Spark)  Project management, team mentorship and leadership qualities  Bonus points if you have experience with:  Data intelligence and visualization platforms such as Looker, Google Data Studio, Tableau or other similar tools About Canadian Tire CorporationAs one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.Ontario-TorontoPermanentFull-timeJob PostingMay 28, 2022, 2:59:45 AM

Job DescriptionThe Software Development Engineer / Data Analyst is a highly knowledgeable and skilled professional who will be responsible for: The appropriate implementation of processes, integrations and automations using in-house, and third-party tools .  The application of data analysis and business intelligence skills to query information and generate reports and dashboards.  The integration of multiple APIs into a workflow automation tool (to be defined).  Evaluate software options and provide suggestions.  The support and maintenance of the API Integration, ensuring its appropriate operation.  The basic support and maintenance of the databases, ensuring its appropriate operation.  The support and maintenance of the workflow, automation, BPMS, business intelligence, and/or reporting software, ensuring its appropriate operation.  The analysis and delivery of monthly reports, including, but not limited to: usage, statistics, uptime/downtime, updates, and general status of the developed platforms.  The regular revision and analysis of updates, additions, replacement, and patch management for the different integrations and automations. The appropriate management of support failures with the corresponding provider or platform.  The design and development of the specific modules that can fulfill current or newer workflows for integrations and automations.  The appropriate documentation of all platform components, APIs, and codes for its correct operation, support, and maintenance. Keeping the adequate and efficient relationship, communication, collaboration, and integration, with key stakeholders within Fortinet that can support and require the value-added that the Training and Enablement team might add to their objectives and business.  Keeping constant, fluid, timely, and relevant communication, both verbally and written with all the groups with which this team has to interact in the regular job duties.  Keeping technology, industry, programing languages knowledge at the highest possible, and be an advanced expert resource for other peers. Senior developer with experience leading and/or working with a team of at least three (3) people, preferably a Scrum master . Advanced knowledge of scripting tools and languages, including but not limited to python, PowerShell, PHP, javascript, .NET.  Advanced knowledge and at least two (2) years of experience with data analysis tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Crystal Reports.  Advanced knowledge and at least two (2) years of experience with integration and automation tools like Power Automate, Power Apps, ProWorkFlow, Integrify, or other BPMS. Medium to advanced knowledge of: Power BI, Power Automate, Tableau  Web Services (SOAP)  Scrum/Agile  Python, PowerShell, PHP, HTML/5, JavaScript, CSS, SQL, MySQL  VMware and AWS  Advanced knowledge of authentication systems, platforms, and solutions. At least five (5) years of experience in any of the following positions: a senior developer, software developer, lead developer, web developer, web designer, web programmer, software architect, data analyst, or similar.  Strong technical writing, drawing, and visual media skills.  Proven experience in developing high-end software platforms.  Advanced knowledge of troubleshooting techniques and tools.  Strong oral and written communication skills in English. Exceptional ability to articulate messages in English.  The ability to speak Spanish, Portuguese, French, Italian, Japanese, Chinese, or any other foreign language is a major plus.  Strong analytical skills, oriented to details.  Ability to be an autodidact and learn new knowledge areas on his/her own.  Proven track as a problem solver and negotiation skills.  Highly organized professional; capable of working and multi-tasking across multiple projects.  Strong ability to talk to either the technical or management level.  Self-motivated, with the ability to work without direct supervision.  Adaptable and flexible, operating in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.  Ability to work and take quick decisions under high pressure.  Availability to travel worldwide on a scheduled basis.  Demonstrated experience working in distributed and international teams. Certifications And Qualifications Having a certification on at least one Business Intelligence tool is a major plus.  Have any product or industry certifications in programming, code, or software (SCRUM, Linux, Python, C/C++, etc.) is a major plus.
