job_title: Business Data Analyst - Energy & Resources, Omnia AI
job_desc: Job Type: PermanentPrimary Location: Multiple Locations, Ontario, CanadaAll Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Montreal; Ottawa; VancouverLearn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coachingPartner with clients to solve their most complex problemsBe empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office. Are you passionate about data and technology solutions, driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution? Are you enthusiastic about all things data, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a solid understanding of software development? If you answered yes, then we have an opportunity waiting for you! What will your typical day look like?As a Business Analyst in our Data Modernization & Analytics team within the Omnia AI practice, you are passionate about data and technology solutions, are driven to understand the latest business challenges and its enablement using technology platforms. You will play an active role to architect and design data & technology solutions using industry-leading platforms on client’s ecosystem. You are enthusiastic about large-scale data transformation programs, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a techno-functional experience with ability to engage the Business as well as IT teams with ease.Specifically, in this role, you will: Lead, define, design and implement end-to-end data-oriented solutions to solve business challenges, use-cases and features for clients Define, develop and communicate using industry standard business process models. Collaborating with enterprise architects, business architects, ETL designer and developers to lead data integration functional requirements and solutions Conduct analysis and incorporate findings, feedback and insights from energy and resource leading practices, trends, and research Own solution design and delivery of significant subject areas covering the functional requirements, and co-relate to solution architecture Collaborate and define complex solution architectures, lead teams through program delivery journey and mentor junior colleaguesAbout The TeamOmnia AI, Deloitte's Artificial Intelligence practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.As a member of our Data Modernization & Analytics team within our Omnia AI practice, you will help our clients design and implement the data platform architectures that are focused on customer domain, consumer industry – be it in the cloud or on-premises – required to enable cutting-edge AI solutions. You will be part of a practice to deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems, with a focus on Customer Data Platforms, Big Data, BI/DW, Data Integration, Data Governance, Master Data and Analytics applications. Each of these applications leverages a different mix of traditional and innovative technologies to achieve business outcomes.Enough about us, let’s talk about youYou are someone who is: 2+ years of experience working in the Energy and Resources sector (Utilities Management, Waste Management, Clean Energy, or other resource management/conservation related areas) on data and technology delivery programs. Understanding of supply chain, asset management, business process modeling (BPM), complex enterprise resource planning (SAP,Oracle) related architecture and data flows 2+ years of experience in data lifecycle and ETL design; strong understanding of data management principles, data profiling, and SQL Experience liaising with both the business and technology teams with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts into easy-to-understand non-technical language in order to facilitate, communicate and interact with business stakeholders, working with Agile development methods on data-oriented projects Completed Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in quantitative areas such as Computer Science, Energy and Resources, Clean Energy, Waste Management, Information Management, Big Data & Analytics, or related field is desired; Master data management is an asset; certifications or experience in ERP data platforms, cloud data platforms, supply chain, asset management and maintenance technologiesIf you believe you have what it takes to be a successful member of our team please apply now. We know your career is important to you and it's important to us, too. This role is just the first step of a highly successful career we can help you build.Why Deloitte?Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you: You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster. You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful. You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.The next step is yoursSound like The One Firm. For You?At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Description De L'entrepriseLes équipes d’Ubisoft comptent 20 000 personnes réparties sur plus de 30 pays à travers le monde et sont liées par une mission commune : enrichir la vie des joueurs et des joueuses par des expériences de jeu originales et mémorables. Leur énergie et leur talent ont permis de donner vie à de nombreuses franchises acclamées telles que Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, et bien d'autres à venir. Ubisoft est une entreprise soucieuse de l'égalité des chances et estime que la diversité des origines et des perspectives est essentielle pour créer des mondes qui permettent l’épanouissement et l’expression de tous·tes. Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de relever des défis passionnants, exploiter des technologies de pointe, et prendre part au futur du divertissement, rejoignez-nous et créez l’inconnu.Description Du PosteUbisoft Entertainment est à la recherche d'un·e Scientifique de Données travaillant aux solutions marketing pour le e-commerce et le store Ubisoft telles que des systèmes de recommandation ou de la segmentation d’audiences. Vous ferez partie de l'équipe global de Science des données au sein du Département Data Office avec un support exclusif des développeur.se.s de données. Le poste est basé à Montréal, mais une partie de l'équipe et des client.e.s sont à San Francisco (US - CA), à Cary (US - NC) et à Paris (FR).Le/la candidat.e idéal.e a une solide expérience en mathématiques et a une bonne pratique de l'informatique et des outils autour des problématiques Big Data de Machine Learning. La maîtrise de Python ou Scala avec Spark est requise.Ce que vous ferezImaginer des solutions en collaboration avec plusieurs client.e.s et partenaires d’affaires (CRM, media, licence, e-com et finance) pour des solutions aux joueur.se.s personnaliséesAméliorer et optimiser nos solutions ML en production avec l'aide de l'équipeDévelopper de nouveaux prototypes de solutions intelligentesCollaborer avec d'autres équipes de données d’Ubisoft (IT, Analytiques, Développeur.se.s, etc.) pour assurer la faisabilité de vos solutionsSérialiser et automatiser vos codes avec l'aide de l'équipe de développeur.se.s de donnéesPromouvoir nos solutions et les rendre accessibles et facile à comprendre, grâce à des présentations, des tableaux de bord, de la documentation, de l'interface utilisateur...Apporter à votre équipe de nouvelles idées, en particulier sur des sujets plus exploratoires comme l’Attribution ou le NLG (Natural Language Generation)QualificationsCe que vous apporterezSolide expérience en mathématiques et statistiquesPassion dans l'univers du jeu vidéoExpérience avérée de travail dans un rôle de Scientifique de Données (hors stages)Maîtrise de Python ou Scala et Spark ou des langages similairesExpérience de la gestion de SQL HiveQL et du Big Data·Connaissance en Machine LearningTrès bonnes compétences en communication en français et en anglaisSensibilité des perspectives d’affairesInformations complémentairesCe qu’il faut nous envoyerVotre CV mettant en valeur votre expertise et/ou expérience et vos compétencesPour votre information : Si vous avez besoin d'un permis de travail, votre admissibilité peut dépendre de votre éducation et de vos années d'expérience de travail pertinentes, comme l'exige le gouvernement.Les habiletés et les connaissances se présentent sous différentes formes et peuvent être basées sur des expériences pertinentes, c'est pourquoi nous vous encourageons vivement à poser votre candidature, même si vous ne remplissez pas toutes les exigences énumérées ci-dessus.Chez Ubisoft, vous êtes les bienvenu·es tel·les que vous êtes. Nous accueillons la diversité sous toutes ses formes. Nous nous engageons à favoriser un environnement de travail inclusif et respectueux de toutes les différences.Code de conduite Ubisoft : Code de Conduite Ubisoft

job_title: Data Policies - Senior Data Policy Analyst
job_desc: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.As data is reshaping the business world, how do we provide a differentiated, data-powered service to our clients?Success in a constantly evolving world demands businesses transform into intelligent enterprises. They must adopt technologies fueled by data to enable continual refinements to performance, uncover new insights and make more informed decisions. And they need to ensure their use of data and technology is underpinned by trust to win credibility in the markets in which they operate.To support this new working world and remain market leaders, EY is also transforming into a data-powered organization. Our strategic evolution enables us to provide new services and solutions, enrich client experiences and find smarter ways of working.The Data Office is the engine driving EY’s transformation. It reframes how we find, manage, use and scale data to realize its full power and fuel new intelligent technologies.With a value-first approach and driven by business outcomes, the Data Office designs a data-powered, trust-enriched journey, ensuring value creation.The opportunityAs a Senior Data Policies Analyst, you will become a key member of EY’s Data Policies team within the Data Office (DO). Within the DO, the Data Policies and Trust team will be responsible for capture and governance process as they pertain to the development and leverage of shared data assets across the EY organization. The development of data rules and their continued enforcement will be critical to the success of EY’s journey to a data driven organization.Your Key ResponsibilitiesSenior Data Policy Analyst will work closely with Policy Groups (General Counsel’s Office (GCO), Data Protection, Independence, Risk Management, and Service Line Quality) to identify and define data rules to enable broader use of data across EY. This role will support the Data Policies team to build upon extensible frameworks and existing data rules, including the capture of localized requirements determined by local Policy Groups.Additionally, the Senior Data Policy Analyst will support the Data Policies team to support the design and enablement of technology and processes upon which the data rules are enforced. You will be taking a lead role in providing requirements for technology enablement and organizational design.At EY we believe that it is important for the Data Office to be multi-disciplinary. This requires that you demonstrate your ability to expand your area of influence beyond “traditional data governance” and contribute towards acontiguous and market leading data services. To satisfy these objectives you must be skilled at gathering requirements and coordinating/participating in workshops as a business consultant.Skills And Attributes For SuccessWork closely with Policy Groups at the global, area and local level, together with local business sponsors to take a lead role in capturing requirements and document processes, including the ability to act as a trusted advisor to our stakeholdersSupport the creation of new processes and end-to-end design of various components within the Data Policies Capability Gather feedback from solution teams and service lines to inform the execution of the various services of the Data Policies capability and take a lead role to manage junior members in the teamSupport the design and ongoing iteration of procedural documentationManage and document requirements from various stakeholders and take a lead role working closely with the project management team to track progress and provide status updatesContribute to the creation and maintenance of a process and repository for the documentation of governance best practices Support the implementation of an ongoing communication plan to educate key stakeholders on data policy frameworks To qualify for the role, you must haveA degree in Business, Computer Science, Law or STEM related discipline or equivalent work experience..Any Data Governance, Quality, Risk Management processes is preferred, but not required7+ years of total work experience consisting of: Minimum 7 years of hands-on Information governance or policy design and implementation. Minimum of 5 years of having been engaged within a multi-cultural, multi-disciplined, globally dispersed teamExperienced working with IT on the analysis of complex business processes and data governance needs and development of re-engineering opportunitiesDeveloping and monitoring the delivery of efficient and effective processes to diverse and complex data problemsProven Track record within Data Governance with significant influence on overall direction of data policies and data lifecycle management Ideally, you’ll also have Previous Knowledge of emerging data policy requirements (e.g. GDPR, Project Open Data, HIPPA) preferred Experience in risk management processes in support of data usage and privacy Ability to effectively participate in workshops to gather requirements and gain consensus Strong analytical skills, good knowledge of policy processes and strong team leadershipStrong relationship building skills and executive presenceAbility to constructively challenge requirements and current state to increase overall value to the organization Ability to direct the point of optimization from the project to the enterpriseShould be well versed with latest data policy decisions, guideline and business trendsFlexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity and rapid changeStrategic skills to develop long-term visions and the ability to translate them into actionable roadmaps that are broadly accepted.Ability to translate business and functional needs into policy requirements, and estimate their impact across the data lifecycleAbility to rapidly comprehend the changes to key business processes and the impact on the overall data policy frameworkAbility to understand and integrate cultural differences and motives and to lead virtual cross-cultural, cross-border teamsEnglish language skills - excellent written and verbal communicationAn overall understanding of the business objectives of service lines and Core Functional departmentsAbility to work and team with a multitude of different people to balance demandsSelf-starter attitude, with ability to work independently Ability to analyze complex situations and to derive workable actionsAbility to understand detailed impact while keeping the eye on the big pictureAbility to abstract real world scenarios into easy to understand modelsAbility to identify, prioritize and weigh different options and to recommend a value add solutionAbility to balance what is "right" with what is "realistic" Ability to stay focused on identified priorities Ability to make decisions in situations of ambiguity and the absence of complete facts What We Look ForAs a Senior Data Policy Analyst you will be required to work closely with Policy Groups at the global, area and local level, together with local business sponsors to take a lead role in capturing requirements and document processes, including the ability to act as a trusted advisor to our stakeholders. Able to support the creation of new processes and end-to-end design of various components within the Data Policies Capability. Provide leadership into the evolution of the Data Policies Capability, working collaboratively across the Data Office and internal stakeholders. Must be able to use independent judgment and discretion in identifying issues. Must be able review complex situations and, through consultation with internal stakeholders, be able to develop a proposed solution, in consultation with Data Office colleagues and expected to provide input and support development of deliverables and solutionsWhat We OfferAs part of this role, you'll work in a highly integrated, global team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer:Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.Please apply to this role only through the ‘Apply’ link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team.The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.EY | Building a better working worldEY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during the interview process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.com.

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewCreative and experimental, TD Lab is a unique team within TD Bank, operating out of the Communitech Hub in Kitchener (currently working remotely), solving customer problems by developing ideas using agile and design methodologies. This lean group of developers, designers, and analysts builds new solutions through ideation, design, prototyping, and tech partnerships, and brings new solutions to test in market. The business analyst team plays an integral role in defining the direction for the products and experiences we create. Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst – Innovation plays a key role in identifying and shaping early stage opportunities for TD Lab. They will work closely with colleagues within TD Lab, using an agile scrum methodology and a user experience focused development process to support the design, build, and test of new user-facing digital solutions. The analyst may work directly with additional TD partners to understand and to solve for high potential present and future problems. They may also work directly with supporting technology teams at TD to help enable both proof of concept development and production development of high-potential solutions. The Business Analyst – Innovation will also work directly with university co-op students through both project work and mentorship, providing guidance, knowledge, and support to these colleagues in an accessible way. As an analyst on this team, you will also have an opportunity to explore emerging technologies and market trends, and be empowered to start/stop projects because of what the market tells you. This is a unique opportunity to work in a highly collaborative team, learn continuously, unleash your creativity, and move as quickly as your ability.Job Responsibilities:Work with TD Lab colleagues and other TD stakeholders to understand business priorities, market opportunities, problems, research, and key areas of interestConduct or review market research through primary and secondary sources to deeply understand customer problems and their root causeEffectively communicate research findings, along with proposals for conceptual ideas and/or development approaches both verbally and visuallyUse design thinking methodologies, including building personas, storyboards, flowcharts, wireframes and prototypesParticipate and support team standups and scrums to drive solution development and ensure solution is aligned with user needsSupport go-to-market activities for early stage solutions, including surveys, test plans, marketing panels, and Proof of Concept planningParticipate in knowledge transfers within the team and business unitsInvestigate the potential of emerging and enabling technologies (e.g. AI, VR/AR, big data, platform features)Work with co-op students in a mentorship role, and support resume reviews and interviews to hire co-ops each term.Represent the lab at public events including hackathons, conferences, and recruiting events.Identify and recommend opportunities to enhance productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiencySupport a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues / points of interest Job RequirementsUndergraduate degree or relevant experience/education in a related innovation discipline (including user experience design, software development, and/or business analysis)3-5 years of relevant experience in an innovation setting or related disciplineLove of collaborationAble to multitask, prioritize projects, and communicate progress and expected milestonesPassionate about finding balance between form and functionExperience in working on real products, for use by real people from an early stageExperience with an agile scrum methodology, and a user experience focused development processAwareness of project management methodology/lifecycle, governance & gating controls, and common deliverables expected of a business analystKnowledge of business analysis and project delivery methodologies (including agile)Awareness of product management methodology, including market analysis, roadmaps, feature backlogs, and translation of strategy into key business requirementsExperience participating in Requirements Management for projectsAbility to create and track Project Plans appropriate for early stage solutionsExperience leading both internal and external presentations, including to a senior audience Additional InformationTeam CultureOne of the things that the TD Lab team prides themselves about is our team culture. It's not uncommon to see kiddos join video calls or for a team member to take a meeting while walking their dog. In the warmer months, there's usually a few of us outside for meetings. We have a weekly "Fundatory Friday" event where we play games together. There's at least one messaging channel dedicated to pictures of dogs and babies. We celebrate how terrible we are at March Madness Brackets. LocationPhysically centered in Kitchener but currently "Flexible Hybrid", with the ability to support remote work within the TD footprint.InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Posted by                  Manveer Singh             Talent Acquisition Consultant at Bell                                     Send InMail                                  Code de demande: 373674Bell ne se contente pas de construire des réseaux de calibre mondial, d’élaborer des services novateurs et de créer du contenu pour des médias multiplateformes : on transforme la façon dont les Canadiens communiquent entre eux et avec le reste du monde.Si vous êtes prêt à donner corps à des idées innovatrices et à vous joindre à une entreprise qui encourage, le développement professionnel et le bien-être de ses employés, l’équipe Bell est faite pour vous.Notre équipe Bell Marchés Affaires soutient la transformation numérique des entreprises et agences gouvernementales à l’échelle du pays, grâce à des solutions touchant divers secteurs, dont Internet et les réseaux privés, les communications vocales et unifiées, les centres de contact, les services de sécurité, l’Internet des objets, les centres de données et l’infonuagique. Nous sommes fiers d’être le premier fournisseur au Canada de services de réseau et de communications large bande auprès des entreprises et des gouvernements.L’équipe de veille stratégique/d’optimisation du rendement de l’entreprise, qui réside au sein de Bell Marchés Affaires, est chargée de développer, d’actualiser et d’utiliser des données pour en tirer de précieux renseignements sur l’expérience client et l’optimisation de nos services administratifs. L’équipe est composée d’analystes pour analyser les données, de gestionnaires de la planification de la capacité pour l’approvisionnement et l’actualisation des données, de programmeurs pour la construction de tableaux de bord et de scientifiques de données pour la construction de modèles d’apprentissage automatique.Notre équipe travaille en étroite collaboration avec d’autres groupes d’informatique décisionnelle au sein de l’entreprise et appuie principalement nos équipes opérationnelles en leur fournissant des renseignements pertinents qui nous aident à continuer de transformer l’entreprise. En outre, l’équipe joue un rôle actif dans le processus de gestion des changements au sein de Bell Marchés Affaires, qui comprend souvent des initiatives d’automatisation, le développement d’outils en libre-service et l’ingénierie des processus. Nous recherchons un futur ou un récent diplômé universitaire ayant une aptitude à créer des incidences sur l’entreprise au moyen d’une approche basée sur les données. Le titulaire du poste aura l’occasion de mettre en œuvre les plus récentes pratiques en matière d’analytique, de visualisation de données et d’apprentissage automatique pour fournir aux membres de l’équipe Bell Marchés Affaires un accès plus rapide à des renseignements pertinents sur les facteurs déterminants de leurs activités.Fonctionnement du programme : Vous aurez l’occasion de travailler sur des projets et d’améliorer vos compétences en matière de présentation à la haute direction, d’analyse des données, de gestion de la planification de la capacité, d’ingénierie des données et d’apprentissage automatique.Tâches Et ResponsabilitésCerner les occasions d’amélioration de l’apprentissage automatique et de l’intelligence artificielle et démontrer aux clients internes la façon dont ces technologies peuvent améliorer leurs affairesSolide esprit d’analyse et compréhension des principes fondamentaux du travail avec des ensembles de données volumineux et complexes Capacité de tirer parti de renseignements stratégiques et d’occasions à partir de données et de mesures afin d’élaborer des stratégies et de formuler des recommandations Esprit d’initiative et leadership avérés, et passion pour l’apprentissage de nouvelles compétences Excellente éthique professionnelle et persévérance face aux défis et aux occasions Curiosité manifeste et capacité d’apprendre rapidement et de gérer plusieurs projets et priorités simultanément Collaborer avec les partenaires des Services opérationnels clientèle et de Bell pour prendre des décisions d’affaires fondées sur les donnéesCompétences Et Habiletés EssentiellesDiplôme de premier cycle ou maîtrise en ingénierie, commerce, informatique, recherche opérationnelle, physique ou mathématiques Une expérience des algorithmes d’apprentissage automatique est un atout, notamment une bonne connaissance des fondements mathématiques de diverses méthodes : techniques de régression, réseaux de neurones, arbres de décision, regroupement, reconnaissance de formes, réduction dimensionnelle Manipuler des ensembles de données volumineux et complexes et des outils et des méthodes d’exploration de données, tels que SAS, SPSS, MatLab/Scilab, R, CART ou autres progiciels de statistiques Au moins un langage de programmation général, comme Python (préférable), Java ou C/C++, et expérience en développement de requêtes utilisant SQL Experience avec des outils de visualisation de données et des séries chronologiques Compétences en matière de présentation, un atout Excellente communication en anglais (écrit et parlé)Expérience avec des outils de production de rapports et de visualisation de données, comme Microsoft Reporting Services, MicroStrategy, Tableau et Python Dash, un atout Expérience avec de grands ensembles de données et les techniques d’apprentissage automatique, un atout#Indeed #Tech #Technology #BI #BusinessIntelligence #Microstrategy #Tableau #Python #SQL #Java #Sas #SPSSLe bilinguisme est un atout (français et anglais). job_title: Scientifique de données - Validation des modèles
job_desc: Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.Niveau d'emploiNV-11Le Mouvement Desjardins dans le cadre de ses activités fait appel à un grand nombre de modèles quantitatifs exploitant des données dans le but de supporter son offre de produits et services et de gérer adéquatement ses risques, tout ceci avec comme objectif de toujours travailler dans l’intérêt des membres et clients. Bien que ces modèles offrent un support incontestable à la prise de décision, leurs utilisations amènent elles-mêmes des risques qui doivent être analysés, évalués et atténués.À titre de scientifique de données en validation des modèles, vous contribuez à l’assurance que les données sont adéquatement valorisées dans les différentes étapes du cycle de vie des modèles concernant leurs contributions à la prise de décisions d’affaires, au développement de solutions et de services adaptés aux enjeux d’affaires et à la compréhension des comportements des membres et clients. À cet effet, vous vous assurez de l’adéquate application des programmes de validation en place afin d'assurer que les modèles respectent l’ensemble des critères de qualité dont s'est doté le Mouvement Desjardins à ces fins.Vous assumez un rôle de leadership et d’influence auprès des différents intervenants dans le cadre de dossiers et projets faisant intervenir des modèles quantitatifs, par le biais de travaux de validation de modèles comprenant des interventions stratégiques et complexes en analytique avancée.Vous formulez des recommandations relatives au développement et à l’utilisation de modèles à complexité opérationnelle et conceptuelle très élevée nécessitant une analyse et une compréhension globale et approfondie du domaine d’affaires et de l’organisation.Vous exercez un rôle d’expert-conseil et de contenu dans votre domaine et agissez à titre de personne-ressource auprès de la haute direction et des instances. Vous êtes appelé à interagir avec un très grand nombre de parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise variés et, à l’égard de la gouvernance des modèles, à conseiller les comités décisionnels dans leurs orientations stratégiques et positionnements d'affaires.Plus spécifiquement, les modèles visés sont ceux utilisés dans le cadre de la gestion des risques de crédit, de marché, de liquidité et de taux d’intérêt ainsi que les modèles de capital économique, de simulation de crises et de calcul des provisions collectives IFRS9.Responsabilités principalesAssurer que les processus de modélisation exploitent adéquatement les données disponibles compte tenu de leur caractérisation, de leur qualité et des traitements effectués dans le cadre de mandats d'envergure stratégiqueAssurer que les travaux de modélisation prédictive sont réalisés selon les standards requis et respectent les critères de qualité du Mouvement Desjardins par le biais du processus de validationAnalyser les besoins d’affaires à l’origine du modèle et confirmer par le biais de travaux de validation l’adéquation du modèle à cet effetAssurer que la programmation nécessaire à la préparation et l’exploration des données, au développement, à l’évaluation, au support, au déploiement et à la gestion de modèles novateurs et de haute complexité conceptuelle est réalisée selon les standards requisUtiliser des méthodes avancées et innovantes en statistiques, en apprentissage automatique et en intelligence artificielle en vue de mettre à l’épreuve les méthodologies proposées par la première ligne de défenseÉtablir et rédiger les encadrements, les méthodes et les choix méthodologiques et technologiques. Conseiller et former les équipes sur les méthodes de validation quantitative de modèles et les faire évoluer dans le but d'améliorer la vélocité de livraisonCibler des opportunités d’optimisation des règles et des systèmes, anticiper les impacts sous-jacents aux changements et contribuer à l'évolution des outils de gestion des données et de support à la modélisationReprésenter les équipes auprès de différents membres de la haute direction et auprès de partenaires ou d’organismes externesAssurer une vigie afin de comprendre et d'anticiper les tendances dans son domaine d'expertise en validation de modèles en vue d'assurer le développement et la mise à jour de pratiques appropriées au contexte de l'entreprise.Conditions particulièresLieu de travail: Place d’affaires Montréal ou Lévis, selon la préférence du candidat retenu. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1Profil recherchéBaccalauréat dans une discipline appropriéeUn minimum de huit ans d'expérience pertinente, dont au moins quatre ans dans le domaine analytiqueMaîtrise ou diplôme de 2e cycle dans une discipline appropriée (un atout)Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation (M.Sc. ou Ph.D.) et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considéréesPour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaireConnaissances spécifiquesMaîtrise des outils spécialisés tels que RiskManager, QRM, MurexTrès bonnes connaissances en modélisation mathématique et en statistiquesTrès bonnes connaissances en programmation : C++, SQL, Python, Matlab, VB, SASBonne connaissance des activités de l'industrie bancaire (un atout)Connaissance de la réglementation Bâle (un atout)Connaissance de l'anglais de niveau intermédiaire, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écritCompétences transversales DesjardinsApprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’actionCompétences clés au profil recherchéCommuniquer de manière efficace, Faire preuve d’esprit stratégique, Gérer la complexité, Maîtriser les relations interpersonnelles, Stimuler l’innovationLieu de travailComplexe Desjardins MontréalSyndicatDate de fin d'affichage2022-05-12Famille d'emploisDonnée (GF)

Are you ready to bring powerful ideas to reality and transform healthcare? Do you want to be part of a diverse, large community of 450+ data scientists that shares a passion for collaboration, solving complex problems and life Science? If yes, it is time to join IQVIA and see where your skills can take you!IQVIA is known as The Human Data Science Company. It is a world leader in using data, technology, advanced analytics, and expertise to help customers drive healthcare forward. Together with the companies we serve, we are enabling a more modern and effective healthcare system and creating breakthrough solutions that transform business and patient outcomes.Your Mission/RoleAs part of the Data Science and Advanced Analytics team (DSAA), your mission is to support and promote implementation of AIML solutions. We are looking for data scientists that will discover information hidden in vast amounts of data in order to help IQVIA deliver better products/services and our clients make smarter business decisions!On a daily basis, you will: Interact within a multidisciplinary team and propose innovative solutions to answer business questionsExplore large data sets, develop data pipeline and leverage AIML to find key business insightsInterprets data and insights with proper business meaning, draws conclusions and provide recommendations on client actions. Communicate results to internal/external clients with proper data visualization expertiseCollaborate with other members of DSAA team QualificationsPost-graduate degree in Mathematics, Data science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning or related field. KeyMinimum experience of 2+ years in data exploration/manipulation. KeyStrong knowledge and applied experience (2+ years) of classical Machine Learning and deep learning methods. KeyProgramming: Strong skills in Python. Good SQL level. Key. Knowledge of SAS is a plus.Experience working with large datasets and big data tools/environment such as Cloudera, Spark, Hadoop.Experience with cloud solutions (AWS, Azure) and visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, QLIK).Details oriented person who works with enthusiasm, persistence and takes pleasure to let the "data talks" (storytelling)Good verbal and written communication skills in English.Desire to make a difference in Life Science.What IQVIA can offer you?Work-Life Balance: Hybrid work model Base Salary and Annual Incentive Plan (Bonus)Flexible Benefits and Pension planPersonal: Wellness Matching Program and Employee Assistance ProgramGrowth/Career: Tuition Reimbursement planEnriching challenges that provide opportunity for constant learning and advancementIQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Senior Data Analyst Who We Are at Elemy:Elemy is building the first managed marketplace for in-home chronic medical care, starting with pediatric autism. Our AI-powered technology matches families with like-minded therapists, resulting in better care that helps children learn new behaviors and reach life-changing milestones. Children receiving care with Elemy report a 13% increase in communication skills, 80% reduction in problem behavior, and 140% increase in skill adoption within six months - amazing milestones that further our mission each day.Since launching in April 2020, Elemy has become one of the fastest-growing healthcare companies in the United States, scaling from four employees to more than 1,300 employees in less than 18 months. The company is backed by some of the most prominent investors in healthcare and technology, including SoftBank, Goodwater, General Catalyst, Founders Fund, SignalFire, e.ventures, and 8VC.Interested in learning more? Watch a mother detail her Elemy experience on NBC News , read Bloomberg ’s take on our Series B, listen to Elemy CEO, Yury Yakubchyk, discuss destigmatizing mental health on Spotify , or check out why Dr. Henry Roane was awarded the highest award of its honor in ABA therapy, the American Psychological Association Nathan H. Azrin Distinguished Contribution to Applied Behavior Analysis Award.Senior Data Analyst at ElemyAnalytics teams at Elemy play a critical role in driving rapid, rational decision making in support of product, operations, marketing, engineering, and business teams. We are masters of business context who can apply a broad set of data science & analytics techniques to solve amorphous problems. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will partner with functional teams across Elemy to build metrics that are durable, design experiments that are defensible, create dashboards that are extensively utilized for decision making, and help shape an analytics practice that appropriately balances speed, accuracy, and risk. You will be a leader within the Elemy Data & Analytics organization, mentoring junior analysts and meaningfully contributing to  how  analytics at Elemy are done.What You’ll Do Solve problems that matter.  Deeply understand the world of pediatric behavioral therapy, the stakeholders involved, and how analytics can (and cannot!) be deployed to bring this industry into the digital age.  Partner with colleagues in analytics and the business to identify key metrics we should track, analysis we should embark upon, and dashboards we should build.  Understand, implement, and maintain key data pipelines that relate to your specific area of the business. Contribute to our data ecosystem management strategy.  Synthesize complex analyses into consumable stories with actionable insights.  Break down - and often reframe - business problems into well bounded problems solvable with data & analytics.  Exercise good judgment - appropriately discerning when basic techniques are sufficient and when advanced methods are required. Who You Are 5+ years working in an analytics team at a high-growth company  Excellent SQL skills, ability to write and debug complex SQL queries  Excellent written communication skills  Experience with Snowflake, Github, dbt, Python, and R is a plus  Experience with at least one data visualization tool (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Periscope)  A track record of working autonomously, with strong organizational and time management skills  Experience with communicating data driven insights to business stakeholders  Experience coaching business colleagues on how to leverage analytics appropriately  Experience mentoring other analysts is a plus At Elemy, we are a globally-distributed team with many of our team members located throughout the world, including in the following cities: San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, Miami, Toronto, Montreal, and Kyiv. While everyone currently works remotely, we envision a future that balances face-to-face collaboration with a remote-friendly environment.The above job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required for the position.Elemy is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing all employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We celebrate diversity and welcome applicants from every background and life experience.#BI-Remote

Company DescriptionDropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to design a more enlightened way of working. From our headquarters in San Francisco to eight dedicated Studios and a worldwide team of employees who choose where they work best, our Virtual First approach is leading the way into the future of work.Team DescriptionOur Finance team builds the financial infrastructure to scale our growing company. We combine analytical and strategic thinking to develop a sound financial future for our global brand. We work closely with teams across the company, as well as with external partners.Role DescriptionAs a Financial Analyst focused on Revenue and Growth, you will be a key partner for our Product and Growth teams at Dropbox. You will play a crucial role in areas such as subscription revenue forecasting, generating strategic initiatives ideas, driving analytical insights, and evaluating resource investments. Your work will play a crucial part in ensuring Dropbox makes sound financial and strategic decisions that drive sustainable business growth. You’ll get substantial senior leadership exposure, focusing real-time on the highest priority business issues, and being plugged into every facet of our business.ResponsibilitiesForecast global subscription revenue, set financial goals for our Product and Growth organizations, and provide regular executive-level reporting to track progress against strategic initiativesConduct advanced analytics, delivering impactful and actionable insights that drive decision makingCollaborate with business partners in Product, Finance, and Business Strategy on ad hoc projects and financial modelingDevelop new processes and tools to drive scalable analysis and insightsPartner with Corporate Development to perform financial due diligence and integrate key metrics for future M&ARequirements2+ years of relevant experience including 1+ year in a fast-growing tech environment preferably a SAAS based company or investment banking preferredUndergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline. Knowledge of GAAP and basic understanding of financial statements highly desirableYou've demonstrated excellence in financial modeling and analytics. Advanced Excel skills essentialBasic understanding of SQL Strong quantitative, organizational and communications skillsYou sweat the details and maintain a high level of integrity in your workYou're a self-starter who enthusiastically drives projectsYou're able to build positive relationships with business leadersDropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

job_title: Senior Data scientist, User Interest / Scientifique de données, Intérêt utilisateur
job_desc: Posted by                  Dominique Drouin             Principal recruiter - Operate Solutions chez Unity                                     Send InMail                    The opportunityThe Unity Monetization team builds advertising, other personalized content delivery solutions, and technologies used in hundreds of thousands of apps. Our Monetization platform processes TBs of data and delivers relevant content to hundreds of millions of users every day. Unity is investing heavily in deep learning and deep reinforcement learning on multiple fronts. In Montreal, we develop cutting edge machine learning-centric products that provide millions of predictions each and every second to optimize the efficiency and profitability of user acquisition advertising campaigns.We are now looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join a team that is building one of the key components in Unity Monetization stack. Our team builds deep learning models that capture the user interest and serves multiple other teams in the monetization stack. You will contribute to and own end-to-end machine learning pipelines and develop deep neural network models to be used by other teams, such as conversion and value prediction models, making sure that the developers and gamers have the best advertisement experience. We expect you to actively contribute with new ideas and drive execution end-to-end. If you are open-minded, interested in learning and excelling we want to hear from you.What You’ll Be DoingWork with the team to improve the personalization of ads for mobile gamingImplement embeddings and machine learning methods that help other models to solve business problemsDevelop deep learning and online personalized targeting solutions with tech stack of Python/Spark/Tensorflow/KerasWork with machine learning-based online decision-making systems on a large scaleWhat We’re Looking ForExperience in implementing data processing and training predictive modelsExperience in machine learning model development using TensorflowUnderstanding of machine learning concepts and programmingGood communication skills to help collaboration with other data scientists and engineersPassion for machine learning and data scienceYou might also haveFamiliarity with KubeFlow and KubernetesExperience with large scale data/distributed systemsExperience in mobile advertisement, gaming, or online tradingLife at UnityUnity is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.The company’s 1,400+ person research and development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than three billion times per month in 2019 on more than two billion unique devices. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.L'opportunitéL’équipe Monetization de Unity élabore des publicités, des solutions d’achat et d’autres systèmes et technologies de diffusion de contenu personnalisé qui sont utilisés par des centaines de milliers d’applications. Notre plateforme de monétisation traite au quotidien plusieurs téraoctets de données pour fournir un contenu pertinent à des centaines de millions d’utilisateurs. Unity investit lourdement dans plusieurs facettes du développement de l’apprentissage profond et de l’apprentissage profond par renforcement. L’équipe de Montréal développe des produits révolutionnaires centrés sur l’apprentissage automatique qui fournissent des millions de prévisions chaque seconde afin d’optimiser l’efficacité et la rentabilité des campagnes publicitaires d’acquisition d’utilisateurs.Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un(e) scientifique des données sénior qui rejoindra une équipe travaillant sur l’un des composants clés de la pile technologique Monetization de Unity. Notre équipe conçoit des modèles d’apprentissage profond capables de capter les intérêts des utilisateurs et dessert plusieurs autres équipes intervenant dans la pile technologique Monetization. Vous contribuerez à l’élaboration de pipelines d’apprentissage automatique de bout en bout et développerez des modèles de réseaux neuronaux profonds destinés à être utilisés par d’autres équipes, notamment des modèles de conversion et de prédiction de valeur, en veillant à ce que les développeur(euse)s et les joueur(euse)s bénéficient de la meilleure expérience publicitaire possible. Nous nous attendons à ce que vous contribuiez activement à l’élaboration de nouvelles idées et à ce que vous dirigiez leur réalisation, du stade de conception jusqu’à la livraison finale. Si vous êtes une personne ouverte d’esprit, prête à apprendre et à se dépasser, nous aimerions vous rencontrer.Ce que vous allez faireCollaborer avec l’équipe pour mieux personnaliser les publicités pour les jeux mobilesMettre en œuvre des méthodes d’intégration et d’apprentissage automatique qui permettront à d’autres modèles de résoudre les problèmes opérationnelsDévelopper des solutions d’apprentissage profond et de ciblage personnalisé en ligne en utilisant une pile technologique composée de Python, Spark, Tensorflow et KerasTravailler avec des systèmes de prise de décision en ligne fondés sur l’apprentissage automatique à grande échelleCe que nous recherchonsUne expérience en matière de mise en œuvre de modèles de traitement des données et de formation de modèles prédictifsUne expérience en matière de développement de modèles d’apprentissage automatique à l’aide de TensorflowUne compréhension des concepts et des méthodes de programmation utilisés pour l’apprentissage automatiqueUne bonne capacité à communiquer afin de favoriser la collaboration avec d’autres scientifiques et développeur(euse)sUne passion pour l’apprentissage automatique et la science des donnéesVous avez peut-être égalementUne familiarité avec les outils KubeFlow et KubernetesUne expérience avec les systèmes de données ou distribués à grande échelleUne expérience en matière de publicité, de jeu, ou de commerce en ligne sur les plateformes mobilesLa vie chez UnityUnity est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateurs, notamment des développeurs de jeux vidéo, des artistes, architectes, concepteurs automobiles et cinéastes, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à ce qu'ils ont imaginé. La plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.Notre équipe de plus de 1400 personnes assignées à la recherche et au développement fait en sorte que Unity soit à l'avant-garde du développement et assure un soutien optimal pour les plus récentes technologies et plateformes. Les applications développées par les créateurs au sein de Unity ont été téléchargées plus de trois milliards de fois par mois en 2019, sur plus de deux milliards d'appareils uniques. Pour en savoir davantage, visitez le site www.unity.com.Unity est un employeur axé sur l’égalité qui s’engage à créer un environnement inclusif, innovateur et ce avec les meilleurs talents. Nous offrons des opportunités d’emploi qui ne tiennent pas compte de l’âge, de l’ethnicité, de la religion, des limitations fonctionnelles, du sexe, de l’identité sexuelle ou d’un tout autre statut protégé conformément à la loi. S'il y a des préparatifs que nous pouvons faire pour vous aider à avoir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, n’hésitez pas à nous en faire part.Les chasseurs de tête et les agences de recrutement ne peuvent pas soumettre un résumé/CV directement sur notre site web ou à un de nos gestionnaires. Nous n’acceptons pas d’être spontanément sollicités par un chasseur de tête et ou une agence; une entente devra être signé entre les deux partis.#SEN

For more than 20 years, PointClickCare has been the backbone of senior care. We’ve amassed the richest senior care dataset making our market density untouchable and our connections to the healthcare ecosystem exponentially more powerful than those of any other platform.With Collective Medical & Audacious Inquiry, we’ve become the most expansive, full-continuum care collaboration network, offering care teams immediate, point-of-care access to deep, real-time insights at every stage of a patient’s journey.For more information on PointClickCare, please connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn.Position SummaryPointClickCare is seeking a Senior Business Data Analyst in our Enterprise Solutions and Applications (ESA) team. The ESA team partners with other teams across the business to turn data into information, information into insights and insights into key business decisions that steer the strategic direction of the company’s critical business lifecycles.Reporting to theManager, Business Analysts, the successful candidate will be an individual with strong business and technical aptitude, problem-solving skills with a focus on operational analysis and presentation of results, attention to detail, a positive professional attitude, and the ability to work in a fast past environment.The right individual for this role loves problem-solving and is a strong verbal and written communicator. We are looking for someone excited about value and digital transformation opportunities to turn data and process into knowledge and automation.This individual will design innovative approaches to extract actionable insights by identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data and develop recommendations to drive business automation.Success in this role is defined by gaining the business’ confidence that you are their trusted advocate who can tap into proper Enablement resources to drive timely solutions, and that you thoroughly understand the business need, data, and technology to support them effectively.Key ResponsibilitiesCapture data, technical integration requirements and develop data flow diagrams, data dictionaries, data mapping, entity relationship diagrams and ‘To-be’/’As-Is’ process flow diagrams Facilitate interviews and process workshops to gather requirements from key stakeholders, while also identifying opportunities to improve the business, using information technology as an enabler In collaboration with the business SME, build user stories translated from to-be use-case(s) and process maps, functional and non-functional requirements, including success criteria Work to identify user story dependencies; participate in both Grooming and Planning working sessions to validate user story definition, impact, priority, and value Design, build and maintain the enterprise business data architecture in collaboration with and in support of the enterprise business systems landscape In collaboration with the Business Systems Manager team, design and produce the applicable roadmap(s) of data management Mentor and coach team members on best practices standards in business data flow and enterprise system integration process modelling Document and maintain the end-to-end business data-flow catalogue for any given business lifecycle Identify critical relationships across systems, gaps and/or areas of risk, including any mitigation solutions Document and maintain the Data Service Catalogue for best-practice delivery playbooks and standards, including but not limited to process management, system user access/persona, and release management Lead business data critical initiatives and related requirement development, providing guidance on upstream and downstream impacts, including any risk mitigation solutions, and the necessary implementation workstreams and success criteria Partner with Enterprise Applications team, providing guidance and support on dataflow, migration and data integrity best practices Provide support in existing and new system integrations; provide support to maintain the Enterprise Integrations Catalogue Provide support in existing and new systems events (new system acquisitions, integrations, 3rd party tools, new release capabilities and/or upgrades, etc.) Partner with the EDA and Data Intelligenceteam, providing support to the enterprise data repositories and constructs, including but not limited to business data dictionaries, reporting and analytical capabilities Provide support on the design, business value and implementation of in-system vs Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) reporting capabilities Provide support applicable in the enterprise data governance programs, promoting the value (and accountability) of data stewardship and/vs. data integrity Provide support with 3rd party data providers, including but not limited to cleansing, adjudication, and enrichment Promote the enterprise-wide common catalog of metrics and KPIs toward high-performance insights Partner with any other OCIO (or Enablement) teams to support in any enterprise infrastructure or architecture programs, including but not limited to TSS in user management, Security, & Trust in access and risk management, and audit, Business Continuity Planning (BPC), etc Required ExperienceBachelor’s degree and/or equivalent experience Experience liaising with both the business and technology teams with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts into easy-to-understand non-technical language in order to facilitate, communicate and interact with business stakeholders, working with Agile development methods on data-oriented projects Experience with modeling tools relating to process, data, and workflow at the conceptual level Experience using BPMN for process modeling/mapping is highly desired Experience in data lifecycle and ETL design; strong understanding of data management principles, data profiling Direct experience working with technical teams supporting the delivery of data migration/synchronization between complex systems and/or integrations Ability to successfully conduct workshops with stakeholders from various functional areas and levels in the organization. Experience in creating complex test plans and quality assurance plans to validate new systems Salesforce, NetSuite & PowerBI experience is preferred Direct experience in various systems analysis methodologies, including data analysis, data mapping, flowcharts, uses case development, story writing, set-up / configuration of systems, user acceptance testing and product documentation Direct experience in Agile methodologies including project management, iterative design, build and delivery Ability to prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment Ability to effectively communicate and drive cross-functional change with a sense of urgency Persuasive and credible presentation and facilitation skills; ability to influence and negotiate Critical thinking, problem solving and analytical skills It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. PointClickCare welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please contact recruitment@pointclickcare.com should you require any accommodations.When you apply for a position, your information is processed and stored with Lever, in accordance with Lever’s Privacy Policy. We use this information to evaluate your candidacy for the posted position.
