DescriptionFor over 50 years, Schlesinger Group has been constantly perfecting the art and science of qualitative and quantitative data collection. Put simply, we provide answers to your questions through practices of partnership, quality, and service excellence, powered by a talented team with a genuine passion for research. work.RequirementsOur ValuesOur team believes in delving in and digging deep. Passion, patience, perseverance, perspective and people are our core values. We promote a culture of openness, authenticity and trust. We believe in being accountable, being committed to ongoing learning, and demonstrating excellence and leadership in all that we do. We consider ourselves to be a pretty formidable team with a close-knit work environment and an entrepreneurial spirit.Job DescriptionAs a Junior Database Analyst for AskingCanadians, you will be responsible for:Preparing data for creating, running, and modifying sample jobs.Developing complex SQL queries using join operators, subqueries and correlated queries, functions, set operators, virtual tables and procedures for large datasetsPerforming data conversion, data cleansing, data masking, de-identification and encryption techniquesExtracting data for feasibility studies, raw data pulls, sample pulls and data appends.Preparing data files in appropriate formats for client review and overseeing the quality of data deliverablesLiaising with Sales, Project Managers, and Programmers on ad hoc data requestsQualifications/AttributesWe are looking for applicants with superior organizational skills and a high attention to detail. In addition, you must have:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Software Engineering, or related discipline with 0-2 years of work experienceExperience with SQL-based database management systems such as Microsoft SQL Server or OracleExperience with NoSQL-based database management systems such as MongoDB or CassandraProficiency with MS Excel functions and formulas including VLOOKUP or Index Match, pivot tables, conditional formatting, Logic functions and filter/sorting.Designing or Understanding data architectures (CDM/LDM/PDM).Knowledge or experience indata conversion, data cleansing, data masking, de-identification and encryption methodologiesKnowledge or experience with data privacy legislation and database performance design best practicesDemonstrated commitment to the accuracy and completeness of informationComfortable working in a team and the ability to work independently with minimal supervisionIntegrity, initiative and commitment to continuous learningThe ability to thrive in a fast paced, deadline-driven environmentDefinite Assets / DifferentiatorsExperience with or knowledge of MS SQL and/or MongoDB is an assetExperience with online data collection, reporting and samplingHow to applyIf this sounds like the role for you and you are up for the challenge, please contact us.We look forward to reviewing your qualifications as outlined in a cover letter and resume.Please send your application to: careers@askingcanadians.comSome things to noteWe will only contact candidates who qualify for an interview. A satisfactory review of your references and a criminal background check are part of our selection process.AskingCanadians is an equal opportunity employer and we highly encourage applications from; women, visible minorities, members of the LGBTQ community, persons with disabilities, and persons of Aboriginal heritage.AskingCanadians is committed to providing a fully accessible recruitment process. Should you require additional accommodations to participate in our process, please contact careers@askingcanadians.com with your request, or to obtain additional information.

Economical fait partie de Definity, ce qui regroupe certaines des marques d’assurance les plus établies et innovatrices au Canada, soit Assurance Economical, Compagnie d’assurance Sonnet, Family Insurance Solutions et Compagnie d’assurance Petline. Depuis nos débuts en 1871, nous sommes devenus un chef de file numérique au sein de l’industrie de l’assurance de dommages. Nous sommes fiers d’aider nos clients et communautés à s’adapter et à s’épanouir dans un monde en constante évolution.Notre promesse : Ici, nous faisons évoluer l’assurance. Pourquoi? Parce que NOUS TENONS À VOUS et nous vous offrons une expérience collaborative, ambitieuse, valorisante et stimulante.Notre ambition est d’être un des assureurs de dommages les plus importants et innovateurs au Canada. Joignez-vous à notre parcours et ayez plaisir à travailler.PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉSÉlaborer des modèles d’apprentissage machine et appuyer la gestion de ces modèles tout au long de leur cycle de vie.Élaborer, surveiller et améliorer les solutions analytiques en collaboration avec les parties prenantes des catégories d’affaires et les professionnels des technologies de l’information.Planifier et gérer efficacement les projets d’analytique et orienter le travail technique des membres de l’équipe.Acquérir une bonne compréhension de l’assurance par l’apprentissage indépendant et la collaboration étroite avec les parties prenantes des catégories d’affaires.Mettre continuellement l’accent sur l’innovation et l’amélioration des processus pour promouvoir des pratiques de pointe et l’efficacité dans l’ensemble de l’entreprise.EXIGENCESDiplôme universitaire en science informatique, génie logiciel, mathématiques ou une discipline connexe.Expérience en matière d’élaboration et de mise en œuvre de solutions d’analytique.Excellentes aptitudes en matière de communication et d’organisation.Capacité d’élaboration de solutions créatives à des problèmes complexes.COMPÉTENCES TECHNIQUESMinimum de trois ans d’expérience en langages de programmation statistique comme Python, ainsi qu’en langages d’interrogation de bases de données comme SQL, Hive ou Pig. La connaissance de Scala, Java ou C++ est un atout.Grande expérience des techniques d’apprentissage machine comme GLM, GAM, XGBoost, Neural Networks, k-NN. SVM, etc.Connaissance des technologies de données massives comme Hadoop et Spark.Une expérience des plateformes infonuagiques comme le GCP ou AWS est fortement souhaitée.Il est hautement souhaitable de connaître les systèmes d'intégration et de distribution continues (CI/CD) pour le déploiement de modèles de données et d’apprentissage machine.La connaissance de Git pour le contrôle de versions et la collaboration est un atout.Nous tenons également compte du potentiel. Donc, si vous n’avez pas exactement ces compétences, mais que vous avez les atouts qu’il faut, indiquez-les dans votre curriculum vitæ et votre lettre de présentation.Allez-y, attendez-vous à plus — vous le méritez et nous l’offrons : Un horaire de travail hybride pour la majorité des rôlesUn régime d’actionnariat de la compagnieUn programme de retraite et d’épargne, avec des cotisations au REER égalées par l’entrepriseDes journées de bénévolat payées et des dons à des organismes de bienfaisance égalés par l’entrepriseDes ressources éducatives, le remboursement des frais de scolarité et du temps d’étude payéUn accent sur l’inclusion par l’entremise de groupes d’employés, de soutien pour les interventions pour l’affirmation du genre, de conseillers des communautés autochtones, noires et de couleur, et d’un accès à des programmes pour les parents.Des programmes de reconnaissance et de bien-êtreDes rabais sur des produits et services.Notre environnement de travail inclusif accueille la diversité et soutient l’accessibilité. Si vous avez besoin de dispositions particulières en matière d’accessibilité au cours du processus de recrutement, veuillez envoyer un courriel à l’adresse mailto: [email protected].Vérification des antécédentsLa vérification des antécédents (dont la vérification du casier judiciaire et des références des gestionnaires) du candidat est nécessaire pour ce rôle.

Data Analyst, Marketing Acquisition (Remote - Canada) It turns out… unicorns are real! In fact, FreshBooks just became one after raising our valuation to more than $1 billion. And ever since launching in 2003, we’ve been on a steady incline towards one goal: Building easy-to-use accounting software for small business owners. It’s the goal that’s driven us to expand into five offices, serving customers in over 160 countries. And it’s the goal we’d love for you to be a part of as a member of our global team as we continue our journey.Known for extraordinary product and customer service experiences and based in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries, with offices in the U.S., Netherlands and Croatia.The Opportunity – Data Analyst, Marketing AcquisitionLocation: Canada, RemoteDepartment: Data & AnalyticsThe Data Analyst will enable FreshBooks reporting and help to derive insights from website, event, campaign and customer web and product interaction data to improve the volume and quality of acquired trailers, determine growth opportunities, understand the customer journey and major drop-offs.The right person for the job will love to solve a problem and have a knack for translating data into insight and presenting that information to stakeholders. You will be collaborating with managers and a team that includes other analysts, data scientists, marketers, financial analysts, and developers all working together to drive growth at FreshBooks.Specifically in this position you will:Complete ad-hoc / deep-dive analyses by translating raw data into useable information Build dashboards for core performance metrics/monitor KPI’sChannel level reporting on trends in acquisition performanceSupport with A/B testing for campaign treatmentsContent / Webpage reviews and analysesWork independently & with engineering to ensure the integrity of data flows / transfersMonitor changes in usage behaviours (organically and due to marketing)Performance evaluations of various customer segmentsConsult with internal clients to gather requirements, scope & executeComplex, long-term analyses on visitor trends and performance impactsCommunicate results and recommended analyses/approaches to stakeholdersWe think you'll be an amazing fit for this position if your application can demonstrate:Minimum 2-3 years in data analytics/business intelligenceIntermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL is requiredGoogle Tag Manager experience is an assetKnowledge of Google Analytics data, and/or similar web analytics toolsStrong knowledge of one or more visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau etc.Quantitative background with strong analytical skillsExperience working with relational databasesFamiliarity with the marketing campaign and/or web data is preferred Python knowledge is an assetWhy Join UsWe're a motivated bunch, with our eyes laser-focused on shipping extraordinary experiences to businesses. You will be surrounded by hardworking team members who share a common vision for what an amazing software company could be, and have the opportunity to help build an elite one, right here in downtown Toronto.Apply NowHave we got your attention? Submit your application today and a member of our recruitment team will be in touch with you shortly!FreshBooks is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, religion, race, mental disability, sexual orientation, age, or any other status. All applicants are considered based on their qualifications and merits. At FreshBooks, we inspire an environment of mutual respect and we believe diversity and inclusion are crucial to our success.FreshBooks provides employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us at phone 416-780-2700 and/or accessibility@freshbooks.com.

ObjectiveThe Master Data Analyst creates and updates data in various key enterprise systems.Data accuracy is a key aspect of this role.Responsibilities Create and update, in a timely fashion, all master data in D365 and in our Product life cycle systems. ( i.e vendor accounts, employee accounts, customer accounts, product related information, etc)  Responsible to support the end users by answering and analyzing requests related to data, in a timely manner.  Document master date processes with all key stakeholders.  Perform integrity tests on master data on a weekly basis.  Train the departments involved in master data creation based on inconsistencies found on integrity tests.  Discuss with departments stakeholders to prioritize the work to do.  Process reports in D365 on a daily & weekly basis. Qualification And Skills 3-4 years of pertinent work experience related with master data.  Strong MS Office knowledge.  Strong Microsoft Excel knowledge  Experience with Microsoft D365, an asset  Basic knowledge of SQL and writing queries  Strong communication, verbally and in writing  Ability to build solid relationships with various departments  Detail oriented & organized  Confident & hands-on  Ability to think critically and find solutions  Bilingual, French & English Apply Now

job_title: Analyste principal, analyse de données et projets RH / Senior Data Analyst, HR Analytics & Projects
job_desc: DescriptionTitre du poste : Analyste principal, analyse de données et projets RHLieu : MontréalSe rapporte à : Directrice, Services partagés RHDomtar est un important fournisseur d'un large éventail de produits à base de fibre, dont des papiers de communication, de spécialité et d’emballage, de la pâte commerciale ainsi que des produits non-tissés air-laid. Le bureau administratif principal de Domtar se trouve à Fort Mill, en Caroline du Sud, et Domtar fait partie du groupe d’entreprises Paper Excellence.Comptant près de 6 000 employés au service de clients dans plus de 50 pays, Domtar est animée par la volonté de transformer la fibre de bois durable en produits utiles sur lesquels les gens peuvent compter au quotidien. Fidèles à nos valeurs que sont l’agilité, l’engagement et l’innovation, nous trouvons toujours de meilleures façons de répondre aux besoins de nos clients, de soutenir nos employés et de renforcer nos collectivités.Principales ResponsabilitésProduction de rapports et analyse de donnéesExtraire, transformer et consolider les données de diverses sources pour créer des rapports et des tableaux de bord clairs, significatifs et conviviaux.Effectuer des analyses complexes et des interprétations associées; identifier les données requises, créer des visualisations, identifier des idées, des tendances et/ou des thèmes; synthétiser les résultats dans une histoire axée sur les affaires; créer des présentations pertinentes et les livrer aux partenaires clients; collaborer avec les entreprises pour expliquer les résultats et déterminer les recommandations.Concevoir, créer et maintenir des rapports et tableaux de bord complexes pour les clients de tous les paliers de l’entreprise.Travailler avec les clients à la compréhension des défis d’affaires et les requis pour ainsi traduire les demandes de rapports en questions de données pertinentes et en hypothèses aux fins d’analyse.Penser de façon créative et proposer des alternatives pour répondre aux besoins des clients; soutenir l’amélioration continue des outils et des capacités d’analyse des RH.Maintenir à jour la documentation des processus de production de rapports.Créer des outils pour prédire les tendances en matière de personnel afin de soutenir la planification de la main-d’œuvre pour les clients partenaires.Documenter les exigences détaillées relatives pour les demandes de rapport complexes. Gouvernance des données et développement de solutionsEnquêter sur les problèmes de qualité des données, y compris la coordination avec les autres parties prenantes (RH et TI);Gérer les demandes d'accès aux données et l'attribution des rôles en coordination avec l’équipe TI;Veiller à ce que les directives de confidentialité des données soient respectées en tout temps;Assurer la qualité des données en analysant les problèmes et en se coordonnant avec les parties prenantes concernées (propriétaires de données, propriétaires de processus, etc.);Identifier les opportunités de développement de solutions.Compétences ClésExpérience des statistiques, des prévisions et des méthodes de modélisation;Expertise démontrée en exploration de données et validation de données;Souci du détail, compétences supérieures en communication et forte orientation vers le service à la clientèle;Aptitudes exceptionnelles à la résolution de problèmes;Aptitude au diagnostic et à la satisfaction des besoins des intervenants;Aptitude à l’analyse et à l’interprétation des données;Aptitude à résumer et à présenter de l’information complexe;Forte inclinaison à passer à l’action, motivation intrinsèque et curiosité intellectuelle;Aptitude à la création de partenariats avec divers intervenants;Aptitude à travailler de manière autonome et simultanément sur plusieurs projets (compétences en gestion des priorités);Compréhension de l'environnement, des défis et des opportunités des systèmes RH, un atout certain.Bilingue, écrit et verbal, en anglais et en français, de préférence.Expérience Professionnelle Et QualificationsB.Sc/BA en statistiques, analytique, mathématique, affaires, ou informatique/ingénierie/sciences de l’information;Minimum 5 ans d’expérience en analyse de données dans un rôle similaire;Expérience pratique en visualisation de données un atout certain ;Compétences éprouvées avec les outils d’intelligence d’affaires (ex : Tableau) et les méthodes statistiques, un atout certain;Maîtrise avancée de MS Excel et solide maîtrise de MS Word et Powerpoint.Vous devez réussir un processus de sélection qui comprend des entrevues, des tests d’aptitudes (selon le poste) ainsi que des vérifications pré-emploi.Domtar applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité et invite les femmes, les minorités visibles, les Autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature.Notre OffreUn emplacement au cœur du centre-ville (métro Place des Arts);Modalités d’aménagement du temps de travail; télétravail hybride, horaire flexible et horaire d’été;Un environnement de travail moderne et spacieux;Un plan d’assurance « À la carte » (vie, soins médicaux, dentaires);Un programme d’aide aux employés;Un Centre de la Petite Enfance sur place;Une rémunération concurrentielle, incluant un régime de boni annuel;Un régime de retraite avec participation de l’employeur;Du développement et de la formation continue payés par l’employeur.-Position title: Senior Data Analyst, HR Analytics & ProjectsLocation: MontrealReports to: Director, HR Shared ServicesDomtar is a leading provider of a wide variety of fiber-based products including communication, specialty and packaging papers, market pulp and air laid nonwovens. Domtar’s principal executive office is in Fort Mill, South Carolina and Domtar is part of the Paper Excellence group of companies.With approximately 6,000 employees serving more than 50 countries around the world, Domtar is driven by a commitment to turn sustainable wood fiber into useful products that people rely on every day. Through our values of agility, caring and innovation, we constantly find better ways to serve our customers, support our employees and strengthen our communities.Job Responsibilities/AccountabilitiesReporting & Data AnalysisExtracting, transforming, and consolidating data from various sources to create clear, meaningful, and user-friendly reports and dashboards.Perform complex analyses and associated interpretations: identify required data, create visualizations, identify insights, trends and/or themes; synthesize findings into business-oriented story; create relevant presentations & deliver same to client partners; collaborate with business to explain findings and determine recommendations.Design, build and maintain complex reports and dashboards for clients at many levels of the organization.Work with business clients to understand business challenges and requirements up front and translate reporting requests into relevant data questions and hypotheses for analysis.Think creatively and propose alternatives to meet client needs; support the ongoing improvement of HR analytic tools and capabilities.Maintain reporting process documentation.Build predictive tools to forecast people trends in support of workforce planning for client partners.Document detailed requirements for complex reporting requests.Data governance & solution developmentInvestigate data quality issues, including coordinating with other stakeholders (HR and IT);Manage data access requests and role assignment in coordination with IT;Ensure data confidentiality guidelines are respected at all times;Actively ensure data quality by analyzing issues and coordinating with relevant stakeholders (Data Owners, process owners etc);Identify opportunities to develop the solution.Key SkillsExperienced with statistics, forecasting and modeling methodologies;Exceptional problem-solving skills;Ability to diagnose stakeholders needs & satisfy them;Ability to analyze and interpret data;Ability to synthesize and present complex information;A strong bias to action, intrinsically motivated and intellectually curious;Ability to create partnerships with a range of stakeholders;Ability to work autonomously and on multiple projects simultaneously (priority management skills);Understanding of HR systems environment, challenges and opportunities a definite asset;Bilingual, both written and verbal, in English and French preferred.Professional Experience/QualificationsB.Sc/BA in Statistics, Analytics, Mathematics, Business, or computer/engineering/information science;Minimum 5 years’ experience with data analysis in a similar role;Practical experience with data visualization a definite asset;Proven skills with Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and statistical methods a definite asset;Advanced proficiency with MS Excel and strong proficiency with MS Word & Powerpoint.You must successfully complete a selection process that includes interviews, aptitude tests (for some positions) as well as pre-employment verification.Domtar is an equal opportunity employer. We invite women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.Our OfferA downtown location (Place des Arts metro);Alternative Work Arrangements; hybrid remote work and flextime and summer hours;A modern and spacious work environment;A flexible insurance plan (life, medical, dental);An employee assistance program;A childcare center on location;Competitive compensation, including annual bonus plan;A pension plan with matching company contributions;Employer-paid development and continuing education.

Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currency and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide. Circle platforms and products provide a suite of internet-native financial services for payments, treasury infrastructure and capital formation. Circle is also a principal developer of USD Coin (USDC), which has become the fastest growing dollar digital currency in the world. USDC has grown to over 53+ billion in circulation and supported over $1.9+ trillion in transactions in the past year. Circle’s payments and treasury infrastructure services available through the Circle Account and APIs helps bridge the legacy financial system and digital currency and blockchain based finance. Circle’s SeedInvest service brings internet-native fundraising and capital formation to startups and growth companies. Combined, Circle’s suite of services helps companies to participate in a more open, global and inclusive financial system.What you’ll be part of:With the mission “To raise global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value,” Circle was founded on the belief that the internet, blockchains and digital currency will rewire the global economic system, creating a fundamentally more open, inclusive, efficient and integrated world economy. We envision a global economy where people and businesses everywhere can more freely connect and transact with each other with new technologies for digital money and internet-native finance. We believe such a system can raise prosperity for people and companies everywhere. Our mission is powered by the values we espouse and which we expect all Circlers to respect. We are Multistakeholder, serving the needs of our customers, our shareholders, our employees and families, our local communities and our world. Furthermore, we are also Mindful, Driven by Excellence, and High Integrity.What you’ll be responsible for:As a Data Scientist, Analytics at Circle, you’ll work closely with product stakeholders and engineers to better understand our products and enable better decision making with data. Your job will include making sure teams are focused on the biggest opportunities, defining success metrics and goals, and communicating insights throughout the company. We are a passionate team with a deeply analytical mindset, and your work will support us in our mission to be a world-class company driven by data.What you'll work on:Own a domain end-to-end, understand the business problems, define and monitor key metrics, identify opportunities and drive conversations around where to invest engineering resourcesMeasure business performance, develop core metrics and create dashboards to track and understand them.Identify data, metrics and analyses needs for business partners; Initiate, develop and maintain data pipelines and data models that powers dashboards and data products with outstanding craftsmanship. Perform deep analyses and build models to understand customer behavior, and extract key insights that impact product decisions.Perform analyses and build models to understand customer behavior, extracting key insights and communicating to stakeholders to impact product decisionsCommunicate the state of business, experiments results and recommendations to a broad team and senior leadershipData collection and analysis of blockchain activity to understand trading activity, incentives, and how USDC fits in to the broader crypto ecosystemWhat you'll bring to Circle:3+ years of industry experience working with and analyzing large data setsExperience in data analyses using SQL and at least one programming language (e.g. R, Python)Understanding of statistics and experience applying them to business problemsExperience planning and executing analytical projectsBe able to proactively manage prioritization of work and deliver work with great quality and influence the broader team in creating leverage.Previous experience working with financial services data or crypto is a plus.Experience with Looker, Tableau or other business intelligence platforms.Domain experience in product, marketing, growth, or other business analytics, compliance, risk areas.Experience manipulating large amounts of structured and unstructured data.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Posted by                  Jordan Le Corvec             Talents Acquisition Advisor                                     Send InMail                    Desjardins valorise la diversité et l’équité en emploi et s’engage à répondre aux besoins des personnes handicapées en adaptant, au besoin, son processus de recrutement.Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.À titre de Conseiller(ère) principal(e) - scientifique de données, vous contribuez à répondre au besoin des données en soutien à la prise de décisions d’affaires, au développement de solutions et de services adaptés aux enjeux d’affaires et à la compréhension des comportements des membres et clients.Vous assumez un rôle de leadership auprès des différents intervenants dans le cadre de projets de développement de modèles adaptés à des besoins d'affaires variés et d'interventions stratégiques et complexes en analytique avancée et en intelligence artificielle.Vous êtes appelé(e) à interagir avec un grand nombre de parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise variés afin de comprendre et communiquer les enjeux et d'influencer la prise de décision.Plus précisément, vous êtes responsable d'analyser la performance des modèles contre la lutte aux crimes financiers (blanchiment d'argent, sanctions économiques, …) pour les différents secteurs d'affaires du Mouvement Desjardins. Le calibrage, le développement d'outil de simulation, la modélisation et la mise en œuvre d'autres méthodes analytiques font partie de vos responsabilités principales pour des problématiques et enjeux de taille, comme d'assurer la couverture en fonction de la gestion du risque et réduire le taux de faux positifs. En tant qu'expert des modèles et outils du domaine d'affaires, vous aurez également comme mandat de participer à différents projets visant l'implantation ou l'évolution d'outils de surveillance.Responsabilités principales Assurer la performance des modèles de détection contre la lutte aux crimes financiers (blanchiment d'argent, sanctions économiques, etc.)Ajuster/calibrer les seuils des modèles de surveillance selon l’appétit du risqueProposer et développer des modèles de surveillance complémentaires pour bonifier la couvertureAnalyser les besoins d'affaires des clients et partenaires, produire des hypothèses et mener des mandats en considérant les particularités liées à leur opérationnalisation et en assurant l'arrimage lors de leur déploiement.Développer des outils de simulation performantsRésoudre des problèmes complexes par des analysesMettre en œuvre les meilleures pratiques analytiques au sein de l'équipeParticiper à titre de conseiller(ère) aux projets relatifs à l’évolution des outils de gestion du risque de la criminalité financièreEffectuer une vigie afin de comprendre et d'anticiper les tendances dans son domaine d'expertise en vue d'assurer le développement et la mise à jour de pratiques appropriées au contexte de l'entrepriseDévelopper, mettre à jour et produire différents tableaux de bord et des indicateurs de performanceProduire, communiquer et vulgariser des présentations et des visualisations de données pour influencer les décisions d'affaires de son secteur auprès de la directionRédiger les encadrements et les méthodes de modélisation des données. S’assurer de l’élaboration de la documentation, de la préparation et de la diffusion de formations.Profil recherchéBaccalauréat en mathématiques, statistiques, économie, actuariat, informatique ou dans une discipline appropriéeUn minimum de six ans d’expérience pertinenteExpérience en analyses et visualisation de donnéesExpérience en apprentissage machine et/ou apprentissage profond (un atout)Veuillez noter que d'autres combinaisons de formation et d'expérience pertinentes pourraient être considéréesMaîtrise et/ou doctorat dans une discipline appropriée (un atout)Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaireConnaissances spécifiquesExcellente connaissance de SQL, SAS et PythonMaîtrise de VBA (un atout)Connaissance des outils de la lutte à la criminalité financière (blanchiment d'argent, sanction économique, etc.) (un atout)Maîtrise de l'anglais de niveau intermédiaire avancé, tant à l'oral qu'a l'écritConditions particulièresLieu de travail : Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride #LI-HybridNombre d’emploi disponible : 1Compétences transversales DesjardinsApprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’actionCompétences clés au profil recherchéGérer la complexité, Maîtriser la technologie, Maîtriser les relations interpersonnellesLieu de travail400, boul. de Maisonneuve Ouest MontréalDate de fin d'affichage2022-06-6Niveau d'emploiNV-10Famille d'emploisDonnée (GF)

Job Type: PermanentReference code: 100550Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, CanadaAll Available Locations: Toronto; VaughanOur PurposeAt Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.Grow your network and your knowledge by joining one of our many Employee Resource Groups.Your career is important to you. It's important to us, too. take ownership of risks, issues and impediments as appropriate to resolve them in a timely mannerCollaborate effectively with both business and technical stakeholdersAbout The TeamThe Artificial Intelligence (AI) CoE team in Solutions Delivery group within Deloitte’s ITS (Information Technology Services) requires an experienced data analyst. AI CoE focuses on delivering end-to-end AI/ML solutions that have a predictive or cognitive component to deliver business value. AI CoE is a data centric team and very passionate about working with data!The Sr. Data Analyst will fulfill a crucial role in AI CoE project delivery and operational processes. This individual will work with business stakeholders and technical team members to deliver AI/ML solutions that enables or enhances business processes. This individual will do this by querying and analyzing large datasets (often from multiple source systems), performing data profiling, creating source-to-target mappings, authoring functional specs, creating data models, troubleshooting data issues, and in general having a sense of ownership to deliver and maintain high-quality solutions. This individual will guide business and technical stakeholders towards a solution that optimally balances business needs and data availability, data quality and performance.Enough about us, let’s talk about youQualifications:4+ years of experience in data analyst roleProficiency in SQL and conducting data analysis, data profiling, etc.Experience working with large datasets from various data sources, e.g. data lake, SAP HANA data warehouse, SQL database (Azure or on-prem), flat files, etc.Experience writing and analyzing complex SQL queriesExperience using various ETL tools, e.g. Alteryx, Azure Data FactoryExperience with Business Intelligence tools like Tableau/Power BIExperience with cloud technologies, specifically Azure, is considered an assetKnowledge of data science concepts is considered a strong assetDetail oriented with passion for technical quality and strong commitment to professional client service excellenceDemonstrated knowledge of various SLDC project development methodologiesAbility to build strong client and peer relationships while working in a team environmentAbility to successful collaborate with offshore resourcesStrong organization skills in fast paced, multiple stakeholder matrix organizationStrong verbal and written communication skillsUniversity degree or equivalent work experienceOur shared valuesWhile our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world. Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility. Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being. Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions. Posted by                  Yogesh Chhabra,CPHR             Technical Recruiter at Zscaler - North America | Hiring Salesforce Developers, Business System Analysts, Technology Architects, Technical Writers, and more                                     Send InMail                    Company DescriptionZscaler (NASDAQ: ZS) accelerates digital transformation so that customers can be more agile, efficient, resilient, and secure. The Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange is the company’s cloud-native platform that protects thousands of customers from cyberattacks and data loss by securely connecting users, devices, and applications in any location.With more than 10 years of experience developing, operating, and scaling the cloud, Zscaler serves thousands of enterprise customers around the world, including 450 of the Forbes Global 2000 organizations. In addition to protecting customers from damaging threats, such as ransomware and data exfiltration, it helps them slash costs, reduce complexity, and improve the user experience by eliminating stacks of latency-creating gateway appliances.Zscaler was founded in 2007 with a mission to make the cloud a safe place to do business and a more enjoyable experience for enterprise users. Zscaler’s purpose-built security platform puts a company’s defenses and controls where the connections occur—the internet—so that every connection is fast and secure, no matter how or where users connect or where their applications and workloads reside.Job DescriptionPosition: Senior Business Data AnalystLocation: Remote within CanadaZscaler is building a data platform to serve as the single source of truth for all data and reporting needs of its cross-functional business teams. these business teams and develop datasets to meet those requirementsDevelop and maintain data dictionary and metric definitions for multiple business functions and technical datasets, metrics, and KPIs and review them regularly for changes and updates Design Tableau dashboards for insights and reporting when necessary Conduct data enablement sessions for these business teams by communicating new datasets, metrics, KPIs, and processesBusiness Process Document(s) for key business process teams, processes, systems, integrations, data flows & models, business rules & transformations Who You AreA passion for building data platform and insights’ solutions for business teamsPassionate about and focused on customer outcomes with the ability to translate business needs into functional and technical data requirements for the data engineering teamProficient in leveraging data to develop actionable insights and story-telling to drive business impactDrives data literacy and enablement within the organization by building and utilizing data and analytics tools to enable improved understanding of data assets impacting business decisionsExperience with SaaS organization and data is a considerable plus.QualificationsQualifications/Your Background:6+ years of experience with data initiatives (data and systems analysis, story-telling, and data engineering) with a focus on reporting and processes, translating the business needs into data requirementsDeep understanding of analytics frameworks and methodologies, data visualization principles, source systems/business applications (Salesforce, Hadoop, Big Data Architecture), processes, and metricsProven track record of executing data roadmap for support groups by translating business data needs into functional and technical requirements for the data engineering teamAdvanced SQL skills and proficiency in visualization tools such as Tableau, LookerStrong experience collaborating with business stakeholders and users to understand, document, and implement data & analytics needsExperience implementing data governance framework and deliverables is desiredExperience with industry-standard ETL tool (Matillion, Fivetran, etc) preferred but not requiredAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.What You Can Expect From UsAn environment where you will be working on cutting edge technologies and architecturesA fun, passionate and collaborative workplaceCompetitive salary and benefits, including equityWhy Zscaler?People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? DescriptionJob DescriptionBeing part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.As a Data Analyst Redemption Optimization, you need to be passionate about using data and exploiting it to guide business decision. You will play a key role in contributing to the pricing and loyalty projects using state of the art models and innovative approaches.Applying knowledge of advanced analytic algorithms and technologies to deliver better predictions and/or intelligent automation that enables smarter business decisions, improved customer experience, and drives productivity.Key Functions & Accountabilities Develops data models and analytical solutions based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.  Understands and analyzes complex business problem, then formulates data-driven hypotheses to drive business value.  Defines innovative data solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets.  Represents the team’s interests in corporate initiatives, making sure profitability levers and efficiency of processes are taken into consideration.  Support quantification of impacts and risks of product parameter management and marketing activities using various forms of interrelated subjects like mathematics, statistics, finance, economics, behavioral economics and computer science.  Demonstrates creativity and resilience to go beyond current program knowledge and understanding.  Provides value-added support to other departments by performing various analyses on redemption data.  Uses data visualization techniques to disseminate the discoveries to other departments in an interesting manner.  Builds knowledge base of insights for proper internal dissemination. Qualifications At least 3 years in a similar position.  Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills  Excellent mathematic and statistics skillsets including experimental design, predictive modeling, time series, optimization techniques, machine learning, etc.  Proficient with relational databases (e.g. SQL) a strong asset  Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI)  Experience with programing language like Python, SAS or R is a strong asset  Experience with financial modeling and post-campaign analysis is an asset  Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines while paying attention to details  Ability to communicate complex concepts into simple ones (i.e. story-telling skills)  Written and verbal communication skills (English and French)  Positive thinking and sense of humor Education Requirements Bachelors Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field Location: Air Canada Tower, Downtown Montreal Conditions Of Employment Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.  Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required Linguistic RequirementsBased on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.Diversity and InclusionAir Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

With committees like Skip’s BIPOC (Black, Indigenous and People of Colour) Network and Women In Tech alongside our CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) work with organizations like Pride and United Way Winnipeg, you have the opportunity for not only your voice to be heard but for your actions to make an impact, joining a cause that you’re passionate about.That’s just a small taste of what it’s like to work at one of Canada’s leading tech companies. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world. Get to Know our  Team: The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Strong communication and diplomacy skills are required. Regularly assumes informal/formal leadership role within teams. Involved in coaching and training of new recruits. Significant impact in terms of project size, geography, etc. by influencing decisions through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization. Come Work with Us!At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.Job TitleData AnalystJob DescriptionWHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?RBC Capital Market Technology’s Data Content team is looking for a highly skilled analyst to join the team. The analyst will be part of a team of Business Analysts and Data modelers with a focus on: documenting data requirements, identifying data requirements gaps, supporting the datasets registration, ingestion and consumption processes, standardizing data within the Capital Market domain (includes but not limited to Trades/Orders/RFQ’s, Calculated Results such as Risk and Profit and loss reporting) and other structured & unstructured datasets used for analytics. He/She will be required to engage with senior Data Architects, IT System Owners, Business Analysts, Data Stewards, Data Owners to drive the standardization effort across different Lines of Business (LOB’s) and functions (Front Office, Operations, Market Risk & Finance etc.)WHAT WILL YOU DO?Participate on Intake forum for Data Fabric and DCM request, work with Business Analysts across different line of business and functions closely on the dataset registration for different project initiatives, ensure appropriate domain classification and provisioning point identifications, etc.Support the dataset ingestion, classification, registration and/ or consumption processes, working closely with DCM (Data Content and Modeling), Data Fabric teams, ETSS Data Fabric team in the SDLC process of the data content releaseSupport data consumption strategy by creating queries/ views based on consumer requirementsPerform the data discovery and research in data fabric platform to identify the data re-usability for new project initiativesSupport the data registry migrations by providing the UAT testing to ensure the consistency of the data content catalogWHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?Must have: Bachelor's degree or diploma in business, finance, accounting or engineeringData system analysts/data modelers /system analyst experienceSQLExposure to data analyticsNice-to-have:Cross Asset experience of Cash and Derivative Products (Rates, Credit, and Derivatives), Commodities, Equities etc.Good understanding of Trade Lifecycle (Pre, Post) and Front to Back functions (Operations, Product Control, Market Risk & Finance)Post graduate certificationData modeling experienceFmpl, Fix, reactj, json, javaWhat’s in it for you?We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicableLeaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunitiesAbility to make a difference and lasting impactWork in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing teamA world-class training program in financial servicesFlexible work/life balance optionsOpportunities to do challenging workJob SummaryAddress:HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, CanadaCity:CAN-NS-BEDFORDCountry:CanadaWork hours/week:37.5Employment Type:Full timePlatform:Capital MarketsJob Type:RegularPay Type:SalariedPosted Date:2022-05-16-07:00Application Deadline:2022-06-26-07:00Inclusion and Equal Opportunity EmploymentAt RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. job_title: Analyste de données | Data Analyst, Genuine
job_desc: Job Requisition ID #22WD59048Aperçu Du PosteAutodesk recherche un analyste de données expérimenté pour rejoindre l'équipe Genuine. L'équipe se concentre sur la prévention et la conversion du piratage et évolue rapidement, apprend constamment et travaille avec des bases de données qui évoluent rapidement. L'analyste de données aidera à fournir des informations et des découvertes sur le comportement des utilisateurs non conformes dans le but d’adopter nos produits à l'échelle mondiale. De plus, l’analyste de données utilisera les techniques d’exploitations de données pour optimiser les campagnes marketing digitales et éclairer les différentes stratégies de l’équipe Genuine. Le candidat devra démontrer une aisance dans un environnement de type start-up au sein d’une grande entreprise reconnu mondialement. Il devra aussi être à l'aise de travailler dans une mentalité de "combat contre le piratage " très agile tout en étant responsable d'analyses précises et détaillées consommées par les cadres supérieurs.Le candidat recherché devra être expérimenté avec des outils d'analyse de données (tels que Python, Power BI, SQL) et avoir une expérience dans la livraison de découvertes analytiques percutantes pour les équipes de marketing numérique et de stratégie. Le travail impliquera l'analyse de données pour les notifications intégrées au produit, les sites internet de l’organisation, et tout autre moyen de communication mis en place afin de fournir des informations sur les taux de réponse, le parcours client et la segmentation client.ResponsabilitésAider l'organisation en utilisant des méthodes d'analyse de données et des techniques d'exploration de données pour trouver des insights clés sur comment combattre le piratageConseiller les principaux partenaires sur les nouvelles idées et découvertes qui aideront l'entreprise à améliorer ses opérations et à convertir des utilisateurs non-conformesCréer des analyses, des rapports et des tableaux de bord ad hoc pour trouver de nouvelles informations et mesurer les progrès des initiatives clésTravailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes de l'entreprise pour comprendre et maintenir l'accent sur leurs besoins analytiques, y compris l'identification des mesures critiques et des KPIsCollaborer avec différentes équipes au sein de l'organisation pour comprendre les besoins et les exigences de l'entrepriseCompétences à démontrer Solide expérience en analyse de données et connaissance des techniques d'exploration de données (algorithme supervisé et non supervisé)Expérience de travail avec des équipes de marketing numérique, de vente et/ou de stratégieSolides compétences dans les outils d'analyse de données tels que Python, Pyspark, SQL, PowerBICapacité à travailler dans un environnement de gestion matricielle interfonctionnelCapacité éprouvée à fournir de nouvelles informations basées sur les donnéesQualifications MinimalesDiplôme de baccalauréat ou plusAu moins 3 à 5 ans d'expérience en analyse de donnéesExcellentes aptitudes à travailler avec des membres d'équipe d'autres horizonsParler couramment en Anglais________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________Position OverviewAutodesk is seeking an experienced data analyst to join the Genuine team. The team is focused on piracy prevention and conversion and is fast paced, constantly learning, and working with rapidly scaling amounts of data. The Data Analyst will help delivering insights into user behavior and product adoption globally as well as data to drive marketing campaigns, report on results and inform strategy. The candidate will have a proven track record in a fast-paced, cross-functional, and global business environment. You must be comfortable working in a highly agile ‘growth hacking’ mentality while also being responsible for accurate and detailed analysis consumed by senior executives.You must be experienced with analytics tools (such as Python, Power BI, SQL) and have a track record of delivering impactful behavioral insights for digital marketing and strategy teams. The work will involve data analytics for in-product messaging to provide insights on response rates, conversion funnels, customer journey and customer segmentation. The role will require a detailed, systematic, and structured approach with the flexibility to respond quickly to ad hoc requests within a fast-moving program that is constantly learning and discovering.ResponsibilitiesHelp the organization by using data analytics methods and data mining techniques to find key business insightsAdvise key business partners on new insights and discoveries that will help the business to enhance their operationsBuild ad-hoc analysis, reports, and dashboards to find new insights and to measure progress in key initiativesWork closely with business stakeholders to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIsPartner with different teams within the organization to understand business needs and requirementsDemonstrated SkillsStrong track record of data analysis and knowledge in data mining techniques (supervised and unsupervised algorithm)Background in working with digital marketing, sales and/or strategy teamsStrong skills in data analytics tools such as Python, Pyspark, SQL, PowerBIAbility to work within a cross-functional, matrix management environmentProven ability to deliver new data-driven insightsMinimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree or higherAt least 3-5 years of data analytics experienceExcellent skills in working with team members from other backgroundsFluent in EnglishAt Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers. With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

job_title: Hybrid Vehicle Data Analysis Engineer - Associate - PSP - NF616
job_desc: Job Title: - Hybrid Vehicle Data Analysis EngineerLocation: - Remote(Ontario)Duration: - 06 monthsJob Description:The Hybrid Calibration Engineer is responsible for HCP calibration development from first Hardware-In-Loop simulators, powertrain dynamometers and mule vehicles up to production on the next generation of FCA’s Electrified Powertrain vehicles. The scope of responsibility spans the application and optimization of control systems into production for hybrid and electric vehicle powertrains. The calibration specialist will conduct HCP calibration reviews with the calibration teams and support all center of excellence (CoE) team meetings and discussions. The calibration specialist will assist the various calibration teams by providing guidance and support with daily calibration activities and issue resolution. Through the calibration CoE teams, they will review any new calibrations that are implemented with software change requests and work with lead calibrators and controls engineers to ensure initial values for the new calibrations are correct by reviewing SWCRs implemented in the new release (performed at each new SW release).The calibration specialist will lead Hardware-In-Loop and dyno commissioning first-run activities for new powertrain architectures. They will work closely with HCP controls team to ensure features are working sufficiently and efficiently. They will provide training to all new calibration engineers and/or anyone else needing training on the operation of hybrid vehicles and controls. They will support development test trips and report activities for Sr. Management. They will work with the CoE teams to ensure best practices are followed. They will provide support to the various calibration teams for resolving any system issues (GIMS, PITS, Etc..)This individual will have also demonstrated the ability to work will with others. The hybrid calibration specialist must be a team player, supporting and promoting team accomplishments versus personal achievement.Requirements:Proof of Covid Vaccination will be requiredMUST LIVE in Ontario.100% remote but some good opportunities to travel to US for in person meeting once in a while.Driving a Stellantis vehicle is a requirement for this position. Will be required to drive a company car. Valid driver’s license is required as well as a clean driving record.Position Requirements:Basic Qualifications:· Bachelor of Science in Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related degree· Experience with electrified powertrain (BEV or Hybrid) calibration or embedded controls· Good oral and written communication skills with the ability to work independently and with others· High level of analytic ability and creativity· Ability to balance work effectively on multiple issues· Action a disciplined test plan and verification process to ensure quality calibrations are released.· Must have strong knowledge of the Powertrain system.· Exhibit strong leadership presence by engaging management as necessary to ensure project objectives are achieved. Preferred Qualifications:· Knowledge of control system development tools such as Matlab Simulink and GT Power· Experience in Powertrain Control solutions development (powertrain control algorithms, On-board Diagnostics/OBD, embedded software)· Knowledge of fundamentals of internal combustion engines· Experience in engine/transmission design and development and/or Powertrain Systems EngineeringDesired Skills and Experience            POWERTRAIN

StackAdapt is hiring a Platform Quality Analyst to join our growing Programmatic Partnerships & Solutions team. You will be responsible for auditing ad creative as well as exchange inventory. You will also assist in building and optimizing compliance and risk management procedures.We are looking for Individuals who thrive at using data-driven solutions to support client efforts to effectively buy advertising through StackAdapt’s platform. While working with a world class team of analysts, you'll be reporting into our Senior Manager of Platform Quality.It is important that you thrive in a fast-paced environment and that you excel at working on multiple tasks at once. Ideal candidates are those with an investigative mindset and an extreme attention to detail.StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in the GTA for this position.What you'll be doing:Review and audit campaign details and ad creative to ensure they comply with exchange specifications, industry regulations and local lawWork with Sales and Account Management team to investigate and troubleshoot any issue with ad servingAudit exchange inventory and ensure brand-safe ad serving environment Coordinate in-depth training on process and best practicesResearch, analyze, and advise on privacy laws, rules, and regulations from around the globeKeep up to date on privacy-related developments around the globe that affect the company and the industryWork hands-on with partnerships and product teams to support the implementation of privacy risk management and compliancePrepare comprehensive reporting for all key risk metricsWe'll be reaching out to applicants that have:Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Economics or similar quantitative discipline1+ years of relevant work experience in an analytics driven role is a bonusStrong analytical skills and data-driven thinkingProficiency in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, data visualization, and manipulation of large data setsExperience with Elasticsearch, SQL, Tableau is a plus, not requiredExcellent time management skills - ability to prioritize and meet deadlines Strong verbal and written communication skillsInvestigative mindset and attention to detailPrevious online advertising experience is a plusStackAdapters Enjoy:Competitive salary Full benefits from League on day one of employment RRSP Matching Work from home reimbursements Coverage and support of personal development initiatives (conferences, courses, etc) An awesome parental leave policy A weekly $15 lunch credit via Ritual A friendly, welcoming, and supportive culture Our social and team events (virtually!)About StackAdaptStackAdapt is a self-serve programmatic advertising platform used by the most exceptional digital marketers. This state-of-the-art platform is where some of the most progressive work in machine learning meets cutting-edge user experience. Ad buyers plan, execute, and manage data-driven digital advertising campaigns across all devices, inventory, and publisher partners. No matter who you are, where you are from, who you love, follow in faith, disability (or superpower) status, ethnicity, or the gender you identify with (if you’re comfortable, let us know your pronouns), you are welcome at StackAdapt. TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewBuilding a World-Class Technology Team at TDWe can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.TD Data and Information Management covers building, developing, designing, and implementing involved with tech data management solutions. Where do we begin? These experts analyze, design, develop and support TD's info management system; lead and support bank data curation; develop data road map and info management strategies; focus on complex data integration, and drive use of our data reference model. This area doesn't work in isolation. We love data and we feel the same about integration and our assignments prove it.There's room to grow in all of it.Job DescriptionNetwork Services is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Service Management team. This individual will develop and maintain data management and reporting solutions to support Network Services risk management stakeholders and supporting teams.Works as part of a team under guidance of senior manager to design, develop and support data management and presentation solutions. Provide a broad range of data management and analysis functions including data warehousing, data modeling, ETL, data quality assessment, data profiling and data provenance and lineage.Collaborate with risk management and supporting engineering/delivery teams to elicit information and articulate requirements.Ensure data is maintained in compliance with enterprise data standards, policies and guidelines.Perform regular code upgrades and associated change management activities (requires occasional after-hours contributions).Contribute to technical system activities such as implementations, upgrades, troubleshooting and incident remediation as required.Identify opportunities to automate data management, refresh and distribution capabilities.Leverage APIs to integrate and process data collected from various sources for staging in data mart. Leverage infrastructure subject matter expertise to assist consumers with interpretation of data and practical applications. Subject matter will include physical network infrastructure, virtual instances, OS software/firmware, risk factors (currency, vulnerability, configuration, support), product lifecycles and standards, service-related financials and project delivery tracking.Potential to develop reporting and interactive data visualization presentations.Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and partners. Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends. Job RequirementsUniversity or Post-Graduate Degree or equivalent experience.Strong academic background (e.g. computer science, data management/data science).5+ years working IT experience.Practical working experience in a data management, analyst and/or reporting role.Excellent verbal and written communications skills and ability to communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.Strong MS SQL experience – data management, ETL, scripting, T-SQL, reporting services, development of complex efficient queries.Working experience with data visualization tools is highly desirable.Programming and scripting experience would be an asset (PowerShell, R, Python, REST, JSON).Ability to leverage APIs for data extraction.Knowledge of IT service management frameworks, tools, processes and procedures.Advanced MS Excel proficiency is expected.Previous experience working with an Agile style approach to development and delivery is an asset.Experience in networking technology is an asset.Familiarity with TDs infrastructure technology standards and/or architectural design practices would be an asset. ServiceNow inventory and process automation experience an asset.Technical network infrastructure build, engineering or architecture experience an asset.Must be flexible and thrive in an environment of rapid change. Additional InformationJoin in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

job_title: COOP LVL 2 - Forest Inventory Data Analyst (BC Public Service)
job_desc: Posting TitleCOOP LVL 2 - Forest Inventory Data AnalystPosition ClassificationCoop Education Train Progm Lv2UnionGEULocationVictoria, BC V9B 6X2 CA (Primary)Salary Range$48,770.29 annually, $26.71 hourlyClose Date5/30/2022Job TypeTemporary (Co-op)Temporary End Date8/31/2022Ministry/OrganizationBC Public Service -> Ministry of ForestsMinistry Branch / DivisionForest Analysis and Inventory BranchJob Summary Forest Inventory Data AnalystCO-OP Education Training Program Level 2This is a temporary Co-Op opportunity until August 31, 2022An eligibility list may be established.On November 1, 2021 the BC Public Service announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here .A great opportunity to take the next step in your careerProvincial Permanent Sample Plot (PSP) data have been collected in the natural forests in BC since 1910s. Those data were recently migrated into a newly developed Oracle database named Inventory Sample Management Consolidation (ISMC). For that reason, a new PSP compiler is under development to summarize those data. The purpose of this job posting is to support the development of the new PSP compiler by integrating the height/DBH calculator from old PSP compiler (written in SAS) to the new ISMC compiler (written in R).The candidate is expected to either rewrite the old height/DBH calculator in the R environment or build an interface in the R environment to call the old calculator. This is a four-month co-op position!Note that the successful candidate may be eligible for the Pacific Leaders Tuition Grant: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/careers-myhr/all-employees/career-development/pacific-leaders/co-op-grantThe BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.For information about the Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service please visit: Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service - Province of British Columbia (gov.bc.ca) .For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Yong.Luo@gov.bc.ca . DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION TO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca , before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.Job RequirementsIn order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below: Currently completing post-graduate studies in Forestry, Natural Resources Management or Computer Science.  Currently registered in a recognized co-op program at a participating post-secondary institution. Preference May Be Given To Candidates With Abundant experience using R.  Experience interpreting SAS programming.  Experience conducting data compilation, analysis, and nonlinear regression.  Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located in the Additional Information section at the bottom of the posting. A Criminal Record Check (CRC) will be required.Application Requirements Cover letter: YES -  A cover letter is required as part of your application. The content and/or format of your cover letter may be evaluated as part of the assessment process.Resume: YES - Ensure your resume includes your educational accomplishments, employment history including start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and any relevant information that relates to the job to which you are applying.Questionnaire (STANDARD): YES - You will be required to answer a standard questionnaire.Job CategoryScientific and Technical, StudentsValue
