Desjardins valorise la diversité et l’équité en emploi et s’engage à répondre aux besoins des personnes handicapées en adaptant, au besoin, son processus de recrutement.Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.Niveau d'emploiNV-10À titre de Conseiller(ère) principal(e) - scientifique de données, vous contribuez à répondre au besoin des données en soutien à la prise de décisions d’affaires, au développement de solutions et de services adaptés aux enjeux d’affaires et à la compréhension des comportements des membres et clients.Vous assumez un rôle de leadership auprès des différents intervenants dans le cadre de projets de développement de modèles adaptés à des besoins d'affaires variés et d'interventions stratégiques et complexes en analytique avancée et en intelligence artificielle.Vous êtes appelé(e) à interagir avec un grand nombre de parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise variés afin de comprendre et communiquer les enjeux et d'influencer la prise de décision.Plus précisément, vous êtes responsable d'analyser la performance des modèles contre la lutte aux crimes financiers (blanchiment d'argent, sanctions économiques, ...) pour les différents secteurs d'affaires du Mouvement Desjardins. Le calibrage, le développement d'outil de simulation, la modélisation et la mise en œuvre d'autres méthodes analytiques font partie de vos responsabilités principales pour des problématiques et enjeux de taille, comme d'assurer la couverture en fonction de la gestion du risque et réduire le taux de faux positifs. En tant qu'expert des modèles et outils du domaine d'affaires, vous aurez également comme mandat de participer à différents projets visant l'implantation ou l'évolution d'outils de surveillance.Responsabilités principales Assurer la performance des modèles de détection contre la lutte aux crimes financiers (blanchiment d'argent, sanctions économiques, etc.)Ajuster/calibrer les seuils des modèles de surveillance selon l’appétit du risqueProposer et développer des modèles de surveillance complémentaires pour bonifier la couvertureAnalyser les besoins d'affaires des clients et partenaires, produire des hypothèses et mener des mandats en considérant les particularités liées à leur opérationnalisation et en assurant l'arrimage lors de leur déploiement. Développer des outils de simulation performantsRésoudre des problèmes complexes par des analysesMettre en œuvre les meilleures pratiques analytiques au sein de l'équipeParticiper à titre de conseiller(ère) aux projets relatifs à l’évolution des outils de gestion du risque de la criminalité financièreEffectuer une vigie afin de comprendre et d'anticiper les tendances dans son domaine d'expertise en vue d'assurer le développement et la mise à jour de pratiques appropriées au contexte de l'entrepriseDévelopper, mettre à jour et produire différents tableaux de bord et des indicateurs de performanceProduire, communiquer et vulgariser des présentations et des visualisations de données pour influencer les décisions d'affaires de son secteur auprès de la directionRédiger les encadrements et les méthodes de modélisation des données. S’assurer de l’élaboration de la documentation, de la préparation et de la diffusion de formations.Conditions particulièresLieu de travail : Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1Profil recherchéBaccalauréat en mathématiques, statistiques, économie, actuariat, informatique ou dans une discipline appropriéeUn minimum de six ans d’expérience pertinenteExpérience en analyses et visualisation de donnéesExpérience en apprentissage machine et/ou apprentissage profond (un atout)Veuillez noter que d'autres combinaisons de formation et d'expérience pertinentes pourraient être considéréesMaîtrise et/ou doctorat dans une discipline appropriée (un atout)Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaireConnaissances spécifiquesExcellente connaissance de SQL, SAS et PythonMaîtrise de VBA (un atout)Connaissance des outils de la lutte à la criminalité financière (blanchiment d'argent, sanction économique, etc.) (un atout)Maîtrise de l'anglais de niveau intermédiaire avancé, tant à l'oral qu'a l'écritCompétences transversales DesjardinsApprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’actionCompétences clés au profil recherchéGérer la complexité, Maîtriser la technologie, Maîtriser les relations interpersonnellesLieu de travail400, boul. de Maisonneuve Ouest MontréalSyndicatNon SyndiquéDate de fin d'affichage2022-06-6Famille d'emploisDonnée (GF)

job_title: Analyste, entrée de données / Data Operations Analyst
job_desc: Job Description Résumé du poste: Nous vous offrirons l’opportunité de propulser l’innovation et l’automatisation à travers l’entreprise. Cela inclura les intégrations d’outils et de processus à travers toutes les unités commerciales d’Equifax à l’échelle mondiale.En tant qu’analyste, entrée de données, vous serez responsable de vous assurer de la qualité des renseignements et de la fiabilité de la base de données. Il s’agit d’une formidable opportunité de vous joindre à une équipe dynamique au sein d’une entreprise en pleine croissance et bien établie au Québec. Responsabilités :  Maintenir la base de données en y associant des transactions immobilières.  Valider les données reçues et au besoin les corriger.  Effectuer le traitement des cas particuliers qui ne peut être automatisé.  Maintenir les exigences en matière d’entrée de données en suivant les techniques et les procédures du programme de données.  Réaliser des tâches de nature similaire.  Compétences requises :  Bilinguisme en français et anglais.  Avoir une connaissance pratique de Google Suite, Word, Excel et PowerPoint.  Ce qui vous distingue des autres :  Une connaissance du registre foncier du Québec constitue un atout.  Avoir obtenu un diplôme d’études collégiales DEC en techniques juridiques (en cours ou équivalent). Nous offrons d’excellents programmes de rémunération et de soins de santé, des congés rémunérés et des possibilités de croissance organisationnelle par le biais de notre plateforme d’apprentissage en ligne incluant des suivis de carrière guidés.Si cette description ressemble à un endroit où vous aimeriez travailler, n’attendez pas et postulez dès maintenant – c’est peut-être vous que nous cherchons!Tous les candidats et candidates qualifié(e)s seront considéré(e)s sans tenir compte de la race, la couleur, la religion, le genre, l’orientation sexuelle, l’identité de genre, l’origine nationale, un handicap ou un statut de vétéran protégé par la loi. Synopsis of the role: We will give you the opportunity to drive innovation and automation across the enterprise. This will include tool and process integrations across all business units within Equifax globally.As a Data Operations Analyst, you will be entrusted to ensure the quality of the information and the reliability of the database. This is a great opportunity to join a dynamic team in an established and growing Quebec company. You and the team will be fully remote, visiting the office when required. What you’ll do:  Maintains database by associating real estate transactions.  Validate the data received and, if necessary, correct it.  Carry out the processing of special cases which cannot be automated.  Maintains data entry requirements by following data program techniques and procedures.  Perform any other tasks of a similar nature.  What experience you need:  Bilingual in French and English.  Working knowledge of Google Suite, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.  What could set you apart:  Knowledge of the Quebec land registry is an asset.  College Diploma DEC in a legal technique (in progress or equivalent). We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.If this sounds like somewhere you want to work, don’t delay, apply today - we’re looking for you!All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

TD DescriptionRacontez-nous votre histoire. Distinguez-vous. Expliquez-nous pourquoi vous êtes le meilleur candidat. Si vous cherchez un emploi intéressant et si vous aimez le changement comme nous, songez à la TD. Venez travailler pour un leader nord-américain qui se soucie de ses employés et qui les inspire à se perfectionner et à se dépasser. Soyez au fait et demeurez compétitif. Bâtissez votre carrière. Évoluez avec nous. Voici notre histoire : emplois.td.com/francais.Department OverviewNotre vision d’être une meilleure banque s’appuie sur notre stratégie axée sur les objectifs et orientée vers l’avenir. Dans un contexte évoluant rapidement, nous savons que la technologie joue un rôle essentiel dans la réalisation de cette vision et la mise en œuvre de notre stratégie. Le contexte nous indique également la nécessité d’accélérer les investissements dans les capacités émergentes pour pouvoir nous adapter aux changements qui s’opèrent autour de nous et répondre aux besoins des clients plus rapidement. Pour accomplir cela, nous faisons évoluer nos plateformes, mettons en place des pratiques d’entreprise clé et remodelons nos parcours client dans le cadre du programme Nouvelle évolution du travail (NET). La NET aidera les collègues à prendre des décisions rapidement, à travailler plus efficacement et à déceler promptement les tendances du marché et celles liées aux clients, et à y réagir plus vite, afin d’offrir des solutions novatrices à un rythme sans précédent. La NET nous permettra d’atteindre nos objectifs communs, de simplifier notre façon de travailler et d’améliorer notre façon d’offrir de la valeur aux clients. En vous joignant à la NET, vous aurez l’occasion d’adopter une nouvelle façon de travailler tout en ayant une incidence sur l’avenir des services bancaires comme vous ne l’aviez jamais imaginé.Voici la plateforme Données-services! La feuille de route et la stratégie des données centralisées de cette plateforme permettront à la TD de devenir une entreprise axée sur les données et nous aiderons à tirer une valeur des données que nous créons, recueillons et utilisons. La plateforme inclura des applications servant à créer et à gérer des lacs de données, des normes, des outils d’analyse et des mesures de gouvernance. La plateforme Données-services regroupera plus de 110 actifs et 200 applications, en plus de réunir nos données sur les clients et experts en la matière provenant des pratiques, comme celles-ci : Données, Ingénierie logicielle et Ingénierie de la qualité.Job DescriptionVous êtes un professionnel chevronné des données, faisant preuve d’une expertise conceptuelle et pratique en gestion des renseignements d’affaires? Si c’est le cas, ce poste offre une occasion pratique d’avancement professionnel, et vous permettra de démontrer un leadership technique en affaires dans le cadre de diverses fonctions de gestion de l’information tout en soutenant les nombreux secteurs de données et d’analyse.Si vous aimez travailler avec vos collègues et les équipes de projet, ce poste est fait pour vous! Vous travaillerez avec les partenaires d’affaires et en technologie pour comprendre les données opérationnelles afin de vous assurer que les analyses et les exigences fournies sont conformes aux normes globales en matière de conception et de gestion des données.En tant que praticien en données pour la gestion des renseignements d’affaires, vous devrez :Mettre à profit votre expertise conceptuelle et pratique pour offrir des solutions et des connaissances dans un éventail de tâchesTirer parti de vos solides compétences en programmation pour développer une gamme variée de solutions et d’analyses de données, en démontrant votre expérience approfondie avec de grands ensembles de données et des technologies liées aux métadonnéesPrendre en compte les exigences en matière d’affaires et de données en vue d’élaborer des solutions d’affaires complètesConcevoir et mettre en œuvre des cadres de gestion de données opérationnelles complexesParticiper à l’essai des systèmes d’information technique afin d’assurer l’intégrité des données et la fonctionnalité des systèmesCollaborer avec les partenaires d’affaires ou en technologie pour résoudre les problèmes relatifs aux données, et vous assurer de la communication des exigences et de leur conformité (p. ex. au cadre, aux méthodologies, aux contrôles financiers et aux autres exigences de l’entreprise)Participer pleinement en tant que membre d’une équipe agile modulable, promouvoir un milieu de travail positif où chacun pense comme un client, favoriser la qualité et encourager l’innovation Job RequirementsLes candidats potentiels intéressés par ce poste doivent avoir :Diplôme universitaire de premier cycle ou certificat technique dans un domaine pertinentExpérience dans le domaine des statistiques, des mathématiques, de l’informatique, des finances ou l’équivalentExpérience des langages de programmation des données, des modèles et des principes de conceptionExpertise dans l’utilisation d’outils logiciels d’analyse, de méthodes d’analyse des données et de techniques d’établissement de rapportsExpertise en matière de stockage et de déplacement des données, notamment les données relationnelles et les mégadonnéesExcellentes aptitudes pour l’analyse et la résolution de problèmesConnaissance approfondie des concurrents et des tendances du marchéCapacité à analyser et à organiser le travail, et à en établir l’ordre de priorité, et ce, tout en respectant les échéances multiplesCapacité à travailler en coopération et de façon autonome dans une équipe agile modulableExcellentes compétences en communication (verbale et écrite) et capacité à créer des relations positives entre les équipesAgir à titre d’ambassadeur de la marque pour notre secteur ou unité fonctionnelle et pour la TD, tant à l’interne qu’à l’externe Additional InformationIngénierie des données :Diplôme en informatiqueSpécialisations : Java, .net, système de gestion de base de données relationnelle (SGBDR), concepts de méthode agile, concepts d’infonuagique#ingénieurdesdonnées Lieux :TorontoMontréalMarkhamLondresOttawaNew Jersey (États-Unis)Delaware (États-Unis)L7-L10 InclusivenessÀ la TD, nous nous sommes engagés à favoriser un milieu intégrateur et accessible, où tous les employés et les clients se sentent appréciés, respectés et soutenus. Nous avons à cœur de réunir un effectif qui reflète la diversité de nos clients et des collectivités où nous vivons et exerçons nos activités. Si vous avez des besoins particuliers pour le processus de recrutement ou d’entrevue (p. ex. du matériel dans un autre format et des salles de réunion accessibles), n’hésitez pas à nous en faire part. Nous collaborerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewThe Marketing Technologies and Analytics (MT&A) function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank.The MT&A team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank.The MT&A team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization.Job DescriptionThe successful candidate will be responsible for campaign analytics supporting the growing needs of the Cards team within the broader Marketing Analytics Delivery group.Success In This Role Will Be Achieved ByYour goal as a part of the Marketing Analytics Delivery team is to design and execute campaigns to drive acquisition, customer management, loyalty, and engagement across personal and business banking products. Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive marketing ROI Ensuring execution (i.e., list creation) is done efficiently and with excellence Designing campaign results can be actioned by providing high value campaign reporting Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of campaign reportingYour success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.ResponsibilitiesDesign/execute/measure high impact direct to consumer marketing experimentsContinuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposalExecute with excellenceManage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be metProactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROIMaintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructureSkill SetsFamiliarity with direct marketing principles (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.)Technical and detail orientedKnowledge of how campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as SASA project management mindset to help deliver on time to specificationsTeam player while able to work independentlyPragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smartsA profit driven mindsetJob Requirements4+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries)Significant experience with IBM Campaign (Unica) an assetKnowledge of SQL and SAS; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of vendors and file format requirementsKnowledge of Python, Azure, HadoopExperience designing successful direct marketing experimentsDegree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative disciplineTrack record of delivering successful initiatives on time and on budget#CanMarketingInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewBuilding a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology TeamWe can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway. TD Applications & Systems Development covers technical planning, integration, systems analysis, design, development, unit and component systems testing, support-maintenance, and more. Meaningful, effective relationship-building is part of what these highly-skilled experts do best as they work together with technology project managers, delivery partners, business and systems analysts, testing and quality assurance teams, sponsors and so many other stakeholders to clarify requirements. There's room to grow in all of it. job_title: Junior Asset Management Consultant and Data Analyst
job_desc: This job is sourced from a job board.      Learn more GM BluePlan Engineering Limitedis currently seeking aJunior Asset Management Consultant and Data Analyst(full-time permanent position)Location: Vaughan, OntarioGM BluePlan Engineering Limited is a multi-discipline consulting engineering firm, providing engineering services to both municipal and private sector clients through a teamwork approach. Our focus continues to ensure that our clients receive high-quality, innovative, practical and cost-effective solutions for their civil engineering projects.Areas of specialty include infrastructure planning, asset management and detailed design and construction administration services associated with municipal infrastructure improvement and reconstruction projects. We have a commitment to develop and retain a diversified and professional staff and provide a dynamic and engaging work environment.We are currently seeking an Asset Management Consultant with strong database and analytical skills to join our Vaughan office Asset Management team.ResponsibilitiesDevelop asset management plans, strategies, decision frameworks, business processes and tools capable of assisting with the development of capital and operating budgets, to provide risk analysis, levels of service and life cycle costing scenarios.Contribute to the development, implementation, and review of asset management best practices.Document current asset management processes, including liaising stakeholders.Support the implementation of information management technologies, strategies and best practices.Contribute to the refinement of existing and development of new asset management tools, approaches, and concepts.Develop and analyze asset data to support asset management planning.Create and manage asset inventories and data structures, including the development of relational databases using Microsoft SQL Server.Conduct detailed analyses and forecasting on infrastructure deterioration, risk, and level of service information.Conduct financial analyses that include but are not limited to development of asset replacement and intervention costs, short and long-range reinvestment forecasting, lifecycle analyses and economic analyses.Develop tools or models for the simulation and analysis of condition and investment scenarios.Develop reports and visualizations based on asset data and communicate trends and analysis results to stakeholders.ExperienceBachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Civil Engineering Technology or other relevant education.Professional designation (P.Eng. or C.E.T.) or eligibility to apply will be considered an asset.0 - 5 years' experience related to the duties listed above in a municipal or consulting environment, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with stakeholders on a variety of issues.Strong writing capabilities, including technical reports, work plans, business cases and proposals.Strong knowledge of asset lifecycles, condition assessment, inspection, rehabilitation, and reconstruction techniques for linear and vertical infrastructure networks (such as transportation, water and wastewater, and facilities).Knowledge of and relevant working experience with computerized maintenance/work order management systems, Geographic Information Systems and relational databases such as Microsoft SQL Server will be considered an asset.Knowledge or experience in computer programming (Python and/or SQL) will be considered an asset.Knowledge of asset management best practices including the ISO 55000 series of standards, International Infrastructure Management Manual and others.Knowledge of the Canadian Infrastructure Asset Management industry, including Ontario Regulation 588/17.Specific certifications or diplomas in asset management and/or project management would be considered an asset.GM BluePlan Engineering Limited Is Committed To ProvidingA dynamic work environment which encourages teamwork, initiative and creativity, while also providing career development and education opportunities.A competitive compensation package commensurate with experience, benefit package and RRSP program.Extra-curricular social activities (where possible, depending on current public health restrictions).COVID-19 ConsiderationsIn accordance with GM BluePlan Engineering COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, all new GM BluePlan Engineering employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment, subject to valid medical or Ontario Human Rights Code exemptions.Join our Team!Candidates who are interested in joining our dynamic team are invited to follow the link to apply.We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Location: Ottawa, Ont To support ICF’s growing energy efficiency program delivery, ICF is seeking a Data Analyst with knowledge of energy consumption to assist with data capture and reporting on a new program in Ontario. The successful applicant will assist the Lead Data Analyst and Program Manager in reporting for the program to the client. This will include weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual progress reports, and include impromptu reporting as necessary. The successful candidate is also expected to assist in the development of the database to enable the aforementioned reporting to occur in an effective and efficient manner.Key ResponsibilitiesAssist with the development of the central database to capture valid information the allows for effective reporting Creating dashboards to provide up to date program information Development of templates for regular reporting Pulling weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting to allow for effective management of the program Impromptu reporting as requested by the client or Program Manager Provide ongoing utility client support as needed. Support will include program reporting, meeting attendance and other client communication as needed. Basic QualificationsDegree in information technology, computer science, or statistics specializing in data analytics High proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, and PowerBI) Preferred Skills/QualificationsKnowledge of a scripting language (Python/Javascript) Knowledge of SQL Knowledge of energy efficiency and energy consumption Experience with creating effective, clean reporting Certified Energy Manager (CEM) and/or Certified Measurement and Verification Professional (CMVP) Strong planning, and organization skills Extraordinary attention to detail Excellent written and verbal communications skills in English Time management skills to handle multiple priorities and flexibility to work limited overtime as needed Team player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment Working at ICFWorking at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth.Ottawa Canada (CD82)

Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONAre you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Do you want to apply machine learning techniques and advanced statistical modeling to solve real world problems to help Amazon reach and delight millions of customers around the world? Do you want to play a crucial role in the future of Amazon?Every time an Amazon customer makes an order they leverage the most advanced and sophisticated supply chain the world has ever seen, Amazon Operations, and its global network comprising of cutting edge software, fulfillment centers, sort centers, delivery stations, airports, customer service centers, physical stores, robots, airplanes, trucks, vans, trucks, world class employees, trusted partners, and more. Conducting a symphony of this scale comes with significant costs. It also comes with the largest repository of supply chain data to exist that’s growing by billions of data points by the minute.Here In Consumer Controllership Data Science Our Data Scientists Raise The Bar On Our Ability To Fulfill Promises To Customers At Greater Convenience, Speed, And Value ThroughLeveraging the largest repository of supply chain data to ever exist to develop models to forecast, classify, and detect anomalous costs.Working with technical and non-technical customers across every step of data science project life cycle.Collaborating with our dedicated product, data engineering, and software development teams to create production implementations for large-scale data analysis.Developing an understanding of key business metrics / KPIs and providing clear, compelling analysis that shapes the direction of our business.Presenting research results to our internal research community.Leading training and informational sessions on our science and capabilities.Your contributions will be seen and recognized broadly within Amazon, potentially contributing to the Amazon research corpus and patent portfolio.This role can work out of the following locations: Seattle, Bellevue, Austin, Arlington, Santa Monica, or Toronto.Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / AgeBasic QualificationsBachelor's Degree3+ years of experience with data scripting languages (e.g SQL, Python, R etc.) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, or Matlab)2 years working as a Data ScientistExperience with AWS technologies (Sagemaker, Redshift, Athena, IAM, EC2, S3)Preferred QualificationsDeep understanding of corporate procurement and their cost driversExperience working on problems of a financial natureAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.Company - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULCJob ID: A2047219

Job CategoryData SolutionsOpportunity Awaits at Altus Group!The OpportunityAs a Market Analyst, you will work within our Data Solutions research team to compile real estate information and maintain our databases through careful data entry. You will also develop industry contacts to facilitate the sharing of information and respond to client needs regarding our database and/or published records. You’ll build on your knowledge of real estate to become an expert in the local market, including conducting site visits to learn about properties.Our Data Solutions team excels at providing accurate, reliable and detailed market data across Canada. Through our databases, real estate professionals gain the important information that they need to generate reports and make well-informed decisions. As a Market Analyst, your efforts will play a direct role in helping our clients.This is an excellent opportunity for someone building a career in real estate, who enjoys being at the forefront of real estate data, being hands-on with data collection and data entry, and has strong skills in attention to detail and deadline management.Key ResponsibilitiesConduct research and collect data. On an ongoing basis, you will use a variety of methods from email, industry websites, news media, phone calls and industry networking to collect real estate information.Conduct site visits. Gather first-hand knowledge of properties by planning for site visits and collecting relevant information once on site. This includes taking photographs that meet database standards.Enter the details and maintain the database. Perform large amounts of data entry into the database in an accurate and timely manner, to ensure that our real estate data is well maintained and up to date. (Approximately 50% of the role.) Follow the trends. Use your knowledge of the real estate market to follow key market indicators and trends.Ensure accuracy. Review the database to ensure all of the details are accurate and current, and that all fields are completed. You will pursue information to complete files.Develop industry contacts. As you network and develop external contacts, you will facilitate the sharing of real estate information and gain a deeper knowledge of the industry.Collaborate internally. As you collaborate with team members, you will enforce a friendly team atmosphere where everyone assists others as needed to meet deadlines.Position RequirementsGenuine interest in the real estate industry with a strong desire to learn.At least 1 year of related work experience is required.Valid driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract is required.Strong attention to detail and proven ability to enter large amounts of data efficiently, with a high level of accuracy.Ability to collect, understand, verify and compile relevant information.Understanding of strict deadlines and ability to prioritize workload in a fast-paced environment.A logical approach to problem solving with the instinct to follow processes and best practices.Outstanding communication and relationship building skills. This is a role that requires reaching out to property managers, owners, and other external stakeholders to ascertain details and confirm information; professionalism is key.The drive to work autonomously and be a contributor to the team’s initiatives. By staying focused, learning the market and pursuing networking opportunities, this is an exciting first or second job for someone considering a career in commercial real estate.Technical skills including knowledge of MS Office, primarily Word and Excel.Who We AreAltus Group is a leading provider of software, data solutions and technology-enabled expert services to the global commercial real estate (CRE) industry. We are a single provider of end-to-end CRE solutions empowering clients to make informed decisions and drive strategic growth.Headquartered in Canada, we have approximately 2,250 employees around the world, with operations in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. We are at the center of what drives the real estate industry and continue to break ground every day with innovative solutions and best practices that touch every aspect of the real estate life cycle.Need any more reasons to join Altus?In 2005, we started with 400 employees and have grown exponentially to over 2,250 around the globe today. Altus Group employees don’t see boundaries, they see opportunity. They deliver results for our clients and our company and are recognized and rewarded for the value they create. This is an opportunity to work on multiple projects that encompass many industries, geographic reach, and high profile design.At Altus, we want you to realize your potential. We value collaboration and knowledge sharing of best practices. We support professional growth and we actively seek out ideas. This is the place to present the newest research, to introduce the coolest tech, and see it come to fruition and be applied. Your work will make a difference.We Work Hard To Create a Dynamic Company Culture That Reflects The Values Of Our Employees And What Motivates Them Individually And As a TeamAltus Group isn’t just about the amazing work we do.Altus Cares - We are always seeking ways to give back to our communities, and support causes important to our employees. We are actively involved in local charity work and we believe in laying the groundwork for a more prosperous future. Our personal highlight is our involvement with Ronald McDonald house in four different countries where we volunteer every September as a company.Education - We believe our employees represent the best this industry has to offer and we want to reflect their commitment to education and continued learning.At Altus Group, we are proud to say that many of our teams are comprised of members who have been here five years or longer. We think that speaks volumes about our atmosphere and our people.Opportunity awaits - come realize your potential at Altus Group!Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.Come realize your potential at Altus Group!Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. Requisition ID: 147855Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.PurposeThe Customer Insights, Data, and Analytics organization at Scotiabank is focused on building high-value solutions across the bank. Our organization consists of accomplished professionals who blend expertise in computer science, data, machine learning, and banking to deliver innovative projects that drive the business. A key part of success for the group is having scalable, fast, and continuously evolving data processes, and this is the responsibility of the Data Office Data Engineering team. As an integral part of the team, the Data Engineer will be responsible for all technical aspects of the data pipelines that power advanced and descriptive analytics work.We have a dynamic work environment that will provide you with exposure to leaders in data & analytics, the opportunity to continuously learn, and support to be innovative.Key Accountabilities Work with business teams across the organization (Canadian Banking, Intl. Banking, Treasury, GBM) to understand their data-driven goals Partner with advanced analytics teams to build powerful data assets and processes Be the subject matter expert on data driven processes, visualization workflows, and tools with which to analyze data Build automated data management and data quality capabilities into projects Build re-usable components to scale development across the organization, collaborating with other technical teams to streamline high-value data to the Analytics platforms Build re-usable managed datasets for consumption by both revenue generating analytics and operational corporate functions (e.g. finance, risk, etc.) Experiment & learn!Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or related field or relevant experience Experience in finance is an asset Programming skills in Python, Scala, and /or Java. Experience with Spark is preferred Comfortable working in database environments. Experience with PostgreSQL, HDFS/Hive, MinIO an asset Exposure to Kubernetes, Airflow, Jenkins is an asset Familiarity with agile tooling to efficiently build as a team: git, Jira, Confluence, etc. Experience with visualization tools an asset: Power BI/Tableau Familiarity with data management capabilities (data registration, data quality, etc.) and ability to learn advanced data management toolsets High aptitude for diving in and picking up new technologies as required Eligible to work in CanadaLocation(s): Canada : Ontario : TorontoScotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

DescriptionJoin our team and what we'll accomplish togetherAs Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building and supporting the data pipelines which enable innovative, customer centric digital experiences. You will be working as part of a friendly, cross-discipline agile team who helps each other solve problems across all functions. As a custodian of customer trust, you will employ best practice in development, security, accessibility and design to achieve the highest quality of service for our customers. Our development team uses a range of technologies to get the job done including Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Apache NiFi. We also do some API design and development with Node.jsYou will be part of the team implementing Informatica Master Data Management (MDM) hosted on Amazon Web Services (AWS). Specifically you’ll be building pipelines that feed MDM as well as extract insights to enable our business partners’ analytics and campaigns. You are a fast learner, highly technical, passionate person looking to work within a team of multidisciplinary experts to improve your craft and contribute to the data development practice.Here’s howLearn new skills & advance your data development practiceAnalyze and profile dataDesign, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve batch and real-time data pipelinesAssist with design and development of solution prototypesSupport consumers with understanding the data outcomes and technical designCollaborate closely with multiple teams in an agile environmentQualificationsWhat you bring A passion for data qualityStrong data analysis skills (SQL)Interest and ability to learn new skills and technologies as neededExperience with Informatica IDQ/PowerCenter, Apache NiFi and other related ETL toolsGreat-to-havesRelevant data pipeline design, build and deploy experienceAPI development using Node.js and testing using Postman/SoapUIExperience with Informatica MDM (preferred) but strong skills in other MDM tools still an asset Experience with AWS and/or GCP servicesExperience with BMC Control-M, Java, Informatica IIC#DSEJobs

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.comJob DescriptionWhat You’ll Be DoingAs a Risk Analyst, you will contribute to the profitable growth of personal lending portfolios by performing the activities that supports business growth. This includes creating and maintaining datasets,  performance monitoring and identifying data related opportunities for tuning rules and models.  The role will support the data infrastructure development and amalgamation of data for the purposes of driving strategic analytical decisions. The Risk Analyst will use statistical software such as SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Enterprise Miner and Python as well as other modeling and visualization software to support the entire model life cycle including development, monitoring and recalibration within Fraud, AML and Retail Credit Risk.Important InformationYou must be currently enrolled in post-secondary education to be eligible, however, you do not need to be in a registered Co-Op program to be considered for this role Please include your resume (no more than 2 pages), a cover letter (no more than 1 page), and your most recent unofficial transcript with your application. These should all be uploaded into the Resume section of the application as one document This job posting closes on May 22nd at 11:59 PM EST.Work Location: as the growing situation with COVID 19 continues to evolve, further clarity on the work location will be provided at the time of your interview. Please note all employees must work within their current jurisdiction and must reside within Canada.Duration of term: 4 opportunities availablePlease note, we have multiple positions available under this posting and you may be considered by more than one hiring team .How You’ll SucceedYou exhibit CIBC’s values of trust, team work, and accountability You are keen in problem solving You process good writing and visual presentation skills sufficient to articulate the results of analysis performed and being able to prepare presentation with guidance You have well-developed communication skills to facilitate development of good working relationships within CIBC You are able to execute job functions with guidance Who You AreYou major in  Statistics, Math, Finance, Business or other applicable discipline. You have knowledge and/or experience in  data/reporting or analytics function, with good knowledge of Statistics or Mathematics, with strong skills in relational databases like SQL.   Statistical software knowledge like SAS, R, and Python is also highly preferred; and have understanding of consumer credits. With guidance, you are able to evaluate complex data relationships, develop fact based reports and presentations on the knowledge gained from the analysis, and generate insights and recommend solutions to problems. You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do. You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. You are able to apply critical thinking skills into your analysis. You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take a task, go above and beyond, and deliver results. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to prepare analytics reports with detailed information in an impactful way under guidance. What CIBC OffersAt CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at homeConnect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativityDevelop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product trainingWhat You Need To KnowCIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. Posted by                  Brittani Stevenson             Manager, Talent Acquisition - Spark Power & Bullfrog Power - ⚡️Canada and U.S.A. ⚡️ - We’re Hiring!                                      Send InMail                    Market Research AnalystOakville, ON Corporate Head Office Overview:The Market Research Analyst is responsible for project management and execution of market research and data analysis activities. The incumbent will have experience in quantitative/qualitative research, working with large datasets and measurement of return on investment.As we build out our demand-generation engine, we are looking for a curious, analytical and resourceful team member to acquire new data, work with existing data, synthesize it, make it accessible to key decision-makers, and draw insightful conclusions to enable the successful growth of our business.From understanding business challenges with internal stakeholders, to transforming these challenges to analytics projects, to finally delivering insightful analysis, visualizations, and datasets, the analyst will play a key role in all stages of the analytics value creation process. In order to succeed the analyst must demonstrate both sound technical knowledge and outstanding soft skills.Here’s what you’ll do in the Market Research Analyst position:  Research, analyze and report on the landscape including trends, service lines, competitive environment and pricing/business models.Contribute to the development of an annual market research plan and execute custom research projects, strategic analysis, and recommendations by leveraging 1st and 3rd party sources.Develop and share widely a deep understanding of customer value, channel strategies/marketing mix and customer journeys across our service offerings.Develop and manage market segmentation studies and develop lists for targeting purposes to help refine and focus marketing and sales effortsDevelop and prepare reports to assess effectiveness of marketing and sales activitiesDevelop and run qualitative/quantitative analysis & build reports/dashboards to facilitate awareness and understanding about key developments, and dynamics within the market. Regularly update a “market watch” brief related to changes in the marketplace and emerging trends throughout North America related to our service offeringTranslate research data and findings into actionable/strategic insights using strong storytelling, data visualization, and presentation skills.Be well informed on trends of market, other party research, and ensure implementation of best practices.Collaborate with other business units across the organization to integrate and analyze dataProvide evidence-based recommendations for operational improvements to respond to customer needsManage day-to-day relationships with external market research service and data providers Key Deliverables:  Solution Design and ImplementationDevelop advanced dashboards using leading analytics and dataviz packages, work with underlying dataflows and datasetsPresent new business intelligence to potential usersData ManagementImplement processes and create documentation to support the acquisition, validation, organization, and storage of data, in order to support analytics and reporting needsPerform exploratory data analysis to identify patterns from historical data, generate and test hypotheses, and provide the organization with actionable insightsAdvanced AnalyticsAssist in development of segmentation, KPIs, and advanced analytics to drive marketing campaigns and pricing strategies Do you have the Spark? Here’s what we’re looking for:  2 Years of relevant experience as an analyst or researcher in a market research firm, B2B marketing/sales organization or management consulting firmExperience sourcing and working with data to analyze and research markets, products and companiesSTEM or Business degree, with strong background in mathematics, statistics or economicsCreative, innovative, and critical thinker with excellent problem-solving skillsStrong organizational and project management skills with the ability to work independently and in a team environmentAbility to work in a hybrid or fully in-office model Who is Spark Power? We provide end-to-end electrical contracting, operations and maintenance services, and energy sustainability solutions to the industrial, commercial, utility, and renewable asset markets.We have over 1300 employees across 38 offices across North America.We have numerous exciting projects in commercial, industrial, and institutional sectors across Canada and the US. What we offer our employees:  · Diverse and exciting scope of work· Continuous training and skills improvement· Career advancement opportunities· Competitive wages plus incentive program · Excellent benefit package with wellness spending account options and corporate discounts · RRSP matching · Laptop and phone provided · Employee Share Ownership Program· Fun and supportive company culture ….and much more

job_desc: Posted by                  Kathy Harper             Talent Acquisition Partner - Aviva Canada                                     Send InMail                    Individually we are people, but together we are Aviva. Individually these are just words, but together they are our Values – Care, Commitment, Community, and Confidence.We are seeking a resourceful and forward-thinking DTP Data Analyst who is primarily responsible for maintenance and daily monitoring of the enterprise DLP solution. This person will interface closely with other DLP security analysts, information security specialists and managers, service and operations support managers, project managers, engineers, architects, external suppliers and internal customers for enhancing and improving existing DLP solution.The role is part of Aviva’s Canada information security operations team.You will have outstanding understanding of Data Loss Prevention Security monitoring in both technical areas as well as an interpersonal level for communication in a large financial environment.Does this sound like you?!What you’ll do Remediate DLP alerts and perform analysis for triage/escalation.Analyze and aggregate data loss prevention data to support the enhancement/improvement/tuning of existing policies and resolve additional controls.Establish and manage relationships with key internal business customers and external suppliers.Proficient in understanding the DLP policies.Prioritize and detail incident management from initiation to completion.Assess summarize and escalate potential breaches to leadership.Assisting partners and staff with related queries.Provide support on ad-hoc project work.Assist with the development of other operational/project documentation.Provide support to other teams within the broader Risk Management Group, as neededResearching of emerging threats to gain insight and understanding of the evolving threat landscape and its impact to Aviva CanadaOther related duties as assigned.What you’ll bring EDUCATION University Degree.Insurance industry specific background would be an asset.An outstanding background in information security operations and threat and vulnerability managementExperienceAt least 2-3 years’ experience working in an enterprise IT environmentDemonstrated ability to contribute and establish effective working relationships and collaborative work approaches with both internal and external peers.Active information security certification, such as CISSP, OSCP, etc.Ability to effectively influence without authorityOutstanding communication, analytical, problem solving, and project management skillsDeep technical skills, knowledge of network protocols and network communication principles, understanding of vulnerabilities and remediation techniques.Experience with crafting incident response plans and playbook.Good interpersonal skills, ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a balanced and controlled matter.Excellent communications skills including preparing briefings, presentations, and oral status reportsPossess strong analytical skills and problem-solving capabilitiesKnowledge, skills & abilitiesIntegrity:Demonstrates dedication to Aviva and its customers.Takes personal responsibility for words and actions.Maintains consistency between words and actions.Acts in compliance with department, company, and industry standards. Holds self and others accountable.Demonstrates drive to excel.Exhibits mature self-confidence.Progressiveness:Exhibits customer service orientation.Demonstrates flexibility and change.Demonstrates analytical thinking.Demonstrates conceptual thinking.Teamwork:Exhibits teamwork and collaboration.Communicates effectively.What you’ll get Competitive rewards package including base compensation, eligibility for annual bonus, retirement savings, share plan, health benefits, personal wellness, and volunteer opportunities.Exceptional Career Development opportunities.We’ll support your professional development education.Additional Information: Aviva Canada has an accommodation process in place to provide accommodations for employees with disabilities. job_desc: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to know our team:Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner DevelopmentBuild dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team’s performance
