Company Description:Merkle Canada is the integrated data unit for Dentsu. We are the first and only, truly integrated data agency in the market.Our team has backgrounds ranging from market researchers to data scientists and analytics consultants. We manage all things “data” for our clients and deliver building blocks for smarter campaigns and drive the evolution towards data-driven marketing. We aim to bridge the divide between online and offline data. Oh and being a “nerd” is not an insult, it’s a compliment!Job Description:Our Merkle team is looking to add a Media Insights Analyst to their evolving team. The ideal candidate will have worked as an analyst with experience in media at an agency, corporate, media research, or media owner environment. A willingness to learn and good, clear & confident communication skills are required. The ability to think outside of the box is welcomed.Develop presentations, overviews, and tactical POVs that explain in detail media performance results to internal stakeholders and clients.Have the ability to set up appropriate testing scenarios to determine key insights and answers to key business questionsObserve, analyze and report on digital media campaigns and provide recommendations for optimization by acting as the connective tissue between media planning, media buying, Carat and other DAN agencies for data, analytics and insights including:Campaign analysisMarket Mix ModelsProvide detailed media delivery information for review by MMM partner to be used for Client’s Media Mix Modeling.Leverage Media Mix Optimization recommendations coming from Client and MMM partnerSocial AnalyticsMedia OptimizationLinkage to proprietary research and tools including:Creative testingInnovation testingData driven decision making for media allocationLeverage the data and insights that client provides to bring strong data-driven thinking to media and creative touch-points. It will be important to integrate and work with any martech stack that the client has in place and help bring the customer journeys that have already been created to life.Build consumer and audience profiles using CCS, CCS Planner and other behavioral dataWork with Client to develop 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data segments to deliver against or exceed benchmarks during planning, optimizations and maintenance. Generation of insights informing optimal audienceGenerate insights for campaign and organic site trafficQualifications:At least 4 years of experience working in a relevant role and willingness to manage othersBilingualism French and EnglishStrong knowledge of Microsoft Suite (MS Access, Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Experience working with SQL, Python, and/or Statistical programs such as R is a plusStrong knowledge of Tableau appreciatedStrong knowledge of the media planning and buying processes from pre planning to post-analysis.Hands on experience with third party buying, tracking and reporting tools including a strong knowledge of advanced reports such as reach vs. frequency and cross-site duplication is an assetAdditional Information:We know through experience that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better business results. We strive to create workplaces that reflect the clients we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.We are committed to working with our candidates from all ability levels throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact [email protected] or to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.Apply Now

Posted by                  Jordan Le Corvec             Talents Acquisition Advisor                                     Send InMail                    Au sein de la Direction Cohérence et Valorisation des données, vous êtes au cœur des travaux de documentation des processus d’affaires, du développement des fondations de données, de la valorisation par l'analytique ainsi que la gouvernance de données. La contribution de la direction influencera directement l’amélioration continue et l’efficience des opérations en mettant à disposition des outils et un accompagnement visant l'utilisation optimale des données.À titre d'Analyste d’affaires spécialisé(e) en données, vous contribuez à l’évolution des solutions d’unicité et de données membres clients. Dans les mandats qui vous sont confiés, votre rôle consiste à analyser le contexte et les besoins d’affaires de l’organisation. Vous formalisez les objectifs d’affaires et leur valeur pour l’organisation. Vous participez à l’identification, clarifiez la portée, évaluez et recommandez des solutions d’affaires. Vous analysez l’incidence des solutions sur l’organisation et assurez leur intégration, de l’étape de définition des besoins jusqu’au déploiement.De plus, vous êtes une personne référente pour les solutions de données membres-clients et êtes amené à contribuer avec votre expertise du métier ainsi que des arrimages avec les autres membres de votre équipe proche. Vous êtes appelé(e) à interagir avec de nombreuses parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise complémentaires. La maîtrise des relations interpersonnelles ainsi que votre aptitude à savoir trouver un juste équilibre entre les intérêts des multiples parties deviennent alors des compétences essentielles.Travailler à la vice-présidence Évolution et mise en œuvre des solutions, c’est s’investir dans la création de valeur pour nos entreprises et nos entrepreneurs!Responsabilités principalesAnalyser les besoins des parties prenantes, les coûts, les bénéfices, les risques, les contraintes et les opportunités d’affaires devant être considérés dans la portée du projet. Identifier, formaliser et communiquer les besoins et exigencesFormaliser les objectifs, soutenir l’identification de la valeur et modéliser les processus d’affairesCo-créer la solution avec les utilisateurs en assurant l’alignement avec les objectifs d’affaires. Analyser les impacts auprès des parties prenantes et identifier les prérequis et dépendances internes. Assurer une vision transversale de la solution et réaliser une traçabilité bout en bout des exigencesContribuer à l'élaboration des stratégies d'essais et définir le plan des essais d'acceptation. Soutenir le secteur d'affaires durant le déploiement des solutionsContribuer à la définition de la stratégie et à la réalisation des activités de gestion du changementCoordonner des arrimages avec d’autres membres de la direction pour répondre de manière concertée à des demandesCibler, préparer, décrire, interpréter et valider les données requises par les analyses et procéder aux recommandations appropriées afin de soutenir la prise de décision de gestion.Profil recherchéBaccalauréat dans une discipline appropriéeCertificat en analyse d’affaires (un atout)Un minimum de deux ans d’expérience pertinenteVeuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considéréesPour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaireConnaissances spécifiquesMaitrise du langage SQL et de Power BI (un atout)Connaissance du mode Agile (un atout)Connaissance de la gestion des bases de données (un atout)Conditions particulièresLieu de travail : Place d’affaires Montréal, Lévis ou Trois-Rivières, selon la préférence du candidat retenu. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride #LI-HybridNombre d’emploi disponible : 1Compétences transversales DesjardinsApprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’actionCompétences clés au profil recherchéAvoir une bonne connaissance du secteur, Gérer la complexitéLieu de travailComplexe Desjardins MontréalDate de fin d'affichage2022-06-17Niveau d'emploiNV-08Famille d'emploisDonnée (GF)Desjardins valorise la diversité et l’équité en emploi et s’engage à répondre aux besoins des personnes handicapées en adaptant, au besoin, son processus de recrutement.Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.

job_title: Residential Market Studies Analyst, Economic Consulting
job_desc: Job CategoryEconomicsOpportunity Awaits at Altus Group! The opportunity Reporting to the Director, Economic Consulting we are looking for a Residential Market Studies Analyst, to join our National Economic Advisory team. You will play a pivotal role conducting research, analysing data, and contributing to studies for our residential feasibility consulting practice.Who You AreYou are a recent grad with an interest in economics, planning, urban development or policy analysis; with exceptional research, data analysis, and writing skills. You are detail oriented and have an interest in consultative report writing and working as a trusted advisor in residential or mixed-use studies - and you are looking for an opportunity to be trained and mentored in this field. You want to join a national team at a scaling industry leader offering competitive analysis and advice founded on data and integrity. You have an entrepreneurial spirit, the growth mindset, and the willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to learn and make an impact.What You Will Focus On Conduct research. You will collect data from both internal and third-party sources regarding economic, demographic, real estate market, and other topics as required. You will correspond with industry participants to elicit and compile real estate market data.  Prepare information for reporting and analysis. You will perform data entry for analytical models and prepare preliminary analysis. You will support complex consulting reports by writing, editing, and proofreading assigned sections under the supervision of a Senior Analyst.  Build and create. You will use GIS software to perform spatial data analysis and provide high-quality graphic outputs and mapping. You will assist with the development and maintenance of analytical models. You will create informative and visually compelling tables and charts for consulting reports.  Learn. You will continuously upgrade your knowledge regarding the market and industry trends. As Our New Analyst, Residential Market Studies, You Bring The education and motivation. You have a university degree in Economics, Statistics, Urban Geography, Urban Planning, Business, or a related discipline. You take ownership of your tasks, are detail-oriented, and comfortable supporting the efforts of a team acting as a key contact for disseminating information.  The technical skills. You have basic research, quantitative and analytical skills. You are proficient in MS Office, including Excel. GIS software knowledge is a benefit.  The interpersonal skills. You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills. You are collaborative and can build relationships with internal teams and external stakeholders. You are comfortable reaching out via email or phone to obtain information and confirm details.  The flexibility. You have a valid driver’s license and access to a vehicle. You are willing to work the occasional weekend or evening to complete studies or attend client meetings, forums, and information sessions when it is safe to do so.  What’s in it for you ? Impact, reputation, and collaboration . Our National Economics Advisory Team conducts more than 100 feasibility studies a year, and we are ramping up. We have a top-end product, continuously evolving to meet the needs of our clients and backed by a reputation for delivering services with independence and integrity. This is a chance to be part of an organization with one of the largest repositories of real estate data, inhouse built tech products to access and analyze the data, and experts in appraisals, construction costs, and valuation.  Exposure. We work on projects across the country, presenting new and unique challenges with leads generated through marketing and a reputation that precedes us. This is an opportunity to gain an incredible amount of exposure and hands-on opportunity working with renowned experts in the field, including VP and Chief Economist, Peter Norman, supporting your work and learning as you go.  Career development. We have a year-over-year mandate to develop the broader team; you will have endless possibilities for growth with the chance to move up to a Senior Analyst, Consultant, and beyond, across the group into commercial real estate studies, or into another line of the business. We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to grow your career and do some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what's new by following us on LinkedIn .Come realize your potential at Altus Group!Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

Job Id: 22450581Job OverviewWe are seeking a Sr .Data Science Analyst to support the Global Trade Surveillance Technology team at Citi. As result the Global Trade Surveillance Technology team at Citi has an increased book of work that requires additional business lines, countries, and more sophisticated surveillance methods to be delivered using our strategic platforms. These platforms allow users to monitor trading activity across multiple asset classes and information barriers, on real time, end of day, and historic lookup bases for indications of potential Market Abuse, Insider Dealing, and other types of fraud. As we further expand global coverage and deliver more sophisticated Behavioral Analytics based solutions, we are seeking a Data Analytics Senior Analyst to join our team.The successful candidate must be capable of applying in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes/work-flow for the area or function. The role requires strong communication and diplomacy skills where candidate will regularly assume informal/formal leadership role within team. You will be part of a team responsible for producing behavioral models and machine learning models to assist our Global Compliance stakeholders in meeting growing regulatory surveillance requirements.This role will provide an excellent opportunity to become a key player in the design, prototype, and implementation of new industry leading surveillance techniques based on advanced data analytics and cutting edge compliance techniques.Responsibilities:Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes.Coordinates and contribute to the objectives of data science initiatives and overall business through leveraging in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function.Work with data scientists, data analysts, business analysts and architects to guide the implementation and validation of the solutions at scale in a big data production environmentSignificantly influences decisions, work, and performance of all teams through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in the business.Conducts strategic data analysis, identifies insights and implications, and make strategic recommendations, develops data displays that clearly communicate complex analysis.Mines and analyzes data from various banking platforms to drive optimization and improve data quality.Delivers analytics initiatives to address business problems with the ability to identify data required, assess time & effort required and establish a project plan.Consults with business clients to identify system functional specifications. Applies comprehensive understanding of how multiple areas collectively integrate to contribute towards achieving business goals.Leads system change process from requirements through implementation; provides user and operational support of application to business usersDrives communication between business leaders and IT; exhibits sound and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex information.Knowledge/Experience:2-3 years of total experience working with Big Data technologies, Python and the various python libraries related to data analysisAbility to write and understand complex SQL queriesAbility to work as part of a global team and help effectively manage a project from initiation to completion, keeping people informed of the progress and dealing with issues proactively and transparentlyExcellent written and oral communication skills and ability to express ideas to people from various business and technology backgroundsPreferenceKnowledge of Big Data technologies such as Hive, Hadoop, SparkExperience with Capital Markets domainDemonstrable knowledge of data processing and data miningOutstanding attention to detail, and determination to deliver robust and complete solutionsHas the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.EducationBachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience-------------------------------------------------Job Family Group: Technology-------------------------------------------------Job Family:Data Analytics------------------------------------------------------Time Type:Full time------------------------------------------------------Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.View the "EEO is the Law" poster. View the EEO is the Law Supplement.View the EEO Policy Statement.View the Pay Transparency Posting

Job CategoryData SolutionsOpportunity Awaits at Altus Group!The OpportunityAs a Market Analyst, you will work within our Data Solutions research team to compile real estate information and maintain our databases through careful data entry. You will also develop industry contacts to facilitate the sharing of information and respond to client needs regarding our database and/or published records. You’ll build on your knowledge of real estate to become an expert in the local market, including conducting site visits to learn about properties.Our Data Solutions team excels at providing accurate, reliable and detailed market data across Canada. Through our databases, real estate professionals gain the important information that they need to generate reports and make well-informed decisions. As a Market Analyst, your efforts will play a direct role in helping our clients.This is an excellent opportunity for someone building a career in real estate, who enjoys being at the forefront of real estate data, being hands-on with data collection and data entry, and has strong skills in attention to detail and deadline management.Key ResponsibilitiesConduct research and collect data. On an ongoing basis, you will use a variety of methods from email, industry websites, news media, phone calls and industry networking to collect real estate information.Conduct site visits. Gather first-hand knowledge of properties by planning for site visits and collecting relevant information once on site. This includes taking photographs that meet database standards.Enter the details and maintain the database. Perform large amounts of data entry into the database in an accurate and timely manner, to ensure that our real estate data is well maintained and up to date. (Approximately 50% of the role.) Follow the trends. Use your knowledge of the real estate market to follow key market indicators and trends.Ensure accuracy. Review the database to ensure all of the details are accurate and current, and that all fields are completed. You will pursue information to complete files.Develop industry contacts. As you network and develop external contacts, you will facilitate the sharing of real estate information and gain a deeper knowledge of the industry.Collaborate internally. As you collaborate with team members, you will enforce a friendly team atmosphere where everyone assists others as needed to meet deadlines.Position RequirementsGenuine interest in the real estate industry with a strong desire to learn.At least 1 year of related work experience is required.Valid driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract is required.Strong attention to detail and proven ability to enter large amounts of data efficiently, with a high level of accuracy.Ability to collect, understand, verify and compile relevant information.Understanding of strict deadlines and ability to prioritize workload in a fast-paced environment.A logical approach to problem solving with the instinct to follow processes and best practices.Outstanding communication and relationship building skills. This is a role that requires reaching out to property managers, owners, and other external stakeholders to ascertain details and confirm information; professionalism is key.The drive to work autonomously and be a contributor to the team’s initiatives. By staying focused, learning the market and pursuing networking opportunities, this is an exciting first or second job for someone considering a career in commercial real estate.Technical skills including knowledge of MS Office, primarily Word and Excel.Who We AreAltus Group is a leading provider of software, data solutions and technology-enabled expert services to the global commercial real estate (CRE) industry. We are a single provider of end-to-end CRE solutions empowering clients to make informed decisions and drive strategic growth.Headquartered in Canada, we have approximately 2,250 employees around the world, with operations in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. We are at the center of what drives the real estate industry and continue to break ground every day with innovative solutions and best practices that touch every aspect of the real estate life cycle.Need any more reasons to join Altus?In 2005, we started with 400 employees and have grown exponentially to over 2,250 around the globe today. Altus Group employees don’t see boundaries, they see opportunity. They deliver results for our clients and our company and are recognized and rewarded for the value they create. This is an opportunity to work on multiple projects that encompass many industries, geographic reach, and high profile design.At Altus, we want you to realize your potential. We value collaboration and knowledge sharing of best practices. We support professional growth and we actively seek out ideas. This is the place to present the newest research, to introduce the coolest tech, and see it come to fruition and be applied. Your work will make a difference.We Work Hard To Create a Dynamic Company Culture That Reflects The Values Of Our Employees And What Motivates Them Individually And As a TeamAltus Group isn’t just about the amazing work we do.Altus Cares - We are always seeking ways to give back to our communities, and support causes important to our employees. We are actively involved in local charity work and we believe in laying the groundwork for a more prosperous future. Our personal highlight is our involvement with Ronald McDonald house in four different countries where we volunteer every September as a company.Education - We believe our employees represent the best this industry has to offer and we want to reflect their commitment to education and continued learning.At Altus Group, we are proud to say that many of our teams are comprised of members who have been here five years or longer. We think that speaks volumes about our atmosphere and our people.Opportunity awaits - come realize your potential at Altus Group!Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. Sharethrough is disrupting the legacy digital advertising supply chain as the first ad exchange to auto-enhance every standard impression by rendering a higher-performing ad that dynamically fits into any placement on any site. Our technology and approach enables advertisers to see substantial campaign performance improvements and cost savings using the same standard video and display creative as well as the buying workflow they use with standard exchanges. The Sharethrough Exchange (STX) powers over 225 billion monthly impressions and is integrated with more than 30 of the world's largest demand side platforms, enabling buyers to efficiently achieve their marketing objectives at scale.We’re looking for data scientist who share our passion for building data-driven products, as well as the belief data should be tightly integrated into the engineering and product flow.In this role, you’ll pair with your data science and product peers to explore new ways to optimize the 20 billion impressions flowing through our exchange every day. We believe in an experiment-driven approach that enables you to test out your ideas. While we’ve implemented some tremendously impactful optimization products already, we believe we’ve just scratched the surface.About The RoleAnalyze Sharethrough data to discover patterns, abnormalities, and increased revenue opportunities Present findings to data scientists and product managers to influence product roadmapsWork with our data engineering team to make the data needed for your analysis availablePair with our product managers to make sure we are properly analyzing the success of our productsWork closely with business leadership to integrate data into every part of the productAbout You3+ years of experience working in an analytics organization Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Econometrics, or similar domainCompetent performing statistical analysis using a scripting language (Python, R, Julia)Proficient with SQL Able to create intuitive and readable dashboards using visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.)Strong familiarity with experimental designComfortable pairing with productBonus PointsExperience or familiarity with the adtech ecosystemExperience working closely with Product teamsComfortable collaborating with leadership to distill down high level business goals and provide data driven recommendations What's In It For You? Competitive compensation packagesGenerous group health insurance planAccess to the virtual healthcare platform DialogueAccess to the company's stock option plan16 days of vacation per year, which increases with seniority at the company3 paid Caring days1 paid volunteer dayOffices closed during the holidaysWellness allocation of $840 per year (for gym memberships, sportswear, etc.)In-house training programs on our company and industryEncouragement and funding of continuing education and trainingVery active social committee and free online sports classesAccess to a tool that measures your engagement and job satisfaction anonymouslyPairing with a buddy for your first 6 monthsAdvantageous referral programInclusive, inspiring, and dynamic work environmentCasual dress codeWork from home and flexible hoursAnd more!

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewBuilding a World-Class Technology Team at TDWe can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.TD Data and Information Management covers building, developing, designing, and implementing involved with tech data management solutions. Where do we begin? These experts analyze, design, develop and support TD's info management system; lead and support bank data curation; develop data road map and info management strategies; focus on complex data integration, and drive use of our data reference model. This area doesn't work in isolation. We love data and we feel the same about integration and our assignments prove it.There's room to grow in all of it.Job DescriptionNetwork Services is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Service Management team. This individual will develop and maintain data management and reporting solutions to support Network Services risk management stakeholders and supporting teams.Works as part of a team under guidance of senior manager to design, develop and support data management and presentation solutions. Provide a broad range of data management and analysis functions including data warehousing, data modeling, ETL, data quality assessment, data profiling and data provenance and lineage.Collaborate with risk management and supporting engineering/delivery teams to elicit information and articulate requirements.Ensure data is maintained in compliance with enterprise data standards, policies and guidelines.Perform regular code upgrades and associated change management activities (requires occasional after-hours contributions).Contribute to technical system activities such as implementations, upgrades, troubleshooting and incident remediation as required.Identify opportunities to automate data management, refresh and distribution capabilities.Leverage APIs to integrate and process data collected from various sources for staging in data mart. TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewTD Commercial Banking services the unique needs of Canadian businesses, customizing a broad range of products. As part of the Commercial Banking team the Analyst Commercial Banking will provide credit writing support to a Relationship Manager who is the face of the Bank to our customers. The position reports to a Manager Commercial Credit who will coordinate workflow and provide coaching on credit structure, pricing and presentation.Job DescriptionThe Analyst Commercial Banking works on a two-person team with a Relationship Manager. Together, they jointly manage a portfolio of approximately 60 mid-market accounts with a moderate to high level of complexity. Portfolios are broadly based and teams have responsibility for firms across a wide range of industrial segments. Clients are characteristically incorporated entities seeking loans in the $1 – 15 million range. The Analyst is responsible for much of the credit writing for the team, structuring credits appropriately to meet customer needs and address perceived risk. The Analyst completes necessary due diligence and produces reviews and risk ratings that reflect knowledge of Bank policies and procedures. Trends and conditions of accounts are pro-actively monitored and action plans are developed for problem situations. The position delivers consistent and timely service to customers and assists the Commercial Banking management team in resolving customer problems with an innovative approach.Job RequirementsIn addition to your undergraduate degree in business or relevant professional designation, you ideally have 2-3 years of experience as a Financial Analyst or Account Manager in a business or banking environment. Alternatively you may have experience in another profession that supports the needs of business and are looking for an opportunity to add value from a different perspective. You have well developed analytical, and relationship management skills and look forward to developing them further in this role. InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. Use compelling communication techniques to allow for storytelling with the data.Designs and implement repeatable processes to clean and verify the integrity of data ensuring information is available to build analytic systems.Researches, develops and implements new statistical analysis methodologies as needed.Extends SaskTel's data with third party sources of info when needed.Maintains confidentiality of highly sensitive issues and information.QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in Business, Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or Economics, with a preference for an advanced degree.Thorough, applied knowledge of statistical concepts and calculations, data analysis, predictive modeling, machine learning, data mining techniques and data warehousing, including:a. SQL and other database querying languagesAbility to apply advanced data-mining and modeling techniques against diverse and disparate data sources.Knowledge of and demonstrated ability to develop and apply best practice both from an industry and departmental perspective.Ability to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation.Problem solving skills and an ability to creatively analyze new business problems.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, and the ability to influence others, particularly when explaining complex methodologies and solutionsA NETWORK ENGINEERING, BILLING MEDIATION OR REVENUE ASSURANCE BACKGROUND WOULD BE AN ASSET About SaskTelSaskTel is the leading Information and Communications Technology (ICT) provider in Saskatchewan, with over $1.3 billion in annual revenue and approximately 1.4 million customer connections including 639,000 wireless accesses, 289,000 wireline network accesses, 289,000 internet accesses, 114,000 maxTV subscribers, and 81,000 security monitoring customers. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewCreative and experimental, TD Lab is a unique team within TD Bank, operating out of the Communitech Hub in Kitchener (currently working remotely), solving customer problems by developing ideas using agile and design methodologies. This lean group of developers, designers, and analysts builds new solutions through ideation, design, prototyping, and tech partnerships, and brings new solutions to test in market. The business analyst team plays an integral role in defining the direction for the products and experiences we create.Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst – Innovation plays a key role in identifying and shaping early stage opportunities for TD Lab. They will work closely with colleagues within TD Lab, using an agile scrum methodology and a user experience focused development process to support the design, build, and test of new user-facing digital solutions. The analyst may work directly with additional TD partners to understand and to solve for high potential present and future problems. They may also work directly with supporting technology teams at TD to help enable both proof of concept development and production development of high-potential solutions.The Business Analyst – Innovation will also work directly with university co-op students through both project work and mentorship, providing guidance, knowledge, and support to these colleagues in an accessible way.As an analyst on this team, you will also have an opportunity to explore emerging technologies and market trends, and be empowered to start/stop projects because of what the market tells you. This is a unique opportunity to work in a highly collaborative team, learn continuously, unleash your creativity, and move as quickly as your ability.Job ResponsibilitiesWork with TD Lab colleagues and other TD stakeholders to understand business priorities, market opportunities, problems, research, and key areas of interestConduct or review market research through primary and secondary sources to deeply understand customer problems and their root causeEffectively communicate research findings, along with proposals for conceptual ideas and/or development approaches both verbally and company_name: Canadian Forces Morale and Welfare Services
job_desc: Who We AreThe Canadian Forces Morale and Welfare Services (CFMWS) supports the Canadian Armed Forces members and their families wherever they are in the world through the provision of fitness, recreation and leisure activities, family and charitable support, retail as well as personal financial services. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with a purpose every day in an inclusive, healthy, respectful and rewarding work environment.THE ROLEUnder the direction of the Senior Manager, Business Intelligence (BI) and Customer Relation Management (CRM), they research, develop and implement analytical solutions for business users to improve customer relationships, forecast and business performance. They design and develop reporting packages, dashboards and scorecards for businesses to improve decision making and achieve business objectives, in collaboration with vendors and stakeholders. They perform analysis and present results and findings to inform key business stakeholders. They monitor analytics, key performance indicator’s (KPI’s) and metrics results and synthesize data and reports for business insights. In addition, they interpret data and identify trends as well as a potential for improvement in business practices such as customer relation management (CRM) strategies, performance of key programs, profitability, customer segmentation and revenue growth.Qualifications NeededEducation, Certifications and LicensesCollege diploma or certificate in Business Administration, Information Technology or a related field AND several years of experience in data analysis, database design or a related fieldExperienceIn Transact Structured Query Language (T-SQL)In developing data cubes for analysisIn using tools and code to support analytical projectsIn data modeling and programmingIn data visualization and in designing and creating dashboards and Business Intelligence (BI) modelsIn applying policies, procedures, and regulationsIn conducting deep-dive analysesIn working with datasetsCompetencies, Skills And AbilitiesClient focus, organizational knowledge, communication, innovation, teamwork and leadership.Language RequirementsEnglish or French EssentialBenefits AvailableHealth Benefits: Drug coverage, travel insurance, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance and accidental death and dismemberment coverage.Work Life Balance: A wide range of paid/unpaid leave, including paid vacation, family related leave and personal days.Retirement Planning: A Defined Benefit Pension Plan and Group Savings Plans.Learning and Development: Tuition Assistance Program and Advanced Learning Program, payment of professional association memberships, online learning opportunities and second language training.Perks: Discounts through CFAppreciation.Other InformationThis position has an assigned location and may allow flexible work options such as remote or hybrid work but the employee must be able to report to the assigned work location at their own cost if required. Remote work may be required depending on health and safety considerations.The selection process will be done virtually.START DATE04 July 2022INCLUSION AND ACCOMMODATIONCFMWS is committed to providing an inclusive, equitable and accessible environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported.  We welcome applications from all qualified candidates who can help us build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live.  Accommodations are available to all candidates identifying a need during all or any parts of the selection process.   Ontario

Posted by                  KatLynne Garcia, PHR, CPT             Talent Advisor Focused on Candidate Experience, Strengthening Business Partnerships, and Leading the Way in Disruptive and Proactive Recruitment Practices                                     Send InMail                    Cronos Group is an innovative global cannabinoid company with international production and distribution across five continents. Cronos Group is committed to building disruptive intellectual property by advancing cannabis research, technology and product development. With a passion to responsibly elevate the consumer experience, Cronos Group is building an iconic brand portfolio. Cronos Group’s portfolio includes PEACE NATURALS™, a global health and wellness platform, two adult-use brands, COVE™ and Spinach™, and three hemp-derived CBD brands, Lord Jones™, Peace Plus, and Happy Dance™.Cronos Group is seeking a Market Analyst to join our Global Consumer Insights & Marketing Analytics team. This role will be responsible for supporting the Cronos team in the day-to-day execution of several data assignments, with primary focus on developing and reporting on marketing campaigns promoting our CBD brands in the United States with some responsibility for our Canadian Adult-Use brands. A core component of this role will be to ensure our DTC & market analytics are accurate, reliable, and actionable.Do you love diving into data sets? Are you energized by the opportunity to have a big impact on a company’s analytics function? As a Market Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the Cronos team in the day-to-day execution of several data assignments, with primary focus on developing and reporting on marketing campaigns promoting our CBD brands in the United States with some responsibility for our Canadian Adult-Use brands. A core component of this role will be to ensure our DTC & market analytics are accurate, reliable, and actionable.Responsibilities:Support the development of DTC and market analytic data and reporting processes for the enterprise, delivering timely and high-quality analysesManage DTC attribution model maintenance and reporting to evaluate impact within and across campaigns to systematically improve impact vs investmentWork with the Digital Media team to measure, assess, and help optimize marketing performance, particularly as they relate to KPI targetsSupport the development and maintenance of a holistic reporting dashboard; service additional and ad-hoc dashboarding needsResponsible for monitoring and accuracy of vendor data (Shopify, HiFyre, etc.)Support the development and maintenance of data pipelines and transformations using both in-house and standard ETL toolingContribute to reporting for the DTC channel including, but not limited to, Paid Search, Social, Email and Display, to be provided to internal stakeholders for weekly, monthly and quarterly reviewsContribute to new strategies that deliver more from our non-paid marketing efforts (e.g. Early Access, Referral, Gifting, and Influencers)Own web analytics (i.e. Google Analytics), ensuring deep understanding of consumer behavior Support monthly performance reporting & ad hoc analysis (i.e. pricing analysis, input into innovation forecasting, market assessments, competitive tracking, etc.) for the Canadian Adult-Use businessProactively seek out and investigate new technologies to advance our analytics practiceInterface with Digital, Sales, Marketing, and Supply Chain to gather data and metrics requirements and deliver solutionsOrganizational Subject Matter Expert for:DTC analyticsMarket intelligence in the US CBD market / US CBD DTC marketYou’ll need to have:Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Statistics, Analytics, Operations Research, or Economics (or related field)2-5 years of experience in analyticsPrevious experience in DTC, Marketing Analytics. Market Analytics, Sales Analytics or related fieldsExperience in CPG industry is a bonusProficient in DTC marketing analytics & best practices (tools, metrics, and techniques)Strong dashboarding /reporting skills using BI tools such as Looker, Power BI, and/or TableauDeep analytical experience. Comfortable manipulating large data sets into easy-to-digest analyses, forecasting product launches, and “sell out” scenariosUnderstanding of CPG shopper analytic fundamentals in the areas of Marketing and Digital / web solutions, capable of making actionable recommendations to increase site traffic, conversion, and drive efficient campaignsExperience with SQL or similar database querying languages a plusDetailed knowledge of Shopify, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics or similar product / web analytics toolsSuperior Excel skills, experience working with data in Knime, Alteryx, Python, R or similar analytics tools preferredStrong interpersonal and communication skills (strong proficiency in oral and written English language skills) to work collaboratively with all levels of the organizationEqually comfortable contributing and influencing in group or individual assignmentsConfidence to adapt to and manage changing (and occasionally, conflicting) prioritiesAppreciation for a “self-ownership” environment, capable of working autonomously with a bias for actionConfidence to appropriately challenge status quo by asking “why can’t it be done” vs. stating “it can’t be done”Natural curiosity and broad range of interestsAbility to, and willingness to, travel within Canada and the USA – note, minimal travel (less than 5%)We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment, and we welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities and people with diverse backgrounds, identities, and cultures. At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.We make the world better, and you can too.Solution Consultant Job location: This is a virtual role. You may work anywhere from home and be based anywhere in the USA or Canada.About The TeamYou will be a contributing member of the Kinaxis Professional Services organization, collaborating with team members to deliver committed customer projects using Kinaxis RapidResponse® software.If you love solving analytical problems, forecasting using complex datasets, finding actionable insights, communicate the story within the data and learning new technologies, this role is for you!What you will do Develop cutting edge expertise in Kinaxis’ AI/ML capabilities to translate customer’s business needs into actionable insights that can drive business improvements.  Support customer to define and implement value metrics and KPIs that will demonstrate visible business success.  Evaluate and measure models’ outputs to ensure client requirements are met and drive continuous value.  Seamlessly collaborative with cross functional teams of Data Scientists, machine learning engineers, data engineers and customer business teams to complete challenging machine learning projects.  Provide on-going support and thought leadership to customers to continually improve their AI/ML models by demonstrating and delivering value.  Work with multiple teams to shape the product roadmap and provide thought leadership content and points of view on industry trends and user stories  Work with pre-sales and help shape a point of view for each customer about how the Kinaxis capabilities can best support them. What we are looking forA minimum of 3 years of experience in a relevant capacityS trong technical background in analyzing and validating data, machine learning models or statistics using python, spark, SQL in various development environments  Ability to understand customers business’ and supply chain needs and leverage it to effectively design solutions to drive business value.  Ability to effectively communicate with executives and business stakeholders to shape and influence decision making.  Hands-on experience with relational databases (e.g. Oracle, MySQL, MS Sql Server, PostgreSQL) and Hive, cloud environments. Working knowledge of distributed computing techniques.  Working knowledge of Machine learning stack such as Kubernetes, Docker, Project Jupyter, Kafka and workflow engines.  Ability to translate planning processes to different industry verticals such as Retail, High Tech, etc.  Excellent interpersonal, presentation and client relationship building and facilitation skills (meeting sessions, conflict resolutions, brainstorming etc.)  Client facing experience (consulting roles a plus) What we have to offerChallenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen. For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewOur vision to be the Better Bank is grounded in our purpose-driven and forward-focused strategy. Amidst a rapidly changing landscape, we know that technology plays a critical role in achieving this vision and delivering on our strategy. It also signals the need to accelerate investment in emerging capabilities to adapt to the changes happening around us and respond to customer needs more quickly. To accomplish this, we're evolving our Platforms, introducing key enterprise Practices and re-imagining our customer Journeys as part of the Next Evolution of Work (NEW).NEW will empower colleagues to make decisions faster, work more efficiently and quickly identify and address customer and market trends to deliver innovative solutions at an unprecedented pace. NEW will enable us to move with purpose towards common goals, simplify how we work and elevate how we deliver customer value. By joining NEW, you'll have the opportunity to be part of a new way of working while making an impact on the future of banking in ways you've never imagined.Introducing the Data as a Service (DaaS) Platform! This Platform will develop a centralized data strategy and roadmap to enable TD to shift to a data-driven organization and help us extract value from the data we create, collect and consume. The Platform will include applications responsible for the creation and management of data lakes, standards, analytical tools and governance. DaaS will consolidate over ~110 assets and ~200 applications, aggregate our customer data, and bring together data subject matter experts from Practices, such as Data, Software Engineering and Quality Engineering.Job DescriptionAre you an experienced data professional, equipped with both conceptual and practical expertise in business information management? job_title: Data Warehouse Analyst, Actuarial - 1 Year Contract
job_desc: We’re Northbridge Financial. We’re proud to be 100% Canadian and owned by Fairfax Financial. We serve through our Northbridge Insurance, Federated Insurance, and TruShield Insurance brands. We have a reputation for being one of Canada’s leading commercial property and casualty insurance company. Our employees are dedicated to understanding the needs of our customers and we go above and beyond to help Canadian businesses have a safer and brighter future. We’re a company of passionate people who put people first. Do you want to join a team that believes in working hard – and having fun at work – all while making a difference? Look no farther than Northbridge.At Northbridge, our Actuarial Analysts are known in the organization for being experts at providing insights to other departments by acquiring, analyzing, and evaluating company and industry data. The implementation of IFRS 17 standards will require a transformation in the valuation of insurance contract liabilities and a significant change within actuarial and accounting systems and processes. Our Actuarial Analysts will support this transition by building data requirements and testing, implementing and enhancing processes efficiencies across the business area, and supporting the audit review and approvalOur Actuarial Analysts are analytical, have strong communication skills, and are proficient with various software and systems. In other words, they’re awesome. If you are too, consider joining us in the Corporate Actuarial team.You’re Great AtDeveloping and verifying sources of data for analysis to ensure data is sufficient, current, and accurateUsing your technical knowledge to resolve complex problemsCollaborating with teammates to ensure proper communication of observed trends to key stakeholdersData manipulation and building efficiencyYou HaveBachelor's Degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Data EngineeringOn the Casualty Actuarial Society exam trackExperience with SQL, Excel, and PowerBIExperience with enterprise data warehouse is an assetReserving experience is an assetMoody’s Risk Integrity and Accounting knowledge is an assetAt Northbridge Financial we embrace and celebrate you and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace for all! No matter who you are or what makes you unique, we welcome you. Please let us know how we can assist or accommodate you during the selection process.

Here at Iceland we’re different. We care. We’re not a dull stuffy corporate. We’re one big team. A diverse group of people who get stuck in and work together. We have a fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our eCommerce team within our Head Office in Deeside, near Chester.Overview And TeamThe Insight and Analytics team within eCommerce is a fast-paced business critical area undergoing a program of growth and investment in people to ensure we get the best out of our data and support the wider online trading strategy. The role is ideal for an experience data analyst who wants be part of an exciting growing team, someone who is willing to put in the work to contribute to this growth and be rewarded with the support and training to drive their own development and career within the Iceland family!The RoleWorking as a key member within a team of multidisciplined analysts the role is a blend of supporting the wider team by investigating issues and opportunities and proactively identifying new ways of driving value from our data. If you’re a person that wants to work out ‘The How and ‘The Why’ as much as ‘The What’, then this is the role for you!Support the Trading Strategy through analysing what products our customers buy, what operational considerations we need to make and supporting fast-paced decision making.Use multiple data sources to support the planning and forecasting of key metrics to help to drive our business forward.Engage and brief senior stakeholders to ensure that the website performance is well understood and acted on as a priority.Work with the wider online team to understand and interpret requirements for new reporting and analysis.Work closer across full analytical team and engage in multiple analytical disciplines.React quickly to emerging business challenges and support the leadership team with the information needed to meet these challenges.Provide and validate information to enable a variety of quick paced and agile business decisions.Proactively create actionable insight across all aspects of the online business.Key Skills And ExperienceTechnical Analytical tools and methodologiesAt Iceland we have a wide variety of analytical tools and use multiple methodologies, we believe in developing the best toolbox we can to drive value from our data and constantly review and build out new ways of working. Across the team we are utilising tools such as SAS, leveraging web analytics to understand our customers, developing our reporting delivery through visualisation tools such as Power BI and trialling new modelling techniques to segment our customers.We don’t expect you to have years of experience in all these tools, but we do require you to demonstrate an awareness of what these tools can deliver, display a willingness to learn and adapt and have a proven track record in driving your own technical development.Other Skills And CompetenciesGood knowledge of Microsoft Office products including a proven track record in using Excel (or similar) to manipulate/interrogate data and present findings in an understandable and engaging way.Create engaging presentations based on findings and articulate technical details to a non-technical audience.The ability to gather, interpret and combine data from a multitude of sources and formatsThe ability to deliver accurate, relevant, and timely information, based on solid researchAn awareness of the importance of planning and forecasting within a business and the techniques and methodologies which feed into these activities.Ability to write queries in SQL of varying complexities.You can make a real difference with your career at Iceland, we expect a lot but you’ll get a lot back in return. We will help you grow and develop your career and give you the freedom to show that you really care.Alongside This We Can Offer YouA very competitive salary with an excellent benefits package25 days holiday, plus 8 days bank holidayFlexible working10% store discount, 30% club individual restaurant discountFree parkingDouble discount weeksHighly subsidised restaurant onsite with our own Michelin Star Chef!Subsidised Costa onsiteDiscounted gym membershipCharity fundraising eventsEducational sponsorshipEnhanced maternity/paternity leaveLong service awardsReward & recognitionOnline discounts at over 150 retailers and cashback on shopping, holidays, insurance and more!Be Proud. Be brave. Be everything that makes us different. Be Iceland.

Title: Data Migration AnalystLocation: Across Canada, work from homeType of contract: Temporary (12 months) full-timeSalary band: $61,113 - $89,122An iconic brand and one of the most inspirational not-for-profit organizations on this planet – The Canadian Red Cross (CRC), is seeking Data Migration Analyst to join our Information Services team.You have a passion for helping others, and want to work with other dedicated individuals? By applying, you are taking a big first step to be part of an exciting organization.At the Canadian Red Cross, we are guided by our fundamental principles of humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity, and universality. We help people and communities in Canada and around the world in times of need and support them in strengthening their resilience.Starting with the hiring process, we are committed to having an accessible, diverse, inclusive, and barrier-free work environment where everyone can reach their full potential. We encourage all qualified persons to apply, particularly Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, racialized people, and people with diverse gender identities and sexual orientations, and others who share our values and contribute to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.We are looking for a Data Migration Analyst, who will work with the Senior Manager, Business Systems & Process Analysis. The incumbent will be responsible for playing a contributory role on enterprise-wide transformational projects. Based on breadth and depth of understanding of data migration, the Data Migration Analyst works on projects of various sizes to integrate business processes, business rules and business data with technology to satisfy business requirements.In This Role, You WillPerform database analysis & database mining and reates routine, complex ad-hoc and custom queries.Be responsible for data modeling , data mapping data quality and data cleanliness in advance of the migration and/or integration activitiesWork closely with clients who may elect to scrub certain pieces of ‘dirty’ data before any migration/ integration run.Perform source and target mapping – conducts discovery and requirements gathering sessions for the data migration and/or integration requirements to identify how items from the source system(s) will be mapped to the target system.Make migration or integration source data available in a standard format to be determined by analysis (i.e., a staging database, Excel, Azure, etc.).Map the source system data to system elements with a preference for using the existing out-of-the-box (OOB) elements first and custom defined new elements second. Identifies and documents any static cross-reference information.Perform source system data analysis to manage source to target data mappingDevelop and produce reports upon request including dashboards and report visualizationsWhat We Are Looking ForThe minimum qualifications for this job are a Bachelor’s degree in a related field e.g., Mathematics 5+ years of job-related work experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience years of proven working experience as a data analyst / data migration analystTechnical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniquesStrong background in using Excel Power Query, Power Bi and MS SQL is mandatory. Knowledge of Azure Synapse, Python, or R is an assetStrong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyAdept at queries, report writing and presenting findingsUnderstanding of Data Migration ETL ProcessExperience in working with both English and French data for data migration and integration analysis and conversionStrong communication skills in English are essential Working ConditionsSome travel across Canada may be required for meeting with clients, stakeholders, or off-site personnel/management.Full vaccination against COVID-19 is mandatory for this position and operation (the CRC will however adhere to its duty to accommodate those who are unable to be fully vaccinated for a reason related to a human right protected ground).The Canadian Red Cross is an organization guided by our fundamental principles of humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you require accommodation measures during any phase of the hiring process, please notify us as soon as possible. All information received in relation to accommodation requests will be kept confidential.#RegularOperations

Job DescriptionRelevant du Directeur, Marketing de données, l'Analyste Performance d’affaires marketing aura la charge de l’évaluation des résultats de campagnes marketing relationnel, de la création d’analyses complexes et de proposer des pistes d’améliorations continues des différentes initiatives.Il aura à sa charge l’analyse des campagnes courriel, postale et télémarketing effectuées pour les différentes marques et régions desservies par l’équipe marketing relationnel au sein de la distribution directe et du réseau de courtage d’Intact Corporation Financière.De plus, l’analyste aura comme tâche la production de rapports stratégiques, d’effectuer des analyses de données et des études permettant de développer l’intelligence d’affaires. L’analyste mettra à contribution ses connaissances approfondies de notre domaine d’affaires, ses compétences informatiques et analytiques pour assurer l’évolution des activités marketing relationnel et de l’environnement de base de données marketing.Vos ResponsabilitésAnalyser les résultats quantitatifs (financiers, réponses, cellules tests, etc.) des différentes activités marketing direct en dégageant les faits saillants et en proposant des recommandations et présenter les résultats aux différentes équipes impliquées.Extraire et préparer les données à partir des différentes bases de données internes via SQL dans le but de préparer les jeux d’analyses.Participer à la planification, l’organisation et la gestion des campagnes de marketing direct. Interagir avec les différents intervenants de façon optimale et proactive en ayant une bonne connaissance des défis, enjeux et processus opérationnels et d'affaires.Coordonner la planification et participer à la conception, l'exécution et la validation d’outils analytiques et rapports d’informations développés par l’équipe.Effectuer des études et analyses adhoc à partir des bases de données marketing et de sources de données externes permettant ainsi de développer des systèmes d'information d'aide à la prise de décision.Agir à titre de chargé de projet dans le cadre de mandats et d’activités en lien avec l’optimisation de l’environnement de bases de données afin d’améliorer l’efficacité de l’équipe et la qualité de l’information produite.Ce Que Vous Mettrez à ProfitBaccalauréat en technologies de l’information, marketing ou autres domaines pertinents;5 années d’expérience en tant qu’analyste marketing, BI ou équivalent;Bonne Connaissance du langage SQL, des bases de données Oracle;Connaissance de Power BI et de snowflake un atout;Expérience en assurances et vente de produits d’assurance un atout;Parfait bilinguisme (français et anglais); un atoutExpérience dans des environnements très dynamiques et en changement constant;Autonomie et débrouillardise;Excellente capacité d'analyse et de synthèseSouci du détail et rigueur.BI Analyst, MarketingReporting to the Manager, Data Marketing, the Marketing Business Performance Analyst will be responsible for evaluating the results of relationship marketing campaigns, creating complex analyses, and proposing avenues for continuous improvement of various initiatives.You will be responsible for analyzing email, mail and telemarketing campaigns for the various brands and regions served by the relationship marketing team within Intact Financial Corporation’s direct distribution and broker network.In addition, you will be responsible for producing strategic reports, and performing data analysis and studies to develop business intelligence. Using your in-depth knowledge of our business domain, and your computer and analytical skills, you will drive the evolution of the relationship marketing activities and the marketing database environment.Your ResponsibilitiesAnalyze the quantitative results (financial, responses, test cells, etc.) of the various direct marketing activities by identifying highlights and making recommendations and present the results to the various teams involved.Extract and prepare data from various internal databases via SQL in order to prepare analysis sets.Participate in the planning, organization, and management of direct marketing campaigns. Interact optimally and proactively with the various stakeholders based on a good knowledge of the challenges, issues, and operational and business processes.Coordinate the planning and participate in the design, execution and validation of analytical tools and information reports developed by the team.Conduct studies and ad hoc analyses from marketing databases and external data sources to develop decision-making information systems.Act as a project lead for mandates and activities related to the optimization of the database environment in order to improve the efficiency of the team and the quality of the information produced.What You Bring To The TableBachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Marketing, or another relevant field.5 years of experience as a marketing analyst, BI or equivalent.Good knowledge of SQL language, Oracle databases.Knowledge of Power BI and Snowflake, an asset.Experience in insurance and selling insurance products, an asset.Perfectly bilingual (French and English), an assetExperience in fast-paced and constantly changing environments.Autonomy and resourcefulness.Excellent analytical and synthesis skills.Attention to detail and thoroughness.Job 59129

DescriptionCreate awesome experiences for our customers.Join our teamWe’re looking for bright people who like solving big problems. As an integral part of the P&C Operations team, you’ll tackle all kinds - and solve them end to end. We’re just as passionate about our team as we are about our customers and we’re looking for people that radiate this passion. We are on a quest to create the ultimate team member experience!Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish togetherAs a Business Intelligence Analyst you’ll play an important role in building critical reporting capabilities and generating data-driven business insights into the end to end team member experience.You will have the opportunity to lead the reporting evolution for P&C Operations from the ground up which will involve tight stakeholder collaboration, data & system management, quality assurance, data privacy & security compliance, and process improvement.You will have the opportunity to partner, network and influence at all levels across the TELUS team to deliver world-class team member experiences. While you will be enabling an operational team, you will also be responsible for identifying and driving transformative and strategic change for the entire P&C team.Here's HowSupport the management of our P&C scorecard in terms of regular reporting and build/ evolve our leading and lagging indicatorsSupport the development and evolution of reporting capabilities for our operations teams such as askHR, Benefits, Finance, and Payroll etc (e.g. Capacity Modeling, Team Member Experience insights, Self-Serve Demand Failure Analysis, etc.)Gather requirements from stakeholders and collaborate across Total Rewards to assess, prioritize, and deliver data solutions Lead cross-functional teams to define & refine KPIs and evolve reporting solutions leveraging Tableau, Visier, Google Data Studio, and other BI toolsReport and monitor KPIs against targets. Proactively identify risks and develop mitigation plans in collaboration with the team to achieve targetsesent insights and recommendations to various stakeholder levels and inform critical business decisionsLead special projects, deep dive business analyses/ investigations and perform other ad-hoc analyses as requiredQualificationsYou're the missing piece of the puzzleYou like to get your hands dirty - diving in and learning new systems to understand the ‘art of the possible’ in configuration and data outputsYou have experience and in-depth knowledge of identifying requirements and building reporting solutions in collaboration with key stakeholders You are known for your analytical expertise and data driven approach. You are proficient in connecting the dots between various data sets to drive conclusionsYou see the bigger picture of the problem you are trying to solve and proactively explore new data points from varied sources to complement your analysesYou are a self-starter with the ability to prioritize and independently execute projects by defined timelinesGreat-to-havesExperience in Human ResourcesExperience with Artificial Intelligence solutions such as “bots”University Degree or equivalent experienceBilingual in English and French, written and spoken, is an asset

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewWhat does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights.We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data.Job DescriptionAbout this RoleAs an expert in data and analytics, you will provide in depth expertise, analytical interpretation, key insights and action items to your multi-functional business partners across the organization. Those insights will be brought to bear to enable informed and enabled business decisions enterprise wide or help to solve the increasingly complex business problems they face.In this role, TD will look to as a thought leadership as well as a leader in your space, coaching, mentoring, empowering and educating your peers to collaborate and bring TD into the future of banking.As a Senior Business Insights Analyst, You WillApply understanding of respective business strategies to produce relevant and substantial data analysis to support business goals and objectivesDevelop analysis to illustrate business trends and identify areas of business opportunitiesProduce insights and recommend business actions to align with strategy and/or solve business problemsProvide seasoned specialized knowledge, advice and/or mentorship to various business and working partnersExecute on data requests accurately and within a timely mannerRepresent functional area as an analytics & insights professional and key resource; build positive and productive working partnershipsAct as a bridge to translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domainProvides day-to-day support and delivery of analyticsWork independently as the senior analyst/subject matter expert and may coach and educate othersConsidered an authority within a given areaOversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to endJob RequirementsWhat can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:Undergraduate degree or technical certificateFive (5) or more years relevant experienceProven experience working with analytics tools: data mining with SQL, Python; data modeling with Python, PySpark, Experience working in analytical environments such as Hadoop, HIVE, Cloud, Impala; and understanding of data mining/analytical techniquesInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

job_desc: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world. Get to Know our  Team: The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world. In this Role, you’ll get  to: Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful testsDisplay: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and othersModeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers What you’ll Need to  Succeed: Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)Ability to communicate fluently in EnglishExposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, TableauGood numerical reasoning skillsProficiency in ExcelIntellectual curiosity and analytical skills It’s Great if you  Have: Experience in digital marketingAcademic
