job_title: Senior Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst
job_desc: TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewWhat does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data. Key objectives include driving business value, adopting key platforms, upholding reporting principles, simplifying and optimizing operations, supporting an inclusive environment and enhancing the colleague experience. The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization. This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise. Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before. Job DescriptionAs a Senior Business Intelligence & Reporting Analyst, you will:• Work with business partners in Fraud analytics teams to understand business objectives, define clear reporting requirements, develop value-added reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts in alignment with D&A reporting principles;• Create complex and comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data infrastructure, localized datamarts and external data sources and transform into visual stories using appropriate systems to support client objectives;• Identify opportunities to meet evolving business needs; utilize various technology/ applications/ methodologies to rapidly generate impactful visualizations;• Use various methodologies to rapidly generate impactful interactive visualizations or tools. You will have a strong working knowledge of standard data practice and partner with the central data function to service all reporting needs;• Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in the Reporting Packages and Dashboards;• Adopt, implement and effectively evolve report automation and/or visualization standards;• Develop and deliver presentations /communications to management or broader audiences;• Adhere to internal policies/procedures and applicable regulatory guidelines, contribute to the review of internal processes and activities and assist in identifying potential opportunities to improve operation efficiencies;• Support development and implementation of standards, policies, procedures, and solutions that mitigate risk and maximize availability of service, efficiency and effectiveness;• Prioritize and manage own workload to deliver quality results and meet assigned timelines within an Agile framework;• Work independently as the senior analyst / subject matter expert in a given area and may provide technical support to others.Job RequirementsJob Requirements• The ideal candidate should have 5+ years of relevant experience in business or financial reporting/business data analysis and reporting, knowledgeable and savvy with new technology and tools preferably within the global financial services / financial crimes and fraud management industries;• Experience eliciting and refining business requirements, understanding stakeholder needs, and creating documentation which may include data process mapping, data dictionaries, and metadata;• Experience developing and maintaining reporting environments across multiple platforms (e.g. Star Schema, ETL, reporting data layer, etc.);• Proficient with programming languages and working in various data environments (e.g. MS BI Stack, SQL, VBA, SAS, Hadoop, R, Python, etc.);• Expertise using business intelligence, analytics and/or data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Alteryx, PowerBI, etc.);• Experience with testing best practices and process, including documenting test cases and performing reconciliations is considered an asset;• Sound knowledge of MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Access, MS Word, MS Outlook, MS OneNote;• Very strong comfortability in accessing large data sources, performing mining, extractions and manipulations to uncover relevant data findings and big-picture stories;• Strong analytically-anchored problem-solving skills – a logical and strategic thinker with strong critical reasoning skills, proactively identifies risks and issues, recommends solutions, challenges the status quo;• Strong ability to work collaboratively and independently, communicate effectively (both speaking and writing), follow instructions/direction, and help building relationships across teams and functions;• Robust organizational skills with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple deadlines and priorities, with a proven track record of executing with excellence and making an impact;• Energetic, enthusiastic, pro-active self-starter – willing to “roll up the sleeves” to deliver results in the short-term while building for the long-term; agile, adaptable, 'can-do' attitude, high degree of responsiveness and initiative.InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

This job is sourced from a job board.      Learn more               Position: Data Analyst Reports to: Product Managers Location: Woodbridge Summary Reporting to the Product Managers, you will join a team who are responsible for our customer analysis and reporting as well as internal analysis and reporting to improve our own decision making. You will be responsible for developing customer reports that surface the insights customers need and building data analysis tools for internal and customer use. You should have a passion for analyzing data, have experience of dealing with large datasets and high volumes of data, as well as experience using multiple systems to retrieve data and produce reporting. Role Objective Analyze customer data to identify key insights and trends Develop data analysis tools to identify any incomplete data Support sales on customer quotes Manage/update price lists Develop customer facing reports to present the data in most easily consumable way and surface the key insights from the data Develop internal reports to present the data in most easily consumable way and surface the key insights from the data Maintain and improve existing data analysis tools and reports Knowledge Skills & Experience You will have working experience of SQL Server and/or QlikView (or other, similar reporting databases) Good (ideally advanced) Excel skills. Any experience of testing reports and/or involvement with projects would be highly advantageous, although not essential Experience of using relevant software packages, i.e. SAS, SQL, Excel, Qlikview, Tableau, Access Strong analytical skills Knowledge of designing/ developing/ maintaining reporting systems Able to work to project deadlines both effectively and efficiently Work closely with colleagues to meet tight deadlines Highly numerate and have excellent attention to detail Have a passion for data and analytics Strong team player as well as a proactive individual contributor You should have excellent time management skills and can deliver quality work to agreed deadlines Ability to take initiative and work with the minimal supervision, maintaining clear focus under pressure is a must The ability to multi-task whilst maintaining high levels of attention to detail Competencies: Relationship Building - The ability and willingness to develop and exploit a range of productive relationships both inside and outside the team. Analysis - The ability to gather relevant information, notice relationships between different pieces of information, reason from cause to effect and generate effective solutions to practical problems. Customer Orientation - The ability to recognize both internal and external customers and the willingness to co-operate with them fully in order to help them achieve their objectives. Adaptability - The ability to maintain effectiveness in a changing environment and the willingness to respond quickly and positively to change. Organizing Work - The ability to marshal and manage resources (people, funding, materials and support) to achieve a project or task. Able to manage own time efficiently and to handle multiple activities in parallel to accomplish the goals. Communication - The ability to speak and write so as to be clearly understood by others using appropriate language, vocabulary and style. Technical/Professional Knowledge - The ability and motivation to apply and develop one’s own professional and technical knowledge and to share this expertise with others. Initiative - The willingness to move things forward by taking action without needing to be asked and with our undue escalation. Achievement Orientation - The determination to set oneself and meet high standards, exceeding norms and expectations.CH123

job_title: SDEII - ML + Big Data, Measurement and Data Science
job_desc: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONCome help build ML-based measurement at internet scale. This is a green grass problem without a known answer or a pattern to follow.We're happy to help move within the US or internationally, to either HQ2, Boulder, CO, US or Toronto, ON, Canada,– we have teams in all 3 places and helped multiple people move.What you’ll doYou will design, launch, own and evolve software that computes estimated impact of Amazon ads. Hundreds of thousands advertisers will use your work every day to decide where to invest next. You'll work closely with our top notch team of scientists and economists to invent, build and try ML-based approaches, and iterate on what works best. You'll help define not only how we compute the estimates, but how do we know we're right. These are really hard questions that are unique to Amazon, so there isn't a footprint you can copy. You'll build petabyte-scale scale measurement pipelines, as well as advance supporting services and frameworks. You'll get feedback from principal and sr engineers, as well as help junior engineers grow.What we doWe enable advertisers to optimize ad spend and allocate budgets effectively by providing accurate, actionable and timely conversion measurement for all Amazon ad products. We're in the early stages of work, where we invent and try a lot of new approaches. We use a combination of machine learning (ML)-based and deterministic techniques to produce the estimates that are fastest in the industry without compromising quality. We constantly invent on our cutting-edge event-driven architectures to stay ahead of growing scale.The charter of this team is focused on computing estimated conversions. We own the math, the algorithms, and the design. We work with a variety of technologies, such as AWS EMR, Batch, Scala, Spark and PyTorch. Science is invented in the same team.What we offerWe are a company of builders who bring varying backgrounds, ideas, and points of view to inventing on behalf of our customers. Our diverse perspectives come from many sources including gender, race, age, national origin, sexual orientation, culture, education, and professional and life experience. We are committed to diversity and inclusion and always look for ways to scale our impact as we grow. You can read more here.Amazon has 13 affinity groups, also known as employee resource groups, which bring Amazon employees together across businesses and locations around the world. Some examples include the Black Employee Network (BEN), Amazon Women in Engineering (AWE), and Indigenous@Amazon.Key job responsibilitiesdesign, develop, launch and maintain measurement applications that compute accurate estimates of advertising impact. work with the data to understand advertiser needs and develop most efficient ways of handling it. closely partner with science team on all aspects, from featurization to training to estimating to knowning we're right. Write code in languages like Scala, Java or Python. Support and improve what you built.Basic Qualifications1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.2+ years of non-internship professional software development experienceProgramming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented designPreferred QualificationsMasters degree in Computer Science, Math or Physics or a related fieldExperience in the advertising or search industriesExperience launching green grass Machine Learning systemsExperience with building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.Company - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULCJob ID: A2061053

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewTD Commercial Banking services the unique needs of Canadian businesses, customizing a broad range of products. As part of the Commercial Banking team the Analyst Commercial Banking will provide credit writing support to a Relationship Manager who is the face of the Bank to our customers. The position reports to a Manager Commercial Credit who will coordinate workflow and provide coaching on credit structure, pricing and presentation.Job DescriptionThe Analyst Commercial Banking works on a two-person team with a Relationship Manager. Together, they jointly manage a portfolio of approximately 60 mid-market accounts with a moderate to high level of complexity. Portfolios are broadly based and teams have responsibility for firms across a wide range of industrial segments. Clients are characteristically incorporated entities seeking loans in the $1 – 15 million range. The Analyst is responsible for much of the credit writing for the team, structuring credits appropriately to meet customer needs and address perceived risk. The Analyst completes necessary due diligence and produces reviews and risk ratings that reflect knowledge of Bank policies and procedures. Trends and conditions of accounts are pro-actively monitored and action plans are developed for problem situations. The position delivers consistent and timely service to customers and assists the Commercial Banking management team in resolving customer problems with an innovative approach.Job RequirementsIn addition to your undergraduate degree in business or relevant professional designation, you ideally have 2-3 years of experience as a Financial Analyst or Account Manager in a business or banking environment. Alternatively you may have experience in another profession that supports the needs of business and are looking for an opportunity to add value from a different perspective. You have well developed analytical, and relationship management skills and look forward to developing them further in this role.InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. job_title: Operations Research Engineer - Optimization Software Development
job_desc: :Formulate, analyze and solve real-world problems originating from industrial applications, such as manufacturing, transportation, logistics, energy, and finance.Contribute to the design of new algorithms or to the improvement of the current tools for solving hard real-world operations research problems.Contribute to the design of AI-powered decision-making platform that automates decision process and is easy to rapidly implement applications and services.Research, develop and implement various optimization algorithms for current optimization software.QualificationsApplicants are expected to demonstrate a significant subset of the following knowledge and skills:Master or PhD in Operations Research, Computer Science, Computational Mathematics, or related fields.Extensive experience in solving industrial-level mathematical optimization problems with applications in manufacturing, transportation, logistics, energy, finance, or related fields.Strong ability in mathematical modelling and problem solving techniques.In-depth understanding of classical mathematical optimization problems, such as linear programming, mixed-integer programming, vehicle routing problems, constraint optimization, and scheduling problems.In-depth understanding of classical mathematical optimization algorithms, such as simplex algorithm, interior-point algorithm, branch-and-bound, column generation, decomposition techniques, meta-heuristic algorithms, and graph algorithms.Experience with off-the-shelf optimization software (e.g., Gurobi, CPLEX, FICO XPress).Strong experience with machine learning techniques is a plus.Dedication to producing extremely high-quality code that meets strict performance requirements, is readable and obvious to coworkers, is easy to maintain and extend, and adheres to coding standards.Additional InformationWe appreciate your interests and would like you to understand that only a short list of candidates will be contacted.

Our world is data heavy, but we love it! You will need to have strong attention to detail, enjoy working with data and are a great teammate. You are adaptable and comfortable prioritizing multiple tasks with a sense of commitment to get the job done and meet weekly tasks. You are well versed and able to present findings by speaking to various groups of the business every day.If this describes you, then keep reading!”What You'll Do:Support Loyalty Program Management team with designed processes to manage loyalty offers across multiple divisions and bannersPresenting offer details weekly with various levels of the organization.Work with the Loyalty Promotions team with ad-hoc reporting requests and troubleshooting on loyalty offersSupport Loyalty Program Management with managing the loyalty targeted offer pool and maintenance of analytical models with current data and accurate item listsProvide expertise and training to members of the Loyalty Promotions and Promo Integrity team on use of the central loyalty systemSupport Loyalty Promotions team with digital loyalty initiativesConduct offer reporting, weekly tasks and ad-hoc initiatives as neededWhat You'll Need:Strong analytical skills with Advanced Excel skills and experience with SQLFamiliarity with retail merchandising systems and processes including Python and Microstrategy is an assetAbility to manage multiple projects and maintain attention to detail in a fast-paced and changing environment and the ability to present findings to various groups in the organizationVery high attention to process detail and documentationWhat Loblaw Offers YouWe offer flexibility and balance, and an environment that sets you up for success no matter where your workspace is located.Here, you will find a great team to help you achieve your goals as you help us achieve ours! Work in our fast-paced, exciting Technology environment, helping our stores, colleagues and customers every day.Loblaw colleagues also enjoy:Work Perks ProgramOn-site GoodLife Fitness, Basketball & Volleyball courts, Ice Rink, Groceries delivered to work via PC Express, Dry Cleaning services (1PCC Office)Online LearningBenefitsPaid VacationIf you’re up to the challenge, then we would love to hear from you. job_title: Senior Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst- EN
job_desc: TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewThe Marketing Technologies, Analytics & Insights (MTA&I) function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank.The MTA&I team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank.The MTA&I team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization.Job DescriptionThe successful candidate will be responsible for Campaign Analytics within the broader Marketing Analytics group. If you are driven by helping stakeholders understand data, love when the latest direct-to-consumer marketing campaign results are available, and continually strive to challenge the "process status quo" to make workflows run as efficiently as possible – this is the role for you!Success In This Role Will Be Achieved By Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive marketing ROI Ensuring execution (i.e., list creation) is done efficiently and with excellence Designing campaign results can be actioned by providing high value campaign reporting Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of campaign reporting Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.Responsibilities Design/execute/measure high impact direct to consumer marketing experiments Continuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposal Execute with excellence Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROI Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructureSkill Sets Familiarity with direct marketing principles (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.) Good knowledge of everyday banking products and transactions; Mutual Funds, Investment Products, Savings, GICs and registered banking products Technical and detail oriented Knowledge of how campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as Unica and SAS A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications Team player while able to work independently Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts A profit driven mindsetJob Requirements1-2+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries) Significant experience with IBM Campaign (Unica) Knowledge of SQL and SAS; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of vendors and file format requirements Experience designing and executing successful direct marketing experiments, including channel tests Familiarity with concepts such as "next best offer" and "always-on" an asset Degree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline Track record of delivering successful initiatives on time and on budget#CanMarketingAdditional InformationInclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. Those insights will be brought to bear to enable informed and enabled business decisions enterprise wide or help to solve the increasingly complex business problems they face. In this role, TD will look to as a thought leadership as well as a leader in your space, coaching, mentoring, empowering and educating your peers to collaborate and bring TD into the future of banking.As a Senior Business Insights Analyst, you will: Apply understanding of respective business strategies to produce relevant and substantial data analysis to support business goals and objectivesDevelop analysis to illustrate business trends and identify areas of business opportunitiesProduce insights and recommend business actions to align with strategy and/or solve business problemsProvide seasoned specialized knowledge, advice and/or mentorship to various business and working partnersExecute on data requests accurately and within a timely mannerRepresent functional area as an analytics & insights professional and key resource; build positive and productive working partnershipsAct as a bridge to translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domainProvides day-to-day support and delivery of analyticsWork independently as the senior analyst/subject matter expert and may coach and educate othersConsidered an authority within a given areaOversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to end Job RequirementsWhat can you bring to TD? Overview Of PositionWe are looking for a data scientist to join our team to build the next generation of AI models to impact healthcare. You will be building, maintaining and improving all parts of the AI development pipeline from data ingestion to production. You will enjoy working with a highly talented and diverse team on some of the richest data sets in US healthcareThis AI/ML Engineering opportunity is an exciting role that will expand your knowledge and will allow you to create commercial grade AI solutions for various medical imaging products that have the potential to directly improve the radiologists and cardiologists work efficiency as well as improve patient’s clinical outcome. We have access to state-of-the-art tools in ML, comprehensive cloud support, and extensive data from our large customer installed base.This role will consist of the design, development, and optimization of innovative AI solutions, from data ingestion and machine learning modeling to integration into our products. The AI Enterprise Imaging team has product and development stakeholders throughout the business unit and works closely with academic and industrial partners. The AI Data Scientist is expected to work with all stakeholders to fulfill the Company’s business needsWhat will I be responsible for in this job?Design, prototype and implement innovative AI/machine learning algorithms for medical imaging use casesCollaborate with academic and industrial partners to collect data, develop, and validate AI solutionsDevelop data cleaning, pre-processing methods to normalize data and detect outliersBuild and maintain large medical imaging databases of unlabeled and labeled dataAssist with the product integration of machine learning solutions and in the development of machine learning Web/UI applicationsSelf-starter that will take tasks and accomplish them with little oversight according to timelines and budgets agreed upon with business and technology stakeholdersWhat are the requirements?Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field or equivalent experiences3+ years of professional experience developing AI/Machine Learning models 3+ years of professional experience with programming languages: Python, Java and C/C++ 2+ years of professional experience with computer vision, image-based AI techniques 1+ years of professional experience with medical imaging 1+ years of professional experience with some of these technologies: Kubernetes, NGINX, VM, Database, GKE 1+ years of experience with R Proficiency with TDD and CI/CD processes Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment Proven leadership abilities in an engineering environment in driving operational excellence and best practices What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?Successful deployment of AI based products Strong experience with ML tools such as Tensorflow, Pytorch, MLFlow Experience with healthcare software product development and/or with regulated industries Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field or equivalent experiences Experience with at least one of the public cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, Azure, or IBM Cloud Strong written and verbal communication, and interpersonal skills Highly self-motivated, directed and results-oriented, cross-cultural and team player who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment How much should I expect to travel? <5%Employees in roles that require travel will need to be able to qualify for a company credit card or be able to use their own personal credit card for travel expenses and submit for reimbursement.Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system!Some of our positions require employees to be onsite at a Change Healthcare facility or a Client site, including Medical Facilities. Depending on the site’s health and safety guidelines, you may be required to have medical screenings or vaccinations to meet site requirements, which may include Covid-19 vaccination and/or testing. Further details and requirements will be confirmed during the interview process.

Do you have a spidey sense when it comes to fraud?Then Jobber might be the place for you! We're looking for a Senior Risk Data Analyst to be part of our Business Operations department.Jobber exists to help people in small businesses be successful. As featured in the Globe and Mail, we work with home and field service companies to help them better quote, schedule, invoice and collect payments from their customers. Having been named the #2 fastest growing software company in Canada and one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in 2020, it’s clear we’ve come a long way from our first customer in 2011 – but we’ve just scratched the surface of what we want to accomplish for our customers.Our product provides entrepreneurs the flexibility of working in their office or the field and we offer that same opportunity to our employees. You will have the choice to work in either our Edmonton or Toronto offices or remotely anywhere within Canada. We’re committed to ensuring the best experience for all Jobberinos to do impactful work. We weren’t named a top workplace in Canada for nothing!The team:Fintech is one of the fastest-growing parts of Jobber, and a core strategic priority for us as a company. We're investing in this growing area because we believe embedding financial tools within our product deepens our ability to help small businesses be successful. Whether it’s helping small businesses get paid, offering financing to their customers, or accessing capital to invest in growth – we believe small business owners should have seamless access to financial tools that allow them to thrive.Our Risk operations - a key group within the broader Fintech area - is central to Jobber’s success, focused on keeping both our Jobber Payments customers and Jobber safe.The role: The Senior Risk Data Analyst will be an integral part of the Business Analytics team supporting Risk operations within the Fintech area of Jobber’ business. This position will have a mix of strategic and operative responsibilities that multiply Jobber's ability to protect against losses while adding a data focused approach to risk decision making. This is a new position for the company and as such, prior experience in similar roles and a strong growth orientation would go a long way.The Senior Risk Data Analyst will:Regularly analyze transaction and platform usage data to uncover differentiating patterns and behaviors and provide balanced recommendations that work to mitigate fraud and credit losses with a need for speed. Build and maintain operative early warning indicators and monitoring tools to identify anomalous and risky usage behavior. Consistently initiate quick communication of findings to power corrective action on risk tools and technology platforms.Perform calendarized rule, parameter and threshold reviews on a regular basis to optimize performance across Acceptance, Monitoring, Chargeback and Recovery processes. Develop and provide metrics to support regular updates on the state of risk as required - ad hoc requests, weekly updates, monthly metrics, quarterly aggregates and board reports. Support the Head of Risk and the Risk Strategy Manager on risk relevant initiatives and projects by producing analysis that quantifies financial, operational, customer experience and service impact and highlights current, new and evolving risks to enable decision making. Deeply understand current and future data needs and communicate and prioritize them with data infrastructure teams.To be successful you should have:Experience in an analytical role supporting risk teams in payments, cards or lending domains.Strong applied technical skills in SQL, Python/ R focused on data cleaning and preparation, analysis and exploration, and visualization and reporting.An analytical mindset and strong statistical skills. Ability to review and find trends in transactions and usage for signs of fraud or abnormalities, and quantify trends in the data by applying statistical techniques.Machine learning experience is an asset.Experience with BI tools (Mode, Tableau, Power BI or equivalent) is an asset.Clear communication skills. You’ll be dealing with multiple stakeholders in the company on complex quantitative issues, so being able to translate and communicate your ideas and findings clearly will be important. The ability to embrace ambiguity. We don’t know what we don’t know, so you should be comfortable coming in and improving the process.The ability to work autonomously. We’re currently working remotely, so while you’ll be a member of a team and there are connection points, you’ll be on your own for a majority of the day. You’ll need to be a self-starter, with the ability to make decisions and find direction and guidance.All interviews are currently being conducted virtually - via phone or video.What you can expect from Jobber:Having been named as a Top 5 Great Place to Work in Canada, we walk the talk. Here are just some of the great things you can expect from us:A total compensation package that includes an extended health benefits package with fully paid premiums for both body and mind, RRSP matching, and stock options.A dedicated Coaching and Development function, including Development Coaches, to help build the career you want and hit the goals you set, while ensuring you’re reaching your fullest potential.Support for all your breaks: from vacation to rest and recharge, your birthday off to celebrate, health days to support your physical and mental health, parental leave top-ups to support your growing family, and a snack box to help support those coffee breaks.A unique opportunity to build, grow, and leave your impact on a $400-billion industry that has no dominant player...yet.To work with a group of people who are humble, supportive, and give a sh*t about our customers. We believe that diverse teams perform better and that fostering an inclusive work environment is a key part of growing a successful team. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.A bit more about us:Job by job, we’re transforming the way service is delivered. Your lawn care provider, home cleaning service, plumber or painter could use Jobber to better connect with their customers, save time in the office, invoice faster, and get paid! We’re bringing tens of thousands of people together with technology to deliver billions of dollars a year in services to happy customers. Jobber exists to help make these small businesses successful, and when they’re successful we all win!

LOCATION  : Temporarily Remote/Hybrid (Toronto, Montréal) our story SOCAN is Canada’s largest member-based rights management organization. We serve and champion more than 175,000 music creators, publishers and visual artists, advocate for them, and protect their rights. We do this by using and building state-of-the art technology that ensures they are paid for their work – music and art we all enjoy.What We Offer Competitive bonus plan  Defined Contribution pension plan  Flexible / remote work schedules (optional 4-day work week)  Comprehensive, employer funded health and medical benefits effective upon hire  Wellness programs and health spending account  Paid office closure period in December  12 paid sick days annually.  our people  We’re a team dedicated to supporting the national and global music ecosystem with innovation, commitment and desire in an ever-changing music and business landscape  We love music and believe that music creators and publishers provide a truly priceless and essential aspect of national pride and culture  We’re immensely proud of our workplace culture and this attribute permeates our works  Our team proudly supports and gives back to our communities and causes, raising tens of thousands of dollars for important charitable organizations and initiatives. About The RoleSOCAN is seeking a Data Reporting Analyst to join our Data Strategy and Analytics team. In this role, you’ll collect, model, analyze and visualize data to enable business strategy and operational efficiency. Working on a centralized team, you’ll operate cross functionally throughout the organization to serve the analytical needs of various business teams. You must be a SQL expert, with a background in Power BI, and are passionate about data and enjoy solving complex problems. The ideal candidate is curious, emotionally intelligent, and possesses a drive for continuous learning and self-improvement. Within the first 3 months you will be expected to understand SOCAN’s high level business model and have fully implemented at least one reporting solution  Within 6 months you must be fully integrated into the analytics team and have developed executive level reporting solutions and KPIs  By the end of year one, you must have pro-actively re-designed our executive dashboard reporting framework.  your contribution You will contribute to “raising the bar for music rights,” by: Collaborate with business users and subject matter experts to document business reporting / technical requirements  Become an expert on SOCAN’s business model and understand how operational processes affect data analysis  Analyze raw data within a centralized data warehouse environment and design tabular / dimensional data models to enable royalty analyses and KPIs  Create automated visualization reports in Power BI to enable strategic decision making  Communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders by creating clear and concise visualizations  Design and develop dataset reports to support operational business processes  Contribute to large corporate projects and initiatives that involve data analytics and reporting  Create data dictionaries for dimensions/measures to support end user training  Respond to adhoc requests for data analytics and insights in Excel.  DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU? Experience 3 or more years of relevant work experience in a similar role  Advanced knowledge of SQL and enerprise reporting  Previous experience designing tabular models in Power Query or Analysis Services (SSAS)  Fundamental understanding of dimensional data modelling techniques and methodologies  Professional experience working with Power BI, experience with Tableau or other BI tools is an asset. Education Bachelor's degree. Skillset/ Nice to Have’s Advanced data visualization skills  Advanced Excel skills (DAX, Pivot Tables, VBA)  Ability to tackle loosely defined problems by asking the right questions  Experience working in an agile project management framework is an asset  Previous experience working in the music industry is an asset  Fluent in French is nice to have.  ACCESSIBILITY SOCAN is committed to providing an inclusive workplace environment that meets the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities. Should you require accommodations please contact us directly at hr@socan.com and we will make the necessary accommodations. Applications submitted to this email address will not be accepted. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY SOCAN is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Hiring and other employment decisions at SOCAN are made without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, ancestry, national origin, ethnic origin, age, disability, citizenship, veteran status, sexual orientation, record of offences, marital status, family status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law, regulation, or ordinance. READY TO JOIN SOCAN and MAKE A DIFFERENCE? We’re always looking for passionate new team members – rockstars, like you. Please visit our career page at: http://www.socan.com/careers/ and select “Apply” beside the role you are interested in applying for.We thank everyone for their interest however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.To learn more about SOCAN, please visit www.socan.com .Apply Now

TD DescriptionTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.comDepartment OverviewThe Marketing Technologies and Analytics (MT&A) function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank. The MT&A team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank. The MT&A team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization. Job DescriptionThe successful candidate will be responsible for campaign analytics supporting the growing needs of the Cards team within the broader Marketing Analytics Delivery group.Your goal as a part of the Marketing Analytics Delivery team is to design and execute campaigns to drive acquisition, customer management, loyalty, and engagement across personal and business banking products. Success in this role will be achieved by:1. Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive marketing ROI2. Ensuring execution (i.e., list creation) is done efficiently and with excellence3. Designing campaign results can be actioned by providing high value campaign reporting4. Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of campaign reportingYour success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.ResponsibilitiesDesign/execute/measure high impact direct to consumer marketing experimentsContinuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposalExecute with excellenceManage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be metProactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROIMaintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructureSkill SetsFamiliarity with direct marketing principles (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.)Technical and detail orientedKnowledge of how campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as SASA project management mindset to help deliver on time to specificationsTeam player while able to work independentlyPragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smartsA profit driven mindset Job Requirements4+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries)Significant experience with IBM Campaign (Unica) an assetKnowledge of SQL and SAS; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of vendors and file format requirementsKnowledge of Python, Azure, HadoopExperience designing successful direct marketing experimentsDegree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative disciplineTrack record of delivering successful initiatives on time and on budget#CanMarketing InclusivenessAt TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.We make the world better, and you can too.Solution Consultant Job location: This is a virtual role. You may work anywhere from home and be based anywhere in the USA or Canada.About The TeamYou will be a contributing member of the Kinaxis Professional Services organization, collaborating with team members to deliver committed customer projects using Kinaxis RapidResponse® software.If you love solving analytical problems, forecasting using complex datasets, finding actionable insights, communicate the story within the data and learning new technologies, this role is for you!What you will do Develop cutting edge expertise in Kinaxis’ AI/ML capabilities to translate customer’s business needs into actionable insights that can drive business improvements.  Support customer to define and implement value metrics and KPIs that will demonstrate visible business success.  Evaluate and measure models’ outputs to ensure client requirements are met and drive continuous value.  Seamlessly collaborative with cross functional teams of Data Scientists, machine learning engineers, data engineers and customer business teams to complete challenging machine learning projects.  Provide on-going support and thought leadership to customers to continually improve their AI/ML models by demonstrating and delivering value.  Work with multiple teams to shape the product roadmap and provide thought leadership content and points of view on industry trends and user stories  Work with pre-sales and help shape a point of view for each customer about how the Kinaxis capabilities can best support them. What we are looking forA minimum of 3 years of experience in a relevant capacityS trong technical background in analyzing and validating data, machine learning models or statistics using python, spark, SQL in various development environments  Ability to understand customers business’ and supply chain needs and leverage it to effectively design solutions to drive business value.  Ability to effectively communicate with executives and business stakeholders to shape and influence decision making.  Hands-on experience with relational databases (e.g. Oracle, MySQL, MS Sql Server, PostgreSQL) and Hive, cloud environments. Working knowledge of distributed computing techniques.  Working knowledge of Machine learning stack such as Kubernetes, Docker, Project Jupyter, Kafka and workflow engines.  Ability to translate planning processes to different industry verticals such as Retail, High Tech, etc.  Excellent interpersonal, presentation and client relationship building and facilitation skills (meeting sessions, conflict resolutions, brainstorming etc.)  Client facing experience (consulting roles a plus) What we have to offerChallenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Access to clean water is critical to sustain life. For over 160 years, Mueller has been providing critical water infrastructure products that support populations globally. Aging infrastructure, resource scarcity, population growth and growing environmental sustainability efforts provide an opportunity to change the world and make an impact that matters.We are currently searching for a Senior Data Analyst to join Mueller’s Echologics business. This position will be based in our Toronto office.Key ResponsibilitiesAnalyze acoustic data files collected by our field teamDevelop processes and procedures for accurate and efficient signal processingWork with the Research & Development team to test new processing methodologiesApply different feature sets & machine learning algorithms for data analysis automationWork with Field team to define acceptance criteria & performance indicators for automation algorithms and software improvementsWork with the software development team to integrate automation algorithms and software improvements into our data analysis softwareMonitor process performance through KPIs and continuously improveUpdate User Guides/Requirement documents, etc. – as requiredWorks in compliance with the Mueller Water Products Code of Conduct and all Environmental, Health and Safety policies, procedures and regulationsOther duties as assignedPosition RequirementsMaster’s Degree in Machine Learning Physics, Probabilistic and Statistical Inference, or a related field; orBachelor’s degree in Computer Science and 3 years of experience in data science, artificial intelligence, or applied statistics.Experience programming in a .net environment.Experience working with Matlab, Octave, Linux.Strong analytical skills, including data mining and statistical analysis.Knowledge of machine learning algorithms (logistic regression, neural networks, etc.).Ability to understand advanced concepts in physics and acoustics.Experience with SQL and programming for relational databases.Strong programming skills.Great communicator, perseverant, detail-oriented, self-starter and a get things done attitude!Mueller is located in the Junction Triangle neighborhood of Toronto. Our office is transit accessible via GO Transit/ UP Express (Bloor GO Station) as well as TTC Dundas West station.Mueller offers a competitive compensation package including employer paid benefits, company matched pension plan, tuition reimbursement, a flexible workplace program and many more great benefits!Mueller is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other category protected by law.

Posted by                  Brandon Langlois                                  2nd                            Head of People & Culture @ DarkVision - We're Hiring                                     Send InMail                    We are looking to hire multiple detail-oriented, technically-minded people to join the Data Analysis team at DarkVision. The successful candidates will work collaboratively with their teammates to analyze our high-resolution ultrasound scans of oil and gas wells and use the results to create actionable reports, 3D images, detailed models, and quantifiable data (all the while, enjoying the benefits of working at a company that prioritizes providing an awesome work environment!) No experience in this type of role is necessary, as the focus is on attitude, aptitude, and raw ability versus specific experience in a similar position. We’re looking for someone intelligent, keen, and highly detail-oriented regarding data deliverables to help meet the growing demand for DarkVision’s products and services.Responsibilities:Inspect ultrasound data using our proprietary software to locate features and defectsFollow detailed processes for preparing datasets and completing analysisMeasure and assess features in the data, utilizing machine learning resultsGenerate detailed spreadsheets and plots using MATLABGenerate and edit reportsGenerate images, videos, and 3D rendersReview and aggregate information from client documentsAssist in improving workflows and documentationLearn and master new types of analysis as DarkVision increases their product offeringsExpectations:Technical diploma or degreeAttention to extreme detail. Applicants need to be meticulous, methodical, exact, and thorough in their analysis, making little to no mistakes.Excellent communication skills, verbal and written.Works well collaboratively. Most projects will be shared among a group of analysts.Available for occasional odd hours. Customer jobs can arise at any time, and they often need answers as quickly as possible. This analyst position may include occasional working evenings or weekends outside of typical office hours.Fast learner, able to adapt to evolving processes and guidelines.Able to follow detailed procedures and meet high standards for quality and consistency.Willing and able to work out of DarkVision's North Vancouver head office.Bonus Qualifications:MATLAB experienceBlender or Meshlab experience.Image processing experienceExperience with 3D dataWhat’s in it for you?Competitive salary or higher (Top $ for top talent)Full benefits package.Competitive vacation allotmentFlexible work environment.About DarkVisionDarkVision Technologies Inc. is a BC-based tech company disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world’s most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform. We are packaging it into multiple new product lines, revolutionizing how our clients quantify and visualize the integrity of their critical assets.Backed by Koch Industries, the largest privately held company in North America, DarkVision’s team of Mechanical, Skunkworks, Electrical, Software, and Machine Learning Engineers is rapidly expanding to meet the demand for the company’s current and upcoming products.We provide employees with the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications and invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.Why DarkVision:Here are 4 reasons you’ll like working at DarkVision:Well-Funded: We are backed by Koch Industries - North America’s largest privately held company, and are actively working with top-tier operators across North America.‘A’ Players: Our team comprises talented, intelligent, and hardworking people. You'll enjoy the intellectually stimulating, challenging, and respectfully competitive atmosphere if you’re an ‘A’ player.Growing Quickly: We are launching several new product lines and, as a result, have more than doubled our headcount over the last year.Lots of Opportunities: We are transitioning into a much larger organization and will soon be expanding into a 52,000 sq ft facility in Vancouver. We have recently opened a larger Calgary office and have expanded into the US, starting with offices in Houston and Midland, TX.

Drop is a rewards platform on a mission to inspire people to live their optimal lives by empowering them financially. Through our personalized platform, Drop intelligently surfaces the right brands, at the right time, to make members’ everyday better than it was before. Powered by machine learning, Drop matches consumers with over 500+ partner brands to satisfy two main goals: to earn points from their purchases and redeem them for instant rewards.Headquartered in Toronto, with an office in New York, Drop is backed by world-class investors including NEA, HOF, Royal Bank of Canada, Sierra Ventures, and White Star Capital.To learn more, visit: www.joindrop.com, or follow us at @joindrop on Instagram and Twitter.Data Science at DropThe Data Science - Decisions team is core to the decision-making process at Drop. As a member of the team, you will help us navigate through undiscovered business and product opportunities as we continue to grow. You won't be working alone — you will have the opportunity to collaborate with the Product, Marketing, Engineering, and Partnerships teams. As a member of the Data Science team, you will collaborate with Data Engineers and other Data Scientists, and your work will have a direct impact on Drop's growth trajectory and future success.You can learn more about our Data & Engineering team's work by visiting Drop’s Engineering Blog.As a Data Analyst, Business you willWork closely with the Data Partnerships, Consumer Insights, Infrastructure and Client Success teams to support our suite of transaction and survey data offeringsShape business decisions for clients by conducting deep dives to drive growth, results, and engagementDevelop dashboards and automated reports via business intelligence tools to gather and present insights, and enable other teams to explore data sets to help answer questionsCollaborate with internal and external stakeholders to brainstorm solutions that drive key strategic initiativesAct as a business partner leveraging your strong understanding of our data to further develop our data product offering and expand our product suiteEngage with potential clients as a technical counterpart to the Data Partnerships and Consumer Insights teamsWhat you bring to the tableYou have at least 1 year of industry experience in data science or analyticsBA/BS or graduate degree in business, data science, mathematics, statistics, or any other relevant fieldYou have experience working with SQL to develop complex queries combining multiple datasetsYou have strong analytical and problem solving skills; you are able to transform data into actionable product and business insightsYou have strong communication skills, with the ability to gather requirements from clients, translate them into an analytic problem and share results using our data products in a clear and concise mannerYou have experience collaborating with various stakeholders to align on project requirements and outcomesYou have experience querying and transforming structured, and semi-structured data setsYou have the ability to learn new technical systems efficiently and have a desire to continuously improve your technical skillsYou thrive in a fast-paced environment; startup experience is not a strict requirement but a bonus. Drop welcomes people from all backgrounds and recognizes the value of diversityYou are passionate about building the next generation of proprietary alternative data productsBonus points ifYou’ve worked in Redshift, Postgres, Athena, or SnowflakeYou have experience with scripting languages such as Python or RYou’ve worked with Looker or TableauYou have experience working directly with clientsYou have experience with financial, loyalty, or rewards systemsYou’re passionate about financial markets and fintechBenefitsLifestyle Spending Accounts and Health Spending Accounts + drug, dental, travel, and group insurance coverageUnlimited time off Parental leave benefitsStock optionsDon't have Drop yet?Check us out in the Google Play or App storeFollow the Link below and use Code: "Candidates" to get a 5k welcome bonus on us! Happy saving Friends!https://b.ewd.io/candidatesAt Drop, we're committed to providing an enjoyable and meaningful environment for every member of our team. We operate under a flat structure with minimal hierarchy where everyone’s opinion is valued equally. We are looking for team members with an entrepreneurial mindset who will thrive in a fast-paced and rewarding environment.Drop Technologies, Inc. is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

Posted by                  Paolo Villagomez             IT and Business Recruiter                                      Send InMail                    1 year contract + likely extensions or conversion to permanent  Must Haves 5+ years’ experience as a Data Engineer with Python development experience Experience in developing key applications with automatic triggered scheduled tasks using Python Experience in working with large JSON and XML files using Python – read and write Experience flattening large JSON and XML files, to be consumed by our Python Scripts. Strong SQL Experience Relational database design experience Previous financial institution experience  Assets Knowledge of big data platforms with exposure to Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, Apache Spark, PySpark, SparkSQL, Mongo DB) Data Visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau Counterparty Credit Risk and/or Market Risk experience Knowledge of Capital Markets, trading systems, and trade data  Day to Day Insight Global is looking for a Data Engineer/Python Developer to join a top financial institution on their Counterparty Credit Risk Reporting team. The team produces a series of regulatory and management reports, using feeds from various upstream systems like FIS Adaptive, Calypso, Bloomberg, Imagine and WSS amongst others. This Developer will be working on the Large Exposures Project, which is looking to change data sources for a large Python based ETL Script. The developer will need experience flattening json files. The developer will also help to transition some report producing Python based business managed applications (BMAs) to technology. This will require the developer to understand current code and business needs and finalize development and/or translate business requirements into technology requirements for technology developers. The successful candidate will get the opportunity to work in a dynamic regulatory environment.

Customer-facing teams use the Uberflip platform to package marketing collateral into mini, personalized websites that educate buyers on their product or service. Our Uberflip Analytics & Enrichment give marketers the ability to integrate their favourite tech with our platform.We're on the search for a Business Intelligence Analyst! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to be part of our Analytics team, reporting to our B.I. Manager. Developer and Product team to coordinate efforts and deliver quality customer-facing reports and Dashboards.You will be the main point of contact for our reporting needs, as such, you will be responsible for usage adoption, by training, educating, and assisting your users.Push the boundaries of our reporting platform to create custom visualizations.Work in a collaborative manner and Interact with other engineering team members, Solution Architects, Project Managers, and Business Analysts to deliver the best data-driven solution, abiding by all Data governance and privacy framework.You will be cross-trained to support our ETL and our Data Warehouse.You will be involved in supporting many other aspects of our data solution ecosystem including augmented analytics projects.We want to talk to you if:You have worked 2+ years in a production setting with Looker or one of the following B.I. connected world more secure.Thales DIS Canada is looking for a Data Industrialization Analyst to join Thales in Burlington, to support in leading & maintaining the Burlington Production Centre Data mistakes.Analyze complex situations and problems and conduct the necessary research using multiple sources of information to arrive at innovative solutions.Data Processing Operations Support the daily processing of customer data to ensure the generated jobs and data are delivered to Operators & Logistics in-time to be able to launch production within the specified service level agreement (SLA).Contribute to monitoring the data processing dashboard to ensure tasks are running as per usual and any issues are resolved.Support the Production team with any ad-hoc or scheduled task in terms configuration set-up, test requests, investigations, and other routine support.Contribute in launching custom database reports to support internal and external customer needs.Assist in the development and deployment of any reporting or automation components required for successful project migration.Work with the operations team-members to identify opportunities for improvement & communicate thoughts to appropriate levels of management.Able to participate in a rotating & paid 24/7 production on-call support.Required Skills & ExperienceEngineering or Computer Science post-secondary diploma (MS/Oracle).At least one year of experience working with an enterprise-level ERP system (SAP/Oracle).Prior experience using MS Excel & VB scripting to develop dynamic applications (e.g. interactive operations team.Forwards-thinking self-starter with strong planning, analytical and organizational skills.Excellent written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills in order to communicate and enrich client records Interface with internal business groups and external vendors as they relate to client data management Provide end user support to client reference data business consumers and confidentiality requirements (legal, compliance and operational risk) Review regulatory data exception reports and remediate exceptions Execute User Acceptance TestingKnowledge: Completion of an is preferred) Practical experience with Fenergo, or similar, data lifecycle management application Basic understanding of data management practices (data profiling, matching, cleansing, mastering, and exception management) Experience with data analysis and reference data reconciliation/remediationSkills: Excellent communication skills – written and verbal Strong team player who works collaboratively, demonstrates initiative, is proactive, and client-focused Ability to maintain strong attention to detail while meeting deadlines Demonstrated experience in analyzing and manipulating data sets Intermediate Excel skills - (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, functions, conditional formatting, tables, charting) Strong troubleshooting, analysis, and problem-solving skills Proven ability to In 2021, Mistplay was ranked as the 3rd fastest growing technology company in Canada. We are the #1 Loyalty Program for mobile gamers - with over 16 million users worldwide. Players use our platform to discover games, connect with friends, and earn awesome rewards.Our teams leverage a wealth of in-game data and machine learning to recommend the right games to the right users - creating a completely tailored gaming experience. Using modern tools and technologies, our data scientists and analysts have access to a wealth of data from which to create models and derive insights. From battling fraud to predicting churn, we have plenty of challenges waiting for you to tackle. Growth is in our DNA. We’re keen to improve on our skills through peer mentorship programs, constantly seeking feedback, and company sponsored training courses.Mistplay is looking for data-driven individuals who are passionate about what they do and love solving complex problems every day. As part of our team, you will have the chance to make a significant impact on the product and bring in your experience to help shape our growth. We want your voice to matter.Join us as we continue to level up!As a fast-growing tech start-up, you can jump right into the action and deep dive directly into the open AI challenges we are facing. Join our skilled Fraud team of Data Scientists, Engineers and Analysts to help us improve our AI-products with a real-time impact on our business. Each day will bring new challenges and opportunities to work on different components of our platform.We are looking for people that are passionate about AI and our product. Technical ability is important, but so is being able to add to our culture. A can-do attitude and growth mindset will take you a long way with Mistplay!What You'll Be DoingWork with a rich database that will push your creativity into engineering novel features that will have direct impact on the companyTrack and ban fraudulent cohorts by building powerful and precise heuristicsAssist in investigation of suspicious users that exhibit bot-behaviour qualitiesWork on a daily basis with our Fraud team of Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and Fraud Analyst to track and identify fraudulent usersHelp us keep track of our KPIs and current models in production by assisting in the development of dashboardsCollaborate with our Commercial team to review monthly fraud reports coming from our clientsWhat We're Looking ForA Bachelors degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics or any quantitative related field is requiredAbility to explore our rich database, continuously uncover new channels of fraud and propose newly engineered features to boost the performance of our modelsStrong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendationsStrong knowledge of SQL for analytics, data mining and data manipulation. Python/R is a solid bonusData visualizations such as Tableau is a solid bonusVos Responsabilités Seront Les SuivantesTravailler avec une base de données étoffée qui, conjuguée avec votre créativité, vous permettra de développer de nouvelles fonctionnalités qui auront un impact direct sur l'entreprise.Traquer et exclure les cohortes frauduleuses en créant des heuristiques puissantes et précises.Participer à la recherche des utilisateurs suspects qui présentent des caractéristiques comportementales d'un bot.Travailler au quotidien avec notre équipe Fraude, composée d'analystes de données, de scientifiques de données et de l'analyste Fraude, pour repérer et identifier les utilisateurs frauduleux.Apportez votre soutien au suivi de nos indicateurs clés de performance et des modèles actuels en production en participant à l'élaboration de tableaux de bord.Collaborer avec notre équipe commerciale pour examiner les rapports mensuels sur les fraudes que nous envoient nos clients.Ce Que Nous RecherchonsUn baccalauréat (Bachelor's degree) en sciences, en informatique, en statistiques, en économie, en analyse commerciale ou dans tout autre domaine lié à l'analyse quantitative est exigé.Capacité à explorer notre base de données étoffée, à découvrir en permanence de nouveaux canaux de fraude et à proposer des fonctionnalités innovantes permettant de booster les performances de nos modèles.Solides compétences analytiques et en matière d'analyse statistique afin de dégager des informations et des recommandations.Une connaissance approfondie de SQL pour l'analyse, le data mining et la manipulation des données. La connaissance de Python/R est un atout certain.Une expérience en matière de visualisation de données (par exemple, avec Tableau) est un sérieux atout.We work hard to make our work atmosphere as inviting and fun as possible! Working at Mistplay is coupled with a whole array of perks that we've adopted virtually and in-person: Team Lunches, game nights, company-wide events, and so much more.Our culture is deeply rooted in growth and upheld by a team of smart, dynamic, and enthusiastic people. We utilize data to constantly learn, improve, and adapt. We foster an environment where everyone is encouraged to share their ideas, push boundaries, take calculated risks, and witness their visions come to life.Think you have what it takes? We'd love to meet you!
